Reviews.Title: “Wedding and function crowds make reception unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: lawyer90
Reviews.Content: Singapore has changed so much since I first visited that where once this hotel was out of the way now it's best rooms have fantastic views of the iconic Marina Bay Sands and the city skyline. Like any MO, this one has high standards and brings with it high expectations. While I've stayed here and at other MOs before, it seems to me that the chain's lack of an affinity programme means it doesn't have an idea of when I last stayed or of my preferences. Since its renovation a few years ago, this hotel has the standards you'd expect in Singapore and it's not always too full of weddings or functions. The layout of reception means that this is one of the least exclusive check in experiences of any five-star hotel I've stayed in. That bring's down it's rating for me, but I'd still recommend this hotel if you get a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great place very $”
Reviews.Author: Mantles
Reviews.Content: Went here for a night for a cameo appearance. Order the Topanga Beach cocktail. Soon good. The service is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Oriental Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: Politiri
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to the action in Singapore, Hotel Mandarin is the place. Lots of action going on close by, tour buses etc right at the door, upscale and downscale shopping close by. Rooms were large and comfortable, rates were GOOD - we staying saturday thru to Tuesday after a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Tenth visit to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: OaklandBK
Reviews.Content: This is my tenth visit to the Mandarin Oriental hotel in Singapore and, like every other trip, the experience has been top-notch. The rooms are very good - not huge, but very nicely appointed. Best rooms are those that face the city (with views of the Marina Bay Sands hotel) or over the pool toward the sea (which I have this trip). The views are unobstructed so any floor is good. The best part of the hotel is the staff - incredibly helpful, somehow know my name at every contact point, and perfect service. Morton's Bar is fun (go for happy hour and try the filet sandwiches), Melt has a very good breakfast (to support the views of other commenters, it's not cheap), and the lounge facing the city has good music on the weekends. Is this the best hotel in Singapore? Probably not. But is it the best in this price range (and I've stayed in a number of other hotels in this range), yes.

Reviews.Title: “The Caged Birds Ruined The Experience”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: As far as luxury hotels go, this is a nice hotel. Great service, great architecture, great views. However, when you first arrive you hear birds in the Atrium and you think they are wild and live in inside the hotel. Not so... if you look at little closer there are six birds in separate cages. A few of them jumping up and down non-stop and what I thought at first was a beautiful bird song now just seems tortured. It has the ruined the experience of the hotel for me. I can't wait to exit the Atrium to not hear the birds. Won't stay here again ever.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Hannmorr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin oriental from2nd to 5th April. Great room overlooking the pool, fabulous breakfast with so many choices but the staff are the standout here- aalmost without exception they are polite, friendly and do their best to make you feel like a very special guest. Facilities at the hotel are great, good busines centre and easy walk to MTR through the Marina Bay shopping malls under cover.

Reviews.Title: “This cannot be the best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: SurbitonEd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two days in Singapore at the end of our honeymoon. We booked the Mandarin Oriental because it had such a good Tripadvisor rating. Having stayed there we can't understand why it's so highly rated. The place looks great and we did have a fantastic room on the 11th floor overlooking the sea. The bathroom was beautiful and all the staff we met were really attentive and friendly, especially the pool staff. This was the only hotel we stayed at which actually acknowledged that we were celebrating our honeymoon - but unfortunately our satisfaction stopped there. This is a very expensive hotel so it comes as a surprise to find that the hotel charges ridiculous fees for almost anything that you consume. Chief amongst these outrages is Wifi. I have a particular intolerance for hotels that charge for internet access and for the Mandarin to charge $10 PER HOUR for in-room wifi is despicable. Even our $40 a night bungalow on Gili Air threw in complimentary wifi. For the Mandarin to scrape together a few extra dollars by charging customers for internet access is indefensible. What's next - pay-as-you-go aircon? Even the business centre wasn't free. We spent a couple of hours at the pool and a quick glance at the menu revealed a similar enthusiasm for squeezing extra money out of guests - $30 for a sandwich! Our flight out of Singapore was not til 2330 but after discovering that a late checkout was charged at 50% of the nightly rate, we quickly realised that a late checkout at the Mandarin was only for those with an expense account to fall back on. Pretty shameful to charge that kind of money for a few extra hours in your room. Breakfast was not included in our room rate but we had heard good things so we decided to pay for it anyway. It was VERY good - a quite amazing choice and very good quality. However when we reviewed our bill on checkout, we found we had been charged $90 on day one and $110 on day two. It turns out we were charged for "continental" breakfast on day one because we'd arrived late, although no-one thought to tell us and we were not actually made aware on any occasion that there was even a continental option. This is poor practice and again gives the impression of maximising money-generating opportunities. Not a great image for what is supposed to be a luxury brand. Mandarin Oriental should take a leaf out of GHM's book - they offer proper luxury and treat their customers with respect. This is a decent enough place, heavily geared towards business travellers, but don't expect anything more for your money than a room with a bed. We paid upwards of $400 per night and we don't really understand what we got for all that money.

Reviews.Title: “very nice view on skyline”
Reviews.Author: rmclee
Reviews.Content: spent 1 1/2 nights. despite we returned at 16h room was not made which shld not happen for such a category of hotel. checkout 15 min which is far too long (he had to check various time about use of minibar). staff very kind. check in at oriental club fast and detailed information was given. overall good standard with weaknesses as mentioned above. however view exceptional, if y book harbour view.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views and FANTASTIC location !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TRACEY E
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore. The service was impeccable!!!! The staff went above and beyond to cater for our needs and were so friendly. Best we have received anywhere. The rooms are presented beautifully and are lovely and clean but the view oh the view. It is breathtaking !!!!! Location wise it was great. Nice and close to Raffles, Orchard Rd, Esplanade, Marina Bay Sands, Flyer, River tours and bus tours. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Everything its cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: jacquelynrose
Reviews.Content: What a pity we only had one night there. The rooms were beautifully appointed (we had a premier harbour room) and the beds were really comfortable. Staff were excellent, polite and very helpful. Breakfast had the most choice I think I have ever seen. No wonder it was so busy! Next time I won't have to decide where to stay, I'll just go back to the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Duliabbot
Reviews.Content: I had a really nice time there. The breakfast and lunch both were amazing. I had a really nice view of the city from my window. it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “An exemplary hotel offering both business and holiday guest the best in the fine country of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: redexcel
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore several times and following this year’s visit -we are left with a dilemma how does one risk appraising any other brilliant hotel which Singapore has to offer; after all it has some of the best hotels in the world. As the value of the pound diminishes inversely with the value for such excellence then I suppose we might be tempted but alas one hopes this will not happen and those in power at the Mandarin will be astute enough to make more offers available to us de-valued Europeans. For now though the balance in still in favour of such high standards – especially the pool on fabulous rooms. One hopes the dress codes the hotel appeals of its guests is politely enforced by the respectable staff and then not abused by a small minority of those guests who do find it difficult reciprocate the esteem this hotel affords. As guest one can reflect on the beauty and enjoy this hotel because it is balanced well but not over shadowed by its exceptional standing as a business venue. The synergy of holidaying guests and people about business do not appear to have influence on each over and this says as much about the efficient management and staff as it does about the hotel facilities. Well done Mandarin your hotel and staff does the super country of Singapore credit. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Moritz_11
Reviews.Content: The minute that you enter the hotel, you automatically Know that its a well driven machine with lots of quality. Staff well spoken and everything possible. Pure luxury and a place that you would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel x”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaFord
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights before travelling to Sydney and it was wonderful. The staff are extremely helpful and polite and really want to make your stay enjoyable. The hotel is very clean and the roof top pool and bar is like a calm relaxing oasis. The views from the room and the hotel location was also great and very convenient. If we go back to Singapore we would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, luxurious setting and fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyKPayne
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Singapore and the Mandarin Oriental was perfect for our stay! The city is completely walkable and MO was perfectly situated to the ArtScience Museum, to Orchard Road, the Marina Bay Sands - great spot! And we chose to have access to the Club - Rudy Reyes was the most customer-service oriented host during our stay. We thoroughly enjoyed incredible breakfasts and cocktail hours in a beautiful, quiet and picturesque setting. He was able to help us book reservations, get our bearings with orienting us through local maps, etc. The fitness center was fabulous and the pool area transports you to a tranquil setting. We loved the Cherry Garden restaurant! And on Christmas morning, the hotel delivered a stocking full of goodies to every room - what a special touch!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding: late check-out”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller123
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was top-ranked in trip advisor - and rightly so. Don't have much to add to the glowing reviews here. This might be of interest: We had a flight out of Singapore at midnight, so we needed late check-out. The Mandarin Club offers some wonderful extra perks, including free breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails and, crucially, check-out at 6pm for about 100 dollars extra - well worth it for us, as I would otherwise have booked an extra night (admittedly at a cheaper hotel). Everything else was also just perfect: truly the lap of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “My first stay at Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: HappyfeetAustralia
Reviews.Content: Last month I stayed at Mandarin Orientatl Singapore during a work trip. this is my first time at this hotel but was surprisingly pleasant. From arrival to departure, the services were excellent from all the hotel staff. The location of this hotel is very good and the room has good view to the Marina Sand. The hotel is within walking distant to MRT. The shopping center next to it has food court and many resturants. Size of room is not big but adequate. It is very well designed and user friendly. I especially enjoyed the food in this hotel. I stayed at a few hotels in Singapore in the past, I found the food in this hotel is by far the best. I tried "melt" and the italian resturant in the hotel. Especially in Melt, the service is excellent even though they were busy. I ended up had dinner here twice instead of eating outside. I will highly recommend to this hotel to any travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TimandElisabeth
Reviews.Content: Treat yourself to a harbour view room, its worth the few extra dollars. I haven't stayed in a better hotel anywhere in the world. Truly 5 star, with excellent staff and a breakfast buffet to die for!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the bath with full city view!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelstar1972
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, great for when i need to come to singapore for business. located within one of the great shopping centres, fitness first gym also located here.....which is a plus if u have an international passport! Great pool, amazing breakfast - offers everything, staff are amazing large rooms comfy beds - makes coming back to the hotel after a long day at work very easy!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Novf
Reviews.Content: We stayed with this hotel for 3 nights. We got upgraded to a very nice sea-view room. The room is big and clean. The best thing about this hotel is service. All staff serve you with a sincere smile and caring attitude. The hotel is close to Marina Sands and Merlion which are currently the most popular attactions. However, it takes about 5-7 mins to walk to MRT and you need a lot of guidance in order to walk to the station. One secret place we discovered in the end is the food street just opposite to the hotel which opens at night. One thing the hotel should improve is the changing room of the swimming pool, which is so tiny and has no facilities like steam bath and whirlpoo which are quite common in most expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: swiss_nomad
Reviews.Content: Great location (splurge a little and get a Premier Harbor room or suite for a breahtaking view of the skyline), comfortable and spacious rooms, a breakfast buffet that will keep you going all day, impeccable service, a newly renovated pool area – and direct access to a huge shopping mall: The MO Singapore has it all. This was our second stay at this wonderful hotel – and we'll certainly be back for more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Easter Break”
Reviews.Author: CrysMax
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights over Easter in a Harbour View Room. We had the most wonderful views of the harbour and the city. The room was spacious, clean and the bed, pillows and linen were lovely to sleep on. The service and help we reveived from everyone was brilliant. The gentlemen on the door, the breakfast staff, the room attendants, the bar staff all were perfect. Thank you. The breakfast (all two huge rooms of food) was fresh and plentiful. Service was quick and accurate. The only thing that kind of was a let down was that right outside our window was a big field were the army guys were prepping for some Easter presentation so for two days we woke up at 6:30am to music and noises from the massive speakers. We can't blame the hotel for that though so maybe take ear plugs if you go around a holiday. We got engaged on this trip so having such a lovely hotel to come back to was a nice touch. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly services, recommend for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: zmenger
Reviews.Content: We took our 19-month-old son there and he really enjoyed his time there. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. We stayed at a suite and the deco is a bit outdated (our only complaint). We will definitely go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: ANMM
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family including two kids (7yr, 5yr) for 4 nights. Harbour view room with great views. Good location directly adjacent Marina Square and Suntec City Shopping centers. Plenty to eat around. Lovely pool area. <S$10 to Orchard Rd. Wife was unwell on last day - front desk staff kindly offered complimentary late checkout and sent up chicken consommé - nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “not much to recommend”
Reviews.Author: debaney
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and thee days there after a Regent cruise and was sadly dissappointed. I was alone so used room service and the food was very expensive and not that good. Went to Mall Food Court and that food was cheap and delicious. Went to the hotel tea/bar and odered a Singapore Sling but it was so sweet I did not want to drink it. They did immediately took it back and made it less intolerable, but like all the drinks there (only had two) they seemed to lack alcohol. Lost a fairly expensive ring there but not sure if I left it out or in unlocked suitcase. I will say that because they were not able to let me stay in room longer than check out time I booked 1 1/2 hour spa treatment - expensive but worth every cent! Barely made it to my flight but I was hydrated and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: cambert_10
Reviews.Content: Whenever I stay in Sinapore for business, I always stay at the Manarin Orientale. I like that I do not have to join any loyalty program to be well treated for being a frequent visitor. They keep track of my stays and provide me with noticeable rewards, such as upgrades, fruit bowls, greeting notes, etc. The staff almost always offer to take me to my room. My paper choice is always remembered. The breakfast location, buffet selection and attentiveness of the servers are all great. I believe Morton's is the best steak house in town. I don't often get the time but the pool and fitness centre are very nice. Most importantly the room is quiet, the bed is comfortable, the wifi signal is strong, tv channel selection is good and room service is prompt and good. I highly recommend this hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LWFPS
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location. Great service. Lobby is kind of small for such a fancy hotel, but still beautiful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best - as always from Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Choogster
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mandarin Oriental on two occasions and both reinforced my feeling that its probably my favourite hotel in the world. Staff are fantastic and go out of their way to make you feel at home (like checking your name as soon as you arrive and addressing you in a friendly way every time they see you). Reception staff were knowledgeable and friendly. The room had a stunning view of the harbour and pool was probably the best I've visited. A well earned No.1 place in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Babydoll_Nexa
Reviews.Content: I can understand why this hotel has won awards. There are a few hotels there that looked far more "rich", modernly designed than this one but it really depends on the style of design you sought after or you prefer. This hotel compared to others have been established far longer and yet they still were able to maintain that modern simplicity, understated elegance that sparks timelessness in its design. The room we stayed in had an amazing harbour view and we agreed it was the comfiest bed ever. Later on we realised it's because of the lush mattress topper they use. The pool area, the service etc were all great. Would highly recommend! Location was right in the middle of Marina Bay and shopping malls. You can walk it to other places as long as you have decent flats with you.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: harrodsfan
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights here. The view was wonderful. The lobby was spectacular. Dinner in the spring moon restaurant was good. The room was small for the price. The hotel didn't have a shop of any kind?? It had been attached to a shopping mall but the entrance was now closed. The breakfast buffet was too spread out and confusing and the coffee was horrible. Service was not great. There are too many other great hotels in Singapore. There was no restaurant with a view of the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buffet Breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: beauoli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. We just loved the hotel. The room was beautiful and we had a spectacular view of the harbor. The buffet breakfast is incredible!! Probably the best buffet breakfast I have ever had!!

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Polly-Anna56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Singapore for just a few days in March 2012. We chose to stay at the Mandarin Oriental after receiving a very good recommendation from my sister and her partner who have stayed there often. We were not disappointed. A thoroughly enjoyable stay in a very appealing hotel with a warm and inviting atmosphere, excellent and attentive staff. Our room was not only attractive and comfortable but afforded us with a stunning view of the harbour and the city. We ate in the hotel, swam in the pool and enjoyed the facilities of the fitness centre - all were terrific. Suffice it is to say, we cannot wait for an excuse to return to Singapore and the Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Best View of Marina Bay Sands & City Skyline”
Reviews.Author: KLemaire
Reviews.Content: Fabulous view in Room 1601 of Marina Bay Sands. Everyone was so nice & friendly. The room was always nicely done & room service were very nice. Staff at Cherry Garden were very friendly & professional & the pool area was great. The hotel is much older than that of the one in HK but still very nice. Amazing views & a wide range of food for room service. Very delicious! Great stay...

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: lgheartny
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend in March with baby. The service was excellent, the lady who checked us in called us Mr and Mrs X every time she saw us. Room was tidy and ready on time. The baby cot was excellent quality. Our little one even got her own set of toiletries. Breakfast in Melt, the world cafe had a pretty broad range of food and it was always easy to get seated. The hotel has an artsy feel to it. Poolside bar was very relaxing. Good location for walking about town. Heard Mortons steak house was good but didn't try it. Hotel limo from airport was also great, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bichelin
Reviews.Content: one word : excellent in every way ! (ok that's not one word...)

Reviews.Title: “Extreme”
Reviews.Author: Finn B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel recently and was extremely pleased with the service and room. Everything was so stylish and spotless and a true luxury experience. The Club lounge was so serene and after a busy day in the office a great retreat. Overall a really nice property with service to match

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 5 nights. one of the best 5 star hotels.”
Reviews.Author: YONGSU J
Reviews.Content: The same as I expected, it's the world top class hotel. - Location : Okay, but I cannot tell you if it's convenient also for the public transportation, as I've only used taxi. Staff at the front door are very helpful for getting a taxi. - Room : View, space all are good as you can see from the pictures. One shortfall is that you have to pay for the in-room internet service, 15$ for 6 Hrs, 20$ for 12 Hrs, 30$ for a day... - Pool : They are so attentive that they serve wet towel and amusement regularly. It's not huge but well designed for both the adults and kids. There was no jacuzzi. (I may be wrong, but I failed to find it.) I was lucky to have this great room at very cheap price (Relatively, around 280$ per night.) It's important to select dates when there are no big event in S'pore for the good price if you can. Ask for the good view. I stayed at an ocean view room during this visit, but want to try the opposite view room with balcony. The rooms with balcony are all city view, but look more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Refined and luxuous hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: PatrickDebus
Reviews.Content: Top class and luxuous hotel (like all the other Mandarin hotels), with very dedicated service and relaxing atmosphere. Beautiful atrium and very decoration inside the hotel (not so nice from outside). Bar quite expensive and not really "top" ("hoegaarden" 3 times more expensive that other nice places in Singapore and, last but not least, not served in the correct glass) One of the best address in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: Credo72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights whilst visiting family. Having stayed in many hotels around the world this hotel is first class. The staff are so friendly and the hotel is in a great location. The rooms are kept to a high standard and the views are amazing (go for the ocean view). Make sure you get up for breakfast it is superb. I was so impressed with the staff I completed the customer survey when I returned home and the Resident Manager Jess Lam emailed me personally to say thanks for my comments!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendy339
Reviews.Content: very good hotel, rooms are spacious and comfortable, the pool area very clean and beautiful, congratulations are also excellent service and friendliness of staff, highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Special”
Reviews.Author: SirMrMits
Reviews.Content: The Oriental in Singapore, is exactly as described by most in the reviews. Probably one of the top hotels in the world of doing its fundamental job to the highest degree. We arrived and were treated as Royalty, and as soon as we arrived were provided with Champagne and shown to our huge room overlooking the rest of the beautiful island and the ocean. The accommodation and room facilties were excellent and staff were well mannered and efficient in carrying out their duties, providing us with support and care throughout our stay. The restaurants, bars and facilties were top rate and I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to couples, business people, friends or family. In terms of location, this hotel is excellent, provding a great place to use as a base to roam the area. Top 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in March this year and what an experiece! Fantastic rooms, bathrooms and most of all staff. Yes it is expensive to eat and drink in the hotel but as they say, you get what you pay for. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. It''s fantastic and I can't wait to visit again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazonlady1
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the most wonderful hotel, nothing is a trouble for the staff, the rooms are spacious with every facility. The pool area is wonderful and the staff so attentive to your every needs. really enjoyed our stay there for two nights, absolutely wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: KandiManPerth
Reviews.Content: Since our first overnight stay over ten years ago, we have been back at least once a year to enjoy the experience that this hotel offers. The rooms are excellent and they are fitted out for a comfortable stay. We love the DVD/TV with surround sound. This hotel has amazing helpful and friendly service from every staff member. Breakfast in the Melt Cafe was a wonderful way to start the day. There is a comprehensive selection of food in the buffet and the staff are friendly and offer great service. We had a significant birthday celebration during our last visit and the hotel made the event something very special. The pool area has been renewed and is now like a resort. We have stayed at a lot of hotels worldwide and this one is simply our best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: RomanoBellini
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in early March. This was a business trip for my wife and I was the tourist. What I noticed first was the nice scent throughout the hotel. When you want something from the front desk, you are greeted first by a hostess who inquires about your need and then directs you to an open person at the desk. Good hotel setup with nice bars and restaurants, including a Morton's. The hotel has the rooms on the outside of a large lobby opening which goes straight up. We were on the executive floor but did not go to the lounge. The room was very nice but ours did not have a city view. Which for us is ok. It was well layed out and had the nice touches in the bathroom and throughout. The most spectacular amenity was the pool, which is on the rooftop and quite large. You can easily do laps. The view of the city from the pool area is fantastic and the day beds and the pool furniture looked quite comfy. The workout area is a nice room but does not have a great variety for weight training. It does have many running and eliptical machines so I can't see there every being a wait for one of those. Now the location...... it is about 4 blocks from the City Hall subway which can be reached either outdoors or indoors. Actually, with the humidity in Singapore, going indoors is very popular. You can also walk to One Fullerton (Marina Bay) and then further to Boat and Clark Quay's. If you are a runner, you can easily hook up with the river trails from here. Finally, all the people working here are very friendly and ready to have a nice chat and to ensure they can do whatever they can to make your stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be treated like royalty this is the place”
Reviews.Author: SBF2
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to celebrate our anniversary. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were treated as if we were a royal couple. The service at all Mandarin Orientals is fabulous, but the service in Singapore is beyond compare. Every one we met bent over backwards to make our stay the most memorable possible. The property is in a great location and all available services were perfect. My wife thought her massage experience was the best she ever had. Our only complaint was that we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Highest quality hotel..but a little boring!”
Reviews.Author: Brummy40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several days before heading off on a Clippper ship cruise to Thailand. Had a club room, which meant we could sample all the lovely nibbles etc at lunchtime as well as the champagne and wine in the evening. The pool area is very nice and the staff are great in every respect, not least in the club floor. The hotel is more orientated to a business clientele, which is understandable, but it might seem a little stuffy and boring. It is very large and very well maintained. The rooms - we visited twice - are of a very high quality, and the breakfast was delicious and worth every penny. This is a great place to stay for a short time....but then again, that's Singapore in a nutshell I suppose. Expensive, but very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful hotel whose service is second to none!!”
Reviews.Author: riocobb
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with excellent rooms, and a wonderful pool area with amazing service. I was here for 4 nights and could not fault the hotel at all. The rooms were of a very high standard and the pool and spa were excellent and a wonderful place to relax. Tea and coffee is served in the lobby early morning if you don't fancy breakfast but if you do then the breakfast buffet has a huge array of choice and of top quality.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, Comfortable Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: DesertCA
Reviews.Content: 3 day stay in 2 connecting rooms for 3 people -- bathrooms are AWESOME. All conveniences and beds are heavenly. Staff is welcoming, helpful and very pleasant. Not just clean and comfortable, but sumptuous. Would stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what to fault.”
Reviews.Author: buibui80
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed one night in the City Suite and had a wonderful experience. If there is a chance, I will stay here again. Service: Check-in to the hotel is fast. If you meet a staff at the corridor, he/she will greet you. The service at the Melt Cafe is good too. Empty plates are cleared fast. Room: Very spacious with a huge L-shaped sofa that can probably sit 6 people, comes with a 32 inch LCD TV, iPod docker and DVD player. If you bring a laptop, you can plug it to the TV with the cables that is provided in-room. Welcome fruits are provided. Bedroom also comes with LCD TV, iPod docker and DVD player. The bed is very comfortable. The corridor to the toilet is also quite spacious which has a big cupboard, some drawers and luggage storage area, which can store about 2 big luggages and a few small ones. Toilet comes with a separate shower area and a bathtub, provided with bath salt and toiletries. Later then we know that the suite is 73 square metres in size. View: Not much of a view for the room we stay as it is facing Suntec City. Breakfast: Very delicious breakfast buffet. The breakfast closes at 10:30am. We went for the breakfast at 10am and the staff are still preparing new food to replenish those that has finished. At 10:30am, the staff went to each table to inform us that they are closing soon but we can grab our food first and continue eating while they keep the food. The waffle is one of my favourite as it's crispy! Gym: Upon entering, we are given a bottle of water and a towel each. The staff is attentive enough to know that I have changed to another machine after one workout and came to ask whether I need her assistance. In a typical gym, there will be shared TV and the volume not very audible. In Oriental, the TV is on the machine itself which is on the same screen as the workout setting. You can toggle the screen to view between the TV and the workout status, or show both at the same time. Earphone is provided for use to watch TV but request it from the staff at the gym and return it after use. The TV programmes come in many languages with channels like HBO, Star Movies, etc. If that is not enough, you can plug your iPhone or iPod to the machine. Swimming Pool: We didn't use the pool and it is very crowded during the day. What makes this pool special is the sunbath chairs in the pool which means, the chair is half dipped in the pool and you can sit on the chair to sunbath and also partially submerge in water. Beside the pool are sheltered daybeds that can fit 2 person each. These beds comes with a iPod docker, self-controlled fan, and speakers so you can listen to your favourite music at the privacy of your own day bed. Overall, we are very satisfied with everything that the hotel has offered and will recommend to anyone who wants to stay at this hotel but it is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at one of the other Mandarin hotels on previous visits, this was our first time at the Oriental and we were delighted with our choice. Other reviewers have commented on the situation - very convenient and well located with great views from the higher floors. What we particularly appreciated was the quiet elegance of the whole Oriental experience. Nothing is overstated, not a thing jars the eye or the ear. After a day out in the city, the hotel is a blissfully peaceful place to return to. Our room on the 18th floor was spacious and very well appointed. Everything was meticulously placed and spotlessly clean - with the notable exception of one very large handprint on the mirrored bathroom door! The cool, fresh bedlinen and very comfortable bed gave us good nights' sleep and we appreciated the tea tray too. I'd describe the breakfast offer in Melt as nothing short of spectacular! So many choices, the range and variety of food, all presented beautifully made a great start to the day. Just when I thought I'd discovered every corner of the buffet, I'd turn a different way and discover a whole new section of fresh fruit or bakery to tempt me. Finally, the staff are universally delightful. Polite and professional, their principal concern was always our comfort and enjoyment and a smile was always part of their response. We would stay here again without question and recommend the Mandarin Oriental wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “An all class hotel”
Reviews.Author: JWGT1957
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling a lot over the past 7 months for business and I've been to Singapore several times in the past few months, staying at a few different hotels. The Mandarin Oriental is an excellent hotel and for the business traveller it really doesn't matter much that the location is a little out of the way from the main shopping locations like Orchard Road and given the size of Singapore and the cheap taxi fares the location shouldn't really matter much to the vacation traveller either. This MO hotel is excellent, it may not have the dazzling lobby of some 5 star hotels but the service and rooms are top class. The staff were always very friendly and willing to assist and I had no issue what so ever with the room or facilities. Value for money is reasonably good, service is 5 star, bed comfort not the best but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Perle23
Reviews.Content: The staff ranging from valet, concierge, front desk, room service, and managers were exceptionally pleasant and professional. Another distinguishing attribute is the diversity of staff of varying nationalities. It is a remarkable demonstration of the hotel's commitment to cater for an international clientele. Upon arrival, my room was being meticulously checked - I told the staff not to worry about my being there and to keep working. Everything from the plug of the bath to the alignment of toiletries were arranged to perfection. The most amazing feature of my room - the view of the Marina Bay! The extra comfortable bed provides great respite after ardious business travel. The food at Melt - The World Cafe, and Morton's Steakhouse are another good reason to stay here. For someone whom time is always of the essence, the only thing that I wished which could be changed about this hotel is its location to the MRT. It's about a 10 minute stroll away - no worries for holiday makers though. However, everything else makes up for this small disadvantage.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: avidtravelerColorado
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a stay in Singapore and can't' say enough good things about this hotel and Singapore in general. First the hotel is fabulous. The staff is so well trained that although the hotel is large, they make you feel like the only guest. The staff at the Melt restaurant was amazing! They knew our name after the first meal and couldn't do enough for us the rest of the stay. If you can get an ocean or harbor view room you are in for a treat!

Reviews.Title: “No 1 in Singapore...Quality all the way !”
Reviews.Author: djhallett
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 day stopover in Singapore and our hotel was outstanding. From the check in, to the beautiful appointed room with views over the marina we could not ask for more. Staff were outstanding throughout the hotel, from those who served us High tea, to the breakfast area in Melt - World cafe. However we celebrated my birthday on a sunday in the Cherry Garden which serves cantonese cuisine and I have to admit it was one of the most memorable of occasions of my life! The hostess who greeted us provided a level of service I can only rate as outstanding!!!! And the Dim sum...well it's the best I have ever eaten and I have been to lots of Dim sum restaurants and the quality and choice was amazing. This hotel deserves its rating... No 1 in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Big Operation-Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: jmurrayolympic
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay at MO in Singapore--besides a great location (Marina Bay) the views are also great. Stayed in a Mandarin Grand room & got early ck in inspite of the usual 2 pm. Airport pick up & delivery back to Changi seamless. Name recognition by whole staff is impressive & makes you feel that your every whim is carefully looked after. Rooms are spotless & loaded with attention to detail. Easily arranged a private meeting area for business w/ excellent service.Breakfast buffet huge & quality plus selections (including fresh cooked eggs while you wait) outstanding. Ate at 2 hotel restaurants: Mortons & Cherry Garden--handy with great food. Axis bar is attractive, comfortable & Exc service. Superb roomy fitness center & grat outdoor pool. Next time I'll go for a club floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: smercury
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect experience from start to finish. We got upgraded to a suite overlooking the entire harbor, which was stunning. The shower had great water pressure, but was a little cramped for space. The breakfast buffet was absolutely amazing with the variety of food. The hotel is conveniently located next to one of their mega malls and near the stop of the Hop-on bus, which we took advantage of one day. The concierge was always helpful. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful Mandarin Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dawn M
Reviews.Content: A couple of the other people who reviewed the property are correct... when taking a taxi just call it the Oriental - it'll save for a lot of confusion. We stayed in a club level room which was really nice because you had your own concierge as well as a restaurant that serves breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails and tappas every day at no additional charge. The room was clean, pretty large and had a beathtaking view of the city skyline. The staff was very friendly and helpful. As usual, it was a 5+ star Mandarin experience

Reviews.Title: “taxis call it "Oriental"”
Reviews.Author: lightravel
Reviews.Content: Caution- there are 3 Mandarins in Singapore... 2 of which are by the marina... so don't say "mandarin oriental", just call it "oriental" (which apparently was what it used to be called). The hotel is nice. The lobby looks a little dated, but that's very "Mandarin" (just like the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong). The room is really comfortable! Bathroom amenities/coffee were restocked everyday. we got a room facing the flyer and sands. the view at night is amazing. The location is not bad. It's right next to a huge mall, with a food court and a hundred other restaurants all over the mall. nothing fine dining, but full of family style feasts and fast food joints. It's also conveniently located off a major road, so there's never a long wait for taxis (always driving by). The Sands, Esplanda, Fullerton Hotel and Merlion are all within walking distance (I actually walked to all of them in the same afternoon. Took maybe an hour or two, with frequent photo stops here and there). We didn't eat at any of the other restaurants except the breakfast buffet (because we wanted to save our stomach for pepper crabs at Long Beach and No Sign. both were pretty good). The food was delicious, but there was a line for everything- noodles, eggs, pancake, waffles, juice. So after the first morning, i just eating pastries and cooked food (which was understandably nothing special) for the duration of my stay. We also didnt go to the pool, but I can see it from my room. Looks really nice, but crowded. I would probably not choose to stay here again, simply because I've already explored everything around the hotel. But if you like the Marina neighbourhood, this is not a bad selection.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: sray23
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with gorgeous views, helpful, attentive and very friendly staff, this hotel would be as as close to perfect as one will get! Extremely pleased with the stay there and the hotel lives up to its 5 star status every bit.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast/Pool - Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TravelbumSouthUK
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms in this hotel for a two night stay in February for a group of five (4 adults/1 child). We were looking for a hotel that was centrally located and had a great pool area. We had booked a standard room and a Mandarin Grand room (for the couple with a child). Upon arrival the couple with the child were upgraded to a one bedroom suite which was done in order to keep both rooms near each other (a nice touch). The one bedroom suite was amazing and had its own private balcony and gorgeous views of Marina Bay. The standard room was nice, but considering the price, not amazing. The whole hotel appears to be built around a central atrium area which resembles the inside of a honeycomb and seems somewhat dated. It does not maintain the sleek Asian luxury hotel feel of the lobby/reception area or more modern feel of the pool area. However, overall the hotel is of a five star standard and is well worth a visit. The best things about the hotel are the breakfast buffet which is definately something to behold and the pool area. Positives: 1. Breakfast has so many choices it would be impossible to want for anything. The quality was very good. 2. Pool is great any time of the day and has beautiful views of the City. Spending a day on a cabana is a real treat and poolside food and service are great. We also enjoyed dinner at Bay@5 one evening. 3. The gym is great. Very modern. 4. Spa treatments, although pricey, are very nice. Not so great 1. For the price, there are other hotels in Singapore which are just as good (if not better) and better value. 2. Concierge could not find a tour booking we made prior to arrival. We really enjoyed our visit and would recommend it to others. However, we did stay in other, better value hotels, we would recommend first.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: Australia1959
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at The Mandarin Oriental, Singapore for four days at the start of a trip to the east and Australia. Having previously stayed at the MO in KL (which is far better) we had expected something special but were very disappointed especially with the service. When we arrived we were checked in to our room and did not get the upgrade that we had been promised through our agent. The check in gentleman then tried to get us to pay another $90 per night to upgrade to Club Service which meant use of The Club Room and a late check out. Don't waste your money as we got a free late check out (an extra 4 hours) by speaking to The Manager. The pool area does not have enough sunbeds for the size of the hotel and if you do not get there early you will be disappointed. The food and drink are priced more highly then London, $25 for two drinks in the bar! Walk across the road and eat at the outdoor cafes near the Mall for much better value. Breakfast is very much the conveyor belt international type catering for huge numbers. We felt very processed. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Steak heaven”
Reviews.Author: sharonsoon
Reviews.Content: Went to Morten's Steakhouse in the hotel, and it was simply an awesome experience. The service was good, and the atmosphere suitable for a romantic, pleasant evening. Our choice was made, and the steaks were perfectly done. The New York Strip for him, and the classic Ribeye for me. Somehow we fell silent as we enjoyed the meal. Certainly a surreal gourmet experience. I look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: rovingruby
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to the Mandarin Oriental, and the standard was as good as always. I love everything about this hotel - the location, the food, the service and that fabulous pool. I do think that you need to be using all this hotel's facilities to get the best from it. If I simply wanted a room, I might not pick this hotel - the rooms are good but probably no better than other hotels in the same class. It is the whole package that impresses, when one has the chance to see excellence in service standards. I do love the marina view and always pick a room facing in that direction. An added attraction now is the light show every night from the Marina Bay Sands that is visible from marina facing rooms. The breakfasts in the MO are fabulous. Certainly the largest selection of food that I have ever encountered in a breakfast buffet and all of wonderful quality. I'd also love to know how they pull off the memory trick of remembering everyone's names. On day one its easy - you give a room number, so of course they know. But on day 2 and subsequent days they are almost uncanny when they greet you by name before you have spoken, take you to a table that already has your preferred newspaper lying on it because they saw you select it from the rack the first day, and bring you without needing to be told the tea for me and coffee for my husband. It is that sort of attention to detail that marks this hotel out - and the service is delivered with a smile and warmth. I also love the pool - so much so that I currently have a picture of it as wallpaper on my computer! The pool is surrounded by comfortable loungers and cabanas, and lots of greenery - a perfect oasis where I have spent many relaxed and happy hours. There is a good food and beverage service there and also staff frequently offer water, cool cloths and complimentary snacks. I can't imagine going anywhere else when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a price”
Reviews.Author: Glamgran56
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a treat having back packed around New Zealand and Australia, so was delighted to be upgraded to a higher floor over looking the marina. The receptionist persuaded me to pay for the Mandarin Executive club @ S$130 which I did. I was escorted to the 19th floor which was good but didn't really have much of a view. However the staff were very attentive. My room was really a wow factor. Breakfast was fine, but didn't partake of the champagne and wished I'd gone downstairs to the Melt bistro. Service was what you would expect and at times, frankly, too much. I had three people serving my lunch one day. Pool was fantastic, and a great Singapore sky line. On check out it was only than that it became clear that the upgrade to the executive club was PER DAY. Now I can't do justice in food and drink per day to that amount, and if you go to the club when it's not serving food or drink then it's very different, empty and unfriendly. Alcohol is VERY expensive. But I enjoyed the experience but probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: shaunsia
Reviews.Content: First of all for the money I paid (I stayed at the Club Room) there is really nothing much to boost about albeit the service was exemplary. The check-in was ok (they checked me in at the lobby reception not sure why I was not escorted to check in at the Club Floor which they should) and the staffs on a general note are very courteous, helpful and professional. I booked the Club Room marina view but upon entering the room realised that it was ocean facing. They claimed that for Club Floor there is no distinction between marina or ocean facing like the cheaper room types so be sure to specify what you want during booking if marina facing is what you desire. For me specifically I was staying the night on Chinese New Year eve so it was important for me to have marina view to watch the fire works. Anyway there was no problem at all I was shiftly moved to the room I wanted so I gave them the credit for that. Honestly I was very much looking forward to thier Club Lounge as the highlight of my stay but there was just something left to be desired. The Lounge has nice cosy atmosphere, but gave you the feeling that somehow it needs a face lift to be on par with many of the 5* hotels around. Moreover the lounge actually faces the boring city rather the marina. The afternoon tea was quite sterile too as I expected more hot food and desert choices. The evening cocktails was alright, with nice white wine (Cloudy Bay) and champagne. The good thing about booking the Club Room is you also get guranteed 6 pm late check-out. The room is beautifully appointed but nothing spectacular for the price I paid, a bit on the smaller side but well maintained. You can tell that the toilet is of a 90's design, with a minuscule bathtub (it is easily the smallest I have seen for the past 10 years of my hotel stay) and a shower cubicle so tiny you can hardly maneuver your hands to wash your back. The only marvelous thing about this hotel is the swimming pool - absolutely gorgeous! It is a must try even if you just wanna lay down on the sun bed. The pool staffs were attentive and will help you to get a sun bed when you enter the swimming pool. Overall is this hotel worth the price tag? I would say not really, but if service is the main thing you are after then you shall not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rudy b
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel on new year exellent view of the firework .the hotel is fantastique very good service exellent food beautifull swimmingpool we go back

Reviews.Title: “LOVE”
Reviews.Author: Mish1984
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, the people and the food. Everything was simply perfect. The staff remembered our names and would always make us feel very important.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBurl
Reviews.Content: There are many good things about this hotel. The location is great - above the Marina Square shopping centre which connects underground to Suntec City and Raffles. It's also convenient for the CBD, the old colonial district and the metro. Views are also fabulous. Best of all is the pool which is a real plus if travelling with children. The rooms are pleasant and well equipped but a bit dated despite a makeover and some of the public areas are crying out for refurbishment. On the down side, Melt (the restaurant serving breakfast and less expensive meals) is very dated and, although the choice was good, the quality of the breakfast buffet left room for improvement. The service provided by the concierge was also disappointing - often very busy and questionable local knowledge. My chief gripe was the charge made for internet - I don't mind paying something but the charge here is S$30 a day which is, quite simply, far too much. Would I recommend the hotel or stay here again? I would certainly think about it for the views, pool and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, and buffet”
Reviews.Author: stuckOntravels
Reviews.Content: Yes, you read that correctly...buffet. I am not a buffet fan. Certainly not for dinner. And since I am living in Asia right now, all 5 star hotels have a large breakfast buffet spread included with the room (unlike the States). And to top it off, I'm a foodie! So for me to start this review with a nod to the Mandarin Oriental's buffet seems unlike me. But the buffet is really well done. Fresh, great variety, high quality. Particularly dinner (though it'll cost you S$68-S$78). Breakfast is also good though service needs more staff. Location at Marina Square is great. You can jump right onto the MRT through the mall. You can walk around the area to Esplanade, Shoppes at Marina Sands, Raffles City, Chijmes. Gym is good. Pool area is beautiful with great service. In general, service here is fantastic: check-in, check-out, room service, restaurant service, bell hops. Rooms are quiet, beds are comfortable, everything works, water pressure and temperature great. People have mentioned that the rooms seem dated. They must be used to the new explosion of China 5 star hotels. If you are used to traveling in the States or Europe - you'll ask "wait, what's wrong with this room?". Only issue I have is the price of food - though they do make up for it partially with excellent presentation and quality. Room service of a garden salad (no protein) with a plate of fruit was something like S$60. Seems a bit excessive. Would highly recommend. I would also recommend the Pan Pacific which is in the same area. Mandarin Oriental has a more intimate feel, better buffet. Pan Pacific is more modern/open feel with a great Indian restaurant (though equally pricey). I have stayed at both several times.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Rover10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Marina Bay area close to the Flyer observation wheel but with few bars and restaurants in walkable distance. Not a problem however as Singapore's taxis are plentiful, well regulated and cheap - a S$10 (£5/$8) ride will take you to Orchard Road's shops or downtown restaurants. The service throughout this hotel is outstanding - from Concierge to Housekeeping and Poolside it is consistently high. The MO is a 20 minute taxi ride from Singapore Airport and we used it twice recently as a stopover between long flights. A 6 00pm late check out costs around S$ 190 but includes use of the Club lounge on the 19th Floor. I have stayed in few better hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro D
Reviews.Content: very convenient location and all the services you can expect from a top hotel chain. Front desk is always busy and service there is below the standard of the rest of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view”
Reviews.Author: migratorychic
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress how lovely the view was from our harbour-view room, especially at night. During the day, you get a perfect view of the Marina Bay Sands and the Merlion. At night, the city lights are just fantastic. The morning buffet breakfast was also something to behold, especially the fresh juices and the sheer variety of cuisine. The coffee was just OK. In-room, toiletries provided are lemongrass-ginger scented and of course, the cleanliness of MO is top-notch. The hotel itself is in major need of a face-lift (btw, I heard the Fairmont Singapore is newly renovated with very spacious rooms). The structure seems monolithic and the lobby is rather dark... the hallways make the MO feel like a convention centre. While we were given access to the gym facilities, we were not given the opportunity to use the steam room (the Landmark MO in Hong Kong is very good with that). The reason given was that it might be too crowded, however, at the time, the spa was completely empty. The business centre also allows exactly 5 minutes of free internet access, which I found very strange. Overall, the stay was very comfy and the view was spectacular, but I don't feel this particular MO was up to the standard of some of the other MO properties we've visited. Still a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel with service to match with great views.”
Reviews.Author: GAKill
Reviews.Content: Had junior suite over looking wheel and harbor. Great view. Used 19th club lounge great service from staff like Mila. Singapore noodles at breakfast there BTW some of the best I have had. Meeting room on 5th floor ok but a bit dark. Food very high standard. Great steak at Mortens. Good buffets, breakfasts and lunches at Melt. Again good service from staff like Ameya. Used gym - well appointed with good outside yoga area.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel - hard to fault it and the pool area is amazing”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneShepherdess
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a combination of business and pleasure. Great location with easy access to the CBD, Marina Bay, shops and food outlets in Marina Square. The hotel rooms were very comfortable - we had a fantastic room with a bay/ harbour view. We were on a high floor and could see the light show each evening and the Marina Bay complex - one of the best views from any hotel I have stayed in. The room was very quiet and the bed really comfortable and despite jet lag I slept very well indeed. We had room service one evening as we were too late to eat out and the Laksa was excellent! The pool is superb. The layout is great - plenty of shade and very comfortable cabanas to lounge in - and great views of the city and the bay. Very attentive service too. This will be my hotel of choice in Singapore from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault it”
Reviews.Author: LouiseM15
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 3 times now, most recently twice as a stop over for our trip to the Maldives. The service is unbelivably good, the concierge has helped up to book many meals, find out where to buys games, where to eat the best kway teow. We were on our honeymoon for the last trip and got given a nice bottle of wine and chocolates on each visit. Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Simply a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shirpet
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit Sigapore we stay at the Mandarin Oriental hotel. Why? Because we have yet to find anything other than sheer professinalism in the management and quality plus comfort in the accomodation. We also love the location, next to a shopping mall and air conditioned walkways to other malls and the MRT (Mass Transut Railway). The hotel is also virtually on the Harbour which, since our last visit, can now be walked around. We just love Singapore as well as the mandarin Oriental

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: PeterGD
Reviews.Content: I was rather disappointed with the Mandarin Oriental - our room was quite small and for the first couple of days it had a very strong, strange smell. A couple of mornings running we were woken by some sort of building/maintenance work going on - I did call to complain, but it did not stop, not did I get and apology. On arrival we were 'sold' an 'upgrade' to the 'club' which is really a waste on money. I would have thought that a hotel like this should provide things like free wifi included in the room rate and not have include it in a 'extras' package. The club itself was fine, but I really should not have bothered with it. Breakfast would have been much cheaper in the neighbouring shopping mall. Staff were all very polite and the Spa and pool area were great. All in all, rather mixed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with extraordinary customer service”
Reviews.Author: Anti-jellyfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 12 nights in January 2012 after a stay in Hong Kong. We experienced spectacular customer service from the staff this is really what sets this hotel apart from the others. The rooms were immaculate and very well decorated and maintained. Although the location isn't perfect (you need to get a MRT to get to orchard rd) the service we received definitely made up for it. P.S Breakfast is huge !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Love the Song Birds”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: My finance was put here when he came to teach a 3-day class. The meeting rooms were well equipped and had natural light - which was a huge plus. And I cannot say enough good about the staff. Our room was not elaborate but certainly very comfortable and it had a balcony over looking the pool and the lights of the city. The bathroom was new and modern which was a plus for me. My finance's father also came to visit with us and his room was similar but overlooked the main street and shopping area. Again basic but very comfortable. The location of this hotel is a plus and the lobby atrium is full of music from the song birds that they have out during the day. The lobby bar is nice to hang it after a long day. Agree with others to get breakfast included with your room. Buffet is fantastic. The Italian restaurant in the hotel is also very good. We found the staff very accommodating and the location fantastic for easy access to tour buses and shopping areas. The pool area is a big plus an oasis in a big city. The only negative would be the fee for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Wow...What can I say? It was a perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: RALFBKK
Reviews.Content: My wife, 4 year old son and me had the privilege to attend our Asian Meeting in December 2011. After a luxurious ride on Thai Airways to Singapore we checked in to our room at the 17 Floor. We were greeted by super friendly staff who escorted us up to our room which was on the Club Level. Service and Rooms were perfect and my son really enjoyed the swimming pool and outdoor area. I had the chance to spin a few rounds every morning at their very nice fitness center which opens already at 0700 am. During my days of meetings and working I enjoyed the private breakfast in their Club Lounge. Service up there was extremely attentive and staff went the extra mile to please everyone of their guests. After 6pm there are free drinks (lots of different beers and wines are available) and great small snacks available. The Club lounge is also a great place to hold meetings since there 2 private meeting rooms available. Over the weekend we enjoyed our breakfast in the restaurant at the 4th Floor and let me tell you, this is something else. Their presentation is amazing and they have so many things to offer including a fruit juice bar. My son was so happy there and one of the reason is of course, that the staff at the Singapore Mandarin Oriental are very kid friendly. Folks, this place is a great experience and if you ever have the chance to stay there, then do it because for us it was an amazing 4 days with so many benefits. We felt so very welcome and happy there. Will be back here for sure as well.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: billinda-10
Reviews.Content: The hotel service and cleanliness was superb, the staff seemed to know what i wanted before I did. We felt very welcome, the rooms had everything we could need.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful :)”
Reviews.Author: avogan
Reviews.Content: We treated ourselves to a lovely night here in a harbour view club room- for the view alone, it was totally worth it. The room itself was lovely, and wifi was included in the club benefits. We found all staff, particularly those in the Club Lounge, to be efficient, pleasant and very welcoming. For a short first time stop in Singapore, the location was ideal to explore the Marina Bay area. The selling point for us was the club benefits included late-check out- as we had an evening flight out of Singapore, this enabled us to explore during the day and use the room before we had to leave. Just wonderful- we certainly hope to come back

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location!”
Reviews.Author: DaisySails
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights out of London and 1 night on our way back. The location was amazing. You can walk to Raffles Hotel and to Bay Sands Marina plus you are right outside an endless maze of shopping malls reached underground. As for the hotel, a harbour view room is a must if you can. This was panoramic. The room was quite spacious and had everything we needed. Plastic milk cartons were a disappointment. Mini bar prices as usual, exorbitant. The breakfast was very comprehensive. Would recommend you sit outside if it's nice as inside is reminiscent of a cosmopolitan bun fight. Very very busy and there were queues for some chef services. The staff were without exception absolutely delightful and made us feel truly valued. We had been let down by our airport pick up, nothing to do with the hotel, and the concierge contacted the firm and fed back to us. Just across the road was a nice local eating venue Makhan Sutra, which was lovely and felt a bit more like the old Singapore. Sadly so much of that has gone. All in all the joy of this hotel was the staff and the location. the interior atrium is very stark and rather dark and we felt that some of the areas would benefit from a refit. As with other guests, we were disgusted that in this day and age and at this hotel standard you had to pay for Wi Fi, what's that about!

Reviews.Title: “I agree with majority of the review here”
Reviews.Author: Can M
Reviews.Content: That this hotel is an excellent hotel. I've been coming here since I was a kid with my parents. Now that I'm an adult and travel on my own, I stay here to reminisce the good ol days.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great pool”
Reviews.Author: singmaster
Reviews.Content: I love swimming laps in pools in Asia. I don't know why, but I do and the pool here is amazing. It is the best thing about the hotel in fact. I didn't think the rooms were anything special, although they were perfectly fine. The breakfast is also pretty fantastic, make sure you get it included in your rate. It has pretty much everything you want - except for waiters constantly bringing you coffee - you have to wave them down for that!

Reviews.Title: “good choice and location”
Reviews.Author: ustinov331
Reviews.Content: Great location, and surely 'an older hotel, but with good service and rooms large and clean. I like the massage spa, well-organized and excellent massages, very good level of cleanliness. Decent prices for singapore. Advised

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality. Best Club/Executive floor experience.”
Reviews.Author: fakeis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Club floor and enjoyed one of the best services. Champagne breakfast is superb. There is a buffet and an additional menu which is served properly by a waiting staff (who remembers you by name and is almost like your own personal butler). Afternoon tea and evening hours d'voures are excellent. Gym is large and pool area is always waited by attentive staff. I didn't use the spa but I hear it is adequate. Chinese restaurant in the hotel was very good (but after you get used to the exceptional service of the hotel staff, you start to expect the same from everyone else). Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Wiland
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight to attend a friend's wedding. The hotel staff was extremely sincere in their service standards. Real smiles and genuine in providing quality service, Eg, orienting us at Melt Buffet to the various available counters. Explaining the food which was served with pride. When I asked for the Gents, they even walked me there. The ambience was good overall and privacy kept in check. The dim lights of the hotel also proved to have a relaxing effect on my and my partner. Check out Morton's Steakhouse when you are there. Prices of steak at from SGD 98 and above but are worth every single cent of it. I will definately return to Mandarin Oriental as my choice of stay if I can find another excuse to pamper myself! For parents with children, they have a kids room which is simple yet cosy. Its located near the Morton's bar where you can have a chat with friends knowing your kids are taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude Receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Ozymandez O
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the second time this month. Everything is great; perfect location, fairly good rooms (albeit a bit aging now) and of course a great location. However, the killer for me was one of the receptionists called Nadya. Extremely rude and unfriendly, she totally ignored me and turned her head even though she wasn't serving anyone else. When i asked if anyone else could help me, she said NO in a very rude manner and turned her ahead away. I was finally served by someone else. Really killed my experience. I normally stay at the St. Regis, but sadly they were full on this occasion. Amazing how one staff can ruin your experience. Won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated and over hyped”
Reviews.Author: Vikram_Krati
Reviews.Content: Let me get this straight - MO Singapore is a good hotel. But that's just it. It is not exceptional in any sense. The best thing here is the breakfast. The buffet menu is the largest I've ever seen and food is awesome. You name it and they have it in their b'fast menu. But apart from that, MO is just as good as any other 5* hotel anywhere else in this world. The service is decent (had to remind them a couple of time for certain issues to get them resolved). The staff is friendly with a smile always on their face but that is what they're supposed to do. I've stayed in other 5* hotels and I found the service and amenities far better than what MO has to offer. The rooms are small and dated. Bed was comfortable. Items in the Mini bar are ridiculously over priced ($9 for a coke can !! ) and so are other food items and services. The problem is not money, it's the wastage of money. Just because a property is 5* doesn't mean it has to inflate cost of every single thing. Better get your coke cans and mineral water from the Marina Square mall which is linked to the hotel. You've to pay for the internet. I probably had too much expectations after reading all the reviews at TA but I was not impressed. It's just average. Am I coming back? Only after trying all other hotels in Singapore :)

Reviews.Title: “5 star...really???”
Reviews.Author: James E
Reviews.Content: I am sure this hotel is great, but they sure did ruin my 1 night stay. PROS: 1. Location is really convenient to a cheap mall for some quick purchases 2. The management staff are very well trained. Very proactive, jump in to help guests. However, th front line staff are horrible 3. Housekeeping is terrific. They do a miracle to make this old hotel look like very clean and fresh. 4. Room service was great. We ordered indina food. The desserts are to die for. Must try - pecan brownie with their home made vanilla ice cream 5. I see many comments about the breakfast at Melt. But i didnt think it was special. Lots of variety, but everytime i took out a plate to get some food, the plate would be dirty! but variety is definitely very good. 6. The bed was beautiful. I have not slept so comfortably in years! 7. The view from the harbour rooms is very nice. You see the amazing sands resort to the left and the entire singapore skyline on the right. 6. And thats about it! CONS: 1. Check in: the lady was very pleasent, but she got everythign wrong. Firstly i wanted to pay by debit card for the incidentals. She said they would just note down my details and not charge. Later in the day i get a call from the reception that they wil have to charge me the entire room rate + $200 immediately. It is strange that i am expected to pay the entire room rate a day before i checkout!! I have stayed at several hotels around the world and paid with debit cards. The hotel will generally take the incidentals and on checkout, they will return in cash. The room rate is never charged at check in. Worst thing was when i asked to speak to a manager (because the person who called me was hopelessly lost) terrance called me and pretty much regurgitated the "hotel policy". What happened to the famous mandarin oriental service! 2. The front desk lady very politely asked me if i wanted the newspaper. I asked for the business times and as i write this review from the hotel room at 9 am, no newspaper yet 3. The room is tiny! I would say about 25 square meters. For $550 that is a shame. 4. The room itself is aging. The hotel interiors are nice till the 4th floor, where all the restaurants are. Very tired on the floors with the rooms. 5. Pool staff speak no english. The waiter had me open the menu and point to the pina colada so that he could write it down in his pad. The manager at the pool is terrific. Pity his staff let him down. 6. The bathroom in the room has no door to the WC area. And there is no sound proofing, which can be embarrassing even if you are staying with your wife. 7. There was a large group of tourists at the lobby last evening, and they just sat all around the lobby. I had to fight my way through to get to the lifts. The hotel staff just stood there watching, instead of guiding the guests away to some private area. 8. I am sure that this is a safety code violation, that the hair dryer in the room is within easy distance of the bath tub. I am an architect and i was very surprised that a hotel of his calibre would overlook someing like this. All in all, i think the mandarin oriental is still going strong only because of their management. They clearly do not have front line staff of the same calibre. The hotel is getting old and worn down. Do yourself a favor, stay at one of the newer hotels, and there are plenty of those to chose from in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: JB39
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, having stayed at a few others in Singapore, I will always go back here. The location is perfectly located to get around by foot to many of the cities cultural and entertainment attractions. So, it's not the most modern hotel in Singapore, but what you are guaranteed is a quality product, great service and if you want to really take advantage and spoil yourself, have a club floor room as the club lounge is a little haven to escape to after a busy day of shopping, sightseeing or business meetings. There are day long refreshments on offer, including champagne at breakfast and the afternoon tea, particularly the scones with home made jam are delicious! The rooms are a good size and the facilities are great if you are on business. The staff are friendly and very helpful, they are very organised and efficient and follow up on every request. It's not cheap by any means, but you do get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Singapore?”
Reviews.Author: MattiasBM
Reviews.Content: A top choice in Singapore, great service, nice room with really comfy beds and all amenities you could ask for. When upgrade our stay to include a lounge package which allowed us to use a lounge area up on the 25th (or something like this) floor with coffe/the/all kind of beverages and a lot of different snacks which changed during the day. The hotel also has a great pool area and is just beside a shooping mall. All in all a great place to stay at, only remark is that it comes with a pricetag to fit for it, I think its a bit to pricy since we're still in Asia.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: nimo5
Reviews.Content: The only part I liked of this hotel were the breakfasts, they have an amazing buffet; anything you want including gluten-free is there. The service is ok but a bit chaotic. The rooms to me were nothing special at all; I much preferred the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong or other location. I didn't particularly like the location of this hotel, it was not very central except to the large shopping mall within walking distance. I don't think I would stay there again if I returned to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspired property, overpriced, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: anonxoxo
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed by my stay at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore. The hotel, which would be a perfectly nice business hotel at perhaps two thirds the price, is not the luxury destination that the brand promises. As it is, the Mandarin is overpriced in every respect, and tends to nickel-and-dime its guests as well. The rooms: While pleasant and with good views, rooms are small and pretty standard. Even worse was the housekeeping; every time I entered the room, there was a faint unpleasant odor that was kind of smoky and musty, even though I was on a non-smoking floor.
