There was also accumulated dust in some spots, such as in the (purely decorative?) wicker easy chair that looked unused for months. The TV never worked properly, with the remote being very finicky and only changing channels if pointed at the minibar cabinet below. Loud guests can be heard passing by in the halls. Toiletries are so-so. Turndown service is unimpressive: no cookies or chocolates, just a breakfast menu left on the bed. Room service is expensive, around S$30 and up for mains. The menu also skews to standard international hotel fare. WiFi, which these days should be complimentary, costs extra. The hotel: The gym is nice enough, but smallish and lacking in some equipment. The pool area is excellent, with all-day sun exposure and lots of chaises. However, the clientele includes many families and children which makes the atmosphere less relaxing, as well as making it more difficult to do laps in the pool. The restaurants are good but, again, expensive and not especially exciting. The worst aspect of the place though is the lackluster service. Almost everything required calling twice, from attempting to get the non-functional TV working, to waiting around for an early check-in, to calling for help with an early-morning emergency. Employees are friendly and smile a lot, but tend to be focused on doing things by the book and aren't terribly efficient. This is the general state of service in Singapore, but that doesn't make it any less disappointing. A notable exception to this was the staff at the business center who offered tea and actually had a personality. In Singapore, the Four Seasons or St. Regis are calmer and more luxurious. For a business hotel, the Conrad offers much better value for the money and has excellent amenities as well. As far as Mandarin hotels go, the Hong Kong and New York locations are much better hotels; having been to those, I was very disappointed with my experience in Singapore. I would advise their management to review every aspect of the guest experience as well as raising the standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “I am a fan of MO...........”
Reviews.Author: Nordic_Mike
Reviews.Content: And MO Singapore does not disappoint. This hotel for me somehow makes me feel much at home in Singapore. When we arrived, we were offered a room on club level at an extra minimal charge including harbor view which we immediate went for. Cannot recommend this upgrade strong enough, as not only do you have a great view over the Marina Bay towards the new Sands hotel, but also small features such as complementary club level access, where by the way you may both check in and also check out upon departure, a great little feature to avoid queuing up downstairs in the lobby, free wifi, delicious breakfast, afternoon tea, evening snack and drinks. But I must say that the Melt cafe on 4th floor probably serves the most lavishly breakfast I have ever tried in my life - an amazing suggestion of food from many continents, especially the fruit and juice station is marvelous. And you can enjoy your food both indoors or outdoors in the garden. The club level rooms are spacious and luxurious, full of amenities, although I do find the bathrooms somewhat ready for a renovation! The staff is overly friendly and courteous. One evening at our visit in the lounge, our waiter Sam assisted us in arranging a special trip to a little hidden gem in Singapore, the outdoor 62 level bar 1-Altitude on top of the former UOB bank. An amazing experience, as you have great views of Singapore and are actually looking down on the Marina Bay Sands hotel. Remember to have a table reserved in advance and you beat the queues on the way up the elevator to the top. Highly recommended. The swimming pool area at the Mandarin Oriental hotel was recently renovated and is a true oasis in this town where you can also enjoy the sun on beds that are smartly fixed right beneath the poolwater surface. The hotel is a 10-15 min short walking distance to Raffles City Shopping mall (and my favorite dumpling restaurant of all - Din Tai Fung - down in the basement in the food court) and Raffles Hotel. Overall a great stay at a great hotel and I already wish I was back again. Yes, I am a Fan!

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a nice setting”
Reviews.Author: HLB99
Reviews.Content: It had been ten years since I last stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore. This stay is business-related and unusually long (seven nights) and has been a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The rooms are very nice and the hotel facilities are great. There is a nice pool on the fifth floor, a good gym, and a variety of restaurants. You can also feel safe here: There was a problem with the smoke alarm in my room going off around midnight and a small army showed up within around ninetly seconds complete with fire extinguisher. Had there really been a problem (which there was not, the smoke alarm has been replaced in the meantime) they would have been right on top of it. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic breakfast and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dipsykate
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days in this hotel on the way to Malaysia for our honey moon trip. This hotel is just fantastic, even if from outside it looks boring (especially if you compare it to Marina Bay Sand, which is literally around the corner). The location is great, the atmosphere is very friendly, the staff is incredible and helpful, there is a huge choice of everything for breakfast buffet. I guess it was the best breakfast choice and service I've ever had in a hotel. From the first day they call you by name and you appreciate it a lot. One evening a friend of us forgot his mobile phone in a taxi, so Monica, a girl from the staff did everything to find it, and she did!!! The gym facility is quite good, the swimming pool area is very nice and it's very calm in the evening!

Reviews.Title: “When u walk in it feels like yr in Singapore... Melt cafe best beekky and lunch”
Reviews.Author: Roular
Reviews.Content: If u can afford to stay here.. Stay.. Service food pool spa... All great.. 5 stars for sure

Reviews.Title: “Good Renovation - Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: oznick
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for a while and was not up to MOHG standards; until they closed it down for nearly a year and did a full renovation! The rooms are a very good size for Asia and nicely renovated (although that's a few years now). The location used to be a bit out of the way but now with the development of Marina Bay Sands, it is in the midst of it all. The best thing of note of this hotel is that it has a huge outdoor pool area that is brilliant for kids and adults alike. Well worth considering this hotel

Reviews.Title: “International”
Reviews.Author: applebox
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times over the last 3 years. Funnily enough each time we had a problem when checking in...which after a long flight is always boring. Once you are past the reception the hotel is very good. The rooms we have stayed all 3 times on the upper levels with views looking over to Sentosa Island. the staff are friendly the rooms are generous and very clean. the pool is beautiful..as is the Italian restaurant that borders the pool. All in all it is a great Singapore hotel..and draws us back each time.

Reviews.Title: “High rise location and high cost”
Reviews.Author: notacouchpotato
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since we've been to Singapore and boy, has it developed over the past few years. Where the Mandarin oriental is located used to be a pleasant neighbourhood overlooking a busy harbour - now its full of high rise hotels, reclaimed land and a casino (only open to non-Singaporeans - we didn't bother). The hotel itself lives up to the MO reputation - impressive atrium entrance, gracious and ever helpful staff and slick service throughout. It was my birthday so they gave me a cake. It's touches like that which makes the MO a special place. Unfortunately, it was also Chinese New Year so the hotel was heaving and breakfast was a bit of a bunfight, even though the staff seemed to be coping brilliantly with the crush. it also meant that we couldn't get into the lovely Cherry Garden restaurant though we did go to Morton's - also excellent but hugely expensive for what is in essence steak, chips and red wine! We had a great view from the 15th floor over Marina Bay - upgraded, which was a treat. Large room with oh so comfortable bed, huge shower and bathroom and extras such as slippers, dressing gowns and toiletries should you have forgotten your toothpaste etc. Expensive but (nearly) worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Discreet and attentive service”
Reviews.Author: Moth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights while my husband was on business and was bowled over by the kindness of the housekeeping staff when I was unwell in the night. They could not have been more discreet, which led directly to a speedier recovery. Service throughout was outstanding and like previous reviewers I was very impressed to be addressed by name after only one visit to the cafe. The location of this hotel is superb, wonderful marina views, walking distance of many of the attractions and the business district, and right next door to a very useful shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Mandarin Oriental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: DOMIKO1975
Reviews.Content: Great location at mid-walk between finance area and Sand Bay terrace Wonderful service, exceptional terrace pool, great food. Room's View on harbor bay just fabulous ....

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: brutus4eva
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I have stayed in- this has been the best experience. The service was flawless, we got upgraded to a two beroom two bathroom suite which was stunning and spacious. The location of this hotel is the best in singapore in my opinion--as soon as you walk out of the hotel you have the marina right therer--a stunning area to walk at night and visit shops, cafes and restuarants. We stayed over the Chinese new Year celebrations so there was stalls, rides/carnival theme, bands etc the nights we visited. The location also of this hotel has the bonus that it is very quiet at night--i didn't even hear the fireworks that were on one night near our hotel! Thankyou Mandarin Oriental!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas treat”
Reviews.Author: matildaclark
Reviews.Content: We flew into Singapore on Christmas Day at the start of a 3 month family tour of Indonesia, Malaysia and Vietnam. Our stay at the Mandarin met all expectations...it is super swish, comfortable and well-positioned. The food is excellent, service exemplary...it is a top class hotel in a city and the price reflects that. It is right next to the F1 track, prices go up over the time of the race but views of the track are extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental!”
Reviews.Author: skashwin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on a recent visit to Singapore.. The hotel staff were very courteous and professional and allotted a room to us despite our very early arrival.. The hotel is in an absolute brilliant location and is a 10 minute walk away from that new Singapore landmark, the Marina Bay Sands.. The breakfast at the MO Singapore was one of the strengths of the hotel.. Rooms are neat and spacious with great beds and nice amenities. The rooms are also equipped with great gadgets and reading material. The hotel was however not as opulent as the MO in HK and Gave the impression of being a better business hotel than a holiday one.. The spa had a lot of variety but was very very pricey.. Overall, we had a very good experience without too much of a "wow" factor attached to the stay..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay. Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Dani94
Reviews.Content: On a recent stop over in Singapore, my family and I spent a couple of nights at the Mandarin Oriental. We absolutely loved the hotel. Our rooms were spacious, well appointed and immaculate. Check in was quick and efficient and handled well by english speaking staff. The hotel is large but certainly not noisy or impersonal. The restaurants in the hotel are exceptional. In particular Dolce Vita is absolutely divine. The food and atmosphere (poolside) overlooking the marina is just gorgeous. Great service and amazing italian cuisine. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MO Enthusiast”
Reviews.Author: maduke
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few MO's over the last few years. Tokyo, Hong Kong, New York and Singapore. I am a great fan of this chain. The little extras set them apart from the other top chains like Four Season, Ritz Carlton etc. I recently stayed in their Singapore Hotel in one of the suites. I was disapointed in this hotel and do not think it deserves to be a MO. The issues I had were; 1 The airport pickup was in a van that would be considered by a holiday Inn. Not a patch on the cars used by other MO properties. (The Peninsular in HK pick up in a new Rolls) 2 The property was booked for a suite and a 2 bedroom room. Got the suite but the 2 bed was a King and a rollaway. 3 The property is tired. The suites arent up to other properties yet they still charge a premium price. 4 The Concierge was hopeless. He sent us to a shopping centre that wasnt open for another 2 hours and a bookshop that had closed down even though we found a bookshop in the arcade directly behind the hotel. 5 Service in the inhouse Japanese Restaurant was poor. The positives are. 1 The Hotel faces the new Marina Bay Casino building. 2 Breakfast was good. I am not sure if the others who have given this hotel 5 stars have stayed in other Mandarin Orientals but I gotta say this one didnt inspire me to return.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: gidget_9
Reviews.Content: Wow! I didn't actually believe that all the wonderful things I've read about this hotel could all be true ... but they are. The hotel is effortlessly elegant, understated in its design - very zen! But as much as it is aesthetically pleasing,it's the staff and the service that for us make the hotel. The staff were genuinely very thoughtful, mindful, friendly and did their jobs exceptionally well. Mandarin Oriental should be proud. From the moment we asked to have an upgrade, the front desk sure delivered with a Harbour view room on the 18th floor -perfect for the firework display that was happening the following night for the Chinese New yrs eve celebrations. Sure you pay the rates and some might say that it is how it should be but I've experienced a lot of hits and misses in a variety of accommodations around the world and I think the service that we received was exceptional and consistent ..reality is not quite the same once you leave the Mandarin Oriental. I asked the concierge if I could get my sandals mended - it required hand stitching - it was over the public holidays but they found a cobbler nevertheless and walked over to the shop to make sure the cobbler did exactly what was required with the un damaged sandal for reference. Breakfast at the MElt cafe was again a delight - staff remembered your name not your room number! they greeted you with warmth but left you alone to graze on an amazing buffet spread. The pool staff are also very attentive - all in all you walk out feeling like you have had a proper break no matter how short your stay is because of the high level of service delivered by such lovely friendly staff you feel completely de-stressed and rejuvinated . So refreshing to find mainly a young hospitality crew delivering a warm and a very professional service.

Reviews.Title: “Revisiting not always a good thing”
Reviews.Author: travelinhope
Reviews.Content: Returned to the MO 14 months after our last visit and was expecting a same outstanding service. Perhaps it was because the hotel was much busier, but I seemed to me that the levels of service had slipped just a little. The room on the 20th floor, marina view, was good. Bed excellent and view of course outstanding. But check-in a little delayed because of so many people milling around reception. The atrium is looking a little dark and tired. We stayed four days and on each day functions in the ballrooms and the conference rooms spilled out into reception and the entrance making it a very busy and congested area. Breakfast in the Melt restaurant was very good, one of the best anywhere. But the room dining menu and the poolside snacks were really expensive (£6 for a cup of tea?!) and the portions meagre. Above all charging for internet access unless in superior rooms is just not reasonable in this day and age and makes the hotel seem mean-spirited, which in other respects is not the case. £5 an hour for internet minimum charge when you need only a few minutes a day is an irritation. Don't begrudge the MO its 2012 award - it does give outstanding service from its staff but it's getting old and needs to keep the goodwill of guests in the face of newer establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience!”
Reviews.Author: elena076
Reviews.Content: In a few words - An excellent city hotel with impeccable service. We stayed one week on New Year's eve and really enjoyed our stay. We booked premier ocean room and got one on the 7th floor. The room was of a decent size with all the nesessary amenities for comfortable stay. However, the ocean is a bit too far, so stating "the room with view of the ocean" is just one of the marketing tools. There was really a perfect view of the pool area and that also was really nice. Yes, there is an outdoor pool in the hotel, but it is small and full of kids after 9 a.m. The choice at the breakfast was the best that I've experienced so far. The quality of food was also excellent. We went to the Dolce Vita restaurant once. The atmosphere and service were perfect, however I was not really impressed with the food. Morton's is pretty expensive, but the steak was heavenly! We paid around 300 SDG for two beers, wierd Ceaser salad (plain - no chicken), baked potato and one steak shared for two (ask them to show the meat plate, so that you could choose the piece). As to the location of the hotel, you can walk around or there is aways a taxi standing outside and the ride to the most attractions is within 15 minutes. The only setback was that the Wifi in the hotel is chargeable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: tiger1127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Singapore Mandarin Oriental for two nights, we had Harbor view room, the hotel is old, but kept very clean, the room is nice, view is great. It is easy to get around in Singapore anyway and we had good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hlst
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed one night in November 2011 after a hectic trip around India. It was a wonderful way to relax. The hotel is in a fantastic location with wonderful harbour views and a lovely swimming pool. The room was tastefully decorated with a beautiful bed and lovely view. Everything was really clean, service was impeccable and check in was fast and efficient. Would happily recommend this hotel and we will stay next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “so good, I went back”
Reviews.Author: PKtourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in 2009 for the F1 weekend and enjoyed it so much I insisted on staying there again for the 2011 F1 weekend. Great service, excellent location and views, the staff were amazingly attentive. If you go for the F1 weekend you are more than likely to bump into some of the race drivers, officials etc. The odd design of the floors and the atrium is a bit out of place given the rest of the opulence but the rooms and the lobby makes you feel like a celebrity in an exclusive club. Mind you, you will pay celebrity prices for a room and wifi is also a pay option which in a hotel of this calibre smacks of greed.

Reviews.Title: “Service and quality continue to be first class”
Reviews.Author: Mags777
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel, that we have visited for over 20 years, gets better and better. The food is very good and the attention to detail pays dividends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: anton5Moscow
Reviews.Content: I've just saw the rating, and I'm totally agree that Mandarin is the best hotel in Singapore. By all means - location, rooms, beds, service (!!!), food (breakfast), spa & swimming pool, value. Have been there twice and will definitely stay there again. On my second visit I got an upgrade to a better room, just as soon as they noticed that my guest questionary has already been pre-filled. Mandarin Oriental is the best choice for everybody: business (excellent working desk with comfortable office chair and all the accessories), leisure, romance...

Reviews.Title: “Not a single problem I just dont see the value for money. Best breakfast in town.”
Reviews.Author: Riveredu
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in an Ocean Grand room with my wife and 15 months old daughter. The hotel itself is very nice, but I was expecting some more luxury from the MO (for the +£500 a night). Small lobby and the building itself is not huge (no shops either). The pool is very nice and the gym was standard/good. The Cantonese restaurant was also good. Service I would say was the best, though my wife tried to get some plain rice for our ill daughter and the room service couldnt simply offer that, but the wide variety of dishes from the menu. The breakfast was massive and the varieties seemed endless, a tough battle for a glutton like me. I wonder how big the other rooms are, as the Ocean Grand Room is big but it seemed nearly twice as big as the other ones. Would I return? I would be keen on trying other options in town, though if I find a good deal here I would.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Accommodation but very slow service”
Reviews.Author: fluffy63
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental and arrived exceptionally late (early) in the morning as our Jetstar flight had been delayed out of Melbourne by 9 hours! The frustration was already at its peak as one can imagine and on our arrival at the MO, it took the reservations desk 21 minutes to check us in ... unheard of, especially when we we the only ones needing checkin at that time of the morning! The room made up for the lack of service and the location of the MO was in the new docklands area ... ultra modern architecture and loads of shopping. The real tragedy however was the checkout ... we thought checkin was bad! Luckily we didn't have a plane to catch. My husband stood in the cue with only five people waiting for service ahead of him. He was in the cue waiting his turn for ... wait for this ... 47 minutes! Consequently, when he finally had got served, there were (and I counted heads here) 42 people in the cue after him!!!!! Now there is obviously something terribly wrong with the system here. Management needs to take a long, hard look at why people are taking so long to checkin and out and a total rehaul of their systen is required if the MO wants to keep its reputation as a wonderful hotel venue, intact. Aside from the latter however, a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible room, service and location/”
Reviews.Author: chunkmunk
Reviews.Content: Wow this hotel is amazing. It certainly doesn't come cheap, but it's worth saving up for as it's probably the best hotel I have ever been to. We stayed in their cheapest room for about $500 a night and the room was spacious and very comfortable with an amazing view over the world's busiest port. The bed was comfortable, everything worked as it should and it was totally spotless.Check in was simple thanks to Daniel on the front desk, who like all the other staff are amazingly friendly and helpful. Breakfast was also incredible. They serve a buffet breakfast with all kinds of western and asian foods and the staff are very attentive, posssibly too much so. They even remember your name every morning which in a hotel of this size is ridiculous. The only slight thing I disliked was having to pay so much for internet access, be it via wireless or in the business centre, I think they should be providing this free of charge. Also the minibar prices were absolutely insane. Otherwise this is undoubtedly the nicest hotel I have stayed in and will be checking in here when I return to Singapore, and would 100% recommend you to aswell, providing it's within budget. I am saving up for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Pingche
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, just 5-10 minutes walk you can arrive at Sands, esplanade, Singapore flyer, Fullerton etc. The service is excellent. The breakfast at Melt cafe is also excellent, both in terms of food variety and quality. All in all, the hotel deserves an excellent report.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: JayZee752
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and everything was awesome. We stayed on the top floor and had the oriental club lounge package, full breakfast, afternoon tea from 11:30 - 4:30 and cocktails and hors d'oeuvres from 5:30 - 7:30pm. The lounge overlooked the city with very comfortable sofas and a free business centre too! Well worth the extra money especially for those that like to be pampered. The concierge was very helpful and the pool was awesome. Great hotel that will be back to enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Quite disappointed in the service”
Reviews.Author: someflipster
Reviews.Content: With regards to decor, location, restaurants, etc, this is a great hotel. However, service is the most important fundamental. My family and I found the service here to be consistently poor throughout the week we stayed. Our experience with poor service began at the airport. I arrived with my family, tired after a long international flight, and we had booked a hotel minivan to meet us at the airport. Our confirmation email listed the correct date/time of the flight. There was no one to meet us, and we eventually learned that that they hadn’t sent anyone despite the reservation. When I called the hotel to ask where our car was, I was put on hold for a few minutes while someone investigated. Finally she came back on the line and asked if she could call me back in 5 minutes. I was roaming internationally on my iPhone and didnt want more phone calls, plus we were tired and just wanted to get to the hotel, so I suggested that we instead just get a taxi. She said that we shouldn’t do this, because the ride had already been arranged. So, I agreed to the 5-minute callback. Not having received any call back 13 minutes later, I telephoned again and asked where our ride was. The same woman asked me if we had met our pickup yet, revealing that she had still not figured out that no one had been sent to pick us up. It took a while to get a cab since we needed a large one to accomodate all of us, luggage, baby stroller, etc. When we arrived at the hotel, a manager came out to apologize and he said they had gotten the flight time wrong and thought we were coming in the evening (even though my email confirmation stated the correct time). This was only the beginning of what turned out to be a week of consistently poor service. When you pick up the phone and press the "guest services" button, it takes on average about 10 rings for someone to pick up. Often, no one picks up even after 20 or so rings and it fails over to the hotel operator. The hotel operators then serve as backup for the guest services staff. Here are a few examples. -Called for concierge, told s/he was on another line, they asked me what my question was, and said they’d pass it on to the concierge for a callback. No callback came and when I called the concierge later, they hadnt heard of my question -Have to call and remind them of requests often. Average number of calls to get anything done is 2. Sometimes takes 3, or going down to the front desk personally to press for what you need. -Ordered some $18 “homemade” nachos with salsa. What they delivered was not home-made, but rather about one third of a bag of a store-bought brand, served at room temperature. Also instead of salsa, they sent up a couple of tomato slices instead. It was not as advertised. -I asked for a bathroom scale (took 3 requests), they brought up a small analog scale that was very inaccurate. I called to asked for a better one, the call failed over to operator after about 20 rings. The operator called me back and said she had been told that this was the only model available. If you want to check your weight at this hotel, bring your own scale or buy one locally. The quality of the scale was significantly below par for a top hotel. -Called to ask for minibar to be restocked around 10 am. They said they’d send someone. I stayed home that day. No one came until about 5 pm. -Desk chair broke for no reason while I was sitting on it. A wheel came off. Got a replacement, but the wheels kept popping off the replacement. Not breaking, but off the shaft so I had to put them back on again. The quality of the room chair also was below par for a top hotel. -A final disappointing experience was when I realized I had left my iPad to television cable, which costs $40, in the room, still hooked up to the television. I realized this after I got back home. It is hard to imagine that they did not promptly notice this when preparing the room for the next guest, as the television will not function properly without removing it, as I displaced the normal cables to make room for my iPad adapter cables, and the cable is very large, and was plugged into an obvious wall outlet. The time/cost involved in having it shipped back to me internationally wouldn't have been worth it, so I just bought a new one, but I was curious to see whether or not they would notify me of the forgotten item. They never did, I did not receive any email, phone call, or any other attempt at notifying me about this item. Overall a very disappointing experience. Changing hotels with an entire family would have been too much hassle, and the hotel was pretty good as long as you didn’t need any services from them, so we just stayed. One comment about the room itself – the bath tub was quite small. I doubt anyone over 5’4” or so would feel comfortable in it. Also below par for a 5-star hotel. This was a great disappointment to me, as I am fairly tall and I like to relax in the bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: MusicalMinis
Reviews.Content: A truly exceptional check in experience. We were immediately whisked to our harbour view room on the 16th floor, where the receptionist, Daniel, went through the paper work whilst serving us jasmine tea. We were at the end of a celebratory trip which our agent had advised them of and they couldn't have made us feel more special. We thought the wine, fruit and chocolates were a fabulous gesture but this was topped by the rose petal filled bath and the champagne at breakfast the following morning. The service provided by the staff is absolutely exceptional. At breakfast on the second day the staff knew exactly what juice and hot dring we had ordered the previous day and asked if we wanted the same. The concierge remembered our names and everyone from the porters, pool staff and waiting staff couldn't have been friendlier or more efficient. Breakfast was the best we have ever had anywhere. The choice and quality of food is beyond description other than to say it catered for every taste and every culture. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable with everything you could ask for. The pool, spa and fitness facilities were all of the highest standard. Around the pool were private curtained "cabins" with their own sound controls, fan, lighting and universal plugs. Just one little hiccup. We wanted to use the remainder of a phone card and asked to be directed to a pay phone. There was not one and used our room phone having checked with the concierge that there would be no charge. He rang the hotel's operator and we were told that there would be none. On checkout however we were billed $10 although this was quickly removed when we complained. Overall, a truly remarkable hotel with the highest standards of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal at great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaffieAustralia
Reviews.Content: We got a two nights for the rpice of one night deal through American Express Centurion and included many other extras. Because of late arrival we had room service sushi which was of good quality and arrived within 20 minutes. Buffet breakfast was excellent although staff sometimes made small mix ups with delivery of tea etc.Also had dinner in the Japanese restaurnat and again freindly staff and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlies11
Reviews.Content: Great location, AAA+ service, the BEST breakfast buffet I have ever seen in my life and well appointed rooms. I do not have one complaint about this hotel. It was a great experience. We were travelling with bmy husband's work and whilst the hotel is ideal for business, it was also fantastic for catering for our baby. The staff made sure she was comfortable by providing her with a beautiful cot (not a cheap travel cot) and pamper package of baby products and slippers (so cute!). Plus, their room service menu even caters for babies and toddlers.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental - what a treat!”
Reviews.Author: beachbabe752000
Reviews.Content: A few girlfriends and I travelled to Bali and Singapore this year in a rare break from our families. Whilst we stayed in some great places during the short holiday, the highlight had to be the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore. What a great place for the last few weekend of our holiday. Cocktails at Mortons were a highlight. Get in early as the bar starts filling up around 5.30 in the afternoon. The view from the rooms was phenomenal and whilst we were there, we were treated to a huge firework display over the water. Go. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location so-so, superior service”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental Singapore is up to the high standards one expects from the brands. It is not new but, having been well maintained, ages gracefully. It is a solid option in a city well endowed with efficient 5-star business hotels. The lobby and common areas are functional with no particular charm and no atmosphere. The hotel's architecture is built around a huge atrium, which feels cavernous and does not invite to hang around. On the plus side, a well-rounded offer of restaurants (international cafe, steak house, Chinese, Japanese, bar, all of excellent quality) and a nice swimming pool. The rooms are average in size, decent but outclassed by competitors such as the Conrad, Fairmont or Ritz-Carlton. Equipment is standard for the category: flat-screen TV, fast Wifi internet, good storage space, but no espresso machine. Internal decoration is bright and airy, not overly luxurious. The rooms facing the Marina Bay enjoy very attractive views. Where the Mandarin beats competition is in the quality of its service, which I consider to be the best in Singapore. My experience was flawless, from check-in (fast and personalized, in the room itself) to room service (smooth and attentive) through restaurant service (personnel is friendly and calls guest by name). Location is central but there is no street life, despite a recently improved environment thanks to the Esplanade nearby. Walking to the colonial district takes a good 10-15 minutes, either boring in underground passes, or sweaty in the Singapore heat. The subway station is on the Circle Line, not very well-connected. One ends up relying extensively on taxis to commute to the rest of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: holidayguru85
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our Christmas holiday in Singapore, the Mandarin Oriental was recommended to us by a family member - due to the hot weather you can access the shops from right near the hotel (straight to air conditioning, perfect!). Right from check in (and escort to our room) everything was lovely and we were looked after very well. We stayed in a Premier Harbour room, it was amazing to walk into the room every night after turn down to see our view of the Marina in preparation for New Years Eve - beautiful! We also had a lovely dinner at Dolce Vita during our stay, it's a very romantic setting and fantastic food and service. Thank you Mandarin Oriental for a making our stay memorable, we hope to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “If you want quality, look no further than the Mandarin Oriental.”
Reviews.Author: Reddo-and-Wrighty
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 17th Dec 2011, Room 1911 for 4 nights at The Mandarin Oriental. From the warm welcome at check in, to the moment we left nothing was to much trouble. Our room was modern, clean and tidy with stunning views of Marina Bay. Breakfast was served in the Club Room and quality of food and service was first class. The location of this hotel is ideal and within walking distance or a short taxi ride to most attractions. You must try Mortons Steakhouse in the hotel if you like Ribeye - best ever steak! Thank you for a wonderful stay and we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Amazing Staff, Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: freestyleadamski
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and daughter (aged 2), and the hotel was exceptional! The attentiveness of the staff is great, but without feeling like they are in your face. I am now a MO convert!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, beautiful Room, wonderful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hippyshippy
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at Mandarin Oriental on the 31st of Dec 2011 to celebrate the new year eve with my partner and was amazed by how beautiful the rooms and the hotel were. The front desk staff was also amazingly helpful and friendly in meeting all our needs. My new year eve stay with the hotel was totally worth it and will definitely look forward to spending more of my special occasion with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: Maice_S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just as it is rated - top-notch. Service was great, rooms were well-appointed, breakfast buffet was also good. We got 2 rooms (3 people each room) as we were a party of 6 (5 adults and 1 child). They allowed us to check in early as I requested, and the welcome was impeccable. They even prepared a birthday cake and balloon for my Dad since they knew he was celebrating his 63rd birthday in Singapore! I found the lobby very nice, and the elevator was described by my daughter as "very cool". There really is little room for complaint. If at all, as an Asian visitor, my only possible downside noticed is they seemed to pay just a teeny tiny bit more attention to the Caucasian visitors. They still provided us great service though but there was a slight difference noticed by my brother and myself (I think one other reviewer prior made the same observation). Nothing that took anything away from our over-all great experience though. I'd highly recommend staying here. It's also accessible to a lot of places.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: CharltonSydney
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Mandarin Oriental in November this year for a nine day stay. We booked adjoining rooms overlooking the bay/casino as we were travelling with two young children. The view from our rooms was great, especially at night, and was a real highlight. This hotel works for us as the staff are very good with our children, expecially in the restaurant where breakfast is served, they have great pools, a good range of room service options and a good location near to shopping arcades with child play areas. We arranged for the hotel to meet us at the airport with their van and this made our arrival very stress free. My only criticism is that they charge for WiFi. We would definitely recommend this hotel to families (or others) and will look to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Number 1in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Ron M
Reviews.Content: Stayed once again at the best hotel in Singapore, arrived early morning and within 10 minutes we were in our room. The next 10 days we had the best service from the front desk to the fantastic staff throughout the hotel.The buffet breakfast and the staff did a fantastic job even though the hotel was fully booked over the Christmas break I commend them.Once Again THANKYOU! Singapore and especially Mandarin Oriental for a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like?”
Reviews.Author: Ros147
Reviews.Content: Had a couple of days at this fantastic hotel and can thoroughly recommend it. The staff were particularly good....they were helpful, polite, pleasant, nothing was too much trouble. We had a deluxe room which was spacious, clean and well appointed. We also had amazing meals in the Melt the World buffet breakfast bar. I would return here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy5951
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as a stopover on the way home from Australia. We were in one of the club rooms on the 19th floor which had great views of the city skyline. The room was beautiful with the furniture, bedding, toiletries etc being excellent quality. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well. We had access to the club lounge for breakfast and evening drinks. This was a great room with comfy sofas and in the evening there was a good choice of canapés to enjoy with a full bar and cocktail selection. The house wine is Cloudy Bay and we preferred the Singapore Slings here to Raffles!! The pool area was lovely with cabanas and heavily cushioned loungers so very comfortable to snooze in the afternoon!! We thought the cost of food and drinks served round the pool very reasonable and beautifully presented. I only wish we’d had an extra day to properly enjoy the facilities available. From the time we checked in until the time we checked out every encounter with the hotel staff was excellent. As we were on the club floor we checked out in the lounge - a really nice touch was offering us a glass of champagne before preparing the bill. This was my first stay in a Mandarin Oriental hotel – as we left I picked up the hotel directory to plan a visit to the next one. From the chain hotels available Mandarin Oriental has gone to the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury soulles hotel”
Reviews.Author: sasisasisu
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness and the luxury from this hotel is to be expected, as it's a five star hotel, located in one of the most prestigious area. However, nothing wowed me in particular. it's everything you'd expect from a five star hotel. If anything amazed me from this hotel, it was the attitude of one of the reception staff. No smile, no eye contact, no hospitality. Totally pissed me off.

Reviews.Title: “Did I miss something ?”
Reviews.Author: stuartSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the night just after xmas on the way to Maldives. Had high hopes of the hotel given its very high ranking. All staff were very friendly but i simply wasn't wowed enough for what they charge for a night. Small boxy room with almost no bathroom privacy. Very expensive restaurants where the service was average / amateur to say the least. I wont be trying them again - didn't see what the fuss was all about ?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sums it up”
Reviews.Author: grinchee
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a great stay here. Hence each good experience seemed super perfect just like when every so-so experience in a place where youre badly looked after sometimes starts to feel less than average. This was a leisure stay but Spa facilities were not used as requested appointments were available only after 11am most days. The situation of the hotel is good. Its a 5 minute walk from the Marina Bay shopping centre. Ask concierege to show you the short cut through the parking garage if you need to pop to the seven eleven for a local sim card for example otherwise it takes 15 minutes to get to the other side of MB shopping mall. The MB mall has the equivalent of our high street shopping brands and coffee shops like Starbucks etc; latter are open til about 10pm. For luxury brands take a 10 minute taxi to Ion Orchard- one of the biggest malls. I had no problem with getting taxis from MO unlike when I visited the Fullerton Hotel where I had to wait 1 hour (although in fairness this may have been due to the MRT being broken down that evening). Its good to select a hotel where taxis are easily available since they are a convenient (v.few traffic jams) way of getting around and travelling between most shopping centres is an average of 10 SD. My favourite experience at MO was breakfast. It is by far the best buffet breakfast I have experienced in any hotel I have stayed. Please excuse the fact that much of this review is therefore focused around it. It is worth paying the 40SD for although it was included in the Club package (note that they currently offer the Club package for the weekends if you book through TA). If you take a Club Room you will have the choice of eating in the Oriental Club Lounge (OCL) or at Melt restaurant. The difference is in both the setting and the presentation of food choice. In OCL you are on the 19th floor. If you take a look at the website photos the interior looks stunning. It is very nice and the triple ceiling height space gives a very airy feel. But it is situated on the front side of the hotel which doesn't give the best views of Singapore and to that end you will enjoy your food looking over tennis courts, some traffic and the back of the Pan Pacific hotel. Still, if you want views of Marina Bay Harbour itself then you will not be short of opportunities to experience it. Request a harbour view category room as it is indeed a lovely view to wake up to and see lit up at night. Back to OCL- its about 500 square meters and very long (just as in the photos) so although it gives each guest a feeling of seclusion you may find it awkward walking up and down to the open kitchen/ snack area if you want to sit at one of the window sofas for your meal as opposed to the dining areas. The thing I did not enjoy so much about the OCL was their ambitious policy of no open or casual footwear therefore excluding all manner of flip flops and trainer type shoes. Its a warm climate so it doesn't help leisure travellers much and this was one of the reasons I had breakfast at Melt and also hardly used the OCL. Also there was no outside terrace which I found unusual for such a kitted out space. Melt is more laid back- with various sections to its dining area including an outside area which is nice and super clean and free of any insects/ mossies but surrounding by lush plants. More details on the breakfast- there were countless stations in these sections- Indian (better than I had in Mumbai!), Chinese, Eggs any style, smoothies (go for the blueberry), a well equipped waffle counter, full pastry selection including gluten free and restricted diet options, Full English Breakfast, fresh fish, meats, salads, fruits, everything you can think of. The thing most worth noting is that the variety was good but the quality of the produce was outstanding. Not before or since have I sampled so many foods all at their optimum ripeness at one sitting. Truly amazing. Thank you MO for putting so much dedication into sourcing only the best for your guests. Details of the room itself. I had the Club Harbour. It was a good size and nice layout with 'see through' bathroom and privacy blind. The amenities are Elemis which in my view are not as nice as Molton Brown or especially L'Occitaine. I think a hotel like MO should upgrade these especially for certain category of room. Basic things like mouthwash and shower cap were not there although the latter was provided on request. I had requested a quiet room. Often at 6am there were disturbances from a noisy trolley being wheeled out of the service area opposite but one to my room. It didn't matter as I was usually awake before then but maybe worth noting to ask to be given a room away. The room facilities included DVD/ Ipod/ etc. but the system was so outdated and slow to operate that I eventually gave up trying to use it. That aspect really needs addressing for this standard of hotel/ room category. Overall I did not think it was worth paying extra for the Club room category but that may in part be due to the fact that I didn't use the facilities of the OCL much. The pool area is very nice and spacious although I did not use it in the day so can not comment on how busy or not it may have got. I found the gym (about 1000 sq ft) busy when I used it (when it opened at 5.30am). It was good to have those early opening hours and even better if it could have been 24 hours for guests on very different time zones (like the gym at Fullerton Bay hotel). In terms of equipment I found it limited considering the size of the hotel for eg. there were only two cross trainers and two bikes- one of which sounded close to the end of its life. There were 6 or so treadmills and some resistance machines but not a great selection- at least not for women. The housekeeping was totally unfaultable. Thank you MO Housekeeping for being so thorough! I had a complimentary pressing service included- this was done with efficiency and perfection. Every house call does take that little bit longer to answer due to the size of the hotel Everyone complains at hotel prices in Singapore which are definitely at the extortionate end but I dont see how any part of the world should operate outside the basic principles of supply and demand. My only doubt about staying here in the future would be that for a leisure stay it is quite a boring environment as it is more suited to business travellers. Does however get busier at weekends with birthday etc. I would stay here again if I can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: prince765
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed. Excellent location right across the bay. Incredible service quality. Best of the best breakfast buffet and very comfortable rooms. Hint: Try to get from the harbour-view rooms because the view at night is simple incrdible. Sİngapore is a beautiful city both at day and night time. With its superb location, you are minutes away from lot of attraction.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: JoannaClaire
Reviews.Content: Our room had great views of Marina Sands and the city skyline. You can walk to the train station from the hotel if you like to walk, otherwise there are always taxis available. The room was very spacious and the bed was amazing- super big and comfortable. Breakfast was great and the staff at the bars were very friendly and helpful. A very pleasant stay indeed!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: John190728
Reviews.Content: This is a truly luxurious hotel. It had everything we could have wished for. My son & I stayed 3 nights and found the accommodation superb, the food excellent and the service and politeness of the staff second to none.They were extremely helpful and readily gave us a later check-out time to link up with our flight time. The hotel has a wonderful location from which everything in Singapore City could be reached, either by walking or a short taxi ride. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if visiting Singapore. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “My fav hotel in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: PinkyPrincess
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at local hotels and Mandarin Oriental simply top my list for now.. The harbour view room was excellent and we really enjoyed relaxing in the room. It was a birthday celebration for my partner and I totally appreciate the complimentary cake prepared for us as per requested during my booking. Pop by the pool and lucky me managed to grab a cabana. I enjoys lazing there reading my book, watching my other half swimming. Kudos to the team for providing icy cold water the moment we sit down and was even served a shot of desserts by the staff. Breakfast at MELT was fantastic.. really good spread of food and we loved it. I wish i can stay at MO soon, it's heavenly!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views of the bay and decent sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: gotthebug87
Reviews.Content: Ended our honeymoon with this stop and the view was amazing at night over the bay with all the buildings lit up. Arrived at about midnight and was looking for some food, but when I asked the staff he told us there was nowhere open and we'd have to order room service. I knew we passed a hawker food area just across the road, so we headed out and found a huge array of cheap food in large quantities. So not too happy that the staff told a fib. Very large bathroom with bath and shower. One basin and no door for privacy (if you wanted it). Helpful check in and out staff and otherwise no complaints. Caught the trains everywhere, just ask how to get places, people will direct you.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jhonnyhome
Reviews.Content: this manderin always has been top and the location on orchid road I was there 10 years ago , 5 years ago and now again, always a plesure to stay here

Reviews.Title: “A very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: busymumsydney
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Mandarin Oriental Hotel and we were certainly impressed! The hotel is in a fantastic location and close to virtually everything we wanted during our stay. The hotel while large, had a very personal feel and we were always greeted by a friendly smile or by name throughout our stay (by our third day, many of the Melt - the World Cafe staff greeted both myself and husband by name during breakfasts!) Our room overlooked Marina Bay with outstanding views of city lights including the NY balloons - throughout our stay, each night we had a mini light show with the Bay coming to life. The room offered everything a business traveller would need including a wonderfully comfy king size bed, large bathroom including bath and gorgeous ginger and lemongrass amenities. Room service was excellent and well priced...prime burger and chips are delicious! The Pool was outstanding and probably the best I have experienced in Singapore - it never appeared overcrowded and had plenty of staff on hand to help with drinks and finding a lounge or cabana. Would recommend dinner by the pool at Dolce Vita - very beautiful. For Laptop/iPad users - Wifi is chargeable - check the best package option to suit usage. The hotel also encourages a dress policy in foyers and restaurants - while at first i thought this may be a challenge (as I was on holidays!!!) it added to the up market feel of the hotel. I would certainly stay at the MO Singapore again in the future...it has an elegant feel, never felt overcrowded despite being full and had a very personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much trouble for the staff of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for but one night in October 2011, en route from Malaysia to Singapore. We regretted that we were not staying for several nights. Now, I travel a lot and I do not normally get round to writing reviews, and it has taken me a while to get round to writing this one, but our experience was so overwhelmingly good that I feel that I must share it. When we arrived it was a little late, and it seemed that there had been a mix-up with the room allocation. So, this hotel is not perfect and it took a little while to get our luggage to the room. However, after that shaky start, it was possibly the best experience in over 25 years of travelling. We had booked a Premier Harbour Room but were upgraded to a suite. Marvellous panoramic views of Marina bay. It was just after my birthday and this had been mentioned at reservation. In the room was a little birthday cake and also a hand written birthday card. Easy enough to put a cake in the room; the hand-written card shows that they really thought about it. The hotel ambiance is warm and wraps itself around you as you walk in from the sweltering humidity of Singapore. At breakfast time the breakfast buffet was one of the most extensive I have ever experienced but even so, whatever you asked for, they would try to provide it. I saw another customer with some fresh berries. I said "Where did you get those?", to which he replied "I asked for them". So I asked and was duly provided with fresh berries. Shortly, during my breakfast, a member of staff asked if I would be there the next day, as, if I was, they would prepare my berries ready for me. How I wished that we could stay for another night! We thought that maybe 12:00 check out would be a little early as we had a night flight. We heard that we could take a shower after we had checked out, should we wish. I expected that maybe we could use the health club or something like that. No, they made a room available for us. After we had checked out. At no extra charge. And they even brought our luggage up for us. There may be six-star hotels in Arabia that offer more in terms of gilt and grandeur, but in terms of quality of service delivered with sincerity in a warm and welcoming ambiance, I wonder if there is anywhere a better hotel than this.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest welcome”
Reviews.Author: aemwwlt
Reviews.Content: We had very mixed feelings about this hotel. Don't get me wrong, the hotel lobby, rooms and furnishings are all exceptionally high-standard and the pool area is beautiful. Breakfast was of a very good standard and, again, the restaurant it was served in was well-designed. What I think let it down was how uncomfortable and unwelcome we felt for much of the stay. Apart from the lady who checked us in, who was lovely and attentive, the staff were quite dismissive, for example behaving snootily when we asked to pay off our bill half way through our stay, and not letting us use spa changing rooms when we used the pool (the pool changing rooms were essentially a cupboard with a toilet- not good when the hotel ask you not to wander around in a dressing gown etc. Where are you supposed to change?). When at the pool the hotel began setting up for a corporate event, again adding to the feeling of discomfort; having an early evening swim surrounded by suits and loud,awful lounge music clearly intended to entertain said suits was not the best end to a day. Pool staff were very nice, however, and a real credit to the hotel. Prices were extortionate, even for Singapore, and again clearly aimed squarely at business travellers. £12 for a thimbleful of rough New Zealand wine, for example. As a tourist, I felt like an afterthought. It's not as if the hotel is inherently bad; it isn't. We just failed to appreciate spending a lot of money to feel like we didn't belong. Service and finishings at Kuala Lumpur MO may not be as slick, but they were far more welcoming. We'd stay there in an instant; I doubt we'd bother with this branch again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kme98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family for 2 nights- there was a bit of a foul up with booking as we needed one of the rooms to be able to have a rollaway- but it was all sorted out and they gave us an upgraded larger room without charge. We were able to get into all rooms early in the morning, instead of having to wait until 3, which was much appreciated after the 12 flight from UK. The buffet breakfast is amazing and well worth having- we didn't need lunch! We all really loved the Christmas stocking hanging on the door on Christmas morning as well, thoughtful warming touch. Pool and surrounding area very pleasant as well. Location was good, we walked to Marina Bay area easily. Short walk to 2 MRT stops.

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms, service is nothing special”
Reviews.Author: GingerHongKong
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to staying here for 4 nights on business after reading all the positive reviews. I was not wowed at all.... The rooms were a little dated. Service was nothing special (barely got a good morning, restaurant service was forgetful, never called by my name....). For the money, I wld go to the Ritz Carlton any day compare to the MO. the rooms at the Ritz are much bigger, modern , better service and more comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: martin_roberts
Reviews.Content: Great service, fantastic pool area & great food @ Morton's. Breakfast buffet exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Sandijs
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore and was pleased with the service and amenities. Food in the restaurants and the one served at the breakfast was excellent. It is a great hotel in a great location. Should you choose the rooms facing harbor you will have a magnificent views. As the title says the Mandarin did not disappoint. The only drawback is the size of the hotel since it has 500+ rooms and if you are looking for that boutique type of feeling then of course you will not find it there. Other than that great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the location”
Reviews.Author: jontowel
Reviews.Content: there are several hotel in the proximity of this area, and I found this hotel to be the best value: not so expensive as 2-3 other upscale hotels (cant mention names right ?) but still better service compared to its cousin next door. Food (B-fast, room service) is top notch. Concierge is also very very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Lacking Mandarin Oriental Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LiveAmused
Reviews.Content: Positives: There are many hotels in Singapore's Marina Bay, but MO has probably the best one. Do throw in a bit more for the Marnia Bay View Room. You will not be sorry as you will have perfect views of the beautiful and continuous light show over the Bay. It starts from around 8 pm goes on up until the dawn. The breakfast buffet is truly extensive. Try to seat outside for a bit of peace and to avoid wearing the all the different food aromas in main dining hall. The staff are very polite and willing to assist the guests. Public buses to/from Changing airport are right across the street. Also, the hop on/hop off buses stop here. Negatives: the building is outdated both on the outside an in. The ceilings are low, the chandeliers are totally not "zen" and the whole decore and feel of the place is non-Mandarin Oriental. They also do not offer free wi-fi in room or anywhere else in the hotel including the business center. T he charge is 50 Singapore Cents per minute or about 40 US Cents. This is so unusual especially for Eastern Asia as most hotels -even 3-stars- offer complimentary wi-fi. We had reserved through Am Ex Platinum. The could not upgrade us which very rarely happens but is understandable. But the complimentary amenity -which is the least desirable one- a free gift was not delivered to us on the first day and we had to remind the front desk about it. Even at that they delivered half of it and we had to make another call to the front desk to complete the transaction. We did not get a chance to use the Spa services. A 60-90 minutes message starts at about US$200-280. The outdoor lap pool is pretty and about an average size. There are also a few poolside private cabanas. So, choose this hotel for its location and view not for the brand name.

Reviews.Title: “Need more than flip-flops”
Reviews.Author: Marcusom
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore a few times now and this hotel is definitely up there with places to stay. The hotel itself is great, the staff extremely helpful and friendly and the views of the harbour fantastic. We had the champagne brunch at Melt restaurant and it lived up to all expectations. It's also an excellent way to shake the jet lag - tons of food and booze. One tip is with regards to early check-in. The regular rooms have a 2pm check-in which wasn't great for us as we arrived at 6 in the morning - exhausted. To have an early check-in for the regular room you need to pay for an extra night which can be pretty pricey. Instead, we upgraded our room to one of the Club class rooms. This was cheaper than an extra night in the other room and also meant we had access to the club lounge which meant free breakfast each morning and a couple of hours of free cocktails each evening so it paid for itself. The new room also had an incredible view as it was higher up in the hotel. One tip from my wife is to bring shoes other than flip-flops as the lounge and restaurant has a shoe policy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overrated”
Reviews.Author: FatcatJunketeer
Reviews.Content: Marina Bay has always been a great place to stay, its removed from the circus of orchard road (only a short cab ride away) and yet offers far better views. There are plenty of choices in the area, and the MO has been around for a while. Although the hotel is in the Marina Square complex, there are no internal doors through to the malls, so you have to walk through the outside and up the staircase to get there. There’s a shortcut to the 7/11 area through the carpark on the right side fo the hotel however. The room was a little on the small side, not cramped but definitely compact. Quality furnishings and a very comfy bed, big tv with a myriad of channels (and bose speakers in the ceiling), ipod dock, dvd player and all the usual comforts you would expect in a five star hotel are there. At this price point however, surely they can ditch the generic toiletries and provide wifi for free. The outdoor pool looked amazing, and there are cabana beds along with the usual deckchairs, some of which are in the water. Breakfast was excellent, with plenty of choices - hot/cold/western/asian, with noodle and juice bars thrown in. Service was good, everyone was friendly and in particular the waitresses at breakfast were extremely efficient despite the place being filled to capacity. The hotel was literally bursting with business and convention travelers, along with a few large tour groups thrown in. As a result the lobby and common areas became a zoo at times, and it’s also a popular wedding venue. Being part of the MO group you expect good service and amenities, and while it was a pleasant stay, it didn’t exactly live up to the hype of being the best in Singapore. There wasn’t anything great about it. Rooms at the Ritz are about 30% bigger and it arguably matches the MO across all spectrums. Conrad (which has rooms 30% bigger) is often significantly cheaper and provides much of the same. If you get a corp rate its not a bad choice, but at SGD$500 a night there are better alternatives in the area. Skip the hotel limousine, it’s ten times the price of a taxi for an E-class Merc and you wont need it in Singapore, cabbies are polite, speak English, and drive/act sensibly.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hanktank4
Reviews.Content: From our arrival we knew this was a top class hotel. The staff were friendly, extra helpfui, and customer service orientated. The location at Marina Bay was perfect, shopping centre's, food outlets, MRT, underground shopping mall's, you name it, it was there. Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Convention Centre and Casino within walking distance. The buffet breakfast was to die for. On arrival at the buffet a staff member took you on a guided tour to ensure you knew where everything was. What a great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janicelala
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for 2 nights. The staff was friendly and helpful. I especially love the breakfast in MELT, the food were just delicious! The bed are really comfortable, and I love the bath gel, shampoo and conditioner they provided. Location is good as well, easy access to Malls and you can do shopping or having all kinds of food there. If you want to try authentic Singaporean breakfast don't miss out Killiney Kopitiam, the kaya toast is really tasty. Definitely will be staying at MO if visiting Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel and super location”
Reviews.Author: sonal66
Reviews.Content: this is one of my favourite hotels in Singapore...absolutely home away from home... extremely warm and soothing and relaxes feeling even whilst on business rooms just right and beds and toiletries etc all tasteful and lovely view of the bay and harbour all staff very attentive and hospitable and warm welcome like the japanese food at wasabi bistro and the axis lounge bar too

Reviews.Title: “It has the lot!!”
Reviews.Author: Mark6167
Reviews.Content: This really is the best hotel in Singapore, it has the lot.......great facilities, fantastic service and the best rooms in Asia. The welcome you receive is world class and the rooms are just what you need when staying away from home with the views of Marina Bay being a highlight for me. The pool area had an upgrade just over 12 moths ago and it can be summed up in one word...fantastic! Mortons restaurant situated within the hotel is probably the best steakhouse in Singapore although it is a little on the pricey side. Portion sizes are very generous so it may be worth skipping the starters and just savouring the main course. The club facilities on the 19th floor are of the highest quality and the staff there are of the highest calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: FCsusan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 2 nights during Thanksgiving Week. The staff was attentive and the concierge was knowledgable. Our room overlooked the pool and the harbor which was beautiful at night. The hotel is connected to one of the many malls and the Suntec Center which made it convenient to find food and avoid the rainstorms! Bed was comfy. I loved the shower - good shower pressure. It was within walking distance of Merlion and close to the MRT stops. There is a hawker stand right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Mandarin Oriental does it again! Close to airport but in the city, away from busy Orchard.”
Reviews.Author: Sf903
Reviews.Content: On our honeymoon trip, they were so generous with a welcome bottle of red, a framed picture during breakfast, and calling me "Mrs". The only feedback I have is that for visitors from the United States, our last name is the second name, not the first. This happened at other hotels too. Other than that, MO has me as a loyal customer. Bathroom was nice with marble and our Harbour view room was awesome. They put us lovebirds in a top floor away from people. They also had a walking map sp we could stay indoors while going through three malls, and catching the Train (which was super efficient).

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Venkatesht
Reviews.Content: Completely unexpected considering the positive things I had heard about the hotel. Maybe law of averages caught up. It was not exceedingly high expectations, but poor service levels in basic things which led to me having a poor impression about the hotel during my stay in October. Was there on a business conference. It all started off with poor service at the reception including incomplete information and not giving out the necessary material. Then, on two successive nights, the reception desk did not pick up the calls untill 15 or 20 rings (on one instance, the phone was even put down). I understood it was because in the night the phone is transferred somewhere else, but surely the hotel can expect calls around 11 pm from guests coming back after dinner. On the second night, I then spoke to the duty manager, who promised to give me a specific message by 7 am the next day. Same did not arrive till 7.30 am when I found the duty manager still at the reception, he pleaded complete ignorance. I subsequently had a discussion with the rooms division manager and also an email response from the General manager to the standard feedback form which I filled - at least this was a solace. Overall, the service was too poor for any hotel and not even considering the higher tariffs here. Would not be returning to the Hotel. Have made two subsequent trips to Singapore - both stays at Pan Pacific - better experience. Just to complete the review of Mandarin Oriental - rooms are good and food was great.

Reviews.Title: “experienced a lack of quality the first time”
Reviews.Author: cmh1979
Reviews.Content: usually the mandarin gets maximum rating, but this year i stayed at a club room and the services/benefits did not match my expectations this time (after staying at the singapore mandarin oriental many times). we are criticize on a high level but with a room rate of 560+ SGD the expectations are - of course - high. the club room benefits such as late check out till 6pm are highly appreciated. also the possibility of using the club lounge benefits after check out till 11pm. breakfast buffet and a la carte menue at the club lounge is - i would say - lousy compare to the huge buffet for standard rooms. a plus is the privacy of the club lounge. the bread was dust-dry and the variety of the buffet food was unsatisfying. afternoon cocktails from 5.30pm are a good thing to get started for the evening/night. but same as breakfast: small buffet and i somehow had the feeling they cut costs and downgraded the quality of food and beverages. (f.e.: they used to have moet champagne, now only some "cheaper" alternatives) food quality used to be top notch a few years ago. i still give the mandarin a "very good" rating since the service quality is still high. but they have to be very careful not to loose top rating (nbr 1 hotel in singapore). the competition is never sleeping and i feel like they need to do some maintenance to upgrade the rooms. but after all still recommended and i will be there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: franceses
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Mandarin Oriental Singapore. We booked a room with the Club benefits and an harbor view. The view is really amazing, corresponding to the memories we had of our last stay in this special Asian city 18 years ago… with some big changes as these unbelievable towers with a kind of boat on the top! The hotel in itself is nice but nothing unforgettable, except maybe the huge inside space with the elevators. The lobby and reception are small and unimpressive. The room furniture are good quality, the room size is not very big, the colors of marble in the bathroom are a bit questionable… light global impression of updated. The service at the club is perfect, from breakfast to cocktail (no time enough to test the afternoon tea). High quality Champagne served as requested is really a must! High speed internet for free was highly appreciated. Localization is very good, close to MRT, shopping malls, etc…

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel.......Simply Great”
Reviews.Author: srivastavasmnavy
Reviews.Content: A Great hotel to Stay, Beautiful views, Friendly Staff, Full of life, Tasty food what else you need in a hotel. The Rooms were awsome. I must recommend this hotel to any one coming to singapore... Just in front of Marina Square and amazingly connected to the mall

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay at Mandarin Oriental during working event in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Johan Z
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore from Brazil after a quick rest stop in Amsterdam, Holland. Upon arrival at the hotel after a long trip it was extremely satisfactory to be quickly checked in and taken to our room after the long trip. All during the rest of our stay we enjoyed all the services of the hotel and in particular the attention we received from the well trained ane well choosen employees and staff. Sandra & Johan Zweede

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SlySydney
Reviews.Content: My work booked me in at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore and I wasn't disappointed. Great service from all the staff, impeccable rooms and top location. The front desk were kind enough to upgrade me to a Premier Suite, which to be honest is a little too big for a business traveler, I felt a bit lost at times wandering around the lounge, dining room and kitchen... I was also given access to the club floor which is fantastic. I enjoyed breakfast and evening drinks up there all for free, well worth paying for in my opinion. The gym is state of art with friendly attendants and top quality machines. The pool looked nice, but I didn't have a chance to use it. Definitely recommend it, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: thackern
Reviews.Content: I have been here many times, latest I came here with my son during new years when he was 4 months. The service provided to me was special as the staff already knew that I was with a baby. Although there was a small problem with the pick up, the staff were there from the doorstep as we arrive very late at night and took us straight to the room where I checked in. After which the service just got better and better. The room chosen was the Mandarin Grand and it was very spacious and lovely. The new years was special with night at the pool side with champagne and fireworks with my 4 month old son. Always will remain special.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHennessy
Reviews.Content: We are spoiled when we go to the Mandarin Oriental, our usual choice of hotels and the Mandarin in Singapore is no different. As to be expected, staff are polite, efficient, and always willing to help and please their guests. Housekeeping and turndown service was done on the dot or whenever we requested it. We stayed there with young children and everyone was accommodating with extra beds, baby cots, making arrangements for our daily excursions, organising drivers to take us sightseeing, calling a doctor immediately when one of the children broke out in hives, etc. However, it is more of a business hotel located in the water front and not quite as warm and cuddly as some MO hotels are. The food was good (breakfast was the usual large buffet) and the rooms were a very good size with neutral decorations and good size, user-friendly bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for businessmen with big expense accounts, not families”
Reviews.Author: motughosh
Reviews.Content: Our family of four including two children aged 7 and 3 stayed for four nights. There are some great things about the hotel. Firstly the pool area was fantastic, brilliant and friendly service and a lovely main pool as well as a great toddler pool complete with cabanas - all very good. The service was very good with staff remembering names and making us feel welcome. This was against the backdrop of a highly corporate feel to the hotel with functional but impersonal architecture - it's basically a big and ugly tower block but the children loved the dramatic lifts. The real whammy was the cost of extras. Food costs are exorbitant at the MO. $12 SGD for a child's glass of milk and $26 for a pizza is 'taking the biscuit' and there was no children's menu. Also our rooms were ready late despite us sitting by the pool in the rain waiting and our bags took a further hour to arrive and they still managed to mislay some of them. A good hotel if you have more money than sense. We stayed a night at Raffles and it was cheaper, more personal, better service and had much better breakfasts... And it's a million times more stylish.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great view of the bay and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: carmylondon
