Reviews.Content: All that you would expect from the Mandarin Oriental, great service and very comfortable rooms. Request a bay view, it is really nice! The pool is a lovely way to relax on a Sunday afternoon after the Sunday brunch buffet in MELT, great food a must try!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: davidsidhu
Reviews.Content: I visited Singapore as my last stop off during my honeymoon. The hotel had picked us up with a friendly driver who was talking to us about the history of Singapore which was a very nice touch. As we landed at 11.30pm the hotel were perfect in the terms of checking in. A lady greeted us at the main doors and rather than going to the check in area she took us straight to our room and did the check in there. Which was very nice of them. The room it self was amazing. The views we had were amazing. the room was spacey and had great sound speakers in the wall which I could input my mp3 player. They provided a free red wine which was nice. The whole experience through out was perfect. The only thing they let down on was when I went to the main desk to ask them if a football match was on tv and they checked and said 'no' but while I was flicking through the channels I saw it on just before half time (i know i shouldn't be watch football during my honeymoon but the PL just started). The location is great not to far from the shops. Great hotel to stay in. I am glad I choose this hotel. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: FMP
Reviews.Content: We booked a harbour view room through Amex - and although upgraded to an enormous suite - actually asked, and were very glad to be downgraded to the room we booked. The view above the pool was incredible, all the sights were lit up at night and looked magical. Good breaksfast, super efficient service - and really lovely pool, complete with complimentary water, ice creams etc.. On our last night because of an injury - we were unable to go out so ate in the italian restaurant by the pool - it was extremely good! and with the view thrown in, became an unlikely highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay !”
Reviews.Author: BLUEWONDER1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the very best five star hotels in the past we can say without any hesitation the Mandarin Oriental is the absolute very best. The major factor which sets this hotel away from the others is the outstanding service experienced. We would say to anyone who has the opportunity to stay once in their lifetime in a hotel which has the highest standards ---- then book the Mandarin Oriental. Thank you to all staff who looked after us --- we will never forget our stay at this magnificent hotel. We were upgraded to Harbour Suite room and the 360 degree view of the Marina Bay Sand Hotel & Harbour View was breath taking --- in addition the Buffet Breakfast at Melt Restaurant was truly superb ! Thank you once again MOSIN.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view of the Singapore Flier”
Reviews.Author: 2003millie
Reviews.Content: We booked into a club room to get the late checkout. Can recommend this, we enjoyed a full last day in Singapore without rushing to pack. We could also enjoy snacks and drinks in the clubroom before going to the airport (think it must have been the champagne helped me sleep on the plane later). Our room 19th floor room had amazing floor to ceiling views over the ships in the harbour and the Flier. At night it was just magical watching all the changing colours of all the lights. Very comfortable bed, sound insulation was very good, once the door closed there was no noise at all.The room and bathroom were not as big or plush as the ones in the Valley Wing at the Shangri La but once in the room our eyes were on the outside view! Staff were brilliant, nothing was too much trouble. Our 'in room check in' was actually in the clubroom over afternoon tea, personally I liked this better. Breakfast was really good. Service was excellent everywhere in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations for a Mandarin Oriental hotel, but at par for a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: siglo
Reviews.Content: When I stay at a Mandarin Oriental, I cannot help but compare it to its Bangkok, Hong Kong, London and Geneva properties which I have stayed before. All are distinguished by excellent rooms and superb service. Against these benchmarks, this property is below par. This is probably due to its "convention-like" feel - a large property with staff hardly at hand. An "old" hotel, which has refurbished its rooms and public areas. My Deluxe room was acceptable as a business-class room but not what I expect from an MO brand. Everything needed is there. The bathroom is below par. Wifi is slow which is not acceptable as its not free. Its location at Marina Bay puts it away from the Orchard Road shopping district, but near enough to the Sands casino complex as well as the Raffles Place financial district. I had lunch at Dolce Vita by the poolside. The poolside is modern and stylish. The menu was basic. It could be better if it wants to be "Italian" and not "poolside restaurant" Dinner was at Mortons. Sunday night but totally full. Excellent service, excellent quality, what one expects from Mortons. Highly recommended After-dinner drinks was at Axis, which was elegant and ideal for a quiet chat Breakfast was at Melts. The buffet offered an excellent selection of items and what I tried were of top quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ManagementSydney
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a few nights business. The hotel and its staff are excellent. Stayed on a club floor and used the lounge extensively. They really know how to look after the guests. Could not recommend more strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Reissu K
Reviews.Content: We were 4 days in Mandarin Orietal Singapore and enjoyed excellent and friendly service as well as nice overall quality in this hotel. I must say that this was the most positive surprice in our travelling history. Especially ALL the personnel was so naturally friendly and without strange and pretending polite behaviour. Buffet lunch was excellent, we normally don't take buffet, and it was really pitty that we found that only at the last evening, it was really incredible and highly recommended.There is anyhow some slight critics to be mentioned, wlan was not free and Italian restaurant was not worth of the high price. Summary anyhow is that price was well worth the product which we got. If we any time return to Singapore, we to be sure know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - get the club upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Jmdidday
Reviews.Content: This place was my sanctuary for a week long business trip. Absolutely wonderful service...they made the room every time I left it. You must upgrade to the view of the water and including the club access. The food there was amazing, and served 3x a day. Highly recommended. It was a bit pricey, but what isn't in Singapore?

Reviews.Title: “Thieving people at the reception”
Reviews.Author: Anu_d10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mandarin Oriental, Singapore with family. The hotel looks quite impressive, has good ambience, would also recommend their breakfast at met world cafe. But the staff's behaviour was quite racist. I found them catering better to their eurasian guests.That apart, the room are not cleaned as expected from a hotel claiming to be a 5*. Though, we stayed there for 7 days the bed linen was not changed. I would also advise ALL quests to be very careful while you are checking out, because we were almost cheated of 140 SD. The lady at the reception/conceirge took the money from my husband, but before issuing the receipt she disappeared and another one took her place. To my husband's surprise the money was still due towards us and these thieves were not leting him identify the female who took the money. In the end only when he threatened to call the police, did they issue the receipt. So be very careul while choosing this hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive the staff are beaming, sincere and helpful. The personal touches abound and the place is spotless. They make you feel like royalty and even came back up to our room after the 'in room' check in procedure to come back with leaflets. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: OTT12
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore on and off since 2000 when we spent New Year’s Eve at the hotel. Once or twice that I was unable to find rooms and stayed at a different hotel I have always been disappointed. From the moment you enter the hotel’s lobby till the time you have to check out you are looked after like no other hotel does. I arrived when the hotel had practically 100% occupancy and preparing for two or three weddings that evening. The lobby was buzzing with guests and although some people don’t like it, I find the lobby area calming and welcoming. Within a couple of minutes I was escorted to my 21st floor room with fantastic views over Marina Bay. The room is large for Singapore standards and having booked a Club Room, it gave me full access to the Club Lounge, free Wi-Fi, breakfast etc. The décor in the room was excellent with all the things you might need whether on a business trip or pleasure. A number of very good restaurants are available at various levels and don’t forget to visit the Axis Bar on the 4th floor if you need a drink with friends and you like some soothing jazz. The Club Lounge on the 19th floor has amazingly friendly and helpful staff whether you are going for breakfast, afternoon tea or cocktails before you venture out for the evening. The hotel is very well located both for business and for pleasure with shopping malls within minutes stroll away and in any case taxis are always available and cheap. In my opinion The Mandarin Oriental Singapore is what you always expect from the MO Group: Perfect staff, Perfect Service, in a very efficient but always welcoming and friendly manner. The best hotel in Singapore by far.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: AstonBaliGM
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay in October this year. Although the building is not so new, the staff were great and the breakfast was wonderful. My event at the Suntec Exhibition centre was an easy 10 to 15 mins walk through the mall with plenty of options for meals inside the hotel and close by. Was grateful for the concierge Leon who went all out to help me with a delivery that was late from outside the hotel. Good to see his earnest efforts to help me, and the package got to me outside of delivery hours, due totally to his persistence. The hotel is mature in it's product, and thus quite consistent in the service delivery. The infant care pack with all you need plus cute MO slippers for little feet was a delightful touch. Well done MO!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, Simple but Comprehensive Hotel 360 Degrees”
Reviews.Author: GoodSport1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, Helpful Staff, Felt right at home. What else can I say!!

Reviews.Title: “Most Impressive”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Singapore before and a friend recommended this hotel - obviously a good friend! I had a Club Room on the 19th Floor and both my room and the view over the city and the river were magnificent. In the morning, after a lovely night's sleep in a very comfortable bed, they served a good free breakfast, then in the evening they serve free drinks and nibbles, both in the Club Lounge and all served by the nicest, most courteous staff you will ever meet. On my last day, having already checked out, I left my bag and itinery with the ladies on the 19th Floor whilst I went to a final meeting and on my return they had not only booked a cab to the airport for me but also checked me in for my flight. Now that's service! And Bar@5 is a great place to meet for an early gin & tonic before venturing out into the city that begins almost on the doorstep. I really can't say anything but good things about this hotel; if you are going to Singapore stay there, you too will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great, to all those wannerbe 5* hotels, look and learn - this is how to do it”
Reviews.Author: DRMB
Reviews.Content: I was booked in by a seminar organiser for 2 nights as I was presenting a workshop. I was very pleasently surprised by the high standards. Room was great, staff were great (polite and knowlegable with excelent English but not fawning over the top like some Asian 5*), food was truely excellent. In short an excellent hotel well worth the money. The hotel is also a short walk to major shopping and business centres, and the trip to and from the airport by Singapore taxi was easy and comfortable. What else to say? Not much except highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “They make you feel really special!”
Reviews.Author: happytogether99
Reviews.Content: Due to my work, I have stayed in some really nice hotels, such as The Peninsula in Hong Kong. However, the recent two-night stay in Mandarin Oriental has made this hotel my new favorite! People there are not just courteous but genuinely friendly and warm, and they make everything easy for you. They really take extra mile to help you, such as giving us umbrella by the pool while they got rained on, or standing by the whole time while we had a late dinner at the Dolcevita restaurant. When you ask for direction in or around the hotel, they don’t just tell you but physically lead you to the place. One of the staff called me by my last name at the beautiful, Bali-like breakfast garden. They really made me feel like a special guest. The facility, including the pool, is 100% excellent; but in my mind, it's the people there who made this hotel #1! I will definitely come back!!

Reviews.Title: “What more could be said that has not been said already”
Reviews.Author: Pierre P
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a top floor suite. Lovely Hotel in a excellent location. Staff are extremely polite, breakfast is plentiful. Nothing more can be said about this hotel other then all the other 5 star reviews. If you are looking for a Hotel in Singapore and want the best service this is it. Club Access room is a must.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: lady_kates
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon in August, and we're so glad that we chose the Mandarin. The service from the front desk staff was superb, and they were so accommodating. We had booked a Harbour View room, and as it was our honeymoon, we were updated to a Club Harbour View Room - as a result we were on the 21st floor (one from the top), and had facilities to the club lounge. The room itself was gorgeous and spacious - especially for a city room, and the view. Just wow. I honestly think that the Mandarin offers one of the best views out of any Singpore hotel. Couldn't fault the breakfast either - plenty of choice no matter what you wanted. We sampled the bar menu too whilst by the pool - a high standard of food, and the service again around the pool was excellent. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to stay in Singapore - whether its business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could rate 6 star”
Reviews.Author: fishyd
Reviews.Content: Without question the best hotel experience I have ever had. Just outstanding. The personal level of service, right down to staff knowing you by name all though the hotel (ear pieces and mikes...here come Mr and Mrs XXX.) Could not fault the place and will not try. Wonderful food, great cocktails, the "Jazz Lady" in the late night bar. Every single staff member we had any contact with. Thankyou, you made our stay. Had to move to Marina Bay Sands for last 2 nights due to a conference booked at MO and it suffers badly by comparison. Spoilt for life and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: demarchiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore for 3 nights before flying to Kuala Lumpur. My wife and I with our 2 teenage girls. We had asked for 2 double connecting rooms each with en-suite bathroom. We had a wonderful view of the harbour and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was very professional and offered us a welcome drink while we waited for our rooms to be ready, considering we had checked in a bit early. The hotel is in a very central position in front of the harbour and at easy walking distance with the pedestrian restaurant area of the harbour. We were there during the dress rehearsals of the national parade so we were also treated to wonderful fireworks taking place right in front of the hotel. Club breakfast and afternoon tea are a real treat. A truly pampering experience!

Reviews.Title: “super service- breakfest less than average- be aware of pinguins”
Reviews.Author: slonik_on_tour
Reviews.Content: Going to Singapore to visit a friend started as a night-mare as my travel agent in Kazakstan messes up the booking and flight was 13 hours delayed on top. However, I got a Harbour view club room during 2 days - organizing myself via internet on Almaty and Bangkok Airport without any credit card details and the fact on top that a Morgan Stanley summit took place in the hotel and normaly all should be overbooked -thanks to the reservation team, great service. Arriving in the hotel, welcome was absolut nice and correct, nothing to complain. I booked a club package hcih allows you to take your breakfest not with the usual crowed with a view of Singapore city ( unfortunately not Marina view ). Breakfest itselfs is less quality than 2-star Hotel in Germany but the staff is very frindly and trained very well. Rooms are ok, for sure it is not the newest hotel in Singapore but you get all what you need and what you want, you even not to take any clothes with you, go to the shopping mall downstairs and buy some. As I mentioned, the staff is very friendly and treat you with respect, as well as you are a little bit more asual dressed like me than the crowed of uniformed morgan stanley people running around in this place like idiots - not the fault of the hotel, it is a business hotel, isnt it ? The pool is ok, normal sized with a nice view on the Marina, the servic very good. As a summary, I would com back as I really was impressed how they got me a room in there. It is a classic how he hotel is and I think if you visit Singapore you have to stay there once at least. On the other hand I am sure that there are many other hotels with the same class in Singapore for the same price - it is not cheap to stay in the mandarin oriental - which I will try next time if I will come back to be able to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: daudratul
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. The service is excellent starting from the reception. very good location for both the business travelers and the holiday makers. The welcome fountain at the lobby is really refreshing and the fresh flowers around the place really added value to the ambiance. The staffs are really noce and don't mind to offer their generous help to you voluntarily. The rooms are with amazing view, for both during the day and in the night. You can really enjoy the view of the waterfront harbor and the bay from the room. The beds are with the best linen I have ever enjoyed and the the bathrooms are really exceptional. For shopaholics, the Marina Square mall is just next to it. You can also enjoy the acquriam zoo which is nearby. The sap was amazing so does the sports bar. Would love to stay their again and again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to experience outstanding hospitality; this is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: adilmirza
Reviews.Content: My wife & I visited this gem of a property in October, 2011 for one of our annual holiday trips. Before going to Singapore we were in a fix as to where shall we stay. After a lot of deliberation we narrowed down on Mandarin Oriental Singapore. I must say that the experience that we had during our three day stay at this property is going to be a benchmark for all the future stays at 5 star hotels! Mandarin Oriental is absolutely an amazing place to stay if your are ready to splurge. Each & every penny that you spend on your stay at this hotel is worth it!!. Your amazing experience begins with the check in itself. We were personally escorted by one of the staff at the reception right up to our room & we were explained each & every facility that we can enjoy during our stay even before we reached our room. They asked us whether it is our first time in Singapore & gave us a room which had a breath taking view of Marina Bay Area on the 11th Floor!! Just check out the photograph to believe what I am saying!! Afterwards we were amazed more and more as time passed by. The property is located bang opposite the famous Singapore Merlion statue & the famous Esplanade bay area. You walk for 5 minutes & you can catch the ever so convenient MRT to reach anywhere in Singapore! Just adjacent to it is a huge mall which is accessible from the hotel entrance also. They have an exotic poolside restaurant which serves an array of delicacies from all over the world (of course that comes with a price). The best thing that you would enjoy is their GRAND (I really mean it) BUFFET BREAKFAST! I have never seen such a massive spread of different delicacies in any Buffet any where that I have stayed so far. Anyone who stays here would definitely not want to miss it (if it is inclusive in your room tariff). You are escorted by one of the hotel staff while you enter the restaurant for the breakfast & are explained what all they serve & where are the corresponding Buffets located. The rooms are fairly spacious & kept clean at all times. We also had complementary wi-fi connectivity & the internet speed was really good. All in all it is one of the best places to stay in Singapore if you are ready to pay the price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sharan B
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 4 day holiday in Singapore staying at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore. I have never experienced such great service in all my travels and would love to return on a future trip. Staff were always on hand to provide anything that you wished for and combined with great location, the best room and wonderful food, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tank09
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of tripadvisor reviews and are pleased to say the hotel lived up to our expectations. The club oriental checkin process was smooth in spite of our early arrival and very shortly our room was made available which had a fantastic view over the city. No problem was beyond the ability of the attentive staff to resolve. The room was comfortable and the bed allowed a good quality of sleep. We were left with an impression that no matter what was required the hotel always over delivered. The only incident which left a bad impression arose on the final morning of our check out when the club didn't open on time and after providing our breakfast orders, we waited over half an hour for the breakfast which never arrived prior to our departure to the airport. In all , this was not a sufficient hiccup to dampen our enthusiaism to revisit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star luxury worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: CUinSF
Reviews.Content: With many newer hotel options to choose from when visiting Singapore, we chose the Mandarin for its tradition of providing great service, impeccable cleanliness, and beautifully furnished rooms. Our standard mi-rise room has a great harbor view, and every modern amenity you could expect. Great air conditioning too, which in Singapore is a must, given the nearly year-round humidity. Good central location, easily walkable to many of the city's sights and attractions. Excellent restaurants, though a bit pricey, but definetly worth the experience. I highly recommend this hotel for a first class, 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: xcapee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a single night in November and it was most certainly one of the most enjoyable hotel stays I have ever experienced. From the moment my taxi pulled up I was treated with utmost respect and friendliness. Having a hostess walk you up to your room and check everything is okay was a nice touch. My room with the view of Marina Bay was large and extremely comfortable. The large bathroom was nicely appointed and the tv connected to decent compact speakers added some entertainment value while enjoyable the view outside the full length windows. The king size bed was ridiculously comfortable and I could have stayed in bed for hours if I wasn't so pressed for time to do some sight seeing the next morning. The foyer and public areas were classy without being over the top and was like an oasis away from the oppressive humidity of Singapore city. The hotel is a short 5-10 minute stroll to City Hall and the MRT and also only 15 minutes across the new walkway over to the Marina Sands Resort complex. The Marina Square shopping centre has all you need conveniently located behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Raymond W
Reviews.Content: Found the staff at this hotel absolutely wonderful, they were so helpful, kind, and polite. The room itself was very clean, had a great view, and very comfortable. Location is not to bad, has shops attached to the hotel, and lots of things to see close by. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, had such a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: DSW21
Reviews.Content: I have only positive things to say about this hotel, the views of the harbour from the room were stunning. The pool was a wonderful relaxing retreat as was the spa. Trying to decide which restaurant to eat at was the hardest decision we had to make.

Reviews.Title: “Great family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMac3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed it. It is a large hotel and it was particularly busy when we were there but despite this we still felt staff managed to retain a great level of personal service. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is very suitable for children which I wasn't really expecting and we had various useful baby items waiting for us such as a bath and baby toiletries. The room (Ocean Grand) was spacious and very comfortable and the view across to the Marina Bay Sands was amazing. Breakfast was excellent with an endless array of choices. We had room service once and it was also great- beautifully presented and the food was very good. Overall a great hotel with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jituvaxhish
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental is a very good hotel. It is at the prime location in Singapore, views are awesome and hotel staff is really very cooperative. Rooms a re spacious and luxurious. Overall this hotel gives you a very good feel.

Reviews.Title: “Worlds Best”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDutchman
Reviews.Content: From the first moment we arrived at 7 'o clock in the morning after a long flight, and were greeted by the doorman by our names (we had never stayed here before), till the moment we left, we have never felt more welcome in a hotel before. Luxury is not merely a question of room size, number (or even quality) of restaurants or breakfast options (although all of the above are more than exellent!) True luxury is defined by the people that provide the experience and service in hotels like the Mandarin, and to us, it never has been better than this.

Reviews.Title: “The best of times”
Reviews.Author: bikeviking
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental is a fantastic place to stay. I stayed at the hotel together with my son on our return journey to Auckland from Copenhagen. The arrival is in style and with an emphasis on a warmth welcome. The interior of the lobby is exciting interior design. The room spacious and great furnished. The view just stunning. Breakfast top class of quality products only. The location was right for our visit to Singapore. The large outdoor sun-deck/pool area with the indoor spa is highly addictive - I always think of this when dreaming of time to relax. At the end of our first night we arrived home after midnight and ordered Singapore noodles as room-service: the meal splendid and so the service. I like Singapore, I like flying Singapore Airlines and I enjoyed my stay at the Singapore Mandarin Hotel. Yes, it is expensive, but it was a worthwhile experience. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: WinePleaze
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to experience this Brand and we chose Singapore as a short stopover, to and from an extended Honeymoon in Europe in 2010. My wife and I were simply blown away by the experience. We wanted an oasis, somewhere to sleep, recover from flights and hectic schedules. The location is lovely and for our needs better than city centre where you might be distracted by external things. We chose the airport transfer which offers a timely and personal meet and greet, baggage handling and the cleanest, shiny black Mercedes door to door, well priced and vagely more than a Taxi. Arriving at the Hotel, everyone knew our name and we were swiftly taken to our room on an Oriental Club floor overlooking the stunning city and harbour. In room checkin a slick touch. Room was beautiful, spacious, spotlessly clean and in that natural timeless style. No minimalism here. Exploring the hotel, Pool scene is one of the best and most stylish I have ever experienced, again, tasteful and purposeful (on the return trip I killed an entire day by the pool and I could have done a week) Service throughout the Hotel is impeccable, and I could go on about the Restaurants but suffice to say, whatever you chose, you will experience culinary excellence. The Chinese restaurant was particularly memorable where the fine details of food and service come together beautifully. It also seemed to offer better value than the Italian Restaurant. Breakfast and the evening cocktail hour in the Club Lounge easily justify the cost of upgrading your room. Overall, I cannot recommed this hotel more highly

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable, really.”
Reviews.Author: deredye
Reviews.Content: Perfect ambiance: the Mandarin is always perfect in this, beautiful style throughout, soulfully decorated, modern Asian fusion with flowers everywhere. Wonderful service: absolutely blown away. 7 people said goodbye to me at breakfast this morning. I didn't count how many said hello, but probably a dozen über friendly staffers genuinely welcomed us. Food: the most comprehensive, cross cultural (not fusion) breakfast buffet I have ever seen. Period. Vegetarian? Indian? Gluten free? Raw diet? They got you covered. Seriously, this place should be an inspiration for other establishments.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to Asia Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Larrie55
Reviews.Content: My husband, 19 year old daughter and I started our Asia holiday here. We are so grateful that we did. The Mandarin Oriental is as close to perfection as humanly possible. We had arranged a driver to meet us at the airport and drive us to the hotel. Everything fell into plan perfectly. Upon arrival we were met by the most professional and welcoming staff: Karla in particular made our arrival a wonderful experience in itself, together with in-room check in and perfect reception. Our room was spacious, with an outstanding view and the best bed and pillows I have ever experienced. Staff went out of their way to be friendly and attentive. Breakfasts were great. We stayed in an Ocean Grand Room inclusive of breakfast and we were sad that we only had three days in this magnificent hotel. We dined at the Dolce Vita Restaurant: food was lovely and service was superb. Without doubt Herman Shah, Assistant Guest Services Manager Concierge will always stand out as the epitome of perfection in hotel service. This is not just a hotel. It is a journey into luxury where "stars" cannot adequately portray the pleasure of staying at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A really good place to stay while on hollyday in Singapore !”
Reviews.Author: Olaf050
Reviews.Content: Here you can relax and have a good time with your family and friends ! Really good food and nice rooms with plenty of space ! You get all the best at this hotel, its even better than at home !!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to Far East Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Northumbrians
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here in October. Wish we could have stayed longer. Loved everything about the hotel. Location, room, service, breakfast - all excellent. This hotel was a great start to our holiday in the Far East.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Bombealaska
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at Mandarin for 10 days, and its truly a memorable experience. This hotel is just too perfect. The staff regardless of their rank and duties are so well trained, and their level of service to guests are exceptional. The level of upkeep of rooms, restaurants and other facilities are so high, you wouldn't believe the hotel is more than 20 years old, the overall feel is as good as new. The rooms, namely the Harbour Premier, the Harbour Suite, and Premier Suite, and even the entry level, Deluxe Room are very nicely design and their decorations are very well thought. Even their infomercial on TV is at least a grade higher than their competitors. As for the overall dining experience is so enjoyable not only because of the food, but the overall setting and environment made the guests feel so comfortable. We dine at Cherry Garden, Melts Cafe, Dolce Vita and the Japanese restaurant. Just one word sums up for our dining experience, SUPERB. We have a long stay but we never get bored because this is not just a 5 stars hotel, we think of it as a 5 stars palace. What a awesome experience

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the grandstand”
Reviews.Author: FelixRIP
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in january 2011 before a birthday cruise on the Superstar virgo and this is without doubt one of the best. The Marina view was fantastic. I love waterfront hotels, especially in Asia, there is always something going on. I watched a passing out parade and 2 soccer games on the floating soccer field opposite. All that aside, the rooms were great, the buffet downstairs, for breakfast and dinner was fantastic. But the pool and poolside restaurant take the cake. Well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Zorax62
Reviews.Content: I've been fortunate to stay in several very good hotels but this one is undoubtedly the best. What makes it so special is the friendliness and efficiency of the staff. To be referred to by your name within 24 hours of arriving is quite an achievement. We stayed in a club room on the 19th floor and the room was well appointed and had a great view of the Marina. The club lounge is superb with good food and complimentary alcoholic beverages between 1730-1930. Given the very high price of drinks in this hotel, the club lounge is good value if you are partial to a glass of wine in the evenings! Food throughout the hotel is of extremely high quality and the buffet in "The Melt" restaurant had more choice than I've seen in a buffet before. The pool area is excellent and the complimentary and frequently supplied cold towels, water and jelly is a great touch. Complimentary WIFI throughout the hotel and pool area is a nice bonus and puts to shame the UK hotels that charge £15 for 24 hours.. One evening, the concierge (Leon) spent 30 minutes sitting with us discussing the things to see and do to in Singapore. To spend that much time with one guest shows a true commitment to customer service by this hotel (and Leon) The only downside to this hotel is the very high cost of food and drink. That said, I believe that is is comparable with other similar quality hotels in Singapore. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway and look forward to one day staying again. It is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Derbala
Reviews.Content: Cheerful room at the 17th floor over viewing marina bay sands and Singapore flyer, friendly smiling staff and great multi national breakfast buffet. The only thing i did not like much was the rather dim lobby, especially after seeing the Mandarin marina hotel? It's just a matter of different taste.

Reviews.Title: “The bar raised higher”
Reviews.Author: Timm01
Reviews.Content: My 2nd visit to The Mandarin Oriental and the quality of the food, service and staff has just got higher, from the moment we entered until we left after a great three day break. Over a period of time the standard has been raised and I think the management and staff should be proud of the product they deliver. Since my 1st visit the pool area has been upgraded and this makes it an excellent place to stay, some great 'covered loungers' and they could do with a few more, such a relaxing oasis. There are many great hotels in a superb city but I will quite happily return to the Mandarin as long as the standards are kept as high as they are at present.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: Trish7
Reviews.Content: We have mostly viewed Singapore as a good stopover option from Europe to Australia but this time we stayed for a week for a little bit of mid-year R & R. The service in the club lounge is excellent and very attentive, within 24 hours staff knew our names and preferences for coffee/tea etc. Very Impressive!!! The upgraded pool area is fabulous and we made good use of the new cabanas when wanting a little break from the Singapore sun. Without exception all the staff we met were helpful and friendly and we have already planned a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our Staycation”
Reviews.Author: celwong
Reviews.Content: My hotel expectations was really high after reading all the reviews. My good points and points for improvement Good points 1) Checkin Process: Impeccable service and accomodating. Even upgraded us to a high floor with habour view. Thumbs Up 2) Escoting to the room: Very nice service and detailed description on the controls 3) Toiletries: I enjoyed the ginger and lemon grass fragance, truly relaxing 4) Room Service: Ice - Perfect and wonderful service. Very polite and prompt to our request. Pleasant smile too. Kudos! 5) Swimming Pool - The service was fantastic, we are escorted a a wonderful shaped cabana. And was treated with cold towels and cold water. The adult swimming pool was a very fun for my son with his float. 6) Room Service: Ice - Perfect and wonderful service. Very polite and prompt to our request. Pleasant smile too. Kudos! Failure to meet the expectation. Let me share as below: 1) Upon Arrival: 1st impression is very important. The doorman in red costume did not bother to open our door or react to my son greetings. Seeing his warm expression in opening a earlier door with foreigners really differs greatly. Another personel asked in mandarin, you have luggage and tried to shove us forward. Maybe they have thought that we are wedding guests but it should not differs in the treatment. 2) Arrival in Front Hall: Seeing another reviewer saying about young kids feeling welcome, i was hoping that my son will feel welcome. But while he was looking at the pool area, lots of eyes were on him with wary eyes. 3) Rooms Size: Room was rather small for a 5 Star hotel compared to Ritz. Toilet size was average too. 4) Room service - Water and toiletries: I have asked for additional water and ice in one phone request. When the water reached, i saw no ice. The reply i got is "I am only in charge of water not ice. Please wait or call again" Shockingly service. And the same irriate look when i get additional toiletries as well. Which we need as my son is staying with me. 5) Children Pool: However he did not enjoyed the children pool as it was quite boring with the shallow water and sprouts. Overall the experience was good, but i will not go there again. As the service really varies from each sector. And I realise that service tends to be better towards non-asian people. This is the same as MBS as well. Realy disappointing that locals are treated by such a way. Will not recommend to stay at Oriental Hotel. As it need to have more training for other staff except for the nice people at the servcie counter. For the price, I will recommend Ritz as throughout the staff service level, all are the same.

Reviews.Title: “Superb food & service, slightly spoilt by tired suite”
Reviews.Author: StephenLock
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights and the total bill was around S$2,500, including a *superb* meal at their poolside Italian restaurant, Dolce Vita, where service was outstanding and the food at a really high standard. I had booked a club room at around S$500 a night and stayed in Suite 1522. This is a huge suite of three rooms long (fair sized bedroom, living room, dining room - with bar and kitchen - and 3 entrances to the suite), as well as 2 bathrooms and dressing room. This would have been super awesome were it not for the fact the bedroom and dressing room carpets were incredibly grubby and over all this felt a rather tired suite long-overdue redecoration. Comfortable bed though, but confusing lightswitches. The Bar has a great view and service excellent and good evening piano player and singer. There is a really impressive selection of restaurants here. I'll try it again and hopefully get a newer room, as public spaces outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give service a 6 out of 5 I would!”
Reviews.Author: AussiePen
Reviews.Content: Another exceptional stay at this hotel! I am just finishing a 3 day stopover on way to Italy and the Mandarin Oriental was a perfect start to our holiday. - beautiful room - exceptional service - great location - food allergy friendly - being coeliac and dairy free is not easy in Asia but the chefs at this hotel are well educated and have not been sick from any of my half dozen meals here - a fantastic range of food but also altered menu items to suit my allergies and it appears they make fresh gf bread! - will make staying here before Europe a tradition and a destination in itself when pampering is in order

Reviews.Title: “The best possible option in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: cateche
Reviews.Content: I've spent two weeks in this hotel and I find it really good. The best option in Singapore. Their breakfasts are gorgeous. Would love to come back one day

Reviews.Title: “Worldwide number 1 not just Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: The reviews written say it all Impossible to find fault, service is beyond compare, rooms are amazing, location is the best in Singapore. I travel the world with both work and pleasure and this hotel leads the way, I just wish the pound wasnt so weak against the Singapore. I will back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance”
Reviews.Author: UpfrontAustralia
Reviews.Content: The MO was our last stop after 7 weeks of touring and before returning home. The moment you are greeted at the airport by the MO driver you just know you're in good hands. In room check in, then breakfast in the Oriental Club lounge. After 12 hours in the air this environment is simply bliss. MO staff are amongst the very best service professionals anywhere in the world. Club Lounge staff are exceptional. Lovely room, great location and flawless guest services. Late check out and a driver to escort us back to Changi Airport. See you next year MO for yet another experience in the very best of hospitality. Thanks once more.

Reviews.Title: “communicating rooms with children”
Reviews.Author: hugh1957
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, well located, large rooms, good pool. I would say the rooms are a little bit dark and need more light. Nice amenities and every evening nibbles were brought to our rooms. Little gifts were given to the children. Mainly business hotel and arriving with young children could look almost odd. Great breakfast and friendly staff. Internet should be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: BWOverseas
Reviews.Content: Super Hotel and experience. We really liked the Club facilities - whose staff were outstanding - intelligent, helpful conversations with a real 'wow; factor. We really had a wonderful time in Singapre and MO provided a great base from which to explore. Strongly recommended. Cherry Garden food is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dante0303
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights during the F1 Grand Prix week and had an excellent experience. The welcome at the Mandarin is wonderful, we had a very warm, sincere and professional service extended to us though out our stay. Our harbour view room had the most spectacular view, the most comfortable bed and a quality, modern tasteful décor. To dine in the hotel is an expensive experience, to have a drink even more expensive but that is the norm in Singapore. My original intention was to stay at Raffles, but I am so very glad that I stayed at The Mandarin Oriental instead, it really was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient hotel with Expensive Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: coops9999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on a Club Level Floor. Friendly checkin staff. Room was very comfortable with separate lounge. Great bed. Lift cards often didn't work - which was a pain. Ate at the Hawaiian/Japanese restaurant - expensive sushi and the quality was lacking. The Cherry Garden Cantonese restauarant - again expensive and not as good as it should have been. They took 20 minutes to bring and open a bottle of wine! The restaurant had two tables. The pool area was great and the sun even came out from the perma-gloom that hangs over Singpaore in the summer. Breakfasts were good, and as we were in a top room, got lots of attention/service - which was surprising for a hotel with so many guests. We came during F1, and so the city slowly got closed down and taxis got harder to find and had a flat rate S$45 plus tax fare. If you're not an F1 nut - avoid if at all possible. For a big city, big corporate hotel - the M.O. delivered - just don't get lazy like we did and eat in the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Very very welcoming and a joy to visit”
Reviews.Author: Bendalot
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The staff really go the extra mile, even offering to polish my sunglasses for me whilst at the pool. The pool also offers majestic views of the city and many Singapore landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: traveller886622
Reviews.Content: great location, friendly staff and very clean nicely presented rooms !

Reviews.Title: “Impressive service, nice view the room should have been renovated”
Reviews.Author: Praredaa
Reviews.Content: Flawless service. And facility. The view s amazing. But room itself should improve. Quite out date and old. Been used for a long time. V clean and best locaton

Reviews.Title: “Better is not possible”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller3_0
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of the Mandarin Oriental. That is why I came to this hotel in the first place. This hotel provides all the service and luxury that you might expect from an "Oriental" Hotel. The rooms are large, the staff very service minded and the food at the restaurants very good. I always pay extra for access to the business lounge on the top floor. Every evening the lounge service appetizers and there is WiFi. The hotel is also located very close to some large shopping malls and when you are lucky you can even see the "Lion", Singapore's national symbol. Last but not least the Oriental has a large pool area to relax after a hard days work.

Reviews.Title: “Product Launch event at Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Anuj G
Reviews.Content: We used the Mandarin Oriental for hosting a event and was very impressed with the services. Senior event Manager Roger Cheow and his team was a pleasure to deal with and everything was arranged flawlessly. The staff always had a smile on the face and can do attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csf1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Sea view room for three nights in September. I can imagine that once upon a time these were the less desirable rooms. The sea is hardly attractive here, lined with oil tankers and container ships heading to the harbour. The city view rooms would always have had the views, giving great views of the skyscrapers of the city. However, I'd imagine that the owners must love that the Marina Bay Sands has been built as these rooms too now have a great view, looking over the Sands, the helix bridge, and the Singapore Flyer. The photograph above is a little deceptive. When one looks at it, or the photographs of the pool with the CBD in the distance, the hotel looks a little out of the way. It turns out it isn't. The CBD is only a short walk away. Raffles hotel and the City Hall are also just a short walk. The MRT station is just around the back of the hotel. You couldn't ask more of the location. We didn't use the pool or Spa facilities (the Spa actually being reasonably priced), but the room was excellent in its layout and design. The beds really comfy. Despite being in such a busy city, there was no noise whatsoever in the room. Service was, as expected from the Mandarin, fantastic, the concierge in Particular being very knowledgable. The cocktails in the bar were in particular very impressive. They had three cocktails which were "molecular gastronomy" cocktails. I had a bellini like cocktail with fruit juice filled spheres in the drink. I've been to many good restaurants that cannot get sphereification right (this being a technique developed at El Bulli not less) and here they were doing them in cocktails! Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Accommodations & Service”
Reviews.Author: A B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in late August 2011 for business meetings. When we arrived the person that registered us also walked with us to the room. As we walked she pointed out specific features of the hotel and where amenities such as pool, restaurants, etc. were located. The room was nicely laid out and a beautiful view of the lagoon. We were also able to see the Merlion statue and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel and shops from our window. Each morning at breakfast the staff greeted us by name and pointed out the steps as we walked. They were very safety conscience. They pointed out the stairs and exits when we arrived at the hotel as well. We enjoyed the pool and the restaurants. They have a Morton’s steakhouse within the hotel. Nearby there are numerous shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. The arts and science museum on the lagoon was very enjoyable. The Singapore Flyer is nearby as well as the Marina Bay Sands hotel and Casino. We would highly recommend this hotel. It is in the heart of a modern shopping area with many attractions nearby or under construction that will continue to enhance this part of Singapore. We have also stayed in the Marina Bay Sands – it is also lovely but more of a tourist attraction because of its uniqueness. If you want excellent service, very professional staff, beautiful facilities and fabulous rooms then stay at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Mandarin Oriental deserves its Number 1 Place”
Reviews.Author: Chasbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the M.O. Singapore in early September and cannot identify a single issue or amenity that failed to live up to the hotel's reputation and it's number one rating on Trip Advisor. We had originally decided not to have a club room but were offered a good deal on checking in and upgraded to a club room on the 20th floor with a stunning view of Marina Bay and the F.1 track being prepared. (The Oriental Club upgrade offers free wi-fi, breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails and is extremely good value for the additional cost) The room itself was well above average, well maintained and cleaned to high standard. We have rarely experienced a more comfortable bed in any hotel, that provided an excellent nights sleep, when combined with general quiet location and relaxed atmosphere of the hotel.The food both at Club Level and in the Melt Cafe did not disappoint and at no time could either place be described as manic and certainly table service was highly efficient (The comment of poor service by a previous reviewer is not reflective of the service we experienced) The staff were extremely efficient and courteous from check-in to check-out. If we return to Singapore we will not look to stay anywhere else than the Mandarin Oriental !

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Brooky50
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for 2nights as a stopover on route to Australia , and wow! We were amazed. The hotel is expensive but well worth it. The rooms are large and the bed was so comfy- we slept really well. The food was first class as was the service and we really can't fault the hotel. Singapore itself is a clean vibrant place and we would like to go back for longer so we can do a city/ beach holiday there. We would use the Mandarin Oriental Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: Ccaruso123
Reviews.Content: Loved my time here. I am a very loyal ritz Carleton singapore customer, and wasn't thrilled that our package wasn't with them for the grand pri but I haven't been disappointed. The pool area and pool beats ritz Carleton hands down and has an awsome feel to it! Service was incredible, but singaporians do this well. Food great, location amazing. Gym- average compared to ritz Carleton, not enough floor room and lacking in machines but does the job and the permanent staff to look after you is great. Change rooms a let Down especially as there not connected but still pretty good! All in all I have been very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Marina Bay View - Lack of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: MillionMilerMan
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Mandarin Oriental toward the end of a trip to SE Asia. Having stayed at the St. Regis, the Regent (Four Seasons) and the Grand Hyatt in Singapore on prior visits, we decided to give the MO a try--primarily because of the views of Marina Bay that the other hotels lack. That was a mistake, especially at 528SD (on the weekend). While the views from the Bay View rooms are spectacular, the rest of the experience was not so great. The negatives: 1. The weekend package our travel agent booked offered (albeit not guaranteed) a 6PM checkout. She had even put a special request in our reservation that we would like a 3-4 PM checkout due to our departure time from Changi. When we arrived, the hotel indicated no knowledge of our request and offered no better than 1PM for checkout. After trying to be pleasantly persistent in getting something later than 1PM, the almost belligerant front desk clerk called over the front desk manager who, after some discussion, offered us 1:30PM. Bad way to start our stay. While it's understandable that every guest can't stay at the hotel until 6PM, to be offered basically nothing smelled a bit of "bait and switch". 2. MELT, the restaurant for breakfast is a chaotic "zoo". While it is well-staffed, there is no one even remotely assigned to tables, so getting coffee refills, juice or anything else is tedious. When we finished breakfast, it took 5 employess to decide (or figure out) if we had to sign a check since our breakfast was included in the rate. After 10 minutes, they just decided we could leave. So many SE Asian hotels are known for their spectacular weekend brunches and exellent service. The MO is not one of them. It seemed to be fully staffed but not functioning very smoothly. 3. While not the hotel's fault, the construction all around the entrance and Marina Bay Area make walking in the area rather difficult. How I missed the relative quiet and charm of the Botanic Gardens around the Regent and the St. Regis. While not a dreadful experience, the MO did not live up to my expectations for the brand. The hospitality was absent and, for the price, there are too many other better hotels in the City. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: maxie88
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I'd stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in two years, and it was every bit as good as I'd remembered. We booked a Club room to take advantage of the 6.00pm checkout as our flight left at 10.00pm. This also gave us 'free' Wifi with a very strong signal (the additional charge for Wifi is quite expensive otherwise). Highlights were the friendly and efficient service, an excellent meal at the Cherry Garden restaurant, beautiful 20th Floor room with views over the Bay and the city. Just one issue was that the bath was quite short, so 6 foot plus husband couldn't stretch his legs out in it. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly services but v expensive internet”
Reviews.Author: horrus
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly services but cost of internet was outrageous. Hotel management should reevaluate their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Right up there with the best, mostly ....”
Reviews.Author: LanPing
Reviews.Content: I last stayed here 4 years ago, and the Mandarin Oriental certainly hasn't lost any of its special charm. Fantastic room overlooking the Marina and the F1 Grand Prix circuit. In fact, thats the fly in the ointment; on any other day I am sure the service would have been perfect; unfortunattely, due to the arrival of F1 in town, all of the roads around the hotel have been closed off, and only chauffered Limousines are allowed in (no taxis); a typical fare to the business district would be SGD7 - with these people it's a flat rate SGD45, and then only of you can get one. I waited 20 minutes, gave up and walked to the MRT station and went by train for SGD1 The rooms are sheer prefection; the Room Service wonderful; the staff attentive and industrious - all in all I was made to feel like a privileged and welcomed Guest; unfortunately, so were the F11 crews (Schumacher was staying here at the same time as me) and during this busy time the Hotel was not always able to give of its best. I am sure it was an exception, and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and consistent Mandarin Oriental Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MisterOpinion
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting this hotel for almost twenty years. It has had one or two upgrades since then and is very consistent. It's in good shape decor wise and staff are excellent. Either Singapore or the US$ exchange rate has made it much more expensive than I recall. The rooms are spacious and of course always immaculate. Bottled water provided every day etc. Room service is prompt, good quality -- but I think pricey. S$28 plus for smoked salmon sandwich! I was attending a conference at SunTec - so this was very convenient; it wouldn't be if you wanted to shop along Orchard Road, though goodness knows what you'd want to buy as Singapore is SO expensive now. Dinner for 2 in a simple Sushi restaurant in the adjoining mall was S$82!! The MO's MELT cafe is excellent; and I had breakfast included. The Wasabi Bistro is very odd. OK food, but dreary decor - this needs sprucing up a bit. Get rid of the table cloths and make it look a bit more like a bistro for starters! It's also expensive - Bento box dinner $62 per person. I have stayed at the Club lounge several times but didn't this trip. It's not worth it. They wanted S$100 plus tax to upgrade - and it is not all day dining like some lounges (Ritz Carlton Moscow or Hilton Vienna - come to mind). Only breakfast and tea. Well -- breakfast I got included and MELT has a much larger selection of food - and who cares about a calorie laden afternoon tea. If it provided a good food service for lunch and dinner it might be worth it - otherwise I'd say skip it. Another thing to skip is a hotel airport pick-up. It's about S$85 vs $30 or so in a taxi. It's very easy to get a taxi, and I guess at some times of the day there may be a wait; but it is quite a short ride in; and Changi is such an easy airport to move thru - the security and comfort of knowing you have transportation awaiting you is not necessary. Overall - this is a solid and consistent hotel in Singapore. It's well maintained. However, had I NOT been attending a SunTec conference I would have probably stayed somewhere else (Sheraton - Hilton and got my points) - as many of the other 5* properties seemed to have better prices. This was the week of F1 (this weekend) so maybe that's why prices were higher than I recall.

Reviews.Title: “Asian luxury”
Reviews.Author: SpencerTed
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, first-class, international hotel which manages to do that most rare of things, that is, it retains an Asian 'feel' about it, though the decor and the design of everything. You wake up in so many hotels and feel that you could be anywhere - not so in the Mandarin Oriental. This is exquisite under-stated modern-in-a-classic-way South East Asian design. The staff and the service are first-class - friendly and informed. It's not cheap, but it's worth it - for my money it beats the faceless international chains hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - legendary asian hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Sekok
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room in connection with Singapore Airlines as one night stopover from our trip back from Australia. This gave us the possibility to have an extended checkout time till 18:00 on the second day as flights to europe leave around midnight. I stayed in this hotel more than a decade ago for business reasons and therefore I'm quite aware that oriental hospitality is absolutely legendary. Well, upon checking-in we've been offered a free upgrade to a "city suite" located on the 8th. floor of the building. Unbelivable: as we walked into the room we found ourselves located in the equivalent of a luxury 2 rooms contemporary city flat with a living room, a bedroom, two separate bathrooms, bath tub, shower and a separate dress room. Now who wants to leave on the next day? In the evening we had a great dinner in Cherry Garden cantonese restaurant inside the hotel. A huge surprise was the breakfast buffet on the next morning. Mandarin Oriental managed to wonder me again! Now the buffet features the largest selection of standard, continental, asian, indian food I ever witnessed. Square meters and square meters of breakfast proposals to choose from, individually introduced to you by the waitresses as you walk into the room in an example of perfect asian organisation. Amazing. BTW take time to visit the pool with bay view on 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: foggy74
Reviews.Content: We adored this place - we stayed here on our honeymoon (it was my second visit as I'd stayed previously with work). It's huge, not the usual sort of boutique hotels that we choose. The staff are superb, the quality of the rooms and furnishing is wonderful, the food in the restaurants (particularly the wonderful Dolce Vita) excellent - fantastic. The views from some of the rooms are just fantastic - see our photographs! It's also very well located - the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay casino, Raffles and Clarke / Boat Quay are all within walking distance. My only gripe was that, on booking, I asked for a rate including the buffet breakfast (we did for everywhere we stayed on our honeymoon). I got a corporate rate (as I'd stayed there before with my employer) but, on arrival, I was told this was not included. It's a shame as the buffet breakfast is like nothing I've ever seen - phenomenal variety and quality, but they were insistent that my rate did not include it. I know I asked for it, and it was possibly just a rate mix-up, but frustrating none the less. Irrespective of the rate issue, we'd definitely return - a flagship jewel for Mandarin Oriental, and a wonderful, relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Consistenly Mandarin -”
Reviews.Author: HardBedVeteran
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 night at this lovely hotel last week - it has a very nice atrium and the main lifts are bubble lifts - very nice indeed! Rooms are very well appointed, just nice and there is a "cascading" balcony design to it. Located at the heart of the "newish" city center (Marina Bay CBD area), it's very convenient for the business traveler working in at the Suntec City area (and also if you're into malls there are 2 (or 3) malls located in its area. But is not quite at the center "center" of the city so make travel/walking allowances when planning (remember however that Singapore is NOT a huge city and I recommend walking all around!) The only strange this was the bathroom is a little elongated - its got everything really, but looks long! :) The TV system was also a bit of a mystery to get going but it was relatively simple really so read the TV remote instruction sleeve - seriously, it's something one should do before calling the engineering folks! (I learned my lesson there - it was SUPER SIMPLE!!) If you are able to get a bayview room, please do so as you would catch a most beautiful view of the seaview and the CBD skyline. So worth it! I will be back again soon and will hopefully be able to upload/update with photos and possibly try the food there!

Reviews.Title: “Simply breathtaking....”
Reviews.Author: icefresh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a family trip to Singapore and all I can say about the Mandarin Oriental is "simply breathtaking....." Hotel staff went all the way to make sure that we were comfortable throughout our stay there. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded from a Mandarin grand room to a junior suite at their highest level floor which was an unexpected surprise. The rooms were huge and very luxurious. My wife and son really loved the bed. Very comfortable and the bed coverings were extremely soft and pleasing. We had breakfast at "the Melt" every morning and the food selection was huge and very satisfying. My wife commented that she kept looking forward to returning to our hotel after spending our days outside. Hotel is not cheap, but what you get is more than what you invest at this wonderful hotel. Oh, by the way, the fitness center is marvelous and the swimming pool is a "must try"! Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DublinGommer
Reviews.Content: I've spent 4 weeks in this hotel in the past two months. Not really much to say that hasn't been said already about this hotel. What were my favourite bits? The client service is incredible. I loved the pool, especially in the evenings when it is dark outside, but warm enought to lie by the pool and swim. The location is great as well. And on all the occasions I have stayed, I have been in a Marina View rom - amazing to wake up to every day. I ate in a number of the restaurants, and they were all good (and expensive as you would expect). Room service was superb as well. Don't think twice about staying here. It is top quality!

Reviews.Title: “Champagne brunch!”
Reviews.Author: Richsmail
Reviews.Content: We had the most amazing champagne bruch near the pool in this hotel the food was top class, free flowing champagne i would easily say this is the best meal I have ever had. Thank you Sean and Andrew.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: AviatorHouston_UK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via BA Holidays. Upgraded by e-mail to Oriental Club which costs S$180 per room per night. This gives you Champagne breakfast in the Lounge, Afternoon tea, and snacks and drinks for 2 hours in the evening. Very good value. What sets this hotel apart is the service - extremely friendly and courteous staff. Can thoroughly recommend the Cantonese restaurant (no MSG). Rooms very spacious with great views. Drinks very expensive in the bars (in common with most of Singapore) - S£49.00 for two small glasses of wine. On balance this is probably the best hotel I have stayed in anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “First rate, first class place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wmccfp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Manadarin while visiting our son who works in Singapore. The location is excellent unless you insist on being in the middle of downtown. You're a block or so from the nearest subway station and within easy walking distance of the inner harbor, the Marina Bay Sands Casino and shopping malls. Because you are on the inner harbor facing downtown it is quieter with less traffic. Our room was excellent facing the harbor and the floor to ceiling window enhanced the view as well as making the room seem larger. It was not the largest we've ever been in but it was more than adequate with current furniture and appointments. The bathroom was well equippped, very clean and larger than the room on a relative basis. We only ate breakfast at the Mandarin but the buffet without doubt is the best we've ever seen in our world travels. The bar in the atrium was a nice place to finish off the night with a drink. The service throughout was excellent. We didn't need the conceirge services as our son showed us around so we can't speak to their competency. As with most everything in Singapore the hotel was extremely efficient while maintaining some sense of the quieter, slower times from bygone eras.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally situated, a classy joint with great service.”
Reviews.Author: billbennettoz
Reviews.Content: My flight to Mumbai was delayed for two days, Qantas put me up at the Mandarin Orchard Road. It's the only time in all my traveling when I hoped the flight would be further delayed! Rooms are spacious and spotless, the buffet (particularly the Sunday brunch) was spectacular, and the service impeccable. I've stayed at the Mandarin in Hong Kong, and this hotel maintains the high standard. On arrival I wanted an ATM to change money. One of the desk staff actually walked me out onto the street to show me where the nearest machine was. Incredible service. I hope my flight back is also delayed!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and Bad Room”
Reviews.Author: lwy2020
Reviews.Content: Was there with my family, thought nice room to be served as free upgraded to suite room, once I get in, feel uncomfortable, darkness and old deco, and bad view from the room, and what a lousy and small twin beds served. Not worth for SGD680 per night. WIll never go back to this hotel. Shangri-la Hotel Resort Sentosa, best and nice, just only SGD440 per night. all staffs are so friendly and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Best Breakfast Buffet (Ever!), but Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: kismika
Reviews.Content: I love Mandarin Oriental brand and have always trusted their top quality service…until we arrived to Mandarin Oriental in Singapore. It all started at check-in. After flying for over 26 hours to get to Singapore, we arrived to hotel by taxi and were informed that room is ready. Yay! Mid-way through our check-in process, another staff member came by to talk to the young woman that was checking us in. Holding somebody else's passports in his hands and completely ignoring us, he started speaking loudly to the woman (not in English) so we couldn't understand what was going on. Since he was holding other guests passports in his hands, we assumed there was a problem with another guest. The woman smiled at us and replied to the rude guy in English that she is almost done checking us in and would help him in a minute. The guy continued to speak, getting super frustrated, constantly interrupting the woman and trying to get her attention. Finally, the woman got fed up with him, so she smiled at us, told us to wait a "minute", got up and left. "A minute" lasted for about 25 minutes during which not even a glass of water was offered. We were just sitting there waiting as if it was a small hotel with only 2 employees working. There were plenty of staff members around, but all of them were either walking around totally ignoring us or blankly staring at their computer screens. We were too tired and exhausted to complain, so we just waited. And waited. And waited. Finally, the woman came back, mood completely changed from politely nice to super agitated. She asked, once again, to complete registration forms, which we already completed before she abandoned us. We reminded her that forms were already completed. She got annoyed and barked back that she was "getting our room ready for us." Like how? Did she go to vacuum the carpet in the room while we were waiting? We were way to tired to argue with her and all she really needed to do is apologize for making us wait for no apparent reason (and it would have been super nice to have the rude guy apologize to guests before barging in and interrupting in the middle.) However, there were no apologies from anyone. I already began to dislike this hotel before even getting to the room. Now, let me tell you that I was choosing which hotel to stay among Mandarin Oriental, Ritz-Carlton, and Marina Bay Sands. After less than exciting experience at Ritz Carlton in Osaka, I narrowed it down to Mandarin Oriental and Marina Bay Sands. The turning point to disregard Marina Bay Sands was after I read multiple reviews on tripadvisor that the check-in process took on average 45 minutes in Marina Bay Sands. Knowing that we would be coming to hotel straight from the airport after flying for 26 hours, last thing I wanted to do is to wait 45 minutes for no apparent reason during check-in process. So, I decided to go with Mandarin Oriental and ironically, the entire check-in process with them took actually longer than the dreaded 45 minutes in Marina Bay Sands. I was disappointed with my choice of hotel, especially at the steep price of over $600/night. We got to our room, which had a nice view of the harbor, was very comfortable, spacious and beautifully decorated (though you really need to close your eyes while walking from elevator to the room because hallways are pretty ugly.) I was too upset after rude check-in to appreciate the beauty of the room, bathroom and the outside view. From the window of our room I saw beautiful Marina Bay Sands and was wondering why I chose Mandarin Oriental. Some people might think that check-in process is not that important, but I tend to disagree. It provides guests with valuable first impression that could make the entire stay relatively positive or negative. Nobody likes to pay over $600/night and then be treated by annoyed staff members as if they are too bothered or busy to welcome you to their apparently luxury 5 star hotel. It is unprofessional and rude. Moving along... after taking a bath and getting back to cheerful mood, we decided to go explore Singapore (our first time visiting.) Concierge service proved to be excellent, attentive and very helpful. Everyone who we met at concierge desk was super friendly, polite and engaging. What a difference from our check-in experience! One night we decided to dine at the restaurant inside Mandarin Oriental and on our way to the room to change, stopped by the restaurant to see if we needed a reservation. It was about 4:50PM, restaurant was completely empty as it was too early for dinner. We walk from the elevator towards the restaurant, a young woman walks out from the restaurant and it goes like this (in the hallway): Her: Sir, we have a dress code, you must wear closed toe shoes to come to the restaurant. My husband: Good evening! Her: Yes, hello. I am sorry but we have a dress code. My husband: I know. We were just stopping by to see if you have room for 2 for dinner LATER tonight. Her: I am sorry, but we have a dress code. We did not eat there and never came back. Instead, we walked to the riverbanks where there are plenty of delicious restaurants and fun hosts who promise you honeymoon table, romantic table, the best table, or anything else that you might desire to ensure a pleasant dining experience. On the positive (very positive note): Mandarin Oriental breakfast buffet was truly something extraordinary that I haven't seen anywhere! It was so delicious and fresh that I would definitely recommend not to miss it! Our room rate did not include breakfast, so we had to pay over $100 for 2 people to have breakfast one morning, but it was worth every single penny. There are so many choices of tasty items that would satisfy even the pickiest person in the world. Different stations featuring various cuisine (yummy!), absolutely stunning presentation that makes you want to try everything you see, freshly squeezed exotic juices (and even wheat grass!). Having breakfast at Mandarin Oriental was truly a treat! We did not try the spa (though I wanted but changed my mind after check-in). In summary, I am still rating Mandarin Oriental high despite unpleasant experience at the check-in and dinner restaurant because it has great location close to many city attractions, yummy breakfast buffet, and because room was really comfortable, cozy and inviting. I will probably continue being loyal to Mandarin Oriental brand but most likely won't be staying at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: letsmakeadeal
Reviews.Content: Really wonderful room. Huge breakfast/brunch buffets with lots of great stuff. Everything done well. I don't know Singapore that well, but the location seemed OK but not fantastic. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: mizuwari
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at MO Singapore during a layover. We arrived very early 7am off a red-eye and we're exhausted. I was injured so was in special need of rest and very nervous we wouldnt get our room upon arrival. To our delight, we got a room not exactly our request but we were able to sleep as soon as we arrived. After a 4 hour nap, my family went down to the pool area to enjoy a swim and have lunch poolside. Nice pool and decent food. Service around the pool is a bit rough but OK. The room was nice and size was adequate. my family of 3 squeezed into a king bed it was ok for 1 night. Bath tub is way too small for a westerner. We've stayed at both MO's in HK and found the service quality a bit better there. Turn down service with evening treats were not provided in Singapore. My son always looks forward to those. Bath tub far bigger in HK; we are an evening bath family. We spent a few hours at the zoo and the evening at the night safari. We heard so many good things about both but not too impressed with the zoo; it was nice but our expectation were really high; the night safari was more unique. I might try a different hotel the next time just because I wasnt wow'd this time.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel .....”
Reviews.Author: mheeaad
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel in a great location, a true 5 star property. easy access from the airport (approx SGD 50 in a taxi and only 25 mins). ask for room overlooking marina bay - amazing floor to ceiling windows and view. great f&b outlets and top breakfast.....highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Dpierce256
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon. As part of our package we were upgraded to a deluxe room on the 18th floor overlooking Marina bay. The views were out of this world and gave an unrestricted view of the Singapore skyline. The staff in this hotel were extremely helpful and polite.
