After going for a quick drink when we first arrived the manager of the axis bar greeted us with a nice card sent to our room as well as a complimentary dessert to try because we liked the look of it. We were also treated to complimentary champagne at breakfast one morning as well as a bottle of wine when we arrived. This was a great base for exploring what Singapore had to offer and the only downside was probably the prices of drink and food which were quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A magnificent indulgence”
Reviews.Author: LesW2020
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Singapore was a three day stopover for my wife & I before heading home after a 12 week sojourn in the Middle East and Europe. The choice of this hotel was just what we needed. The view from our room was magnificent - it took in the city, harbour, Marina Bay Sands Hotel, Casino & Shopping Centre, and the Art & Science Museum The staff, facilities, and restaurants were simply excellent - although we must admit that the specialty restaurants were quite expensive and under utilised during our visit. The breakfast buffet was simply one of the best we have experienced. The hotel is very centrally located and close to underground shopping links.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mm_at2814
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Mandarin Oriental after a very long flight and was the first leg of our holiday and wow was the hotel impressive!! From the door men, to the receptionist who checked us in (and upgraded us! thank you), everything was just perfect and the service what you expect from a 5 star hotel. The beds are comfy, location great and the staff really do make this hotel a pleasure to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in great city”
Reviews.Author: NoCheese
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental is in a great location; hotel services and amenities are divine. Views from rooms are spectacular. Executive club has wonderful food and great concierge service. The italian restaurant is delicious nd you can dine outdoors near the pool- very refreshing. Only downside is to be careful when asking doorman for a taxi. Twice they put us in a "limo taxi" which costs twice as much as regular taxi. Just ask for "normal taxi" and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “loved it ,will go back!”
Reviews.Author: bhimji
Reviews.Content: loved this hotel .i can,t say anymore then it be prefect,everything right outside the door,thankyou all for a lovely stay,pool was big and clean. fresh fruit in room everyday ,just loved it !

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: ceejayenn
Reviews.Content: I had booked a Premier Harbour View room for three nights' stopover in Singapore on way back from work visit to Australia. On arrival, the receptionist suggested an upgrade to the Oriental Club for a reasonable daily charge. This proved good value as breakfast and an early evening buffet were included along with free internet access and a 6PM checkout (and no problem about staying in the Oriental Club Lounge until I needed to go to the airport). The room was excellently equipped with superb bed and lots of little touches, even a bookmark on the bedside table for my book. Staff were very hospitable without being excessively obsequious, and used my name without needing to ask what it was. The evening hors d'oeuvres buffet was plenty to make a dinner unnecessary, but I ate in the Cherry Garden (Cantonese food) one evening and had a delicious Chinese meal. As a solo traveller, I was glad that wine was available by the glass. Overall, a tremendous experience, and I hope to return soon. One small niggle: the hotel is adjacent to the Marina Square Shopping Mall, but there did not appear to be a direct entry from the hotel to the mall - it was necessary to leave the hotel, walk about 100 metres and then go up a rather shabby staircase and a narrow passage to gain access to the mall. The nearest MRT stations are all about 500 metres from the hotel, but frequent buses from the stop on Raffles Avenue opposite the hotel go to Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, both for business & leisure”
Reviews.Author: psiew13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night @ August 2011 for a business/leisure stay over. Booked the premier room via www.my.pyotravel.com and got a good rate. One night stay including breakfast for 2 cost us SGD283nett (RM698). Check-in: Arrived earlier than the standard check-in time and hotel reception quickly find us a room. Upgraded us to premier room with harbour view. Service was prompt! Room: Very comfortable and it's just luxurious. Room is spacious for Singapore standard. I love the hotel toiletries.... infused with ginger lemongrass herb. I feel like just stepping out from spa after the bath. Welcome drink in the room is a special grape tea. Super nice and refreshing. The view from the room was breathtaking at night, facing the Marina Bay Sands, Art Science Museum, Fullerton Hotel, Merlion and Esplanade! Bed and pillow was comfortable for me. Bathroom was spacious too, with separate bath tub & shower. Location: Can be accessed via 2 MRT station - City Hall station (about 10 minutes walk through City Link Shopping Mall) or Esplanade station (5 minutes walk). I would said the hotel location is convenient. Cabs are aplenty in front of the hotel too! Breakfast: I super love this. Great varieties and very yummy foods. The service here was great eventhough the crowd was huge. One thing is the coffee house is very cold, do bring a sweater along for breakfast. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay as heaven”
Reviews.Author: EvelynPethick
Reviews.Content: We had a sea view which is worth the extra money. Rooms are very high standard and so clean. All your needs are catered for and the staff are wonderful from front of house to restaurant. For pure luxury I would recommend anyone to treat themselves and stay here. The pool area is beautifull and staff very quick to help you get a lounger and constantly bringing iced water or drinks if required. Completely spoilt. Breakfast is amazing and so much to choose from it takes ages to decide staff are very efficient and no normal wait to get a table as often happens at breakfast time in large hotels. It was my husband birthday and the hotel sent him a lovely card and a beautiful birthday cake which was delicious. So if requiring a hotel in Singapore stay here for pure luxury. The hotel also asked for our feed back once we had left and were very quick to respond on any comments we made.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful service and definitely would go back”
Reviews.Author: Lynds1109
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mandarin Oriental for our Netball tour to see the World Champs as a spot of luxury and a hotel that rated consistently well and it certainly didn't disappoint. We loved the service in particular. The concierge and pool staff couldn't do enough for us and then there were the extra little touches like jelly shots by the pool and yummy snacks in the bar. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to stay somewhere out of Orchard Road, close to the Marina and who will use the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have wished for better.”
Reviews.Author: Ke1thred
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Singapore as our stopover on our return to the UK from our trip to Australia. We had three nights here and took in trips around the City both during the day and at night. We could not have wished for a better hotel than this and it certainly deserves its number one status. From the moment we arrived we knew we were in for a special experience. The architecture of the hotel including the feature central lft column is awesome. We stayed in a deluxe room on the 20th floor and the view through the whole wall picture was breathtaking and at night spectacular. The pool and restaurant facilities are first class and the breakfast arrangements left us speechless. The thing that stands out throughout though was the courtesy and professionalism of the staff, their attention to detail and their absolute determination that they do everthing possible to make your stay special. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Love everything about this one !”
Reviews.Author: Rafaya
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best one in Singapore. Room was spacious, view to the Marina Bay was breathtaking. Service was seamless, friendly and efficient. DVD player in the room was awesome, we spent time watching films inside while it rained outside. Within walking distance to the mall, espalanade, marina bay sands, etc. Breakfast choices were plenty, they even gave us a tour before we started to eat. Room was modern, quiet, bed was soft and comfy with fluffy pillows. Had a very good sleep. Bathroom amenities were complete and smelled very nice, tea and coffee making facilities were available and replenished daily. Stay here and look nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT AND WE WILL BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: susy1Brisbane
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental was fantastic we were treated like royalty everyone was so polite it made you feel like a part of a family. The rooms were great and we were very close to public transport and shopping centres and the marina.The breakfast was 10 out of 10 so much food and good service.Perfect 8 days. Would recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: “amazing service, we will be back”
Reviews.Author: bellm2
Reviews.Content: the hotel is like any other 5 start hotel, but i think the service at the mandarin oriental sets it apart from the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...”
Reviews.Author: jasse_1234
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice stay there and can see myself going back. Stuff very polite, pool area very nice and room with a great view over the harbor. If I have to get really picky, then I´d say the bathroom could be a bit more modern.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT AND WE WILL BACK.”
Reviews.Author: DALIPGUPTA
Reviews.Content: We have booked two rooms for 3 nights, as we reached early to hotel we were granted rooms much before the check in time. The overall staff was very friendly nature. the facilities were excellent, as we were Indians, were strange to find such a good indian food in hotel itself. The breakfast was also very lavished. The other facilities such as swimming pool, fitness center were excellent. As you u staying with Mandarin Oriental u r entitled for free usage for internet for some time that is also one plus point of this hotel. The location is perfect for the hotel as Singapore flyer is just walking distance from there, next to the hotel there is attached mall also. WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO PEOPLE TRAVELING SINGAPORE.

Reviews.Title: “Much better then expected”
Reviews.Author: vastgotta
Reviews.Content: Normally I visit Singapore once a month from Australia and I always try to stay in the Shangr La.. Unfortunatly (or in hindsight luckily) there was no room availability for my last trip. As a result I got set up with the Mandarin Oriental. I know Singapore well enough to know the location is great but was not to sure of the brand: - check in: excellent, no cue and I had the key in my hands in minutes (with a lucky upgrade, I feel I always get an upgrade on First new hotel visit but never afterwards). - the hotel atrium is huge, much bigger then at the Traders hotel... Just wandering how expensive it is to have such an open space in this A location. There are plenty of elevators to shuttle all guests up and down. - room: great, great bed, tv with plent of channels and even a balcony.. My room had 'city' view but could have also been 'no' view or at least 'nothing to see' view. - bathroom: big, bath and seperate shower...only thing is that all soaps and shampoo are lemongrass scent...Im not a fan of lemongrass. Luckily I had my own toiletries with me. - interest was fast and included in my rate. - breakfast: a blast with everything you can wish for. Indian, Japanese, Chinese, juice bar, normal cheeses, low fat cheeses...the only thing I missed was muesli. On 2 mornings I went out for an early morning run along the Singapore river and Marina and on both occassions the doorman had a bottle of water, fruit and a towel waiting for me upon my return,,,,speaking of service! Check out: the bill was correct. The biggest challenge I now have is: should I keep my Shangr La status or keep coming back to this great hotel.. A luxury dilema.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: turnleftpreferred
Reviews.Content: The service here is outstanding. Everyone knew our name after day 1. Travelling here with babies was great and the staff were so attentive and interested. Outstanding baby pool. Lovely pool area with cabanas - all spotlessly clean. Quick and efficient room service. Restaurant meals not perfect but service outstanding. I certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, wonderful rooms, & a world-class breakfast buffet...”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie-LA
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental Singapore is located strategically at Marina Bay, within easy walking distance of the Marina Bay Sands complex. The architecture itself is stunning inside. The rooms here are clean, modern, and comfortable. It's clear to see that housekeeping pays attention to details (spotless bathrooms, replenished stationary). The pool area is welcoming and well-designed, with day-beds for lounging. The breakfast buffet is worth a mention: An INCREDIBLE array of breakfast foods from all over the Asia (& Western cuisine as well). Overall, the Mandarin Oriental Singapore easily manages upholds the excellent reputation of the Mandarin Oriental brand, and I felt it was a good value, even at its price point.

Reviews.Title: “Service & personal attention like you wouldn't believe”
Reviews.Author: Sarget
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived (late) by airport shuttle bus - the staff were on top of it. They greeted us by name and took our luggage check-in arrangements were taken care of extremely quickly and we were escorted to our room with the most superb views over the Singapore eye and Casino. This was the first time I have been to a hotel were the room is set for your arrival with soothing music a dvd playing, airconditioning room temperature perfect and the curtains back to take in the view. The toiletries smell soooo good. Choose complimentary fresh fruit in you room by calling service. Breakfast is to die for, again greeted by name and taken to your table (staff remember you and direct to your preferred seating). Choose your fresh fruit juice any combination you like squeesed for you! Same with tea/coffee they will fetch you a fresh cup while you go to have your eggs cooked how you like them and ponder the smoked salmon cold serves, english or asian style buffet breakfast or healthy fruit and yoghurts, they even have a fresh honey hive dripping and make their own spreads. Once your full, head out to the pool to relax in your private pool anexxe with plush towels and cool fresh water. We got a great deal through Octopus travel accessed from Malaysian airlines hotel booking site $250 per night.Well worth splurging out -

Reviews.Title: “D Best...”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in different hotels around Asia however this hotel was really a class apart.Not only the rooms and its appealing amenties it was the service standard which showed its excellence.. Melt is the buffet restaurant where we had our lunch and we were amazed to see its array of food choices , garnished with fantastic service of the restaurant staff. The reception and concierge was extremely helpful and efficient.Thanks to all the team for making our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “good for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: roshy222
Reviews.Content: good business facilities provided for small meetings - don't know about large confrences. excellent as you would expect

Reviews.Title: “A Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in 3 months and I was genuinely looking forward to returning as I spend half my life in one of the Mandarins in HK and have a strong affinity to the brand. The instant I entered my room I was reminded however of average taste left in my mouth since my last visit: a TV remote control that barely fits in the hand featuring technology that had been superseded more than 20 years ago; an otherwise decent mattress on the bed that is ruined by a 10cm feather pillow top; ants crawling along the desk and a slippery bathroom floor. None of this would/should prevent people from staying here but is enough to make you wonder when the last refurbishment was and when the next is? Views from the Mandarin are spectacular with the development of the Marina Bay area. This, together with a fantastic pool are draw-cards for the property. If you can get a cheap rate then the Mandarin is a viable option.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: fcgsandoval
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for two nights from July 24 to 26, 2011. This was our second time to stay in this hotel and we just had to go back! From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out, our stay at Mandarin Oriental was excellent! We arrived at 9:00 a.m. on July 24 and despite the fact that check-in is usually at 2:00 p.m., the front desk graciously allowed us to check-in AND they even upgraded our room to boot! We were given a Premiere Harbor View Room and the room was simply spectacular! It was very spacious, had a king-sized bed (which I think was actually two double beds placed next to each other), and had an awesome view of the Singapore harbour from the wall-to-wall window! The bathroom was also very spacious with a bathtub as well as a separate shower cubicle. Both the room and the bathroom were well-equipped with the usual amenities you would expect from a five-star hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located right next to a very nice mall called Marina Square, which also links up to other malls and easy access to the MRT. The Esplanade, the Marina Bay Sands, the Merlion and even the Singapore Flyer are all quite close to the hotel and would just require a 10-15 minute leisurely walk. Buffet breakfast at the Melt Cafe was great as well! There was a good selection of food! When it was finally time for us to check-out after our second night, they allowed us to have a late check-out of 2:00 p.m. and since our flight back home was still late at night, they allowed us to leave our bags at the concierge for pick-up later in the day. Over and above the very well-appointed room, the great location and the good food, what makes this hotel stand out is the friendliness, efficiency and overall attitude of their staff. Throughout our stay here (both this time and October of last year), we were always greeted warmly by each and every staff member and our needs were attended to quickly and efficiently each and every time. Simply amazing. Mandarin Oriental will always be our hotel of choice in Singapore! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Buyer333
Reviews.Content: Service was superb! Hotel staff were all courteous and helpful. We were with a 2 handicapped people and the staff members at the door were more than happy to assist as we bring them in and out of the vehicles. A couple of times i jogged outside early morning and when i got back to the hotel, they offered cold towel and apple at the entrance... How sweet is that! Rooms were very clean. And i love the beds. Swimming pool on the 5th floor is a must try experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: thehoneymooner87
Reviews.Content: My fiance was lucky enough to be put up in Mandarin Oriental during a work conference in Singapore . The service was excellent from the very minute you stepped out of the taxi. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help. However, the highlight was without a doubt - the bedroom! It was absolutely gorgeous (probably one of the best rooms I have ever stayed in). The toilet was gigantic with both a bath and shower and the whole room was very modern. Deco was impeccable. The only negative comment is that although it is right next to Marina Square (a shopping centre), the rest of the shopping distract (Orchard Road) is about 10 minutes away which requires frequent taxi rides. Other than that, there is NO doubt that we will be back to Mandarin Oriental Singapore! FIRST CHOICE.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: pointyendpreferred
Reviews.Content: We are in-house at the moment and as a family have 4 rooms. The rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortably furnished as you would expect in a hotel of this standard. The breakfast buffet is one of the most impressive we have seen anywhere. I don't think I have seen a hotel buffet breakfast offer three different types of salmon before. There is a juice bar for freshly squeezed juices and a choice of Indian, Chinese, Japanese and Western foods. Espresso machine coffee is available on request at no extra charge, something that really annoys me in other hotels. It will be great when wifi is also included in the room price. What distinguishes a hotel is the service provided by the staff. The service here cannot be faulted, the staff training is outstanding. The staff have excellent product knowledge and if they don't know something they will say so but then go and find out the answer. No organization, be it a hotel, bank or airline, gets everything right all the time. However it is how the mistake or mis-step is handled that determines how the guest will feel. The Oriental staff more than compensated in this respect. We had ordered a couple of toasted sandwiches which took longer than expected. The waiter took it upon himself to bring us complimentary soups to cover the delay. The prawn soup I ate was really delicious! The Executive Chef Marco can be justifiably proud of his staff but this clearly comes from his lead and the lead of the other managers starting at the level of the hotel manager. Well done Mandarin Oriental! A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel ever I stayed”
Reviews.Author: leestan
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time to stay in MO Singapore. We cannot say anymore with their service. All the staff is friendly and helpful, they will try their best to solve your problem. Good Point: Great Service, Great Room. My room can see the Marian Bay and Golden Sands Hotel. Breakfast is the best I ever taste (Taste, Variety is great). Shopping is good, there are many shopping center around you. There are great outdoor food court stand opposite of MO. Bad Point: A bit faraway to MRT ( City Hall). This time I visited seems have a new MRT. Overall Experience is great and I recommend this hotel to all of you. MO will be my first choice when I come back to Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “It was good but NOT excellent”
Reviews.Author: TurtleFan4
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet was great spoiling of choices and quite tasty. I had a tough time with the room key. Stayed 1night on the 18th floor and I had to go down 4times to the lobby to de-code the room key. On the last time, ONLY the guy at the reception asked me if I placed the room key right next to my mobile phone. Apparently it was my phone that's the culprit. Should have notify us when we check-in, nohh?? I had a hard time opening the balcony's glass sliding door. In my opinion, it needs some WD40. We had a function at the ballroom and we experienced electricity disruption. Thank God 10minutes before the function starting time, we got the power back for the powerpoint, audio & both restrooms. So some guests experienced difficulty to use the ballroom's restrooms for at least 30minutes. My skin allergy was being attacked while I was in the ballroom. But while I was in the room, I felt alright. Checking-out took me about 20minutes and the swimming pool is quite small or should I say many people were in the pool ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: eight7eleven
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first leg of our honeymoon. We upgraded to the oriental club which was great, even just for having somewhere to sit and relax with a drink. All the staff were very courteous, and the food we had there was mostly of a very high standard. We particularly enjoyed the Italian restaurant by the pool. If we are ever in Singapore again, we will definitely stay at the MO.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better, relaxing pool area”
Reviews.Author: bi17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MO Singapore for a week in June. The rooms are nothing special, a bit dated and on the smaller side. The atmosphere is less elegant as it is in Kuala Lumpur , reception staff so-so. There is a newly refurbished pool area with cabanas and very attentive pool attendants, you can spend easily a whole day there and relax in the heart of the city with a fantastic view. Restaurants are pricey, but o.k. I have never seen such a brilliant housekeeping team (room is ready after breakfast!) Unfortunately, SPA was closed due renovations, but no notice before arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Simple.”
Reviews.Author: funkysmile
Reviews.Content: Not much to fault with this hotel. Service, breakfast, rooms, facilities are all excellent. The selection of restaurants isn't as good as the hotels around it (e.g. Pan Pacific) but that's not a huge negative since they are all within walking distance. The spa is pricey, but otherwise definitely recommend the MO.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service, older rooms”
Reviews.Author: Raidian
Reviews.Content: the service at all mandarin properties i've stayed at so far is superb, the rooms in the singapore location are a bit dated and could do with a refresh, if you are into modern style and a newly kitted out room, in this price range you can do better in singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SusanGrogan
Reviews.Content: We initially tried to book the Shangri La but it was fully booked so decided to try the Mandarin Oriental. We were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location, the room was large and well appointed and the service was excellent. We stayed on the Oriental Club floor. The breakfast was fantastic, as was the afternoon tea and snacks offered. In the evening the club lounge served canapes and cocktails including champagne. The staff really couldn't do enough to help make our stay pleasurable. The staff manage to remain attentive without being in your face. Would seriously recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service in everyway; no hestitation to return and will!”
Reviews.Author: sugarhorse
Reviews.Content: Cant fault this hotel and the service. All the staff are aware and antcipate everything, the rooms are spacious and well serviced and the food on offer is second to none. I cant fault this hotel. If anyone can point at one better in Singapore only too pleased to know!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: manish887
Reviews.Content: It is situated right in the middle of Singapore, has a great view from almost all rooms. In fact it is at walking distance from the famous Singapore Flyer. The room was good, the hotel itself was very luxurious. The hotel staff make sure you have a great time while you stay there, you enjoy it. The breakfast spread is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort was the order of the day”
Reviews.Author: ambikajain1
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for a week.We found the hotel to be comfortable.Being centrally located travel within the city became easy.The shooping mall just behind the hotel was a boon.This mall was also connected to the underground metro which procted us from the rain.Its strategic location and in house facilities made it a wonderful stay! We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious property + Great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: viren_phocus
Reviews.Content: Its one amazing property and right in the CBD district. I was here to attend the ITB, Asia event and had a great stay time. The client services team is very assistive and assited me quickly while our meeting room had some technical glitches. Regards, Viren

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel but not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms_Dewijakarta
Reviews.Content: We were staying on one of the top floors . I believe they called it the premier floors? the breakfast was good and the service was good. The hotel is old and quite pricey. Free internet on my floors. The hotel connects to a big shopping mall which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “A grand Singaporian Establishment”
Reviews.Author: AussieBD
Reviews.Content: This is our 22 visit to Singapore and each time we look for 'what's new'. We love staying at this hotel the staff and reception are wonderful.Our room overlooks the Marina and with the recent completion of the Marina Bay Hotel and Casino the sky presents an amazing visual picture of Singapore. From the graceful Supreme Court to the red roof of Raffles and through to the ultra modern three pronged hotel with a banana boat sitting on top on to the Singapore flyer. Wonderful! The hotel is marvelous excellent service and nothing is to much trouble Well done to MO. The biggest disappointment is that they don't offer free WIFI whereas other MO in the group do- time to look at this seriously MO Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “very tired”
Reviews.Author: Leucoxene
Reviews.Content: Staff, service and food were what should be expected at a Mandarin Hotel, but the rooms were terrible, to the point where both a bath robe and a bed sheet had holes worn in them and the towels looked threadbare. Room was also tired and in desperate need of a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nelsontraveller
Reviews.Content: We chose the Madarin for its rating on Service and location. On the plus side: Location and setting were great. Great pool and great harbour view from our room. On the minus side: There is something about the Service I cant quite put my finger on - seems to lack sincerity? Staff appeared to be helpful but it was apparent that if your request was not able to be fulfilled or it was out of the ordinary, instead of simply saying they cannot help they pretend to be helping hoping you will stop asking. For example my lunch order was incorrect and when I advised them it was wrong they went away and 10 min later came back with the same incorrect dish. There seemed to be a problem that rather than telling me they had run out of that menu item they simply brought something out that was close. I'd prefer an honest response straight out - but maybe this is some cultural issue I'm unfamiliar with.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Mkgustaf
Reviews.Content: The staff is really friendly and helpful and they have time for chats and remembers you if you stay for some time. The rooms are little larger than normal standard with a larger bathroom with both tub and shower. Note the bathrooms have a glasswall but there are drapes that one can close. Though would recommend only sharing with someone you know very well. There is some walking time to Clark Quay and Orchard Road but taxis are cheap and works great. From Longbar and Raffles one can basically walk inside the whole way as there is an underground link from Esplanade Metrostation to Marina Square shopping centre and then to the hotel. The walk is then in air conditioning for about 10 min between Raffles and the hotel. Next to the hotel is a big shopping centre Marian Square. And one can walk through the shopping centre to Suntec Singapore Convention Centre. The breakfast is great; Western as well as Asian food. Only down of the hotel is that on weekends the food run out and the staff don't have time to refill, but if one asks they are quickly refilling and bring the food you asked for to your table. Also ate at the Chinese restaurant Cherry Garden and at the Italian restaurant Dolce Vita as well as at the pool side and the staff is always friendly and the food is great. The pool area is great but on weekends it can be full. There are 5 cabanas but one need to be early to get those on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: tazzalou
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, it can't be faulted. The service and politeness of the staff is incredible. The hotel is walking distance to most of the attractions / shopping malls / restaurants etc. Even if you need to get a taxi they are very cheap and the taxi drivers clearly love their wonderful country telling you everywhere to go. We had a gorgeous room overlooking the Singapore wheel and the sights of the city, it was amazing at night. The room has tea / coffee facilities, safe, dressing gowns, slippers, toiletries etc everything you need and more for a very relaxing stay. It was our honeymoon so we also received a bottle of wine. Breakfast was one of the best I have ever seen there were so many stations preparing many different foods from all round the world we were spoilt for choice and breakfast kept us going all day. Staff were impeccable throughout and we definitely agree that this is Singapore’s number one rated hotel. We would love to go back there and wouldn't stay anywhere else now, Singapore is an amazing place, clean, crime free with wonderful people. TIPS 1.Go and se the water laser show at Sentosa it's fantastic and if you go to Sentosa after 7pm on the cable car it's really cheap and you get lots of extras (drinks, snacks) 2. Do the Singapore Eye the view is amazing just a short walk from the hotel 3. Definitely go for afternoon tea at Raffles all those cakes will have you putting on weight in that one afternoon! 4. Taxi's are really cheap to get about and if you tip the drivers just a couple of dollars they are so grateful and don't expect it!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Calm”
Reviews.Author: PanAm007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on my first trip to Singapore. The view - of the bay and the new Sands Casino/Hotel - was stunning, especially at night. The breakfast buffet at Melt would put Vegas to shame and everything was delicious... but the best area was their pool - it's surrounded by skyscrapers, but beautifully designed and very relaxing. we went every day - which we needed after such a long flight! the only negative experience was at the Morton's Steakhouse Bar - two drinks came to a whopping $70.00. I know Singapore is pricey but that was excessive and left a bad taste in my mouth. (No pun intended!) Their sushi restaurant was quite good, but again, very expensive. However, if you're on expense account then no worries!

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best in Singapore and One of the World's Best”
Reviews.Author: jinapsan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel and only extremely positive ones. The staff was truly superior. The Rooms were well equipped and comfortable. Views from the room of Singapore Harbour were breathtaking. The bed was ultra comfortable. The wifi was powerful even though not complementary. Price not so much higher than an average hotel in Singapore so of great value based on what you get for the price. I would love to come back to Singapore just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Made a business trip into a holiday”
Reviews.Author: whyaretherenoscreen
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most seamless stays I've had at a hotel. I arranged the airport transfer through the hotel, the driver must have called on the way, because as soon as I got there two of the hotel staff were waiting to meet me by name, going straight to the room we did check-in there which was great as it was quite late at night and missing the normal check-in queue was a blessing. The room was of a very high standard, and while not huge it didn't have you feeling cramped - the view was sensational. The staff were all very helpful from the business center to the concierge, very understated service but exactly what was needed. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, attentive staff, faultless”
Reviews.Author: Bs8kate
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is super...we arrived in the morning, well before check in and were assured they would find us a room within 2 hours so we could rest. In between time, we were offered a complimentary breakfast (huge choice) which was great and then spent the next hour chilling by the fabulous pool. The pool staff were great - attentive and laid your towels out for you and provided face towels to cool off and complimentary 'refreshers', such as sorbets. There are great day beds and we never struggled to find a sunbed...it was pleasant lying there with a cocktail in the early evening and enjoying the great views. The rooms are spacious and spotless, as were the well equipped bathrooms. Rooms were quiet - huge comfy bed - slept really well. The staff here are brilliant - nothing is too much trouble, everyone says hello. We didn't use any of the hotel bars or restaurants as we were out and about, but the poolside cocktails and breakfast we experienced were of a high standard. Hotel location is also brilliant...I have been to Singapore twice before but not stayed here before -if I return, I will stay here again. We had a letter from the hotel on our return saying that we had left an ipod charger behind and how could they help return it - really great service. Stay here if you go to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality accom”
Reviews.Author: StewWoodend
Reviews.Content: Quite acceptable for SDG300 per night but regardless glad I wasn't paying out of my own pocket. Great location and only 10 minutes from Raffles Place. Good views over the casino area. Dry try amenities given time constraints but you'd be mad to eat here over China town. Probably would not ping for this again if paying out of my pocket.

Reviews.Title: “The view of the harbour at night was amazing”
Reviews.Author: 1soupdragon
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of this hotel were very impressive, We arrived late evening after a delayed flight. We were shown to our room where they regestered us in comfort in the sitting room. The view from our window of the harbour was amazing. The staff were friendy and attentive with prompt room service. The only thing which spoilt our holiday was the noise from the refurbishment of the spa on the 5th floor. (We were on the 17th floor) The noise during the day meant that you could not enjoy relaxing in the room or around the pool. We had also planned to experience some of the treatments they had to offer. What upset us both was the fact that We received no prior notice of this work. I have to praise the staff who worked in the executive lounge as they made our stay enjoyable (especially Rudy) who worked very hard to ensure everyone was happy. Overall our stay was enjoyable and will probably return again. (but we will check with them first to confirm that no building work is being caried out)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: youngprofessionalUK
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days in this hotel during a business trip and utterly enjoye my stay. The service is impeccable, the rooms modern and clean, the location is convenient for Marina Bay Financial Centre and the city. Th hotel features a number of good restaurants and bars, a great swimming pool area and the best gym I have ever seen in any hotel (albeit still an hotel gym).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Oriental feel and will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: shadab31
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip planned for Singapore in June and wanted to book a hotel. I had initally planned to book the fullerton because i had heard its a wonderful hotel. I just got one day in Fullerton so i changed my booking to Mandarin Oriental. I am glad I did that because this is one of the best hotels I have stayed. They very sweetly upgraded my room which was now a harbour view one. The staff were very courteous and prompt and I was well taken care off. The best part was that it wasnt just duriing my stay, once i checked out i got a call from the General Manager about my stay. this was a real good gesture and i am glad that I stay there. Absolute value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Small details make this hotel Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bureau1103
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to again stay at this hotel early this month for more than a week. It is located beside the Marina Square Mall and across the Esplanade. It is not directly connected to the mall, but there is a flight of stairs that is just outside of the hotel lobby that directly brings you to the mall. The Marina Square Mall is well connected by the underground walk ways and it is possible to walk to Suntec and to as far as City Hall underground. It was not walking distance from where I work, but taxis were easy to get and cost under SGD10. Under SGD30 to the airport. The view from my room was the Singapore Flyer and the Marina Bay Sands Hotel The EXCELLENT room service made this hotel awesome. My used clothes were neatly folded everyday I came back from work. They provided an extra bath mat when they noticed I moved the one that was by the shower to the sink. They provided a small cloth where all my toiletries were neatly placed. And one that I've never seen before in any hotel I've been, they put my half opened snack in a big zip-lock kind of bag! The hotel had a well equipped gym manned by very helpful attendants. It would have been perfect if they had a squat rack. The swimming pool is nice and it was relaxing to just lay down and hangout on one of the lounge chairs. After reading the reviews, I probably expected too much from the Breakfast buffet. It was ok but nothing out of the ordinary. I've been to other hotel breakfast buffets with better spreads (Traders in KL, Westin in Seoul). There are a lot of restaurants and places to eat near the hotel. The Marina Square Mall and the Esplanade have lots of choices. There is also an open air hawker-like food area across the hotel by the Esplanade. The hotel had an excellent Laksa (it is of course pricey!) Overall, the hotel provided all my needs and more. The best hotel I've stayed in so far. Looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Conferences and Business”
Reviews.Author: LeesaSoulodre
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Mandarin Oriental for Business in January. I was upgraded on arrival and had floor to ceiling views of the Harbour. Conference facilities were excellent and the business lounge service was reasonable. I had excellent room service and the staff are very pleasant. I wanted to have my hair done for the conference the next day, and the hotel made an appointment for me at the local hair dresser - who was excellent. Great coffee! Incredible food - try the Salmon with the asparagus and the mango dressing. I had it 3 days in a row as I was working around the clock !!! I also had lunch in the local restaurant as part of the conference one night. Excellent cuisine from all over the world under one roof. Great service. The hotel bars are also very attentive when you are with clients. Very quiet, great ambience and you are able to hear each other speak. In fact, we needed to discuss confidential business matters and they organised a table very quiet and discrete. A private conference room was also offered - but they were all fully booked on inspection. You definitely need to book any conference facilities well in advance. A truly 5 star hotel. I will definitely be back! A place I would also bring my husband for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Calyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. After a long plane journey this was the perfect place to stay for our visit to Singapore. The rooms were spacious, and the buffet restaurant was absolutely amazing. Everything you could possibly think of was there! Breakfast was amazing as well. The only small point to improve on was getting a taxi. The doorman had to go out on the road and hail one! But otherwise this was a truly amazing hotel and I would stay here again. P.S. The pool was also really nice along with the pool bar!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: JollapParis
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights, and did enjoy an unsurpassed service level by all employees whom I interacted with: - at check-in, with a smile & attention to details that looks like being natural - with the concierge, who was of very good advice in suggesting a restaurant matching our criteria. I did enjoy a room-upgrade to Club level, and the amenities at these floors are superb. Would definitely recommend for any business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CAMDVM
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel with a fantastic pool area – Ask for a room with a view of the marina area, excellent view – Lovely Staff – Good Location – Not too sure about Morton's bar though, a bit gloomy and average food. Visit the zoo and night safari - both are excellent

Reviews.Title: “Stunning 5 stars+!”
Reviews.Author: TravelEd73
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel that manages the balance between quality rooms, service, food - views to die for - and a warm and friendly welcome. We arrived late at night and so when we opened the curtains the next morning we were gobsmacked at the stunning view below - of the harbour, city skyline and Merlion, etc. We have stayed in a wide range of hotels over the years for business and pleasure and this rates as one of the BEST! We will also be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service - The best ever - Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: lainey007
Reviews.Content: My Stay at the Mandarin Oriental was for 7 nights. I travel a lot and this hotel was by far the best service i have ever experienced. Everything was delivered with a smile. The room was roomy and clean, very comfortable. The Pool and Gym were great. I highly recommend this hotel for location, shopping or Business.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: PJW22
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and ranks in my opinion as one of the best Mandarins. The level of service is outstanding and I felt really well looked after from the doorman all the way through to laundry. The staff in the business centre could not have been more helpful. T he swimming pool is very large for the location. Restaurants are excellent and I particularly enjoyed the Chinese. The rooms have been refurbished and are well-equipped although they are somewhat smaller than nearby rivals.

Reviews.Title: “Unnecessarily let down”
Reviews.Author: VPV
Reviews.Content: We will usually choose to stay at MO for the amazing service that sets it apart but on this occasion found the service lacking compared to previous visits. At time of booking, my bf requested an upgrade, which we were told would be subject to availability. On the day of our stay, he rang to check and was told that all rooms at the higher grade were fully booked - however we then tried to book the room on the hotel website and found it was available. I have no problem being told we cannot be upgraded, but I don't appreciate being misled by the staff. We ended up having to speak to a hotel manager who did upgrade us for a small fee and who greeted us personally when we checked in which was very nice. Note that the hotel spa area is currently undergoing refurbishment on the 4th floor - they don't tell you this until you check in, but if you have enough floors between you then the noise shouldn't be an issue. Room - we had a harbour view room, and the view from here is spectacular. The room here is not as big or luxe as some other MOs e.g. Jakarta, but still very nice. Unfortunately the flush on our toilet did not work properly so we had to stand by to make sure that the water stopped flowing. Clearly this is an issue housekeeping should be aware of. Pool - one of the best in the city and very very relaxing, like being at a resort. The only other I have enjoyed as much in a city was Sukhothai in Bangkok. For a late lunch I ordered the lobster club sandwich. And was given the chicken club. No issue so I asked for it to be changed to my order. 5min later the waiter came back with the original chicken club with a couple of pieces of lobster tucked in. Not good. Even worse, as I was eating the sandwich I realised that the chef had put in 2 slices of cheese and left the wax paper separator between the slices, leaving me to pick it out of the sandwich and from between my teeth. Very very unimpressed considering the sandwich costs nearly $40. On the upside, as it was quiet, they granted us a late checkout of 3pm (usually 12pm). I love the MO, and am happy to pay the premium usually for the superior quality of its rooms, and its service. On this occasion I was let down.

Reviews.Title: “A truly 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: EJK80
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel located in a great spot in the centre of Singapore. The service is second to none and facilities are top notch. We were upgraded to a harbour view room and escorted by staff to be shown the room & point out some interesting places from the window. The pool must be tried - private cabanas with drinks service and a view over the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Friendly and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Excelevation
Reviews.Content: This is our family's favorite hotel in Singapore. We have been here three times for 'staycations' and we have enjoyed our stay each time. The staff is very friendly, the pool area is excellent and kid friendly. The morning buffet can get a little overwhelming with all the people during busy weekends but the food is very good and there are nice healthy selections for kids.. The hotel is in a great location since it's close to the Marina and the views are great at night. We recommend this hotel to all our visiting guests and for families.

Reviews.Title: “I am a fan - faultless again!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore about a dozen times since it opened and have always enjoyed it.When I stayed for two nights last week I was very impressed with how it continues to be improved and updated.This renewal process has seen the pool upgraded and MELT food area introduced since I last visited.Both are great additions.I paid extra for a Marina Bay Club room and it was worth every cent.The rooms have been also upgraded and the Club is one of the best around.Breakfast is sensational and the various benefits of the lounge are very useful.I have wondered in the past how the MO would cope with increased competition of which there is plenty.Well from my experience they are setting such a high standard the competition must try to aspire to it - good luck! I found the staff very good throughout the hotel and was amazed how often I was addressed by my surname correctly.With all the changes in Singapore this is still one of the best located hotels and is ten minutes walk from the Singapore Eye and Marina Bay Sands.You could spend a lot of time and money trying to do better than the Mandarin Oriental - I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome! Love it to bits :)”
Reviews.Author: ShilaShower
Reviews.Content: Here what I wrote on my blog (I copied pasted the same thing here ya) :) So here, comes next after my "Flying with Jetstar" entry is my personal review of Mandarin Oriental Singapore. By the way, there are a lot of photos ahead! So don't say that I didn't warn you in advance ya? :) Personally, from the friendly warm hotel staff to its impeccable service to well thought guest room, it is truly a pleasant and delightful stay in Mandarin Oriental Singapore. Everything was just amazing from the moment we stepped into the hotel till the last moment we waved goodbye to their staff and off to the airport. Knowing me who is very picky and particular on friendliness and service, this hotel has scored five stars on both fronts. ;) Their concierge, bell hops, front desk staff, house keeper and practically everyone working in the hotel is incredibly friendly and welcoming and willing to make our stay as the best one ever. Top notch service and I am very impressed by the entire team at this hotel. :) We always got someone to usher us to the room (so don't worry if you came back with handful of shopping bags) and upon arrival, luggages were brought promptly to the room too. Owh, in case you are taking public transportation, hotel concierge will arrange a cab for you at all time and will be very helpful to direct you the nearest MRT or bus station, so just let them know your needs. Great thing here as hotel is conveniently located very next to Marina Square and short walking distance to Esplanade Mall, Suntec City Mall, Singapore Flyer and Marina Bay Sands. Perfect location and ideally situated yo! Hotel lobby was not that big tho and a little bit of dated and dark too, but worry not, the guest room (Premier Harbour) was awesome! Extra bonus with spectacular view of Marina Bay area and Singapore's financial district. Nicely sized room (even after we rolled in the babycot) with small office area and well equipped with plasma TV (over 30 channels available), DVD player and internet connection. Other room facilities and amenities are excellent as expected. Basically, we got everything that we requested at no fuss and no charge :) You know what? They have most fluffy pillows and heavenly bed that I ever slept on. I feel like sleeping on clouds like that. Owh owh owh! How wish that I have all the money in the world so that I can buy that type of bed and pillows and linens that I bet must be sold at freaking hefty price tag. -___- Their large marbled bathroom was superb with separate tub and shower and have large sink vanity. With good quality and comfy towels and bath robe, this is what I discern between good and great hotels. Not to mention that you can get this sexy view straight out of the bathroom through its glass window. >:} Hehehehe. Of course there are blinds on the glass panel lah. :P Owh ya, love their lemon grass and ginger fragrant toiletries too, very spa-ly smell. Room was cleaned every day with new towels and other room amenities too. Breakfast spread is excellent but I have nothing much to comment as we didn't really eat everything there. But the Belgian waffle is seriously out of this world and fresh fruit juices are made right in front you (just name the type of fruits you want it to be because basically everything is there). And the best part of all, the one which won the most stars is the pool area. Absolutely fantastic with comfy pool cabanas, ample sun loungers and breath taking view over the city as well. Seriously to die for and I don't mind going back again just to spend a quiet peaceful time in pool cabana. Good books, Ice Vanilla Latte, glasses, iPad and cushioned private cabana, ahhhh, what a pure bliss! But of course someone has to look after the kids lah kan. Pools are spacious and sufficiently big to accommodate all the guests. Kids pool is great too with with multiple of jet water to keep my kids amused and truly enjoyed conquering the pool to themselves. Towels are provided and iced water is continually brought to us and surely a great service from pool staff. Room rates? It might be a tad pricey but reasonable enough by its international standards and basically, we got what we paid for lah :P Hehehe..All in all, we had an awesome stay and went back home with memories that worth a lifetime. More pictures at http://shilashower.blogspot.com/2011/06/mandarin-oriental-hotel-singapore.html

Reviews.Title: “good hotel , good location”
Reviews.Author: priya14
Reviews.Content: otel is really nice with excellent rooms and good staff . hotel is located in the shopping district . step out of the hotel and u r in main shopping area . bus is also easily accessible from outside the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Hotel but Not as we Expected for 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adelicious
Reviews.Content: We stay for 2days in Spore and 3days in KL. We decided to stay here coz the location is strategic at marina bay, the lobby stuff was so friendly and helpfull, we escorted to the room with other friendly staff who bring the luggages, the room (even not look fresh/like old building) was clean with balcony terrace, pool view and very tall building with other skycraper , and merlion statue on the left side. The restaurant was huge, delicious food, wine, cigar (smoke outside building/in the car). Just walk to the right side theres connecting way to shopping mall. Over all, the friendly services n location beat the unperfection of the room hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for business travel, not so good for a holiday”
Reviews.Author: PandCSki
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very efficient and clean. We stayed in a 'city suite' and found the layout to be very odd but it was good to have a separate living room to sit in while our son slept. Breakfast was great so much to chose from. Service however was very mechanical, although exactly what I would want if I was there for work. The food and coffee and cocktails at the pool restaurant were awful. The cocktails at the the other bars was great. Room service was fantastic Location was average, and it was very disappointing that you had to walk past the hotel rubbish bins and through a car park or up a flight of dodgy stairs to get to the mall behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Mandarin Oriental in 24 hours!”
Reviews.Author: noxioust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a short stopover on the way to Sydney for less than 24 hours and it was worth every cent! We arrived at the hotel after being driven in comfort from the airport by the hotel limousine at 8 am. We were greeted by lovely lady named Kat who informed us that our room would be ready in the next hour or so and were shown to Melt Cafe for a complimentary breakfast buffet. The breakfast spread is as good and varied as I can remember from 4 years ago. We filled our jet lag bodies with scrumptious fruit and breakfast delicacies from around the world. The check in essentially occurred at breakfast which was very civilised altogether! We were shown to our harbour view room by 10 am, freshened up and nicely tucked in by 11am in the extremely comfortable king size bed. The room was nothing short of perfection - spacious, impeccably clean, all the toiletries and amenities required. One could essentially just bring a change of clothes! After a short period of exploring after our nap, we enjoyed a specially prepared, gluten free, 5 course meal at Cherry Garden cantonese restaurant at the hotel. Being coeliac, my partner does not get to enjoy chinese food that often. Weeks before arrival, Rebecca at Cherry Garden, designed a menu which was not only catered to the asian palate, but also completely gluten free. After the fourth course, the chef appeared from the kitchen to ascertain our verdict - two thumbs up and two very satisfied jet lagged diners. 830pm - enough time for a quick tipple before our 7am flight. A glass of port in the Axis Bar with live jazz music paved the way for what was ahead in our lovely bedroom - the fluffy and comfy bed! 6 hours later, we were woken up by a pleasant wake up call from reception. We were served a shot of espresso and a glass freshly squeezed OJ during our 5 am check out at the front desk. The limousine then whisked us away from one of the greatest hotels I have ever stayed in to the footsteps of Terminal 3 at Changi in 20 minutes. I was asked when will I be returning - Hopefully very soon...

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dierregi
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this hotel and it was a most pleasant experience. Check-in was fast and very efficient. We got a room with view on the bay, which we loved. The room itself was very spacious, with a large bathroom. Water and a welcome tea are complementary. We also had breakfast in the hotel and enjoyed it a lot. The breakfast selection is huge, and the food is very fresh. Besides, it was the first time that a member of staff took us around the breakfast area and explained where to find what. It was a very professional touch and much appreciated. We also liked the pool on the fifth floor. It is an architectural little jewel. Besides, the hotel provides clients with a plastic bag to carry their belonging to the pool, which is very handy if you forgot your own. We had one dinner in the Japanese restaurant and found it also very pleasant. We had to check out quite early in the morning and before we left, we received a very large breakfast as room service, served on a table elegantly dressed with clean table cloth and napkins. I must praise again the courtesy and efficiency of the staff that made our stay truly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “OK because of the location”
Reviews.Author: princess_0986
Reviews.Content: very impress with the location, shopping areas are just by walking distance. other than that, very average. the service was slow, i think they put few trainee staffs as front liner - not a good idea. breakfast - average, i expect more from Mandarin. went to one of their restaurants and it's a bit overpriced. room a bit old and dark, i had nice pillow and bed - thank you. overall, my stay was ok. love the location so don't have to walk too far.

Reviews.Title: “this is by far the best hotel we have stayed at , and we travel extensively”
Reviews.Author: poshO1
Reviews.Content: the staff are really very well trained , they make one feel very special , always greet guests with their name . the rooms are well equipped , very comfortable bed and pillows . we also thought the bathroom very good . the standard of cleanliness excellent . we will not hesitate to come back to this hotel next time we visit singapore .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel but Club Lounge could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: Travelux7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for four nights. The hotel has many good points. The door staff are all super friendly and make you feel very welcome on arrival. We opted for a club floor room and were on the 19th floor. The harbour view was fantastic. The room itself was very small but very nicely furnished. Clean and modern. The bed was extremely comfortable. The club lounge had a good selection of snacks and for the evening offered champagne which was a nice bonus. However it was sometimes hard to find a staff member to sit you down or tend to a request. We had been going to the lounge for two days wearing open toe shoes and then turned away on our third day for wearing such shoes. It was quite embarassing for us and we felt this should have been pointed out on the first day. We found the lounge had quite a sombre atmosphere compared to lounges at other hotels and we opted to eat breakfast in the Melt resturant and preferred it. More choice of food and it was lovely to have a table outside and it felt more holiday like. I appreciate that lounges are aimed at business travellers but they can still have a a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The breakfast at Melt was great- excellent food and service. The waiter even knew my name which was a nice touch. The restuarants here are excellent. We ate at Cherry Garden which was fantastic food and service and also at Dolce Vita which was excellent. One of the best pastas I've ever had! The pool area is outstanding. Fantastic views and a really modern, funky set up. Big, comfy 'pod-like' day beds and also cushioned sun loungers. We sat and had lunch outside at Dolce Vita overlooking the pool area and had a fantastic meal. I'd highly recommend. The spa here was good- we had a couples massage. Not the best masage I've ever had but that might be down to personal taste. The facilities at the spa were very nice although I'd recommend booking in advance as we struggled to get in and they only had one time slot available over the four nights we stayed. The location is good- there was a mall next door and a five minute cab ride to Orchard Road. it was a great hotel and I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The model by which all hotels should be judged”
Reviews.Author: Mike_R17_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. Every single aspect of its operation and staff that we experienced was exactly what you would expect of a 5* hotel - yet with a genuiness and friendliness that isn't always included. We particularly liked the discretion and under-stated nature - despite the fact that the hotel is large and busy it provides a personal and individual service. Nothing is too much for the staff, who all take great pride in looking after their guests. The location is fantastic - overlooking Marina Bay - and getting a room overlooking the Bay is a must. Room facilities, bathrooms, etc, were all fantastic and it would be very possible to spend a week here without actually having to leave the hotel. The restaurants, bars and pool area were also wonderfully operated with excellent service and great facilities. Truly a sensational place to stay and could not be recommended more highly.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: ScarfBFC
Reviews.Content: It's all been said before. This is the best hotel I have stayed in for location, view, service, friendliness of staff - just everything. We stayed for four nights and our subsequent eight days in Bali were an anticlimax after the Mandarin. The views from our room over Marina Bay were breathtaking. I just wish I could afford to come back in Autumn for the Singapore Grand Prix; the hotel is in just the right place for it.

Reviews.Title: “7star plus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharerona
Reviews.Content: In my whole life I dont think I had ever experienced an outstanding level of service as in this hotel,the people,the facilities,the service and the product itself all takes you to another world ,our whole group were amazed; the genuine and one of a kind detailed service make you speechless and you just cant but to write about it and salute each and every employee there for an outstanding job they are doing.Mandarin Oriental ALL THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel but does not quite make the grade”
Reviews.Author: shaunbacher
Reviews.Content: i found that the hotel did not live up to the expectations i had of it. the Mandarin in Hk and Bangkok are far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service”
Reviews.Author: OnlyTheBest-Lux
Reviews.Content: It was our first time at a Mandarin Oriental. Having stayed at several five star hotels around the world, we were not overly impressed, when looking at the hotel from outside. The hotel is a bit old, but this is a really good place to stay. Location is great, service is fantastic. You really feel good staying here. Remember to take a high floor room with harbour view!

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant - could not recommend more highly”
Reviews.Author: WillB294265
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 5 nights in a club room. Had a week in Sydney in the middle and was greeted like a member of the family when I got back. Rooms are just stunning, everything you need technology wise, great lotions and beautifully presented. The club lounge simply rocks - the girls that run it are so kind, welcoming and friendly. The pool is also great with a great team looking after you. I don't think I have ever stayed in such a nice hotel before and I have stayed in many and paid far more for the privilege. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with awesome staff and swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: leonowen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my wife. From the moment we checked in we were nothing but completely satisfied with what the hotel had to offer. The location just beside marina square. The concierge service and receptionist was brilliant. The room was very clean an nice with modern designed. The swimming pool just renovated is excellent. You could see a awesome view from the swimming pool. What's a nice experience. The breakfast that included from my hotel voucher also great. There's a lot of choice and delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: mcavanaugh
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with superb service. The Consierge level was outstanding. Would not stay at any other hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSDUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a Club Room. Excellent service and and attention to detail. What a 5 star hotel should be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Miff
Reviews.Content: We came to MO Singapore from MO Jakarta and experienced the same excellent service particularly in the MO Club. Special thanks to Rudy, Leslie, Stella, Jaya and Shine Xie whose friendliness, attention and professionalism is of the highest order. The size and decor of the Harbour Rooms are not noteworthy but the view is wonderful. The pool and its staff are also excellent. This hotel is great value and a delightful place to stay. Only one warning- the coffee in the club lounge is weak, watery and has little flavour, stick to tea!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Wilk082
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were made to very feel welcome and even shown to our room. Such personal service from the doormen to pool staff. We had a double deluxe room which was beautiful with very comfortable bed (so comfortable I slept in and missed breakfast). 5 star through and through! The view of the harbour was great and you can easily walk to the new Marina sands hotel and shopping complex. Would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, convenient location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: hippodiver
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 (2 year old son) and stayed at this hotel for 7 nights while I was on a business trip. The below review is based primarily on how business and child-friendly the hotel was. CHECK-IN PROCESS: Very Good - We were able to check in early at our request. - Check-in process was relatively quick and completed inside the room. ROOM: Very Good - This is one of the rare hotels in Singapore where the room's temperature control actually worked! - Our room had a very nice view of the marina bay, MBS and Singapore Flyer. - Good TV/AV equipments with Bose speakers. The DVD player was a nice feature to keep our son entertained. (DVD's were available for loan from the business centre). - Internet was available as both wireless and normal. Internet was not complimentary but included in our room charges. - Nice room/bathroom layout and furniture. Be aware of the desk though. My son banged his head against the desk twice as the gap between the desk's corner and bed was quite small. We found out that the desk could actually be slided towards the window to provide more space. - Room was well equiped for business and the stationary (staplers, paperclips, highlighters, etc.) was a nice touch. - The cookies at turn-down time were very nice. POOL: Excellent - Best hotel pool for us in Singapore so far. My son loved the wading pool and my wife loved the family bean-shaped chair accommodating our family size easily and the cabana (hard to get one due to popularity though). - Drinking water and occasional refreshment given at pool side. - Changing rooms also available. SERVICE: Very Good - Another area that makes this hotel stands out from the other hotels. LOCATION: Very Good - Not directly on top of subway but a short walk through Marina Square/City Link. - Bus stops in front of hotel. - Complimentary shuttle bus to CBD OVERALL: Very Good - The hotel's decor and building probably not worth writing home about but the very nice pool, nice functional room and convenient location made it one of the best all-around hotel for us as a family with a kid.

Reviews.Title: “Staff maketh the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozziepore
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the MO Singapore. Hotels in Singapore are becoming more and more expensive, and this one is up there, but it was a splurge for us and we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a harbour view room which made all the difference. The view from the bedroom of the harbour and Sands hotel was stunning. I had heard that the pool was fabulous but at first was underwhelmed. However when you spend a few hours poolside you become enchanted. The in-pool beds are so luxurious when it’s hot, and the poolside cabanas (no extra charge) are the epitome of luxury and comfort when it’s drizzling but still very much warm enough to be pool-side. Of course, the view from the pool is also fabulous. The hotel is really rather low-key in comparison with some of Singapore’s other high end luxury hotels, however the art works throughout the building are classy and beautiful and the atrium – whilst very Marina-Bay 90’s – is airy and architecturally interesting. Of course, this is a Mandarin Oriental and the staff are faultless, constantly greeting you by name and anticipating your every desire. I don’t know how they knew my name in order to greet me at breakfast, when the large buffet breakfast room was full to capacity on a busy Saturday morning, but they did and it’s these little touches that make Mandarin Oriental’s service stand out from the crowd. My only gripe is that the cost of internet when you are paying these rates is insulting, I believe it should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient comfort style”
Reviews.Author: dublindu0
Reviews.Content: Very good at delivering what was promised - stylish, bright, cool, comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend to remember”
Reviews.Author: anna00747
Reviews.Content: At this incredible Hotel you will be in awe of the level of service as well as the luxurious amenities. There are so many things about this place that deserve superlatives. The pool area with its private cabanas, the little touches like refreshing drinks and watermelon whilst at the pool. The way the staff are so attentive and seem to guess your every need. They dont hover at all they just seem to materialize when you need them. Every time we left the room, even if it was for a very short time during the day, the room had been refreshed, towels changed, clothing folded by unseen staff. I would pay extra for the Club floors, it is not costly to do so and the benefits are tenfold, drinks and canapes in the evening, fabulous breakfast, free wifi. Singapore is worth the stopover just to stay here! Even if its not on your route, take a detour, this hotel is beyond amazing. I see why it is number one in Singapore on this site and I may not have bothered writing this review. I saw a recent member compared the rooms to a Holiday Inn which I felt was terribly unfair on this Hotel. The rooms are Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Hits and Misses”
Reviews.Author: gazzerukukuk
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 9:00am so I was very pleased that the hotel was able to get us a room straight away as we were both extremely tired from our 13 hour flight. However, when we were shown to our room, the hostess said 'this is one of our most beautiful rooms'. This was a blatant lie as it was just a standard harbour view room. It wasn't an upgrade, it wasn't a suite or a club or a grande so it certainly wasn't one of their most beautiful rooms! Whilst the room is very '1990 Holiday Inn' the view over the harbour is fantastic, I don't think I've stayed in a room with a better view. Room Service is excellent as is concierge and we got into the habit of ordering their club sandwiches which were excellent. One night we pushed the boat out and had dinner in their Chinese Restaurant, The Cherry Garden. Whilst the service was very personable, the food wasn't anything to write home about and to be honest, I've had a better meal from my chinese takeaway. Having said that, afternoon tea at the Axis was delicious. Concierge were faultless apart from the elderly gentlemen who was in charge of putting people into taxis. He twice put us in the wrong taxi! MO did try and charge us for breakfast when it was prepaid. I took this up with reception and she said she would go away and double check. She came back and told me that although my partners breakfast was included, mine wasn't. Now why would I pay for my partners breakfast and not mine!?! I knew only too well that I had prepaid for both breakfasts for the whole 3 days so I found it very frustrating when the reception had told me that they had double checked. I therefore told her to get the manager to call me, Within 5 minutes, the manager called me and told me it was their mistake. Problem solved - quite minor but very irritating and not something you should have to endure in a five star hotel. Also they charge for wifi which I think is a disgrace in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nukenriles
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,great location and best of all a superlative staff. I would especially like to commend the staff at Melt , they went out of there way to make my wife's Birthday an occasion to remember. If this can be done at a breakfast buffet you can only imagine what the rest of the property has to offer. I would recommend MO Singapore, it ticks all the right boxes in my book. The pool area was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation, relaxing, luxurious, and excellent buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Katetam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 days at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore over Easter Holidays. We stayed at the Pan Pacific across the street last year, decided to give MOSIN a try. Booked three rooms, requested non-smoking, adjacent, early check in, late check out, hotel car pick up at airport, ALL were perfectly organized by MOSIN without any problems. Our rooms had the most perfect harbourview, facing the Esplanade, Marina Sands Hotel, and beautiful harbourview. The view is at its most beautiful at night. The hotel is quiet, and connected to the Marina Square shopping center, very convenient to get to convenience stores, dining options, MRT...etc. The hotel's staff are all excellent, courteous, and polite. Concierge is brilliant. When we arrived, the reception brought us straight to our rooms for in room check in. With three kids, and a group of 9 people, that was welcomed. We loved the buffet breakfast at the MELT on 4th floor every morning. Food and variety is so good, it's worth waking up to every morning! Each time we ordered a maxi-cab, it was ready within 15 minutes. We went to Sentosa Island, that was fun and easy access from MOSIN, about 15 minutes car ride. Went to Singapore Zoo, Jurong Bird Park, each time we used the hotel car or maxi cab. Our flight was at 7pm, asked for late check out, and the hotel granted our request. That was really helpful with a baby and two kids around. So, that allowed my daughter and husband to go to "swim with dolphins" on the last day in the morning and still can come back to take a shower, and I can finish packing. Hotel car took us to the airport. All in all, MOSIN is a great hotel to stay in, will definitely consider to return next time we visit MOSIN.

Reviews.Title: “once again top-notch”
Reviews.Author: cmh1979
Reviews.Content: annual singapore traveller. once again stayed at the mandarin. for me still the 1st address in singapore - even after the marina bay sands openning. more "private" feeling, not to mention the mandarin typical 1st class service. pricy but compare to other mandarins still quite ok. although they should think about a refurbishment within the next years. (like the "asian flair" though) brand new pool area. very nice. can be busy on peak times...

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: dylizzy
