Reviews.Content: we arrived here at 8.30am in the morning after a 15hr flight, and were informed that our room would not be available before 11am. we asked if we could freshen up anywhere and were told in the toilets near the swimming pool. when we did get to the room it was fine but the delay getting there did not make me want to rush back.

Reviews.Title: “MO's fluctuating business model”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Moscow
Reviews.Content: The whole idea of MO is that they cut costs on luxury and invest in superb service. The paragon is MOHK, where these two sides are well balanced. What happened in MOSIN is that the services is still good but the accommodation is too underinvested. The rooms feel as if it's any 4* hotel anywhere around the world: absolutely bland and somewhat worn out which is unacceptable for a hotel of that level - I mean it. The only special thing about the rooms is the view - especially the Harbour view, absolutely post-card awesome. The cleanliness is also an obvious issue there (not so obvious for the management though). Rooms are cleaned well but not perfect, towels you get by the pool are stained (I ask to change and they brought me an even more stained one), and once I even got stained bedsheets in my room (though the management did their best to apologize). I mean, it feels strange when you can't trust a 5* hotel for clean bedsheets and have to check them before getting in bed. The pool is large enough though shallow; it has a perfect view. And well, the club lounge is good and the breakfast is second to none. This breakfast alone is worth waking up early. The service everywhere around the hotel is true Mandarin. All that put together turns out to be a not-so-obvious-choice considering the USD 500 price tag. I mean, the spaceship-like Marina Bay Sands is just across the bridge, and I don't think they have a problem with worn-out room decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience a lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gigi019
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the Hotel. We stayed on the Oriental Club Floor and can't speak highly enough of the staff in the Club Lounge. Each day greeted with a smile with nothing too much trouble. The attention to detail with the Hotel is very good even to the point of checking that we had our passports as we left to go home in the cab by the gentleman in the red coat at the front door. I also should mention that one of the staff at the Club lounge even assisted us in organising our wedding anniversary dinner - greatly appreciated as we both forgot about it until we got there! Thank you The swimming pool area is beautiful with a lovely pool - quite peaceful at the time we were there, very good service and nice cold ice water as you arrive with a cool face cloth - just what you need as you arrive after a long flight. Dining is very good although both the food and wine are expensive but worth a try particularly Cherry Garden. All in all - can't wait to return to the Mandarin Oriental - well located for all you need in Singapore. Thankyou to the staff and management for looking after us so well all the way from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable!”
Reviews.Author: MsTravelHag
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the MOSIN and we enjoyed every minute of our stay! Granted, the rooms need be updated, the TV, etc., but the views and the impeccable service more than made up for it! There are not enough positive words to describe how incredible the staff members are at this property! Kudos to the entire staff and a special thank you to the amazing staff @ Melt for the wonderful birthday surprises!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: unklez
Reviews.Content: Everything that needs to be said about this hotel has already been said! The hotel is located centrally, has excellent facilities, great food, very knowledgeable and caring staff.

Reviews.Title: “5* Classic Luxury with an Intuitive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: After a long time in transit (JFK-CDG-SIN), I was warmly welcomed into the country and pleasantly surprised many times over. I opted for the VIP airport transfer and my chauffeur, Mr. Zul, was right in front of me once I cleared customs with a sincere greeting. Beverages & cold towels with orchids were there for my comfort and an inquiry as to the type of music i prefer was made. During our drive, I was given a small tour along with detailed information. Upon hotel arrival, a number of staff members (bellhop, personal concierge, etc.) greeted me enthusiastically and respectfully by name. I was immediately ushered to my room, bypassing all lines, and checked-in in the comfort of my king club harbor view room on the 20th floor. All appropriate materials were given (map, etc.) and all questions at the time answered in detail. Once settled, I enjoyed complimentary cocktails in the Oriental Club Lounge on the 19th floor. Additionally, I was happy to see Eggs Benedict was offered as just 1 of many excellent complimentary breakfast options in the lounge. I found the hotel facilities, amenities & perks for those staying in club rooms to be at-and above-par (for a 5* hotel) at the MO, Singapore. Keen appreciation for tranquility clearly resonates throughout the property (the pool is wonderful at dawn and dusk & there is ample culinary mastery provided by the hotel's selection of noteworthy restaurants. ****What impressed me above all else, and on a consistent basis, was the ability of the staff to figure out/remember what I wanted out of this trip & what my individual needs were (all the way down to housekeeping and where I wanted things - and what I wanted). On a number of occasions, the staff went out of their way to ensure my contentment.**** Offering an undoubtedly memorable and enchanting experience in Singapore, the MO has earned its rank on TA as #1. The only bit of criticism I have is that the hotel has a book of the world's best hotels -- from 2008/09, which tires the establishment & its integrity as a leading 5* hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “Familiar Mandarin Oriental Style & Speedy Service With a Smile”
Reviews.Author: LuxeTravelerHK
Reviews.Content: While not as plush as signature properties such as the MO HK the Singapore MO is convenient, modern, has top class facilities and is very comfortable. The work desk and chair and set-up is comfortable, making it easy to work. Incredible views are one of the biggest assets of this property (note: request a MBS-facing room). The pool has recently been redesigned and refurbished and for a business traveller this unfortunately makes you envious of the people who have time to lounge/swim. (Good for them, though. For the leisure traveller, you are right to choose this property!) Morton's offers one of the best places in Singapore for post-work drinks and any of the other F&B establishments are perfect for business lunches and breakfasts. The rooms could instantly raise their user-friendliness by upgrading the remotes for the TVs (which are currently Soviet-era shoe boxes with less functionality than a shoe box!) and upgrading the telephones to a more MO-appropriate standard. A word of caution on room service: be sure to specify how you like your meat cooked (any meat).

Reviews.Title: “Met high expectation, fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: thungalore
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights with two young children(nearly 4 yrs old and 5 months old baby). Everything was, as expected, fantastic. Our flight into Singapore was early morning (arrived at 6am) and out was late night(8pm) and we wanted to use a room as soon as we got there(pretty normal if you travel with a baby). We had to pay for an extra night for an arrival date to guarantee a room (fair enough, no complaining, it was Friday and we arrived at the hotel at 8am!) but on our leaving day, they let us use our room until 2pm and kept our suitcases, when we came back from last minutes shopping to pick them up they allowed us to use a room for an hour to refresh without any extra charge. That made a HUGE difference to our travel back home, we could get change, re-pack last minutes shopping and feed hungry tired baby quietly. Staff were very friendly and efficient, always nice smile and very polite, even to our nearly 4 years old son. Oh and our room got upgraded which of course, scored high : ) It’s worth staying at Mandarin Oriental Singapore and we most definitely will be back there again.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal place for a stopover or business trip”
Reviews.Author: BigBill6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights en route to Oz. Covenient location, great service by very attentive but unobtrusive staff. We loved waking up to the bird song in the morning - bizarre but something reminiscent of home. English Premier League football is really popular out in Singapore and certainly in the Mandarin , seemed you could watch it 24/7 if you were so inclined. One word of warning though DON'T be tempted as I was to have a suit or two made to measure by the on site tailor, Maharajas. Delivered 'just in time' prior to our departure I discovered too late the poor quality of their workmanship which included - missing pocket, poor quality stitching, buttons so loose a modest tug had them fall free. I was well and truly done and my complaints on returning to the UK have gone unanswered. Management of the Mandarin take note and fellow travellers be warned !

Reviews.Title: “Fisher's Mackay Queensland "Fantastic"”
Reviews.Author: 13fish
Reviews.Content: Wow simply the best. We arrived at 6.30 in the morning to find we could check in to our room staight away, we payed the extra and enjoyed the club room this was just the best. From the time we cheched in to the time we left the staff where amazing they remembered every little thing from our names each time they greeted us to what drinks we liked to how we had our eggs for breakfast and nothing was ever a problem. I would recomment this hotel to anyone that want's to pampard. We will definitely be staying with the MO when next time we visit Singapore. 10 out of 10 to all the staff & Managment.

Reviews.Title: “excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittycat2011
Reviews.Content: - Lovely spacious rooms - Great view - Loved the bathrooms & partitions & amenities - Fab breakfast - Great service - Friendly for business groups - Room rates could be a little lower - All food places in Singapore close early & theres hardly any all night places open

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aus9
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental Singapore lives up to the famed reputation of the chain for service and quality of the hotel! Located in the Marina Bay area, rooms are large and have stunnig views of the bay and the Marina sands towers (which are about 20 mins walk). While the location is a little away from pretty much anything else, given the distances in Singapore, this is not of huge discomfort. Ideal for a business trip or if you prefer to be aways from crowds...

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and as a nice feel about it.”
Reviews.Author: TowerHouse
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is top class with out being too posh. Rooms lovely and nicely done out. Wish we had one of the front veiws, we were down the side but Singapore is spectacular lit up at night. Afternoon tea is a must, with miniture sandwiches, pies and cakes, do try it.Go to Raffles for Tiffin.Drinks are very pricey, limited ourselves to one or two cocktails each night.Restaurant first class. Singapore is the cleanest place we have ever been and so was the hotel.We also saw Ricky Hatton there.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely classy hotel in singapore with a lot of character”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyMumbai
Reviews.Content: the hotel mandarin oriental is a lovely hotel in Singapore, one of the nicest i've ever stayed in. The hotel is charmingly oriental with lots of character. It has a fantastic view across the singapore river. Excellent food as well as service.

Reviews.Title: “amazing amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: johnk348
Reviews.Content: living in asia, we are blessed w/ the opportunity to travel a lot. i don't get a chance to leave too many reviews, but i was just blown away by my experience at the sg mandarin oriental. to describe the service in a word: impeccable! we came to celebrate our daughter's first bday, and the staff was super accommodating at every turn. they gave us a free room service bday cake, and one staff member in particular (wendy), helped my wife to change my baby's diapers! on the down side, the hotel is getting a little bit old and probably needs updating soon (e.g., cracks in the marble in the shower that's been filled over by putty, and some of the decorative pillows are missing buttons, etc.), however, the service left us more than impressed. i would not hesitate to recommend the sg MO to fellow friends and travelers. p.s. the pool is awesome! p.p.s. on this trip, we also stayed at the shangri la rasa in sentosa. and the service there is terrible. i cannot count the number of times we heard the word no from the staff. for families that are considering traveling to sg, stay in the city and make sentosa a day trip. you will thank me for it!

Reviews.Title: “Baby Friendly”
Reviews.Author: rhp-travel
Reviews.Content: I want to share my experience staying in the hotel with 8 mo baby. When we reached the hotel, I reminded the front desk of the baby cot that i requested and they said it's being prepared so I went in to the room and wait. and when the baby cot arrived, i was surprised!! it was not the playpen box we used to have in the other hotels (well not that I mind that) but the real made -from-wood baby cot. and the bedding was really nice too, the matress is of the right firmness. PERFECT!!. they were also very nice to bring some baby toilletries to my room. My baby was treated as a real guest, that makes me very happy. Thank you Mandarin Oriental

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: kittyylk
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there with our 1-year old baby for her birthday trip. Great view from the room. Best location to all those new attractions in marina bay. All within walking distance. Fantastic pool- one of the very best we've been. Can't rave enough about the good service, even at the pool area--staff found you a nice cabana, laying towers for you. You'll feel totally pampered. Though it's a business hotel, it's also very kid friendly. I am particularly impressed that the front staff Wendy to give me tremendous help with the baby diaper changing. That is service! Overall staff is extremely helpful and friendly. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: fozzymitch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manadarin Oriental for the first 4 days of our honeymoon and couldn't have wished for a better strat to our holiday. The hotel is in a fabulous location with stunning views over the harbour and within easy reach of the river and china town. We stayed in a harbour view suite (strongly recommneded) which was beautiful. The hotel itself is both modern and luxurius with an excellent choice of restaurants. We had room service on our first night which was as good as any of the meals we had during our entire break. The staff at the hotel really do deserve a special mention, particularly Eugine (front desk) and Marcelle (Melt restaurant) who were both extremely friendly and helpfull. We would not hesitate in recommending this hotel. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast and super service”
Reviews.Author: taiwee
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was the best ever in the hotels that we stayed in Singapore. The spread was vast. The best part was that there is a lady that makes fresh juices on the spot. We had a great view from our hotel, looking at the singapore flyer. You can even go the business centre and pick up some dvd's for free when you want a movie night. The pool is great, very cosy and there are day beds all around it for one to lounge and read a book. The staff are all very professional. We are coming back for sure. The only fault I can say was that one night out of the 4 nights we stayed, there was a fire alarm which went off at 1am for 5 mins. We , like many of the guest waiting along the corridor of our floors to see if there was really a evacuation . It turn out to be a false alarm which no announcement made by the staff. We had to call the front desk to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kingbob
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. Now everyone has different tastes but this hotel was just my kind of place. Lovely sleek stylish design without being too Oligarchesque. Great professional and friendly service throughout. I booked a harbour club room and got a free upgrade to a suite (with a bathroom and separate cloakroom) and my 6pm check out was extended free of charge till 8pm. The club lounge was beautiful and the food fantastic. Nice pool and very relaxing spa.

Reviews.Title: “An "A" For Service, Pool, Food...But A "B" For Rooms, Common Areas, Location”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: In all fairness, the Mandarin Oriental is a fine hotel and does deserve its place among the world's better properties...but it is due some significant renovation to be at the highest level of world-class. I found service at most every turn to be both flexible and flawless, the food to be widely varied and well-prepared, and the updated pool area is both large and fantastically designed. My concern was that the room and bath were unimpressive, partly because of some slight but acceptable wear, but primarily because the space simply felt outdated and overdue to be totally reimagined, much like the recent pool transformation. Same could be said for the common areas, especially the hallways, which were just a bit dull. Location is very subjective, but having now been there, I prefer Orchard Road for expanded options and a much more lively scene. Views at the Mandarin can be excellent, but street life is dull and the nearby shopping and dining options inferior to Orchard Road. That said, a cab can whisk you most anywhere in minutes. I'd be happy to return to Singapore and happy to find myself at the Mandarin, but after a bit of scouting this trip, I'd most likely pop into the St. Regis next time.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: davepatu
Reviews.Content: We treated ourself with this holiday for our last night after traveling around Malaysian and Singapur. It was wonderful. The staff were so kind and helpful. After we checked in the man at the reception brought us up to our rooms and explain everything nicely to us. When you consider that we were backpackers. The service was just super. If you needed a taxi or wanted to walk to a place or wanted to know where the nearest MRT Station was, they helped you and showed you were to go. Our room was wonderful and the view we had to the bay was unbelievable. As we only stayed one night , we only had breakfast there. But the breakfast buffet was amazing, you can have everthing for breakfast. It was a great big international breakfast buffet. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: primada
Reviews.Content: I am shocked by the last review! We found the service to be faultless. The best we have ever experienced and we travel a lot and always stay in good hotels. Nothing was too much trouble. All the staff are attentive and gracious and totally welcoming. The rooms were very nice and well equipped. Good bathrooms. Comfy beds. The restaurants were superb and the food excellent. Location spot on too. The pool area is magnificent. Five floors up overlooking the city - it is amazing both day and night. I just loved it. By far the best pool area I have ever been to. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “cool and trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline_priester
Reviews.Content: during my asia trip with friends I stayed a few days in the mandarin oriental, which is the best hotel i have ever been. the staff is very friendly and helpful, even if you have problems with the air cond. the food corner is very big and has a lot of international food for everybody. The hotel is located in the city so it was very easy to travel around singapur und get to know the city better. i enjoyed my stay very much and I can recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure class - this hotel exudes quality”
Reviews.Author: London_UKWebbie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. From arrival to departure we could not have been treated better. The staff have unbelievable memories and always greeted us in a friendly and happy way. Their smiles and pleasantries created a wonderful atmosphere and made our stay very special. They even surprised us on our anniversary with a glass of champagne at breakfast and a photo signed by all the staff in the Melt restaurant. Special mention should be made to Marcel Li the restaurant manager and the lovely waiting staff including Innah the lady with the best smile in Singapore. The MO does not have the gimmicks of other hotels in Singapore (ships on top of the hotel!!!) but is still the premier hotel in the city. Highly recommended by the Webbs

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel with immpecable service”
Reviews.Author: Mags777
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel regularly for many years and it has consistently improved. Its really excellent service sets it apart from other city hotels. The new spa & pool deck with amazing views set it apart from other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Rajesh_in
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental has all it takes for a traveller. Good rooms, with bay view. Efficient service levels. Good conferencing and meeting facilities . Shopping is also near by. It also offers good choice for food and spa services.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy experience, wonderful hotel! Oriental Massage the best!”
Reviews.Author: astonmartin22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Feb 2011 as we were attending a wedding in Singapore and also enjoyed a short holiday as we had never been to Singapore before. The hotel was extremely original in its layout and decoration, its all a few years old but immaculate, and we could spot staff on several occassions walking around and making sure everything was presented perfectly. Architectuarly something out of the ordinary for sure. We had a room facing the city side but didn't really have too much of a view, but it was very big, clean with comfortable bed and atmosphere. Rooms with views are apparently smaller so its really a personal choice on what you book. The room was always cleaned twice a day with fresh fruit and water bottles, & importantly new towels etc. The staff really look after you here. The swimming pool / outdoor area is pure bliss in an otherwise bustling city and has full harbour/city views. You could happily spend hours a day here if you had the time to spare. Location wise could be better. It is fine if you are catching cabs everywhere, but there is only an older style shopping centre directly next door for daily shopping. Marina Bay sands & the Casino are less than 10 minutes walk though. If you want to shop at the bustling Orchard Road you will need a 10-15 minute cab ride. 20 minutes to the airport. We used the concierge a couple of times who helped us book everything we needed including Jumbo restaurant! The chilli crab was amazing. Finally we used the day spa on the last day and the oriental massage with hot stones was the greatest ever! quite expensive, but an hour or pure bliss. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Whytex
Reviews.Content: Picked up at the airport by hotel car, arrived at the foyer where we had to wait for staff to find us for in-room check in. It must be very difficult to manage meeting people when they are arriving in your own hotel limo.... Anyway they finally managed to locate us and walked us to the lift to complete all the normal check in procedures in the room. The lift doors opened to a wonderful sight of a completely out of this world drunk, half standing holding a glass of whatever - very uncomfortable ride to the fourth floor where our check in companion happily guided him out of the lift and onto to his next fuel top up at the bar. The hotel is old & tired looking probably 70's or 80's design - Not hard to imagine that with all the development going on around Singapore that they are going to be left behind. Good location. We stayed four nights enjoying the "club indulgence" package, the club is nice & big enough to accommodate a large number of guests - they have a furniture layout that places two tables next to each other near the windows. However, they seem to be very reluctant to seat different parties on either of the tables.......that is if there was one person sitting enjoying breakfast at the window they rejected our request to sit at the other free table and instead herded you off to a coffin type room with no windows and zero ambience. They also had two huge lounge set ups that would easily seat 4 to 6 but again if there was one happy camper sitting there already they appeared to accept he had the rightful claim to it all. This sitting regime only served in alienating many guest once they were walked past many empty tables/seats on their way to the coffin. We witness many other people struggling to understand and questioning this strange arrangement. Just a real dampener on what a club environment should be trying to provide guests. On more than one occasion they ran out of glasses & plates - I'm a patient person but after waiting a few minutes for a glass for your refreshing morning juice you don't expect to be handed a scotching hot glass straight out of the dishwasher. The whole club atmosphere and general feel was tortured and unpleasant, the staff seem to be very active playing their role in implementing policy that in our opinion is destroying the very reason guests want to go there. About 3 weeks prior to arriving we had the concierge book three restaurants for us - two were booked without fault with the third completely messed up and contrary to email confirmations that we received before arriving. We have stayed at MO's before & in particular Bangkok and can say with absolute certainty that the Bangkok outfit are brilliant and without peer in that city so I know what the brand can do. Overall our stay was disappointing and not up to high standards we have enjoyed elsewhere around the world. I would urge the managers of the "club" to undertake a review trip to other providers to see how it's done - the Four Seasons Hong Kong would be a great place to start. SIngapore was great.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrownjoeLondon_uk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental before and have never been let down. This hotel defines five star service. Staff are beyond helpful and professional, facilities are world class and the atmosphere in the hotel is both relaxed and refined. It's what all five star hotels should be.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: COMPITSEC
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a lot all over the world mostly on business. Staying at a Mandarin Oriental hotel is a pretty safe bet if you value good service and clean comfortable rooms. Mandarin Oriental in Kuala Lumpur is a step above the one in Singapore. Don't get me wrong the MO in Singapore is good but compared to other 5 star hotels its pretty bland ... there's no wow factor with this hotel BUT to me that's not important. I can't fault the service or the rooms and that's after all what really matters.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast, rooms...out fo this world!”
Reviews.Author: KarenBirminghamUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for the last part of our honeymoon, We stayed for 3 nights and loved the hotel. It has a michelin starred restaurant (which we didnt know until after we had eaten there) which was fantastic adn service was as you would expect. The room was huge, modern, clean....loved it! Had to say a special thanks to vasanth who works there-knew our names and greeted us everytime he saw us. I lost my driving license in a club out there and the staff were very willing to call the club the next morning to see if it had been found. Breakfast-out fo this world!!! Ypu have to go...it is truely magnificnet...you will not know what i mean until you actually go. Every single option you could ever imagine is available and you can get omletttes, pancakes, fresh fruit juice from whichever type of fruit all made right in front of you. The only slight negative was that given we were on honeymooon we did not get any type of recognition-which in all of our other 5* hotels we visited across the world, did! Good location too/ Overall, definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pure atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: OliviaBert
Reviews.Content: If you have a chance to visit this island nation, don't miss this one to stay in Mandarin Oriential Hotel. I and my husband spent a great holiday in this hotel last time. The most impressive view was the hospitality of staffs there. We stayed in a comfortable room equipped with modern equipment such as air conditioner,TV,etc. Every morning, i could enjoy the view of beach through the window, breathing the pure atmosphere. Especially, food and relaxing services were really great. We really highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic experience with fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: RichardFillingham
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental deserves all the praise in the world for the way we were treated by every member of staff - real class. We were celebrating our 21st wedding anniversary with a tour of London, Singapore, Bali, Perth, Melbourne, Sydney and Hong Kong and I emailed the hotel to inform them of our early arrival. When we arrived they surprised us with an upgraded, beautiful suite with hot tea, chocolates and a bottle of lovely red wine. The next day they placed flowers in our room. I cannot praise the hotel and staff enough for their kindness and professionalism. From the moment we arrived it was obvious to us that we had picked the perfect place to experience a fantastic city break. We would highly recommend this wonderful hotel and we also loved Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Met rather than exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: extra_leg_room
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this is a fantastic hotel, and we thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay here. Though given the high level of praise for the hotel on this site, it was fair to say that we went for our stay with exceptionally high expectations- some of which were met, some of which weren't. Ours was a tourist, rather than business trip, and for us the location was good. Great views over the Marina- close proximity to the Singapore flyer and Marina Bay Sands Resort (10 mins walk for each), and the CBD along the river could be reached in around a 20 minute (humid) walk. Cabs were about the only thing cheap in Singapore though, so we also took advantage of them. Great pool area, nice enough rooms, all be it nothing out of the ordinary, and special mention must go to the staff at Melt, who managed the daily breakfast with great professionalism, and I would say was the best feature of the hotel. We used the Spa and also dined at the outdoor Italian restaurant- both of which were nice enough, but the prices were about 20% higher than I had experienced in other comaprable hotels. Same goes for mini bar and room service- both very expensive I felt. Probably our only real gripe was the quality of information we got out of the Concierge desk on the times we used them. I'm afraid we didn't really find them up to the same level as the rest of the staff, which was a shame, but it didn't really detract from our stay too much. Overall, a very good hotel- just be prepared to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let down for a "luxury" hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonoglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Pros - great pool area - i had a great room with excellent harbour views - well located for transport and malls/alternative food options - some nice service touches to the room e.g. bookmark placed in book(but varied depending on who the house keeping staff was - see below) - access to club lounge was great - good quality champagne and booze on tap (nb-champage only in the evening I think) Cons - terrible lifts - something wrong with the computers causing lifts to stop at more floors than necessary. lots of extremely frustrated guests (and staff!) in the lifts. esp in the morning rush hour - standard rooms rather tiny and cramped for a luxury hotel - concierge service could not pick up a bottle of contact lense solution from the mall next door - inconsistent attention to detail that you'd expect from a "luxury" hotel e.g. bathrobes not changed even if placed in the bath (whereas towels which were hung up were changed) - check-out at the club floor took absolutely ages as they couldn't get the computers to work Overall, some effort has been made at refurbushing the hotel, but the whole inner space and structure is not personally to my taste as it feels very corporate and chain-like, with the exception of the excellent pool area. Would I stay here again? Prob not if I could get the corporate rate at the St Regis which has standard rooms which are 3 times bigger. The best thing: the club lounge with access to premium label booze. The worst thing: the awful lifts!

Reviews.Title: “The friendliness of the staff and level of service is quite outstanding”
Reviews.Author: artemis25 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 5 star hotel with great service and a wonderful swimming pool. Of course it is not cheap. It was very crowded over chinese new year but they handled it well.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: NYCBOS
Reviews.Content: The MO has it figured out. Too many attempts at being trendy end up producing cold, gimmicky and unwelcoming environs. The MO has designed rooms that are modern, yet elegant, comfortable and extremely practical. Moreover, the MO sets a standard in service by which I judge all other hotels. You almost don’t need to ask for help because the staff seems to anticipate your needs. The hotel has great views of Marina Bay. The pool is great for an early morning swim for the jetlagged westerner. The hotel has a selection of excellent restaurants. The breakfast buffet is one of the best around.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: imataitai
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and it is always our top choice in Singapore - and that is up against some other top hotels we've stayed in town including The Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Fairmont and the Grand Hyatt. The staff takes it up a notch over the others - the check-in is efficient, door staff helpful with getting around & greeters at the buffet Melt match the quality of the spread. One special touch - I accidentally left a white shirt in the closet on a prior trip. I notified them after & they said they would hold it for my next stay. One year later, on our next trip, I didn't mention the shirt again upon check-in.. but found it laying folded in a basket in my room. They also seem to remember repeat guests, upgrading me to a better room with a small living room & view over the harbor and swimming pool - which has also been upgraded from its older 80s look it used to have. The place is convenient - with a foot bridge to the new casino or a hallway down from a nearby mall. Its close to downtown and near enough to orchard by the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: milla84jakarta
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to go to Marina Bay and this hotel really suit it. I don't know what to say, the hotel was really great. Two thumbs up!!! Sure want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CJM275
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I spent 4 wonderful nights at the Mandarin Oriental in January as a stopover back to the UK from Australia. We had managed to get an excellent deal through flightcentre which happened to be offering 4 nights for the price of 3 inclusive of breakfast and a late check out on the last day. Service was faultless from the moment we arrived from the opening of the car doors to us not having to even touch our luggage and a smooth and pain free check-in. It was great. Then came our room and we had the so called "standard" room. It was really lovely. No view to speak of but then we hadn't paid a lot so didn't bother us. The beds were so comfortable, the tv was big with plenty of channels, the bathroom was luxurious with separate shower and a nice big bath tub. The toiletries offered were lovely and even the little things like the freebies in the bathroom were way better than average. I also am quite a light sleeper but I didn't hear a sound from any other room which is what you want from a luxury hotel. Then came the buffet breakfast. Absolutely outstanding. More choice than I have ever seen anywhere (with the exception of Las Vegas and that's saying something). At least 10 different stations offering every kind of breakfast choice imaginable. The swimming pool is something else. It is truly to die for. Huge, clean, luxurious, ample sunloungers and day bed cabanas for those that want to stay away from dangerous rays. And the pool staff lay out towels for you and come round with little icy treats of sorbet and iced water. Could not have been any better. We also had dinner in their Chinese restaurant Cherry Garden one evening which was excellent and we also had a drink at Morton's Bar and their other jazz bar. Expensive, but to be expected at a top notch hotel. If you spend the next night eating at China Town or Little India it all averages out! The concierges were also excellent and booked a trip to Universal Studios for us and helped us with directions and maps. Watch out for the occasional language barrier that could lead to a misunderstanding though.Our only regret was missing out on the dayspa which we left trying to book until it was too late. Instead we went to the dayspa at The Fullerton which was superb I have to say. They also have a state of the art fitness centre and free yoga on the pool terrace everyday. Sensational! We loved this hotel and I will never stay anywhere else in Singapore again!

Reviews.Title: “Just the best”
Reviews.Author: BJPDunfermline
Reviews.Content: What can I say that has not already been said, this hotel is brilliant, has everything you would expect in a five star hotel, well worth the money, breakfasts were devine, room was awsome, softest matress ever, staff very good and friendly, well equipt gym, pool was the best, great location for views over the marina... all in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff of Concierge”
Reviews.Author: jenyim188
Reviews.Content: Stay there for 3 nights & have to say this is an unforgettable experience due to the staff, Mr. S. Kesavan, of concierge. The enthusiasm & kindness offer is far beyond my expectation. He did make a difference. All in all, it's the staff who make Mandarin Oriental Singaore different from others 5 Stars Luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LynB1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on our way back to New Zealand for Christmas - it had been a busy year and decided to treat ourselves and I am so glad that we did! The service was great from the time we checked in until we checked out and our harbour view room was wonderful - would love to have been there on New Years Eve for the fireworks! We spent an afternoon by the pool, very well looked after by the attendants and had a great snack and drinks from the pool menu as well as the cold water which was provided as soon as we arrived - much appreciated. The buffet breakfast would have to be one of the best I have ever seen and certainly set us up well for the day. Unfortunately we didn't eat dinner in the hotel as we had made other plans but I would definitely do so next time we stay. We had to leave early on our last morning and ordered the continental breakfast from room service - absolutely brilliant! I only wish we had had more time to enjoy it and the view rather than having to rush to the airport. A great stay and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Singapore : Perfect for our family.”
Reviews.Author: ET59
Reviews.Content: The MO definitely lived up to its reputation. I am just back from 5 nights there with my wife and 6 yo and 3 yo ( I had read all the TA reviews from the last 12 mnths for the top 20 htels in SIN and you always wonder if some of them are fake and added to boost a hotel's rating : THE MO's Rating is CORRECT!) Now we were unusual in that most people who stay here are business people, older couples and honeymooners. We saw only a few families and not many young kids. Having said that the Staff were great with our 2 kids - from the little welcoming gift to always acknowledging them amongst all us adults - now thats courtesy. So why did we choose the MO? 1. service - its was excellent . Yes there were small issues which you can read about in some past reviews but I have a view about these things: " Small things often make a holiday but small things should never spoil your holiday" . eg. in The Melt at Breakfast the staff came up with a small child cushion like at the cinema for my 3yo to sit so she could enjoy brekkie better ; never seen that at any 5 star hotel weve been to ( without me asking either). 2. Location steps away from Marina sq , suntec, Flyer , Millenia walk, Gluttons Bay and Esplanade mall - if you stayed a year I bet you could not eat twice at all the food options there were; let alone the 2000+ shops open every night to 10pm. So we could have great hawker food , or the kids got Burger King when they needed it or you could try any number of upmarket restaurants. I think myrm said it best " You are spoilt for choice" 3. The pool : if you have kids 6yo and under its the best in singapore hands down. Read the research here on TA and you will find that there is a separate kids pool for this age group , its far enough away from the main pool that you will not be worried about noise that they create and you have your own cabana ( brand new renovation in April 2010) where you can lounge with the free ice water and look a a fabulous view of the bay. Also the pool has multiple jets of water to keep the kids amused for hours. They also have their own lifeguard and personal assistants who make up your cabana or deck chair and basically respond to your every need. Also because there are not many young families you have it all to yourself . Basically the MO was the foundation for a great holiday - will post a Trip report on the main board soon as I learnt so much from TA and am happy to share that experience .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible service”
Reviews.Author: anthonyuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore just before Christmas. We had booked an upgrade to the Club Level and I have to say it was worth every last penny. The staff in the Club were incredibly friendly and went out of their way to please. On my first morning at breakfast, they had realised that I was there celebrating my birthday and brought out a cake with candles, and everyone sang happy birthday! We were also picking up parents from the airport a day after we arrived. They had been stuck in the snow at Heathrow and were very tired. By that time of night, the Club Room and restaurants in the hotel would have been closed, but they kept the Club open especially for us, just so that we could eat together. As I say, utterly fantastic service above and beyond the call of duty. The rooms were very well appointed and the views on to the harbour were incredible - just what you would expect from the Mandarin Oriental. I would return on the basis of the service alone.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: jozobami
Reviews.Content: great service. great views if you go for top floors with bay/ city view. lovely breakfast. most amazing pool! great gym- modern and pretty big for a hotel/ well designed. beautiful atrium and hotel interior design! kind and prof staff, very polite, friendly, helpful. big and very comfy beds, pillows and comforter. ONLY minus was the entertaining system in the room- it was rather difficult to make it work with our i pods/ i phones AND i would love to see this hotel go more ECO friendly in ways of how the towels, linnen, etc are distributed and also LESS A/C. both gym and the MELT - THE WORLD CAFE (breakfast place) were COLD! which wasn't nice for me nor good for the environment. from the hotel you can go through 2-3 malls and reach the CITY HALL og ESPLENADE MRT, which is handy when it rains. We also stayed 2 nights at the Ritz Carlton, basically right next door, cause their room decor and bathrooms are to die for (ask for the NEW re-furnished rooms), but service, food, interior design in public areas, pool and atmosphere wise, Mandarin Oriental was much better. I would def go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: ParisCookie
Reviews.Content: My husband and i are great fans of the mandarin group and have been to quite a few of their hotels. The hotel is in a good location within walking distance of the new marina sands complex with excellent restaurants and good shopping. The room is quite nicely decorated, except forthe bathromm which is quite outdated. Service is very good generally except for the lounge which is extremely slow and also one day i asked for a specific cookie which had been in the free afternoon tea on the day before and the waitress told me that these were for Xmas only when this was obviously not true since the day before was not Xmas and there had been dozens of it in a box!! The lounge is very elegantly decorated and the food is of excellent quality. We wanted to book the bar for new years eve and the staff never got back to us despite our several calls and finally we had to go there at the last minute to ask about our reservation and it was already done but we had not been informed. Service at the bar was very good but the finger food were not very tasty. There was one concierge guy who was all talk and no real help and did not even bother to show us the places we wanted to go to on a map and we had to insist on that and whenever we wanted a reservation at a restaurant , he said "it's almost full" and did not bother to call until we insisted. In spite of these minor incidents, everything else was very smooth and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply magic from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: Hadkat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last night of our honeymoon here on our way back from New Zealand. From the moment we arrived we were both seriously impressed. Clearly we'd been 'tagged' as honeymooners as we were upgraded to an Ocean View Suite, the duty manager came up to our room congratulate us in person and every single member of staff who attended to our every whim knew not only our names but also that we were on honeymoon. A preferential rate couples massage package, complimentary champagne at breakfast and extra little touches and generosity along the way meant it will be remembered for ever more. The hotel is spotless, the service unobtrusive but efficient, the pool fantastic - and I wouldn't hesistate in reccomending a stopover or longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “a low-profile luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: cc1128
Reviews.Content: good location- within walking distance to the sands casino & near the MTR station generally good service- quick check-in/out process; staff are friendly; fast response to fix the tv in my room. great view- amazing harbour view at night from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: BellaCuore
Reviews.Content: I realized I never wrote a review for my stay in April. The hotel was excellent. I enjoyed my stay from the moment I got there. The room was extremely clean and the staff came in at least twice a day to freshen up. I slept great and enjoyed how quiet it was at night for sleeping. The hotel breakfast buffet was fantastic and since I was a solo traveler the staff checked on me every morning to see how my trip was going and offer suggestions of new things to do during the day. My only downside was the pool was not ready and at the time I stayed there was only one other pool choice. I have to say when I filled out the online survey right after my stay the front desk contacted right and assured me they would "make it right" the next time I returned. As a result I am coming back in the spring with family this time and we are looking forward to the stay. I would like to add is the spa was fantastic. I loved my hot stone massage and am looking forward to having another this spring.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: JaySha
Reviews.Content: IMHO, This is one of the greatest hotels in the world. This location carries the Mandarin Oriental reputation. Rooms are impeccable, staff is well trained - I really don't know how they manage to learn the names/faces of their guests - we were greeted several times throughout the hotel - totally unnecessary but pleasantly surprising. The food here is off the chain - the buffet was just...amazing! Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Five star. Especially loved the food”
Reviews.Author: chillwelldan
Reviews.Content: I was unlucky enough to be delayed in Singapore during the closure of Heathrow in December, but being put up in the Oriental was certainly no problem. It's a great hotel, good location, nice rooms. Service was impeccable, despite staff being very busy as hoardes arrived from airport. The food, even in the 'cheapest' buffet restaurant (which is by no means cheap) was gorgeous. I had probably one of the best curries i've ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, good location, but not your typical MO...”
Reviews.Author: GringoWim
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms here between Christmas and New Years for my wife and I and our two teenagers. At first glance, it looks a little like a Courtyard by Marriott, in that the hotel is kind of "round" with elevators in the middle and open hallways onto a huge open, 30 floor expanse. I have stayed in other MO's (Praque, for instance), and this one leaves you expecting a bit more. While the room was quite comfortable, and extremely clean, it is a tad on the small side. We did receive an upgrade to a harbor view room, which was nice in that the entire harbor was lit up for the holidays. As we were on the 18th floor, the view was quite spectacular to come home to after a long day out an about. In addition, there are several VERY good concierges, I am sorry I can't remember the name of the one who helped us plan our first few days, but he was extremely professional and knowledgeable. In addition, the breakfast buffet, included in the package we got, was quite extensive, with both extensive oriental and western options to chose from. One major drawback for me is that they charge for wi-fi. I can't understand why some hotels, when charging US$300+ per room per night, still have the gall to charge for what ought to be a free service. All in all, I would recommend this hotel as a decent place to stay in Singapore. Decidely not the best hotel in the MO stable, but a perfectly good hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Decor inside makes it look like a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: KitchieKai
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore and were NOT impressed. The guest room floor layout makes it look like a Holiday Inn. The rooms were unimpressive in their decor and amenities. This doesn't stand up to the other Mandarin Orientals in Hong Kong and Bangkok. The service is still good though. Stay at the Ritz Carlton or St. Regis for truly luxury hotel living in Singapore. Don't know how this one manages to compete.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Bunny1970
Reviews.Content: I recommend a harbour view room - we were lucky and were upgraded to a penthouse suite!! It was needless to say it was absolutely perfect. The pool area is also to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way”
Reviews.Author: Sweetcheeks800
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights over Christmas at this hotel, along with our teenage daughter. I honestly cannot praise both the hotel and staff highly enough. Upon arrival in the early hours of the morning, we were upgraded from a Mandarin Grand Room to a one bedroom suite - what an unexpected bonus! Our bags were brought promptly to our room and the staff couldnt do enough for us. This level of service was consistent throughout our stay, everywhere from the restaurants, doorman, pool staff and cleaners. We were literally treated like royalty for the entire duration of our stay, and have never experienced anything like it before. Breakfasts were an absolute feast, no matter what your taste in food there is something for everyone. I would suggest making sure that breakfast is included in your room rate/package, as it is well worth the 'extra' cost. Apart from breakfast, we only dined once at the hotel - as to be expected, it is very expensive to eat 'on site'. Taxis are cheap, and the drivers are an absolute wealth of knowledge on where to eat locally, the best seafood places etc etc, and they are very willing to provide lots of local advice on sightseeing, eating etc. We were unsure about tipping, but did in fact give a few extra dollars on every journey and this was greatly appreciated by them (the government has extremely tight controls and regulations on fares and we didnt want to offend by offering a tip if it wasnt the 'done thing'), however they were most appreciative. Our room was very spacious, big bathroom with an extra powder room which was brilliant for teenage daughter. Decor was tasteful and not overdone, and we had fresh flowers in our suite which was a lovely touch.The refurbished pool area is like a scene from a hollywood movie - lots of cushioned private 'cabanas' (think 'arabian nights') complete with their own sound systems. Towels are provided so no need to take your own or the ones from your room. Iced water is continually brought around to you, no need to even ask, and poolside snacks always available (at extra cost). Location of this hotel is great, very close to shopping centres, merlion park and the marina - well worth a visit at night. We were here for 6 nights and felt we hardly scratched the surface of things to see and do. Would recommend a visit to Raffles Hotel (drinks at the Long Bar), however if you want to have 'high tea' in the afternoon book at least a week or more ahead. We didnt realise how popular it would be, and missed out (on the to do list for next time!). A river cruise is also good to get a different perspective of the city. If you like seafood, a taxi ride to East Coast Seafood Centre is a must (about 15 or 20 mins away) for dinner. For perfume dont buy it anywhere except Mustafa in LIttle India - its about half the price of the big shopping centres elsewhere. If you want gold jewellery, Mustafa is also the place to go, it has the hugest range of jewellery in one place i have ever seen. If you are going to Chinatown, try the peking duck at Da Dong Restaurant in Smith street (go upstairs and the owner will look after you). I could go on and on about the Mandarin Oriental, but quite simply it is an awesome place to spend your time in Singapore. Great location and service outstanding. The only gripe i have is that the internet is quite expensive - $150 for 5 days access, which i thought was a bit steep. Would i stay here again? Absolutely, its amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: theGEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 7 night break and were not disappointed. Whilst we had booked a marina view room we took the offer on arrival of an upgrade to a larger city view room. Whilst the view is nothing special the size of the room was good and made for a comfortable stay. I did have a problem with the comfort of the bed at first but the front desk sorted this immediately with the provision of a thick mattress topper. Our room rate included breakfast and this was outstanding. The choice on offer and quality of the food was very very good and the serving staff and front of house were so welcoming. Due to the temperature we made use of the pool area to relax in the daytime and this was lovely, with again, great service from the staff, constantly providing water and occasionally frozen grapes. I can also recommend a pizza from the poolside restaurant. A few criticisms, T.V reception was not great and the bathroom finish could have been to a higher standard but it was clean and always tidied up with the turn down service. All in it has a quality feel to the hotel with a really friendly welcoming approach from all the staff, from reception to the ladies that clean the lifts. Whilst not having the wow factor of the MO Tokyo I would recommend it for a Singapore break.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel number 3 in Singapore?”
Reviews.Author: critic_Iz
Reviews.Content: Have always stayed at this hotel whilst stopping over in Singapore. It is near perfect in every way. i enjoy and look forward very much at staying at this hotel but unfortunately they were fully booked the night I wanted to stay as I wanted the one room for myself and my 2 sons (aged 7 and 13, in this situation only a Grand room with accomodate 3). I did not want to pay the price for two rooms therefore I had no choice but to book elsewhere at great disapointment. I chose the Pan Pacific which is right next door to the Mandarin, I know the area, shopping malls and is ideally situated, but what a come down after the Mandarin! So my question is.......why is the Pan Pacific the second rated hotel in Singapore and the Mandarin number 3? You can not compare the two hotels being the Mandarin is in a class of its own. The Mandarin is the best hotel in Singapore and the only hotel I will stay in whilst in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Close to being perfect, but not”
Reviews.Author: cendut
Reviews.Content: Compared to MO Jakarta, the MO pretender Puli Shanghai, Grand hyatt singapore, and Hilton Wangfujing (all has the same style of decor, identity and target market: the business travellers) this one is definitely the best. I think this is THE best business hotel I have ever stayed in, anywhere in the world. Most of the other hotels lack that special touch, the hospitality that doesn't seem like rehearsed, forced or artificial. The people at MO singapore really, really seem like they care about you, they look after you, and they will make it happen. Yes, they GET it. The location of this hotel, while for families may be a bit 'off', is perfect for me. I have stayed in orchard road for all the 50+ trips I made to singapore ever since 1987, and this is really a welcomed escape. I have never seen this side of singapore before and I love it. Close to the CBD and lots of modern, big buildings. Makes you feel like you're in Hong Kong. Being in Orchard makes you close to all you ever need, and close to most of the action, too. One thing I miss staying there is the grocery shop, not the watson but the kind where you can buy meat and chicken for your baby. I have been to marina square, shoppes at marina bay sands, but didn't find any. The concierge told me they have those at carrefour, but not conveniently of walking distance, especially since I have to get the meat everyday. That is of course a very small annoyance and I can just not feed my baby meat or chicken for a few days. Another small annoyance is we booked a connecting room, since my babysitter is travelling with me. Well they made sure we got it, which is good, but the connecting door is LOCKED upon arrival. The bell boy said the reception will get the keys for us, and the reception (after waiting for 10 minutes) said the bellboy will open it. After a while I phoned house keeping and 35 minutes after entering the room, the connecting door is finally opened. For a while all of us and luggage are stuck in one small room. Minor annoyance. The room, as with most rooms in singapore and hong kong, is small. The view (harbour) really, really helps. It was AMAZING. The view of pudong and Hong Kong island is of course better, but this is the best view in singapore. The food is terrific. I thought the food at straits kitchen/grand hyatt room service is good, but this is definitely better. All I ordered (asian section) have been delicious after delicious food, although once I tried the italian, it was so-so. The portion is HUGE so you might want to share it, or waste it. The breakfast buffet was nice, pretty big for singapore I guess but small compared to Jakarta 5 stars like the mulia, and the shangri la. But the quality of the food is very good. Service, as I mentioned was of the highest standard. These filipino staff are really experts! They sure know what they're doing. I have another small annoyance, probably for most of you it doesn't matter but this is the first one for me. When I ordered tikka masala on my last night, the Indian waiter that brought it up to my room had body odor. First time for me. All the other staff in all the hotels in my life never had those. Just a small annoyance. One thing that made this hotel flawed is the beds. The beds are nowhere near 'sleeping on clouds' or 'heavenly'. NO WAY. Westin palace madrid's heavenly bed IS heavenly. Mulia hotel jakarta has fluffly, heavenly beds. These beds are hard and annoying. The pillows are too soft, and the king bed is actually two beds joined together so you can feel 'something' in the middle. It felt like a long, hard, very thin 'pipe' that run across from the head to the foot of the mattress. And my baby is sleeping in the middle, which means he is sleeping on top of this annoying, hard object. Thank God he doesn't mind, but the beds are just plain horrible. I am aware that you can ask for pillows that suit your preference, but it all of the other hotels, I have never need to ask. Shame because beds are the most important thing in a hotel room. I still give this a 4 out of 5 though.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't measure up to the Mandarin Oriental name”
Reviews.Author: skanklor1
Reviews.Content: Dear Jim, An open letter to the Singapore MO: I appreciate your explanation after my complaint to you during my stay. Just wanted to let you know that my stay was comfortable, but it really wasn’t anything special. I am the first to admit that I am spoiled when I stay at the MO in other cities. All my special memories have been at the MO in NY, MO in Las Vegas (when they first opened last year) and the MO and Landmark MO in Hong Kong. I guess in the instant case, there was stuff that just doesn’t happen to me when I stay at the MO. We already spoke about my unfortunate check in incident – which I would not be surprised if I were staying at a Holiday Inn or Motel 6. But stuff like: -when I checked out, local calls were charged to my room, which isn’t a big deal, but when I called and asked when I first checked in, I was told this was included – obviously the person that I spoke to when I checked in was wrong -I also requested someone call me to see if I could get a room with one King bed, no one called ever (even once) to follow up (and this was the minute I checked in) -I never received any newpapers- which I assume would be included. All of this stuff is not a big deal, but I don’t really expect these mistakes at a chain like the MO.

Reviews.Title: “The best service I have experienced in years”
Reviews.Author: gibeon
Reviews.Content: A fine hotel with exceptional staff. You are going to need a large appetite if you are going to do justice to the breakfast buffet. Well worth the money and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with Trip Advisor Rating”
Reviews.Author: dave_jacqueline
Reviews.Content: The aspects which particularly impressed us were the service and attention to detail - a very large hotel but the staff were universally friendly (in a genuine way) and professional. Any matter I raised in a three day stay was dealt with efficiently. I have stayed at a few hotels in Singapore all have been good but this is the best. Fantastic views from room, superb breakfasts and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Eptiome of Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Eugenejacob
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best hotel I have ever stayed in the World ! The class of service has surpassed any other chain I have ever entered. Worth staying in a lifetime. The staff is impeccable. Location is also comfortable via all modes of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Landscaped pool”
Reviews.Author: kevink02
Reviews.Content: I booked for two nights at the Oriental. Usually I am not big on coming to Singapore but I had to be there to attend some meeting. So the locationin walking distance tothe waterfrontwas favorable. The hotel itself might still need some work even though I understand it has been redone a while ago. Overall it is a good place to stay and I highly appreciated the landscaped pool with harbor view.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Goldenboy75
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, our stay was impeccable. The staff was friendly and competent. The buffet breakfast was wonderful. Rooms were nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. The hotel itself is immaculate and interesting in terms of design. The location is close to major shopping and attractions. We would return here again

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: cj1GoldCoastQLD
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to the Mandarin Oriental, what an awesome Hotel this is, the staff are so polite and helpful.We wouldnt stay anywhere else in Singapore, the food and restaurants are first class, the rooms are to awesome and the comfy beds are like sleeping on a cloud!!! Well done to all the staff once again for an awesome stay for ten days and for making us feel so welcome once again.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service in the world.”
Reviews.Author: TH07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights in November. After a room mix up on check in our stay could not have been better. Our room had the most amazing view over the bay. The room itself was clean and modern with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was spectacular with lovely toiletries and lots of clean, fluffy towels. We ate breakfast and one evening buffet meal in the hotel - the choice and quality of the food was exceptional, the best of any hotel I have stayed in. I used the gym facilites every morning and was impressed with the choice of equipment. The best thing about this hotel is its staff. Every single member of staff greeted you warmly and were pleased to see you. The restaurant staff couldn't help enough. The gym staff were knowledgeable about the equipment and interested in what you were doing. To be thanked by the door man for staying at their hotel on our departure really was not necessary - it was thanks to them we had a fabulous stay!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: TLA80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a business trip as the usual hotel was not available. I loved this place. the views across the marina were fantastic, the breakfast was amazing (in room dining) and the rooms so clean. I would definitley stay here again. Slightly out of the CBD (for walking to work) but taxi's are easy to come by in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Halimbalo
Reviews.Content: Stood there for one night 26th-27th nov at a room 2004 with habour view and oriental club accsess and it was just wonderfull! The room at the 20th floor was well equiped and had a spectacular view. They are really taking care of you and the club louge provides you with all you need during (e.g. free internet use, nice breakfirst, cocktails for free and a very practical late check-out by 06. p.m.) The pool has recently been renovated and is a dream with again a perfect service. We stood as well at the Marina Bay Sands and the Naumi but at the end I would go again for the Mandarin Oriental. In this case older is the better. Tip for the management to even improve their services: If you anyway fill out the registration form why not double-checking if the person has birthday during the stay. Recognizing this could really make another difference. Anyhow: it was a fantastic experiance and I would always go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the Mandarin Oriental Standard”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental singapore is well located beside the Marina Square shopping mall. It also easily accessible by public transportation (MRT and taxi). Orchard road is a mere 20mins taxi ride away (provided you don't get caught up in the heavy traffic). Check in was a breeze. The lady at the reception even escorted us to our rooms...something which I certainly never experienced before. The beds were comfy and we got a room with the view of the newly renovated pool and Singapore Eye. The buffet breakfast wasn't really up to my expectations cause I have had better ones in other 5 star hotels. The buffet spread certainly needs improvement. Also, wifi in the room was chargeable!

Reviews.Title: “Inspired selection”
Reviews.Author: terwencus
Reviews.Content: On a stopover to Europe in Singapore, the Mandarin Oriental proved an inspired selection. This is not a new hotel but has been refurbished and provides an array of facilities including five restaurants, several bars, landscaped pool with spectacular harbour views and a high standard of comfort and service. The room was spacious, featured a large well-appointed bathroom, high quality linen and a panorama of the city and Sentosa Island. The Mandarin is close to parks and shopping and within comfortable walking distance of the downtown shopping precinct, the old town along the riverfront, Raffles and the civic centre. Access to Orchard Road, however, requires a taxi. Originally booked in for two nights which included a midnight checkout, we were offered the alternative of a Club Lounge membership which included breakfast, day-long snacks and drinks and an 8pm late checkout at half the cost of the second night's tariff. This was a most attractive option and enabled us to enjoy a full day in the city, take a shower, eat at the excellent poolside restaurant and leave for the airport with ample time to check in for our flight to Europe. Staff in the Club Lounge, Reception and restaurants (especially Rhea - Italian Restaurant) were unfailingly cheerful, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “There are many more hotels available of a 5* standard than this.”
Reviews.Author: cthecliffs
Reviews.Content: Inclusive night following the Eastern & Oriental train journey to SIngapore was followed by 3 additional nights paid for ourselves. Don't know where your reviewers have stayed previously but this is not a 5* hotel. Room upgraded to a shabby suite because they hadn't any harbour views available. Told us breakfast included in the upgrade then asked for $105. for the 2nd days breakfast - they did agree to waive this later. Furniture was old and tired, carpets were stained, curtains were dirty and bathroom marble tile grout falling out. The breakfast choices were the best part of the stay, and all staff very polite. In this day and age of high speed IT access why does this hotel still charge for access.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic... could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: GlobalNomad62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MO for a getaway weekend, got a club floor room and enjoyed the fantastic service. This hotel is truly a standout, the room was great with a fantastic harbor view. The Club Lounge was great, the staff immediately made us feel incredibly welcome. The lounge breakfast was fantastic, afternoon tea and pre dinner champagne were all equally good. It really is the quality of the staff that makes this hotel such a true standout in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: sekiR
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful stay in this hotel! We were upgraded to a room facing the marina bay, we were shocked by the nice view from the room! The swimming pool was nicely set with views of the bay, marina bay sands and the Singapore flyer. The service was to the top notch, especially impressed at the breakfast buffet. The wide range of food served in the breakfast was really outstanding. The only drawback was the walking distance from the station. But this is not a problem if you don't mind taking taxi everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, comfort, relaxation”
Reviews.Author: visitor_to_scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed firstly for three night and thenfor fournights at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore and cannot recommend it highly enough. Gorgeous rooms, great turndown service, fantastic breakfast (the serving staff know your name via their earpieces in the breakfast area), brilliant location close to the Marina Sands complex, fantastic view from our (upgraded) room on the 17th floor. Thanks to all the staff who made our stay so utterly relaxing. Sets a new standard.

Reviews.Title: “Big liar and no response so far. Avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: Kittayos
Reviews.Content: I booked a package "Business Plus" and Internet access is inclueded by the time I booked. Sadly when I arrived on June 1st 2010, internet connection is charged at extra cost. My question is why the heck Oriental Hotel staff put this on its website? Very unprofessionally handled. On top of that, I reported this and claimed what went wrong via email and so far there's no response at all. I'd rather spend 450 USD on else where. The service isn't as great as expected either.

Reviews.Title: “great service & amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 808surf
Reviews.Content: beds are a bit hard. but the service is great and the breakfast is amazing! walk outside to major shopping malls and convention centre. about USD$25 in a cab from airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “tired, soulless and massively overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: luckyfishsoup
Reviews.Content: a birthday weekend away. am a regular singapore traveller (3-5 times per year for 20 years) but had never stayed at MO (not to be confused with Marina Mandarin) or in this part of town before...(usually grand hyatt or a new flashy boutique if i'm flush, furama city centre if not, and one of the many other mid-priced places in a good location) thought it would be a nice change. At $380++ for a sea-view room and a glowing "#1 hotel in Singapore" it should be the spot for a perfect romantic pamperous weekend. Just felt ripped off the whole time. Friendly service on arrival and throughout the stay, but nothing out of the ordinary for a good hotel. Strange 70's style cavernous hanging garden interior (without the garden) that's been revamped at some point - going for moody and imposing but only just managing gloomy and haphazard - no "aahh" moment when you walk in. Odd pagoda-style bar plumped in the middle of the atrium like some throwback 60's oriental spaceship. rooms sizeable with good view and big bed but furniture and fittings scuffed and careworn: very 2.5 star. someone bought into a white elephant with a huge, complicated and barely functional tv remote. badly designed bar fridge cupboard door hazardous to knuckles. black scum in the bath peppered the bubbles on first fill. no special little treats or wonderful surprises - hotels of this reputation and price need to do more than just slippers and a couple of floury apples. spa a huge disappointment: the steam room is $20 and you have to book. There is no sauna or plunge pool. It all seems dingy, stale and "cigar-bar", un-tropical and not at all built for langorous lounging. the "massive-bill-at-the-end" treatments leave you feeling more stressed than when you walked in. Pool looks re-freshed and we liked the curtained cabanas. food so-so. room service caesar salad could have been crisper and lobster rolls were mushy. We opted not to go back on day 2 for the $50++ per person buffet breakfast in very pedestrian surrounds. Instead treated ourselves to Straits Kitchen buffet at Hyatt instead and for $40++ per person: presentation alone is worth it. I try not to be a snob - i often stay in budget rooms ($15 -$70 per night depending on the town), orange-carpet motels and love to camp in a tent. have been known to sleep in the car on road trips. but it's all about managing expectations. There are fresher, better places to stay in Singapore, and better value. The city-state itself should probably take a good hard look at itself - i was shocked at how expensive it was since the last time i was there (about 4 months ago). with the US dollar relatively low and sing$ inflated you'll get stellar bang for your buck on a long weekend in bali, bangkok, kl and even HK.

Reviews.Title: “Very good 5 star, but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights whilst visiting for a friend's wedding (which was also held in the MO). We had a very pleasant stay, but it's not a "wow" hotel for me, hence only 4 out of 5 stars. Nothing particularly about it stands out (except for the pool), but there is nothing wrong with it at all either - very solid 5 star hotel. Pros - Newly refurbished pool area with cabanas is absolutely fantastic...great views over the city as well - Service was impeccable throughout our stay - Lobby is intimate but impressive - Decor is chic, but not too opulent or intimating or "stuffy", which can be the case with some MOs....it is a more casual / relaxed feel here. - Location is quite convenient, close to shops and the casino (if you are that way inclined) Cons - Location is not very good for catching public transport. So you have to be reliant on taxis, and sometimes the queue is very long. - Generally starting to feel a little old, especially in the rooms. I think it is about 5 years away from the need for a major refurb. - Some of the rooms have very ordinary views....and require a super long trek from the elevator to get to (obviously mine was one of those!)...and some rooms are actually quite small Compared to the very funky and chic Landmark MO in HK, this is 2nd class. And it doesn't have the opulence and history of the Bangkok MO or the HK Original MO. I think it needs a full renovation within the next 5 years to still be world class. But Singapore is somewhat lacking in some new chic and stylish hotels generally (maybe the Sands? but haven't been there yet). Would I recommend it? Yes, especially if you have corporate rates for around US$200. But I think the Ritz is still the benchmark in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: GMTLP
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the weekend in Singapore and stayed at Mandarin Oriental. Whilst it was a quick trip we wanted to be pampered, relax and enjoy a rare kids free weekend! We booked a Club Floor room and enjoyed visiting the lounge. The service was impeccable, friendly and personal through out the hotel especially in the lounge. The special touches in the lounge were very nice, the food was very good and the flow of french bubbly was the perfect pre dinner drink! The only negative was the event held at the harbour, blarred out music way too early for a Sunday morning. Otherwise, great location, fabulous product and look forward to retruning!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: greenjob_10
