Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 5 nights over the period of the Singapore Grand Prix. Without doubt this is the best hotel stay we have stayed in Singapore. The attention to every detail by the Hotel staff was outstanding. The breakfast was first class and plentiful and what was particularly nice on our first morning was being shown where everything was in the breakfast room rather than being just left to find it for ourselves. A little point I know, but this is the attention to detail mentioned earlier. We will be returning to Singapore in the future on our way to Australia and this is definitely where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: sidcampbell
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental has style and luxury. The facilities and the service are really state of the art. There is an excellent pool area, with best service we've had for a long time. Excellent restaurant outlets, spacious and well appointed Gym. Even at busy times we never had to wait for a taxi. This is an amazing Hotel, Great Room, Fab Bathroom, wonderfull Breakfast in Melt and at this point would like to mention the assistant manager Azinah Miswan who was the most pleasant, knowlegable and helpfull member of staff with always a smile and a good morning personal greeting using your name. This is a brillant hotel would go back tomorrow a true 5 Star Hotel with a lovely spar ,cocktail lounge, top terrace, pool and fantastic staff. Singapore has so many things to see that we ran out of days and energy but had a fantastic time doing so. Now the negatives but not about the hotel. We found eating out or buying a drink expensive. For example a steak can cost between 60 and 120 dollars plus service charge at 10% and 7% Tax, a beer is approximately 10 to 16 dollars. spirits is also expensive Vodka 70 dollars and Jack Daniels 90 dollars. You can however if you look about get outside eating places, one is just accross the road from the Mandarin and they are really good value at between 30 and 40 dollars including two beer. We will certainly go back to Singapore and will be back at the Mandarin

Reviews.Title: “Top Service and excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: centuriontraveller3
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental was one of the first luxury hotels in Singapore and with all the hype on Singapore and the many openings of spectacular new hotels, one might shy away from booking a room at a place that has been around for so long. That would be a big mistake. MO have continuously invested into their hotel, the facilities are very modern and stylish, the rooms were all renovated and re-furbished, the pool with it's excellent adjacent Italian eatery (go on Saturday or Sunday for a great buffet and all you can drink Champage deal) provides brilliant vistas and the most attentive service we have experienced in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Not Legendary”
Reviews.Author: tarrytown54
Reviews.Content: The cabbie at Changi Airport grinned from ear to ear when I instructed him to take my Dearest and me to the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. ‘Very famous hotel’ he announced. ‘Legendary’, he added, just to show that he had paid attention during his American language classes at school. This was a vast improvement from his initial attitude: he had bared his teeth with ill-concealed anger when I insisted that he fit all my luggage into the trunk of his taxi, rejecting his ridiculous suggestion that I employ his friend to carry my bags to the Hotel in a separate cab. With the first mention of the Mandarin he brightened up as visions of an oversized tip from Americans able to afford the Mandarin began dancing around his pea brain. He was disappointed. No-one gets tipped for baring their teeth at me. Upon arrival at the Mandarin the reception desk attempted a stunt unworthy of a flop house, let alone a legendary hotel. I had carefully booked a room with a king bed and had a confirmation to prove it. As my Dearest and I approached reception, I heard another guest complain bitterly that a promised king bed had not materialized. Grinning from ear to ear the receptionist who assisted my Dearest and me announced that we had been upgraded to a suite. ‘Do you accept upgrade’ the receptionist asked several times with growing vehemence. Smelling a rat, I signaled to my Dearest that he was to remain silent and asked our receptionist whether the suite contained a king bed. Caught out, the receptionist admitted that the suite contained just two twin beds: information that should have been shared upfront. We stuck with our king bed room, thank you! The Singaporean cabbie and I differ on what is the stuff of legend. While undoubtedly a premium businessperson’s hotel, the Mandarin Oriental Singapore falls well short of legendary: (1) On roughly half the occasions that I called the Hotel guest services line it was answered within three rings. Other times it rang and rang endlessly until I slammed the phone down fuming. Legendary hotels staff their guest services lines with enough people so that all guest calls are answered promptly. My friends calling from home reported being put on hold for long stretches by Hotel operators, which is inconsiderate if you consider the cost of a phone call from America to Singapore. (2) Twice the guest services line attendant entirely misunderstood my request. Legendary hotels make sure everyone answering guest services calls is fluent in the American language. (3) Much of the furniture in the room consisted of bulky chunks of particle-board covered with wood veneer. Legendary hotels offer solid wood furniture. The upholstery in the room was uncomfortable and stained. Not something a businessperson running to the next meeting might notice, but something I spotted immediately. (4) In the world of hotels, there is lovely marble with rich colors, large tiles, almost invisible seams between tiles, and patterns that flow continuously from one tile to the next (luxury). There is also cheapo marble with dull colors, small tiles, prominent seams between tiles and unconnected patterns on each tile (not luxury). The marble in the Mandarin bathroom fell in the cheapo category. Worse, it bore glaring plastering and patchwork repairs where former bathroom fixtures had been ripped out. (5) The seams in the wallpaper were far too obvious and in some spots the wallpaper was starting to pull apart. Many bits of wall were scratched, stained, and scuffed. The Hotel restaurants and bars were generally nice. Wide variety of tasty food. Cocktails made skillfully, as ordered and without fuss. Superb waitstaff who could always tell whether I was in a rush or wanted to linger over my meal. My Dearest asks me to mention that the business center was exceptional and made the impossible possible several times. Point noted, my Dearest, but if you planned effectively you would not need to ask hotel business centers to yank rabbits out of hats for you. A stay at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore is not hardship duty: the Mandarin is a well run high-end hotel with many nice amenities. It is especially well suited to business travel. But legendary? Don’t make me laugh!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service, excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: grischa62
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental is one of the older luxury hotels in Singapore but luckily, management has invested on an ongoing basis so that the style, the facilities and the service are really state of the art. Great pool area, with best service we've had for a long time. Excellent restaurant outlets, spacious and well appointed Gym. Even at the busiest of times, we never had to wait for a taxi, which is a real plus in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Mandarin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ads1212
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positive feedback for this hotel. While the lobby is nothing to write about, the standard of top-notch service, coupled with a fabulous room (thank you for the upgrade!) made my stay in Singapore fantastic. Be careful the week before the Singapore F1 Grnad Prix however, the whole Marina Bay area goes into lock down and you can't even get out of the hotel (except through a Matrix like underground car park). That said I would recommend this for any business traveller. It certainly maintains the level of comfort and service this chain is famous for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great and Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: DLMC88
Reviews.Content: Dont let the outer facade of the hotel fool you as it is looking a little old compared to the newer hotels. However internally it must have been refurbished recently is excellent and lives up to its 5 star standard. The rooms are very spacious and superbly comfortable. I was there for 2 business meetings and we used their conference and meeting facilities which were all excellent as well. Beyond the the luxury and ambience of the hotel the stand out factor for me is the service. Nothing was a problem for the staff and they responded yes to all my request and the service is very personable which is a welcome change as sometimes it can be robotic. This hotel is also very well located in the Marina Square area with various malls within walking distance ie Suntec City and also the MRT stations.All in all an excellent stay and this being one of the best hotels in Singapore certainly lived up to its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a cIty Break, Great Location, Friendlt Staff”
Reviews.Author: navysihota
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice staff, nice food expensive though nice location, helpful concierge, 30 mins from airport Only thing was we got there the day after the Grand Prix and the Hotel was on the course so it was all locked down until Tuesday afternoon-Singapores a really nice city break

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Apollone
Reviews.Content: Simply perfect. I have been upgraded to a bigger room once arrived. What can I say, just fantastic, clean, great staff, good location in Marina Bay. Restaraunt offer is very good, one of the best breakfast ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW WOW WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dodie86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing!!!! The staff cannot do enough for you. They all know you by first and last name. The hotel quality is amazing....i could sit on here all day about this hotel. The new pool area is superb! We loved this hotel so very much...i hope to be back as soon as i can. Thankyou MOS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great views”
Reviews.Author: Rondotcom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during September for a total of 10 nights during our first visit to Singapore and what a good choice we made! The service we encountered was impeccable, efficient and very friendly from the moment we checked in to the day we left. The concierge was very helpful with trip planning and offering advice on local transport. The location is excellent and there are two MRT stations within a 10 minute walk all of which can be done undercover with air conditioning if you don’t fancy the heat. There were always taxis outside and guests are given priority if there is a line. We booked a Marina view room and I can recommend paying the extra for the view which spanned from the new Marina Bay Sands round to the St.Andrews Cathedral and included the CBD which is spectacular at night. The F1 GP track was being built as we were there 3 weeks before race day and the hotel is opposite turn 16 so we could see the track develop during our time there. The room was very well equipped and spacious enough for the two of us with all the amenities one would expect from a 5 star hotel. My only gripe about the room is the high charge for wi-fi. Buy yourself a prepay dongle if you are there for more than a few days, it’s much better value. The turndown service at night is worth a mention as the whole room is freshened up, new towels, robes, soap etc, in fact anything which needs changing gets changed and a book mark is always left as a gift. There are so any places to eat in Singapore and we were out in the City so much that we only ate in the hotel once. The Cherry Garden restaurant specialises in Cantonese cooking and was enjoyable if a little expensive as are most of the dining options available inside the MO. We really would have liked to have eaten at Morton’s the Steakhouse but the pricing really was sky high so we gave it a miss. There is very much better value to be had eating at one of the joining shopping malls. The Morton’s bar is quite nice and very busy during happy hour but unfortunately it closes at 11pm leaving only the Axis bar which reminded me of a business class lounge at the airport. The service is good though as are the cocktails and a pleasant way to end an evening out. If you don’t eat much for breakfast may I suggest you just pay the room only rate and make a good saving by eating out. There is a great place called Kopi-O for breakfast just a 2 minute walk from the front entrance of the hotel across the road at the entrance to the Esplanade Theatre. Peanut butter toast and coffee for two for around £5! Special mention should be made of the swimming pool. I know this has been updated this year and it’s really been done very well. The service is really quick and once your sun bed has been made up and towels given out some iced water is provided which given the heat and humidity is most welcome. There are some good views of the city sky line from many of the sun beds some of which are actually in the pool so you can relax in the water!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great service . May be best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JSJ2010
Reviews.Content: Great facilities in particular swimming pool and club on 19 floor ( great place for business meeting) Great quality of service with staff calling you by your name Great food including best steak in town (Moreton's) but very expensive Highly recommended hotel - a must do a Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Bern_Fidi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MO Singapore for the third time - this year for a long stay (15 nights). This hotel is just perfect and fantastic! We felt welcome and "at home" from the first to the last minute. We'd consider the MO Singapore as the best hotel in town. Service Staff recognized us upon arrival and greeted with name. Service is - in all locations of the hotel - at top top level. Room / Room service Fantastic view of Singapore skyline. Rooms are very cozy and equipped with everything you need. Room service is perfect. Room was serviced twice a day (not just turndown - real service also in the evening). Always very clean and stocked with everything (e.g. this is the only hotel in the world in wich I never ever run out of facial tissues). Restaurants / Bar We had dinner at Cherry Garden (chinese): Wonderful. At Wasabi Bistro (japanese): very good and very good choice in menues. Melt: Breakfast is unbeatable and cannot be described; Buffet dinner was top. Dolce vita (italian): By the pool with view of the skyline; Wonderful service, very good food. We did not have dinner at Morton's as the prices are obviously too high. But... the daily highlight was Axis Bar. There we really felt like home and the Service is 7 stars! Pool The whole pool area has undergone renovation and is now a little place of heaven. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great facilities - also in the gym. Concierge Very helpful and very competent. We booked tickets thru them and service was very quick and matched exactly our needs. Also all doormen and the "taxi-man" are top. Location Singapore is now quite a big city. But the location of the MO is perfect. Shopping Malls, restaurants and transport (underground) are just next door. Overall. We only can highly recommend this hotel and take this opportunity to thank all the MO staff for the wonderful service. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose Mandarin Oriental for our Singapore holiday.”
Reviews.Author: 255103Jack
Reviews.Content: The staff are professional, prompt and happy to be of assistance with everything. The room was lovely modern and very clean. If you decide to stay here you must have the buffet breakfast its amazing everything you could think of is there. Special thanks to Marcel and all the staff at Melts.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ilst
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the club floor with expansive harbour views. We expect a high level of service from a 5 star hotel and we were never disappointed. Housekeeping was attentive and service at the club lounge with a great view was excellent. Rooms here are well sound proofed and a good night sleep is guaranteed. The pool area is nicely done in a resort style. It used to be a simple lap pool style which I never used before but this time I enjoyed it very much. Breakfast at the Melt is breathtaking. We wished we could stay longer to try the massive range of food. The hotel was full one day and people were everywhere but the food was replenished quickly. We could have had breakfast at the club lounge but I prefer the Melt for the array of food. The location is convenient to go anywhere. We took a full walk around the harbour and went to the top of the Marina Bay Sands (amazing view). Easy to catch a taxi from the hotel and also easy to walk to a MRT station, through air conditioned shopping centres. It is worth getting the harbour view room (not ocean view). My e-mail request was replied within 24 hours and was on our record when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “A Truely 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: chengdu-resident
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Mandarin Oriental was of very high quality and I would recommend this hotel to others. The location is great and you have easy access to the underground system which can get you out and about in Singapore. The service of the staff was extremely good and was definately a 5 star standard. The room itself was large, comfortable and very clean. It was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Singapore for nine years, so was familiar with the property, had eaten at restaurants like Morton's there before, but was the first time I'd stayed. Given how long the property had been around, and the relatively low corporate rate I'd gotten I honestly didn't have particularly high expectations. I was set straight but good. Upon arrival, the hotel had done a nice job of landscaping the open driveway in front of the hotel. Upon arrival, I was escorted and my bags whisked to the front desk. There was no line at 8-9 pm, and the attendant was very friendly, efficient and generally solicitous of my well-being. The structural design of the hotel was very early 90s, but the touches and finishings by the hotel made it seem attractive, recently renovated, and actually quite luxurious. My room size was typical of that era, but of a reasonable size (I'd estimate 30-40sqm) and the space was cleverly broken up by a long bathroom with the closets along the side and a glass partition to the main bedroom. The chocolates left for their guests were delicious, and the fruits were very sweet and a nice touch. The location of the hotel is great - I was able to be at a conference in the nearby Ritz-Carlton in 5 minutes by just taking some stairs up one flight to the mall and then cutting through it to the 1st floor entrance to the Ritz. It's close to the subway, to lots of shopping, and it was walking distance to the Marina Bay Sands (if you don't mind a 15-20 minute walk along the spectacular pedestrian bridge). Great location for joggers. And you can even take in a show at the Esplanade next door (hit the No Signboard seafood for pepper crab or chili crab if you don't have time to go to the East Coast). And the breakfast buffet was the most impressive I'd seen in a very long time. It was the first time I'd stayed at a hotel in Southeast Asia or East Asia that had an Indian section as well as roti paratha, which was excellent. Great selection of food, quality was excellent. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: doydy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a week, the hotel was one of the best we've been to, been to Ritz SG before. Stayed on the 16th floor room overlooking the ocean. MBS is visible on this side of our room. Spacious with decent channel on tv and dvd player. Wi-fi is not free. Staff were very courteous and accommodating. Mall is right next to the hotel as with other known hotels. Would have rated it 5 star if not for the package the front desk have lost when we left it there and they didn't care to get back at us. Nonetheless its still an excellent hotel, just don't leave your package on the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “all this and wheatgrass too!”
Reviews.Author: KualaLumpurBuddy
Reviews.Content: Any hotel that serves wheatgrass at breakfast gets it! A great view of Sands..walking distance to the river ..nearby malls ..smiles from all staff..a great Chinese restaurant..wonderful breakfast made for a memorial experience.

Reviews.Title: “perfect as it should be”
Reviews.Author: Medanese
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mandarin Oriental Spore (MOS) on September 12-14 September 2010. Arrived at 6 PM and the check in process is superb, the reception staff even walk me to the lift, and even to the room if I want her to, but I dismissed her as I knew she had much things to do and I can find my own room. I was given a room at 11th floor, No.1118 facing the Pan Pacific hotel. The room was in very good shape, spacious except the TV remote that does not work well (I did mentioned it on my check out process). I walked down to Promenade (Circle Line) MRT station to meet my friend for dinner, 10 minutes walk.. 2nd night I take MRT from Dhoby Ghaut and arrived at Esplanade MRT, another 15 minutes walk to the hotel. Marina Bay Sands is just a walking distance and so is Espalnade. We have 2 days training at Harbour View Suites at Level 5 and lunch at MELT (level 4). After all, this hotel is perfect in location, very good in terms of helpfullness and friendly staff and might be something you won't regret.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: cellphonesamba
Reviews.Content: The mandarin Oriental deserves its 5 star rating. Impeccable service, suites were exceptionally clean and had thoughtful touches and the bed is sooo comfortable. One of the best breakfast buffets we've ever seen in both variety and quality. Great pool. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Live_t0_h0liday
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in transit after a long day of travelling. We received a room upgrade which was a nice surprise and we found all the staff very professional and friendly. The room was luxurious and the bed was so comfortable!! The view of Marina Bay from our room was also spectacular!! Hotel in a good location with easy access to Marina Bay and other nearby shopping complexes.

Reviews.Title: “best service for commercial hotel we've ever received”
Reviews.Author: TheOlivers78
Reviews.Content: this really is a 5* hotel. Room was fab- spacious with a panoramic view over the bay. Breakfast was the best we've tried in a commercial hotel. The service was incredible. The only small downside of this hotel is that you have to get taxi's to most places. However, the metro & buses are gr8 and really cheap. That being said, I would return. Concierge & check in were seemless! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: SaraD1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its staff were truly amazing. All the staff were very polite and helpful. Expensive hotel restuarant but lovely food. The room suite was luxurious, wonderful views of the harbour, Singapore flyer and the Marina Bay hotel. Totally recommend it, memorable honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service - almost!”
Reviews.Author: Ed-Scotia
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if not as swanky as some of its newer counterparts. Service and staff were impeccable except for first checking into room when air conditioning was not working properly (rather essential in this climate!). Two maintenance guys arrive and one very helpful the other simply saying takes a while to cool down and give it 5 minutes - this after having already given it 40 minutes and it had dropped a massive 1 degree!!! Anyway did not detract from the rest of the staff who were pretty much without exception outstanding. Bizarrely there appeared to be at least four people in the steakhouse restaurant all celebrating a birthday! After hearing pretty much the whole staff congregate around a table and provide their rendition of "Happy Birthday To You" for the third time, the fourth gets a bit boring - or am I just an old crank??!! Great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Business or Leisure”
Reviews.Author: AlanTam25
Reviews.Content: Intended to stay at the Mandarin Oriental for a whole week, but unfortunately they were fully booked, so I could only stay here for the last couple of days of my trip. Originally I didn't intend to move hotels during the trip, but the other hotel I stayed at, the Marina Mandarin, was just terrible. Well to keep the long story short, Mandarin Oriental is simplying superb. The room is nice and clean, and the bed is so comfortable. The breakfast is amazing, huge selection and great quality, one of the best breakfast buffet among the hundreds of 4/5 star hotels I've stayed at over the years. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurants need to lose the attitude”
Reviews.Author: MangoRacin
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with my visit to Mandarin Oriental Singapore, although this trip was just for a few casual pre-dinner drinks. We arrived at the hotel dressed casually as nearly all guests were given it was Youth Olympics time and popular social venues are nearby. Dressed smartly in bermuda shorts, t-shirts and shoes+socks, we were still denied entry to the hotel bar and Moreton's bar due to a "no shorts" policy. No such policy was posted at the entrance of the venues. I'm the first to respect dress codes, but this was untypical for Singapore for a 5pm time period on a Monday night. Aside from the dress code, I was most upset by the manner in which the staff dealt with the situation. Staff response was aggressive, rude, confrontational and without a polite closing note. Tip for staff: if you want to enforce a dress code, then 1. make sure it's sensible for venue/time/location/guest situation; 2. have the policy clearly visible or at least somewhere you can direct to in a professional manner; 3. explain the policy respectfully and apologise; 4. encourage the guests to come back ("sorry for the inconvenience, but if you would like to return later this evening, we'd like to offer your party a complimentary drink/voucher/discount/something for your inconvenience"). There's ways to do this and MO let us down on this occassion. It's unlikely I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great food and very good service....”
Reviews.Author: rahulzz1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Mandarin Oriental for over 3 days in August for a conference in Singapore. The conference was in the same hotel hence was in the hotel for almost three full days. Very good place indeed..one of the better ones I’ve visited. The cab ride from the Chagai airport for S$20 and the hotel is just above the Marina Square shopping mall. Another huge mall..Skywalk..I guess...was close by. The closest MRT is just 15 mins walk. My room faced the marina bay esplanades. The only issue I faced was the disturbance due to the the Youth Olympic Game preparation in a stadium right on the marina bay. Best part of the hotel was the global restaurant “Melt” that also served vegetarian Indian food. The dinner had in the same restaurant had an elaborate buffet of international cuisines ...and the dessert were really good. Need to mention that the hotel staff was also very friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on 2 previous occassions in 1995 and 2000 so we knew what to expect in terms of service and location but our recent stay confirmed our view that this hotel (and staff) is the best hotel either of us have ever stayed at. We had breakfast every day and the food selection was enormous including Chinese, Indian, American, cold meats, cured fish dishes. I would unreservedly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Best Mandarin Oriental ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingEconomist
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for 4 nights in the Mandarin Oriental Singapore and consider this hotel one of the best 5 star hotels in the world. My room was in the 21st floor (the highest) with an amazing and breathtaking view of the Singapore skyline. The room was readily available when I arrived, which was at 10:30 in the morning. The restaurants are excellent and the service is truly 5 star and the food is of a very high standard. They can anticipate your every need. For me, this is the hotel to stay when in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it looks”
Reviews.Author: JRNSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: I wanted a luxurious long weekend and chose Mandarin Oriental because it was comparatively new, in a part of Singapore I had not stayed before and promised the best of everything. Initial impressions were good, quick check in with friendly staff and room ready as promised. I had paid extra for a "club" room and told I was given an upgrade on that, but have to say the room looked exactly like what I had booked. Nice standard but not exceptional. Essentially the hotel really has been built out very nicely and every corner has a pleasant hotel ambience. In addition they have the staff all treating guests very courteously and give the impression nothing is too much trouble. Until you scratch the surface. Then I discovered that neither the main desk or Club Concierge had the least idea how to help with a Singapore Airlines seat question (any other airline ok, but this is their national carrier and a good proportion of guests would lkely use it) I was shown a computer in the corner so I could fix my own problem. Sigh etc Food is their weakpoint In the first two days of my stay I was presented with a cold bacon and toast breakfast in the exclusive Club area. Gave up asking after that. Made my own toast. The Melt Cafe was expensive, boring and on the special barbeque night, they really couldn't cook properly. But the cost was stunningly high. Every hotel has a cafe eatery and usually these are slightly cheaper comfort food places with usually good buffets. High priced and not special here. Then I wanted to try the really elegant Chinese Restaurant just to compare what I thought would be high end Chinese food compared to meals in Chinese restaurants at home in Sydney. Sorry again it was certainly expensive, but the food clearly came from the freezer shop. Not bad food just bad value. So nice hotel, friendly staff but but eat your meals somewhere else. Mandarin Oriental you really must try harder

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: saraheli55
Reviews.Content: Walked into our hotel and room and the wow factor was definitely there - we had a harbour view room on the 15th floor - it was amazing! We loved Singapore and this hotel is the best I have ever stayed at. The breakfasts were out of this world and the service was unbelievable. If you are going to SIngapore STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: Hua-LianPanorama2009
Reviews.Content: perfectly service, a good panorama and a taste good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Not impressive for a Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: BENLEE123
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental as a luxury hotel brand is ranked among the best in the world in this rather exclusive field. Mention Mandarin Oriental and it conjures up images of the exotic east, luxurious accommodation steep in culture and design and impeccable personalized service. So confident is the hotel group on it’s image that it even pioneer the “I’m a fan” campaign with prominent celebrity endorsement. The Mandarin Oriental Singapore is a more dated property among the MO portfolio but has a prime harbour-side location at Singapore’s the Marina Bay area. Arriving I have always prefer hotels at Marina Bay area due to it’s proximity to the airport. I have tried Pan Pacific, Marina Mandarin, Ritz Carlton and Conrad already. This time, I decided to try out the Mandarin Oriental. Arriving by taxi, I was escorted to the reception desk and check-in formalities was efficiently handled without any waiting. A good first impression. I was also glad to hear that they have upgraded me to a suite. The Room The suite room is a spacious 73m2 city suite which at first glance, looks rather quite functional, with calm, relaxing décor. The suite is neatly divided into a living area and a sleeping quarters with a king size bed, connected to a marble bathroom and a walk-in closet. Strangely missing though is a dinning area but I can understand including that will make the place too crowded. There is a long working desk with plugs and connections conveniently located at the side. Wireless and wired internet works and quite fast. There’s a large 40” LCD TV which is hooked up a in-room A/V system, but it’s rather basic and sound, well… like most A/V system in hotel sounds, ie mediocre. ( Note : I’m a A/V enthusiast so my standards are higher than usual ). There’s no iPod dock but the hotel provide some cables to hook up the iPod manually, a rather un-elegant solution in this day and age. The lighting is not flexible. While there’s no mood lighting, at least separate light switches should be provided. Instead the main switches just either switches everything on or everything off. Above the working desk is a glaring spot light that cannot be switched off without switching off every other light, which is quite annoying. Sound proof isn’t that great either. I can hear street noise coming thru the windows which I suspect isn’t double-glazed, hence the noise. The bed is quite comfortable but not exactly top of the line for a hotel of this class. The bathroom I think is the most undesirable part of this suite. For a suite room, it’s surprising small and the bathroom fittings are a mixture of old and new. And again, there is this dreadful shower-stall with only a single shower head and low water pressure that makes one feel like taking a bath under a water tap. Seriously, hotels of this class should by now have installed mandatory rainforest showers in their bathrooms. The bathtub is deep which is good but I find it rather narrow. Overall, this room is showing it’s age and while it has been refreshed and touch-up before, such as installing flat panel LCD Tvs, it’s basically still resembles a hotel room from the late 80s / early 90s period, ie old and un-appealing. Common Areas The most impressive common area feature of this hotel is the soaring 24th storey atrium, which is especially majestically when viewed from the 4th level. Sort of shape like a fan, a symbol of the Mandarin Oriental group. There are a couple of restaurants in the hotel but I only visited the café for the morning breakfast. There’s a large morning crowd and it was rather noisy, not very nice ambience. The food served was OK, standard hotel breakfast stuff. Service I used to have high expectation of Mandarin Oriental service, which are often exemplary especially among their two signature hotels in Hong Kong and equally good in Bangkok but have since toned down my expectation after an awful stay at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo 2 years ago. The service here in Mandarin Oriental Singapore is not as bad but woefully inconsistent. During my stay, I encountered some staff that seems to be trying out of their way to be friendly and helpful ( but at the wrong occasion ) and some being rather indifferent and some that are downright rude. Case in point, I arrived late at night, was tired after the flight and ordered room service because I just want a quick meal before my bedtime. The room service attendant that brought me my food was being overtly attentive, hanging around longer than usual, asking how he might be of service and trying to strike up some small conversations which I was frankly in no mood for. I wasn’t quite sure if he wanted a tip or just trying to be nice. A case of “over service” perhaps? Then the follow day, it goes to the other extreme during morning breakfast that when trying to order an egg omelet, I was rudely told to “wait in line” by a very grumpy looking staff because apparently, there was another hotel guest waiting for her order but I didn’t noticed any queue forming. Fortunately, the restaurant manager was on-hand to help me take my order so I don’t have to stare at a sour face the first thing in the morning. Conclusion During my short stay at this hotel, I went away unimpressed. Granted I was given an upgrade to a suite, but I really don’t find anything particularly outstanding about this hotel in where it counts. Comparing against other hotels in Singapore, in terms of room quality, it is a step down from the grand and luxurious St Regis. In terms of service, it’s inconsistent at best and definitely not comparable to the Four Seasons which has class and finesse. In terms of comfort factor and value for money, it lacks behind the Conrad. If measured against the MO’s own standard bearers in Hong Kong and Bangkok, it falls even further behind, neither as opulent as their sisters property and lacking in wow factor, especially for the rates asked, it’s a pale imitation at best. #1 in tripadvisor? I’ll give it just a passable 3/5 and I think I’m already being generous.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Vanessa
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with exceptional service and very helpful staff. The hotel has a great position and the view from our room was breath taking. Realy enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line!”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: One of the best business hotels ever. Absolutely fantastic and helpful staff, great rooms with wonderful views. Newly renovated pool area is wonderfully done with staff reading your every needs from your lips. Location in Marina Bay is very convenient for conferences and near by businesses. Short walk to the MRT station if required. Definitely a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Zella
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, service was in a different leaugue, one of the best hotels we have ever had the pleasure to stay in..cant wait to go back one day. OUTSTANDING! you will not regret staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “truly wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Canucks-down-under
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with my wife for an anniversary get away. Booked a harbour view club room. Room was very clean, view was great and the club access was more than worth the premium. Club staff were excellent (addressed us by name from the second time we went), attentive but unobtrusive, food and drinks were good - nightly nibbles especially. Rest of the hotel's facilities were at least what we expected - pool area has a good view across the harbour and very good pool side service, couples massage package at Mandarin Spa was among the best we've had and the food at Dolce Vita was world class. The hotel is next door to Marina Parade, walking distance to Raffles, Orchard Road shopping, etc and if you're energetic, walking distance to Little India. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: crispy60
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay in Singapore and I chose the Mandarin Oriental as the hotel chain came recommended. Everything about the hotel is absolutely superb!!!!!!!! The rooms are luxiourous and very very clean, the restaurant has to be seen to be believed but above all the service you get is beyond your wildest dreams. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will be staying here again on my next visit to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “A remarkable experience”
Reviews.Author: ferien_messenger
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at Mandarin Oriental. Stayed there for 2 nights and the whole experience was great. First of all, we got a great deal from our travel agent (room came with breakfast). We arrived at the hotel earlier than check-in time and the front desk staff was courteous enough to inform us that our room will not be ready until later on. Not a problem as we managed to 'kill' some time by doing some shopping at the Marina Square shopping mall (adjacent to the hotel) - very convenient. And Suntec City is merely a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. We were given a room with a magnificent view facing the Marina Bay. The view was breath-taking and it's so picturesque! The room was immaculate, a very cozy setting with a big glass facing the bathroom. The toiletries provided were top-notch. The Axis Bar and Lounge was a good place to have a drink and listening to some good live music. And the buffet breakfast spread at The MELT cafe was amazing. A huge selection of international cuisine as well as Asian. Had lunch at The MELT again (a la carte) and it was good. I ordered a pumpkin soup but need to go up to my room for a while, and they realized it and kept the soup hot for me while I was away! very considerate of them! Overall, a truly remarkable experience and I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theogeor
Reviews.Content: I was in Singapore for 4 days and I have chosen Mandarin Oriental for my stay. (So did some of my colleagues). What a wise choice. The Hotel is excelent in every way. Service is TOP, Restaurants are amazing (yes they are expensive as well) and the rooms are great with every detail been taken care off. I had a room on the 20th floor with views of the Marina and it was fantastic. As said me and my colleagues tried different restaurants and bars and I would not fault any of them. the steak house is fantastic (having your differ on the bar if no table is available is fine) and the staff are more than helpful and put every effort to make your stay confortable and enjoyable. At the end of the stay we all agreed that the next business travel we have in Singapore the 1st choice would the the Mandarin Oriental

Reviews.Title: “Decadent travel”
Reviews.Author: AfricanNomad
Reviews.Content: An absolute marvel of a place. If you ever have the need for a bit of self-indulgence in Singapore then this hotel is a must. With its own Singaporean flair, this hotel does make it easy to forget that hotels are a temporary convenience. The staff are constantly at your service, irrespective of the request. Good food at the hotel restaurants some have a Michelin star. Centrally located in the city including access to a variety of malls and other Singapore delights. A Spa, located at the hotel, for your companion, and an excellent, well-equipped business centre. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, highlight of our trip”
Reviews.Author: marvel_pl
Reviews.Content: My and my husband stayed at this hotel during our one week trip to Singapore and Bangkok in November 2009. I always carefully select hotels for our trips as I believe proper hotel adds a lot to the whole trip experience. We were impressed by the overall look and more than excellent service. We got upgrade to Premier Harbour View room as this was our 10th wedding anniversary trip. Views were stunning and we would sit in the evening by the window and admire the Singapore skyline. We'd read a lot about famous breakfast in Mandarin Oriental and were not disappointed! Dishes from all around the world, hot and cold, international cuisine - Japanese, Chinese, Indian, Thai, Indonesian, European.....you could spend the whole week and still not be able to try everything! This was probably our best culinary experience during our stay. Not mentioning delicious desserts and countless fruits, juices and smoothies! Our room was spacious, tastefully decorated, the bed was really comfortable. We travel a lot but for the first time it happened that when I left a book in the room, I would find it with a beautiful paper bookmark - each day it was different colour and different motto. Such a little thing but so nice! MO should be on "to do" list on each Singapore itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KiwiInPimlico
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Shangri-La the first time I visited Singapore, I thought I would try the Mandarin. I really enjoyed my stay, and this had a lot to do with how great the staff at the hotel were. By the end of the week, most seemed to know my name (!) and they couldn't have been more helpful. While the rooms weren't as big as I was expecting (and I was upgraded on arrival) the views of the city were gorgeous, and it seemed a shame to draw the curtains at night. I appreciated the little touches such as the bath salts in the bathroom, and the fresh fruit every day. I used the hotel spa for a back treatment, and came out feeling a brand new person after a 12 hour flight from London. I didn't use many of the restaurants, but found room service to be pretty good! I also used the business centre and again found the staff to be incredibly helpful. Two little gripes - broadband is not free and the lifts took forever, but I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: acton1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on the Club Indulgence package. Our room was upgraded to a suite overlooking Skyflyer and the Sands on the Clubfloor. The service and faclities weres excellent. Club Lounge offered free drinks in the early evening. The atmosphere was quiet and exclusive. It is something that you would appreciate in this busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great value, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: jrzgirl_inDC
Reviews.Content: I had a conference in Singapore (at SUNTEC) and my husband joined me on the trip. We were thoroughly impressed by the Mandarin Oriental. Our room was lovely, with a fabulous view of the harbor. Breakfast was amazing, and we can not say enough good things about the absolutely wonderful restaurant staff. They went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed for our breakfast each day. The hotel is conveniently located, within walking distance or a short cab ride to most of the city's attractions. Although we did not have the opportunity to swim, the hotel pool area (which I understand was recently renovated) is absolutely gorgeous. Our only minor complaint was that the concierge had little to recommend restaurant-wise, apart from the main, nearby tourist spots. For example, when we mentioned that we went to Geylang (the red-light district) to eat at its No Signboard Seafood, rather than eat at the No Signboard in the Esplanade, he seemed both shocked and appalled, despite the fact that we had been advised by several local Singaporeans that the Geylang restaurant is far superior in terms of both quality and price. So, if you're looking for local finds or places off the beaten path, do your own research! Also, the free wireless was only for 12 hours per day, using a continuous clock (rather than tracking login/logoff times), which was a bit annoying. Otherwise, in all respects, I highly recommend the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Asia”
Reviews.Author: travelhellokitty
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry for people who didn't find this hotel good enough for you. The Mandarian Oriental Singapore surely exceeded my expectation. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with an elderly and young children. I find everyone at the hotel very helpful and friendly. Hotel rooms - we had 4 rooms and they were all clean and well equipped. Although the hotel is not brand new but the rooms were kept very nice. Check in staff - very efficient and polite. English was good enough for me. Pool - highlight of our trip. All my kids wanted to do in Singapore was to spend time at the pool. Staff there were friendly and attentive. Business Centre - Ladies at the business centre were fabulous. There's always no wait for a computer and the first 5 minutes were free. They also offered complimentary coffee/tea. I thought it would be served in a paper cup or something. To my surprised, they served it as if i ordered it at the hotel restaurant. The even gave me some cookies to go with my tea :) Conceige - I was lucky to be helped by the best Conceige I've ever met. Eisham tried his best to make our stay a pleasant one. He made restaurant reservations for us and made sure we were all taken care of. The restaurant we went to was not up to our expectation and Eisham did some magic and got us 20% off our credit card bill after we left the restaurant. Because we travelled with an 85 year old, we needed to extend our check-out time. Without any problem, Eisham again helped us without any charges to us. All in all, Mandarin Oriental was the best hotel we stayed in Asia and we travel a lot for leisure. THANK YOU everyone at MO. We'll come back agian! :)

Reviews.Title: “Still Cuts It....Just”
Reviews.Author: Dezzydez
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on a stopover to visit family. The Singapore MO was in a good open location in Marina Square, great view of the bay, new casino and the Singapore wheel from our window. Room was a good size, cleanliness and condition was up to usual MO standards and it was equipped as you would expect from a 5* in Asia. The room appear to have been refurbished in the last few years but personally I found the style a bit dated, in fact the whole hotel's atrium style still had a whiff of the late 80s about it, so perhaps a complete overhaul and remodel is due? Service itself was ok, just ok nothing, nothing to write home about, a bit indifferent tbh. Nearby amenities were good, you had Marina Square mall, the Esplanade, Clarke Quay and Boat Quay are were all nearby. I haven't stayed in another hotel in SG so cannot compare but I would say this was good by HK standards. Note, can be a bit of a wait for taxis as the Hotel function rooms host alot of weddings and events so guests join the taxi queue..factor this in when leaving for airport. Overall still a great hotel, we had a pleasant short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jk737
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mandarin Oriental Singapore for 3 nichts after two weeks in Bali last Oktober. The Mandarin Oriental Singapore is great value for money, but it lacks the flair and style of the Raffles (which, however, is triple the price of the Oriental). It is rather a first class business hotel (modern, stylish - you see, what I mean, when entering the lobby the first time) than a "grand dame" like the Oriental in Bangkok, for example. When you are looking for something like that, you have to spend the money for the Raffles. Service is good, but not perfect. The SPA was very nice. In any event, you have to go to the happy hour in this "Steak House Bar", great drinks and great free steak sandwiches. The view from our room (Deluxe Seaview in the 20th floor) was great. The pool was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel and the worst service”
Reviews.Author: miteshgupta
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 nights last weekend june 25 - 27 on our way back to india from bali. We checked in late around midnight and they had 2 twin beds for us. They are supposed to automatically upgrade us with amex platimun booking and they didnt. The room wasnt turned down. Housekeeping is simply terrible for the grade of hotel this is. We had to call at least 2-3 times for each request (ice, to clear the garbage,) They took over 1 hour and 3 calls to housekeeping to get me packing/masking tape. The staff on the telephones dont understand english very well. The restaurants close at 2.30 - we went to lunch to their japanse, chinese restaurant at 2.15 and were told that its closed for lunch on saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK, Lah”
Reviews.Author: JayODHK
Reviews.Content: A few good things but a lot of negatives also. The hotel is huge with 80's-style cylindrical glass elevators in the center of an atrium surrounded by all the guest rooms. Sound carries real well so when a 7 year-old on the other side of the hotel yells "C'mon Grandpa!" at 6:30 AM you will hear it and you will be awake. Elevators serve every floor so they are very slow (sometimes 5 minutes from lobby to your room - this is really not great if you are hot, tired, have to "go" etc - which is almost all the time in SIN). In addition to being slow, cars are very small so you will become well-acquainted with your fellow guests (like it or not). Typical Mandarin Oriental-type room, lots of chintz, unneccesarily complicated lighting system, the bath the looks luxe at first but on closer inspection is a little tired and in need of a reno. Pool, though, has had a recent makeover and is stunning, one of the best in Asia - view to the rear of the Singapore Flyer and from the front over to tall skyscrapers, The Fullerton, and one of the Merlions - a real photo op. Poolside service gets the balance right between solicitiousness and leaving you alone. Pool swarmed with not-too-well-supervised kids on the weekends, however, so not as relaxing or peaceful as it should be - stone on the pool deck is pretty slippery which can result in a little rough justice for the real misbehavers. Hotel location near The Esplanade is a key plus. Everybody in SIN is a food critic so some will turn up their noses but for us the Makansutra Gluttons Bay outdoor hawker centre and the No Signboard Seafood branch were all we needed for darn satisfying weekend dining. The hawker centre was particularly great - halal food (at least some of it), icy Tiger beer, open til 3 AM - that's SIN in a splendid nutshell. Service in the Axis Lounge was very poor however and a real visit killer. It was our anniversary and after a delicious but economical white pepper crab dinner, we decided to celebrate with a nice bottle of vintage champagne (US$300+). Server insisted on pouring thimble-size amounts, spilling quite a bit each time. When we said nicely we would like to pour for ourselves, she told us "the Boss wants me to pour" - this sort of thing happens a lot in Asia but is infuriating every time nonetheless Instead of getting the service you want, you get service forced upon you based upon someone's zombie-like tunnel-vision view of what that service should be. Service like that absolutely ignores the customer's wishes as an individual and, honestly, at $300 a bottle - the customer should be "the Boss." By the end, the poor girl with the phantom "Boss" hovering over her shoulder had spilled just about a full glass. Profuse apologies were given, but the situation called for 2 complimentary glasses of the house champagne . . . we got nothing but the check. My wife, smart & beautiful girl that she is, said we just should have stayed at the hawker centre for another round of Tigers - I'll listen to her next time, as should you.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxus in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: muratie
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental in Singapore has everything you would expect from the typical 5 star hotel: great rooms, friendly staff, luxurious interieur, amazing breakfast (and unfortunately upmarket prices...). I would stay here again - you can't do anything wrong if you stay at Mandarin Oriental in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, roomy and give an amazing view of the Singapore skyline.. The breakfast was the highlight with a large selection of items.. This hotel is well located near a mall and a train station.. Staff are helpful and efficient.. Got a complimentary late checkout which helped as the flight back home was rather late in the evening..

Reviews.Title: “Good Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saurabh_ag
Reviews.Content: A Good hotel but very expensive hotel to stay. All the amenities are luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “asian service par excellence”
Reviews.Author: car0raj
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 3 nights the service from the minute we got off our taxi was pleasureable.Each staff member greeted us by name with a warm smile and continued to do so until our departure.The hotel was very well located facing the Marina and the F1 race track and walking distance to Suntec via the marina square shopping complex which is linked to the hotel where there were inumerable restaurants and a wide variety of cuisines to choose from.Each room had a balcony which was a rare find in city hotel.The bathroom was spacious and toiletries very good. breakfast ws excellent with a good mix of oriental , western and asian cuisine .Five restaurants including a stakehouse and a very nice fitness centre and spa. MRT is not very close about 15kms away

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view of the Singapore Flyer and great location”
Reviews.Author: SameerBombay_India
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin for 3 nights. What I liked: 1) Large rooms with long pane windows overlooking the harbour. 2) My room gave me an excellent view of the Singapore Flyer and the strobe lights reflected in the sea 3) Very good conference facilities 4) A choice of restaurants and bars within walking distance 5) Stylish lobby and facade What could have been better: 1) The gift shop 2) The selection of vegetarian food. All in all a great propertt albeit a bit pricy.

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: JamesSharpe
Reviews.Content: Travelling on ( or at least) near to our anniversary saw us in Singapore we had the fortune to stay at the mandarin oriental. This is without doubt an ultra five hotel. The service is impecable. Funny enough the mandarin is a wor experience for those training in high class silver service and everything is checked and double check with your pleasure at the front. We were more than grateful for our complimentary upgrade to suite.  The pool area is fab. Througout your tenure you are treated with ice  cold smoothies and frozen delights on the house as you slurp away at your Singapore slings. Being an ex british colony probably describes the feverish actions of your hosts to assemble parasols when the short lived turmulptous afternoon thunderstorms race by. You needn't move - you're warm, you're dry and relaxed knowing when the momentary downpour passes your hosts will remove the offending shade and you can get on relaxing and tanning unoffended.  We were lucky enough to enjoy three nights while stefan thiel and cynthia otterbach played smooth classics in the bar and made a perfect holiday better still. By the way cynthia knows everybody from the new Orleans crowd so catch her after the performance and oil her with martinis to hear her life story. It is interesting trust me :) Top tip free flow bar in the hotel buffet is worth it. The food quality is excellent and at 24S$ for free flow after two drinks your quids in.

Reviews.Title: “JUST FANTASTIC! BEST PLACE TO STAY IN SINGAPORE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 04bat
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Mandarin a while ago, I just felt I need to write a review on what a fantastic trip I had. Visiting en route to Australia, we decided to stay in the Oriental for 4-nights there and 4-nights on the way back. The hotel is very large and has a huge atrium that goes down into the shopping centre underneath. The rooms are extremely spacious with all the mod-cons and great tv's, and views overlooking the harbour are just stunning. Great for thunder-storm spotting, was just fantastic! The staff could not be more helpful. Really they are so nice. They'll do anything you ask and made the trip that extra bit special with such great service. The hotel has a pool outside with a nice pool bar. The pool has underwater sound and is nice when swimming... you just don't wan't to come up! Really do stay at this hotel. Even if it's for a night. It's really really really great and I'll defiantly be going back on my next visit to Singapore. Visit the Island of Sentosa and see the water display. That's fantastic too!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marianknits
Reviews.Content: Hotel was everything one could want and location near to some great malls and foodspots. But the high point for me was the amazing breakfast. Not only that, but everytime we entered we were greeted by name! First time given a tour of all the food so we couldn't miss anything. I'll be delighted to return.

Reviews.Title: “World class excellence”
Reviews.Author: scruffybags
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely world class in every respect. We stayed their in a club suite for the first two nights of our honeymoon and it could not have been better in any way. The hotel pick up was superb and they went out of their way to assist us with a baggage problem we had. The arrival experience is slick and incredibly impressive. The rooms are beautiful, view amazing, lovely small balcony to stand out on. Lovely extra touches to suprise us for our honeymoon. Housekeeping fantastic. Club room second to none, service attentive and champagne free flowing. Would happily recommend this hotel to anybody and hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “a little tired”
Reviews.Author: bob_and_carole73
Reviews.Content: On arrival first impressions were quite good; however we had just spent the previous 4 nights in the Mandarin Oriental Hong Kong, so we had a direct comparison. Staff were very helpful and efficient here, but in several areas this hotel lagged behind its Hong Kong counterpart. Breakfast was quite good, although the layout of the room was confusing. We did also comment to the hotel that hot food was left uncovered, so that it was only warm at best. In public areas some of the decoration was very "tired", and the bedroom, although very comfortable, was also in need of updating. However the view from the room was terrific. A couple of the elevators/lifts were temperamental, leaving the overall impression that the hotel needs refurbishing. Strangely enough the pool was closed for refurbishment - priorities seem to be wrong here ?? One final thing...........why do they need to charge internet access as an "extra"? Perhaps if we had not come straight from another Mandarin Oriental, my assessment may have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MMF3759
Reviews.Content: After a 10 day trip to Vietnam and Singapore with my husband who had been working in Vietnam on a project for 6 weeks, this was a surprise stay at the end of our trip. WOW, I expected very nice, but the service was so special I wanted to never check out. We were upgraded to a suite with a fabulous view from the 16th floor, wonderful beds, fab bathroom and the Executive Lounge was one of the highlights of the stay. We opted for the late check out package as our flight did not leave until 2am and that just added to the ambience. The pool area was newly renovated. We walked over to the new Marina Bay Sands and would rather stay at a hotel like the Mandarian Oriental on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Service”
Reviews.Author: kalikidd05
Reviews.Content: Solid typical Mandarin service with helpful and considerate front desk and concierge. Breakfast was very nice, with massive selection of American, continental, Chinese, Japanese, and South East Asian choices, although a bit crowded the days we visited. The lobby was renovated and looked nice, but the rooms are a bit dated compared to some of the newer offerings in the city. However, the quality of the service alone made up for the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Mandarin effort”
Reviews.Author: TokyoGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while attending a conference. Bed was very comfortable. Overall impression was very good. Rooms are nicely appointed with special consideration for business travelers -- no need to go to the business center given all the stationary and supplies already in the desk unit. I was on executive floor so was able to use the exec lounge on the 19th floor. Great setting for one on one meetings with food that was so nice I didn't bother to go to restaurant for breakfast or lunch. Tried the gym; very clean and modern machines. All hotel staff are very friendly and helpful when asked questions. My room faced the Marina so I could watch the Sands Casino grow daily. It got pretty hot in the room in the afternoon so had to crank air con all the wat to 18 degrees in order to work at desk which is right by the window. My only complaints: Given relatively high cost of hotel room, why does hotel of this caliber still try to charge Sing $30 per day for internet? Also there was a bit of a long wait for taxi at peak rush hour times. Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: RSTravels2
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT hotel. I would definitely recommend the hotel for its very friendly staff and high standards. The hotel location and room view was superb. Our room was simply beautiful. I cant see anyone being disappointed with their stay here. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: defseptermber
Reviews.Content: Very spacious, tastefully decorated room in excellent condition with a stunning view over the harbour. Very friendly stuff. The breakfast is excellent with a large choice of Chinese, Indian and Continental buffet type food. The breakfast room is very tastefully decorated. However, if you prefer you can also have breakfast outside. The hotel does not have a lobby though, which is a bit of a disappointment. Recommended. P.S. Please note, the swimming pool is currently (April 2010) under renovation. So you have to go to another hotel's pool.

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason this is ranked so high!”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 11apr-14 apr and it has been one of the nicest stays we have experienced. I have stayed at several luxury resort chains and boutiques but can only remember a few where the service was as good as it was in this hotel. Apart from the room, the ratio of staff to guests is very high so things get done quickly and there is always someone around. They catered to our every need even when we had to leave our luggage for 2 days with them due to an unforseen emergency . The location is very nice though the nearest MTR is 15 mins away however that walk is through an adjoining mall and cabs a really cheap. I would return to this hotel every time because the rooms are spacious, the food is good and the service is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent in every way”
Reviews.Author: Thousandeurist
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Mandarin Oriental. It was the treat of our honey moon and every bit exceeds the high expectations we had. It was, without any doubt, the best experience ever. It makes me re-visit some of my previous hotel reviews, as if there is a 5 score, it is the MO who deserves it. I might say that this hotel is in a price-category I am not use to, as value for money is an indicator I consider when travelling. There, my perspective might lack of experience. However, I tend to believe that my comment is still valid. Because we informed the special occasion I mentioned above, we were upgraded to a harbour-facing room, which had a great view over the skyline and the harbour. They also presented us with a bottle of sparkling wine, a bouquet of tropical fruits and a delicious tea. And the most awesome of all the treats we received: I was exhausted and feeling dizzy due to all the hours flying. It was notice by a member of the staff while in the elevator to our room: he offered to send a tea service to restore my senses. It took 5 minutes before a tray arrived with the most delicious tea I’d never tried. And it worked!! The service was simply outstanding: fresh from arrival the doorman was polite and courteous, the receptionist professional and pleasant (he come with us all the way up to our room), all the staff we have the opportunity to meet from the breakfast room to the Morton’s Bar or the cleaning lady, all are phenomenal. Breakfast was excellent. Food delicious and in a variety that can only spoilt yourselves with choices. The hotel itself has an understated elegance. All subtle, full of nuances, cool in every way. The room was lovely. Modern, stylish. High quality fabrics and all the amenities you might need, and more! There is just one minor critic: there is no free of charge Internet connection I would certainly recommend the Mandarin Oriental to everyone. It is a truly gem, a place where you experience how the best customer service should be like.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel if your working close to Robinson road.”
Reviews.Author: Amit_Kawatkar
Reviews.Content: The hospitality at Mandarine is one of the best I have ever experienced. Ppl can enjoy the free wi fi facilities when you are on your business trip and it has a good choice of rooms when it come to smoking and non smoking rooms

Reviews.Title: “went here twice”
Reviews.Author: fashionbabe
Reviews.Content: the first and second stay we got a 1 bedroom suite, very nice indeed. the spa was nice, overall was nice, no complaints. We love the the Mandarin Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelr
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel has a bland corporate look, the staff provide a warmth that creates a good experience. Stayed on a high floor (right below the club floor) overlooking the harbor - very nice room with great views. Unfortunately the pool was closed, so couldn't use it or hte spa facilities. The breakfast buffet was outstanding. It's so large that they give you a tour the first time you eat there. The dining room staff was also spectacular. A couple of nits: never received turn-down service & the concierge wasn't up to par. Although the location is a little further away from the center of town, I enjoyed the waterfront location. Was able to take advantage of a music festival. Also, Glutton's Bay is a great aggregation of food hawker stands across the street (hint: take 3-4 people - 1 to secure table, 1 for drinks & 1-2 to buy food, plus you get to sample more food).

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: Devilmasa
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Singapore for shopping or night life, you can get other hotel on Orchard Rd. instead of this one. But if you just want to have a peaceful and delighted vacation or for all kinds of business, this is definitely a nice place to stay. The location here is not so noisy like Orchard Rd. , the view is also great here if you choose the bayside room. Room is cosy and the bed is comfortable. Showers and tubs are great and water pressure is also make me satisfied. And if you still want a shopping trip on Orchard, it's 5 mins to walk to metro station, and after 4 or 5 stops you are on the Orchard rd.

Reviews.Title: “It was all disconnected”
Reviews.Author: Jaser197
Reviews.Content: In anticipation to celebrate my 10th wedding anniversary, I made a phone call to the hotel hoping to book a room with them. It was all wrong from the start! I called the main line and tried to get connected to the reservation department. The lady who answered my call then put my call through to another department. Someone from Sales picked up and the Sales person told me that I was connected to the wrong department and transferred me back to telephone department. Instead of connecting me straight to the reservation department, I was put back to telephone department. For the 3rd time, I was transferred to another. This time around, I was being placed on hold for a good few minutes. It might be only a few minutes but it certainly felt like eternity with all the transferring. In the end, I gave up and decided to have my 2nd wedding anniversary at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Not a Ton of Personality, If That Matters.”
Reviews.Author: NorCal8
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - very clean (like Singapore), and tremendous service. We checked in at 2am due to a late flight - staff met us at the car, walked us directly to our rooms and processed check-in at the desk in the room - very impressive. Our package (i think many do), included breakfast each morning at Melt Cafe - this is a specactular breakfast - really can't say enough good about it. We looked forward to it every morning - full buffett of basically anything you could think of, and excellent service. Rooms were very nice, very clean. Housekeeping made three stops daily - even put a new book mark in the book at my bedside for me. Ate a nice dinner at Morton's, in the hotel. It was excactly like a Morton's in the US - not sure if that's a good thing or a bad thing, but completley indistinguishable from a Morton's in Chicago or Denver or LA. They do have a very cool pagoda type bar outside the restaurant though. At the least, stop in there for a drink. Complaints: - Elevators are a little slow, and its the only way to get around. - We booked a conference room for a meeting, which included a toilet. There were some HUGE roaches in there. I told the staff (attentive as always), and it was quickly handled - but man, there are some big f'ing roaches in Singapore. - The pool was closed for a re-model. No mention of that on the website, which was a bummer. They offered use of teh pool at a neighboring hotel, but who wants to walk for a quick swim?

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but lacking some personality”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, with nice rooms (spacious as well) and great buffet breakfast (even though not as magnificent as many reviews have pointed out, honestly I have seen better buffet breakfast, like the one at the Ritz-Carlton in Jakarta or at various JW Marriott properties just to name fews). Location is good, as the hotel is directly connected to the Marina Square mall. Service is very attentive, and I liked the efforts they make to remember your name at both Axis (which offers incredible views of downtown!) and at Melt. The room was spacious and elegantly appointed, the bed very comfortable. What I didn't like is the lack of personality the hotel demonstrates. The lobby area is shabby and uninspiring at best, and it surely pales to the one of the Ritz-Carlton Milennia for instance. The swimming pool was closed for renovaton, but they offer access to a neraby hotel's pool. All in all though, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ASB2013
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to Thailand and had high expectations of our stay, having read many great reviews of the hotel. It is safe to say that the hotel exceeded all our expectations. From check-in to check-out the staff could not have been more courteous and the concierge was especially helpful in giving us ideas for tourist activities! The room was very comfortable, good size and had every amenity we could need. Location as well was great, not that anything is that far away in singapore. My one suggestion to a potential visitor is to take a harbour view room as the view of the marina is sensational. Worth every penny, if only for that view.

Reviews.Title: “will be going back”
Reviews.Author: megel
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night in a Club Room with Harbour View and it was amazing. We were personally greeted on arrival by a lady who escorted us directly to our room whilst our luggage was taken up for us. We had much some requests about the room all of which were adhered too and we were given a tour of the club lounge facilities and provided cool drinks immediately. It was definitely worth paying the extra to have access to the club lounge, the staff were extremely attentive. The range of food at breakfast, during the day and in the evening was amazing. We did not need to go out to dinner at all due to the amazing selection of hors'dourves on offer, and probably could have gotten away with no lunch if we hadn't specifically wanted to go to a restaurant. We got free wi-fi as well as use of a printer which we needed and all the while being paid attention to by the staff to ensure we were not wanting for anything. The rooms were lovely, comfortable and clean. The bed was the best bed we slept on for our entire 6 week holiday. The fresh fruit in the room each time it was made up was a lovely touch. We utilised the late check out (which is until 8pm, though we only used until 6) which is an incredibly useful feature. Would definitely stay again when/if we return to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Good for late check out”
Reviews.Author: louisa1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on our way back to UK. Picked because it had guaranteed late check out until 8.00p.m for club floor rooms as our flight was at 11.00 p.m. Booked harbour view room which did have the most amazing view, especially at night. Room on the small side and bathroom also small with only one small basin and shower small by far east standards. Nice touch of hot tea in a little box on arrival. Club floor had excellent service but the lounge was again small, quite narrow and just didnt have the views that the Conrad had. Drinks very good and staff superb, afternoon tea and evening nibbles disappointing. Breakfast in main restaurant excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with amazing views, decor and rooms”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyCoventry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on my way to New Zealand. What a stunning hotel. The reception area, rooms, bar, dining rooms were second to none. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious with amazing views and lots of little extras to make it special. The breakfast was out of this world - indeed a breakfast for every corner of the world was catered for there. The staff just seemed to glide around and tables were cleared and tidied before you knew it. Wonderful service. I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone stopping over and indeed for an extended weekend break. The sight-seeing was very easy to organise and the city itself was so clean and easy to get around with bus, boat and metro facilities. I had a two day ticket which was worth every penny because you just hop on and off as and when you want or see something of interest. It goes without saying the shopping was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Mandarin Oriental Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Princessmanagement
Reviews.Content: best Hotel in Town, i love all the Mandarins of this World !

Reviews.Title: “Believe what you Read!!!”
Reviews.Author: Raqs_Sydney
Reviews.Content: I visited TripAdvisor to check this hotel's ratings before booking for a few nights before a business conference. All the reviews were fantastic and I would agree - this place is excellent! I was sad to leave - the conference was at the Fullerton Hotel (really disliked that hotel). The service, the rooms, the location - everything was just fantastic. Especially liked when they would return to your room before you did of an evening to turn on the lights, and the Asian inspired music through your room - what a nice way to find your room on your return to your home away from home before bed!

Reviews.Title: “To awake and look out at the view over the city was worth the money alone.....”
Reviews.Author: atholebrose
Reviews.Content: I had checked online before visiting, so knew what I wanted - Marina View overlooking the city - just fantastic.
