On arrival, the hotel said we had been upgraded to a majestic club room on the 18 floor overlooking the ocean - and a building site - new marina complex due for completion later this year! We said no and were shown to our originally booked room on the 20th floor. Half the size (still large by UK standards) but not disappointed - with a view to die for!. Our first visit here and we were treated like royalty throughout! if anyone is looking for that special treat with a touch of the orient, in a very central location in Singapore then the Mandarin Oriental is for you. The only negative was the closure of the swimming pool for upgrading on our first day. Guests were to be catered for in neighbouring hotels but apparently due for re-opening in 3 months. We were stopping over en route home from Australia for two nights and this was the icing on the cake. If ever the chance to visit Singapore in the future, the Mandarin Oriental's for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, food, and room: just book it.”
Reviews.Author: Martin1249
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 3 nights over Chinese New Year, on our way to New Zealand. Service exemplary, room excellent, and the best nights sleep I've ever had in a hotel. Range of food at breakfast has to be seen to be believed (try the home made yoghurt). Also ate in the Italian restaurant which has a competant maitre'de and excellent food. Clarke Quay is a short walk along the quayside walkway. There's also quick access to the shopping centre via a passage/ door to the front left of hotel (easy to miss and not very well signed). If I had to find fault it would be: pool area needs some updating; more seats in the foyer area.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fisherontour
Reviews.Content: The service was superb from the moment we were picked up at the airport by our chauffeur (limo return transfer to airport included as part of the package booked with the hotel). The personalised in-room check-in whilst sipping china tea was very refined and relaxing. The service (and food) in the Cafe Melt and Mortons restaurant was excellent. All staff delivered service that was personal and never seemed to be a chore. Even when the reception staff were bidding us farewell, they were inviting us to stay as long as we wanted, as if we were friends rather than paying guests. Also included in our package was use of the very elegant Oriental Club Lounge where cocktails and d'oeuvres were served before dinner. Internet access & newspapers, and light refreshments were available throughout the day and the staff were gracious and very helpful. Our room was smaller than expected for this grade of hotel; space being at a premium in Singapore. The bed however was huge and very comfortable. The hotel's location is good for shopping at Marina Sq and Suntec, but otherwise is not in a particularly attractive part of the city. We would certainly stay at the Oriental again. My rating would have been closer to 5 if the room had been larger and the hotel situated in a nicer location.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit - even better than last time”
Reviews.Author: mookiejay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MO Singapore last year and absolutely loved it, so this time we decided to head back again. Unbelievably, it was even better. We landed at 6am and was driven to the hotel in yet another fantastic Mercedes. As it was quite early in the morning, I was quite worried that we might not get a room until closer to their normal check in time. But nothing to worry about! They actually upgraded us to a Club room so that we can get in there and relax. To be honest, I barely left the hotel in the two days that we were there. The bar was great - very good service; the waitress had poorer English than most but she certainly tried her best, and kept the drinks and nibbles coming. The breakfast was great as always. Unfortunately the pool was undergoing maintenance at the time, so we couldn't go, but everything else more than made up for it. I won't bother staying anywhere else in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: kikika
Reviews.Content: Building / grounds : Big brownish building. From the inside, it looks like what was supposed to be futuristic in the 70s'. Neither very cosy nor beautiful. It's been fully renovated in 2005. Location : Not very convenient during daytime as it is quite far from the shopping spots and the MRT but walking to the esplanade is quite enjoyable during the evening. It is a nice 15mn walk to Clark Quay. Service - check-in / out : Front desk staff seems to confuse efficiency and cursory manners. When entering the room, I was disappointed by the view and the lady showing us around told us 'next time, you should book a better room if you want a better view". Thank you for the advice. Duly noted ! When I handed over my room key to check-out, I've been told that "all had been already taken care of" (I had prepaid the stay) and ... that's it. No "thank you for staying with us" or "hope to see you again" or even "goodbye" . This is not a big deal but it surprised me to say the least. Hopefully, the lady concierge was very kind and helpful. Room : We had a premier sea view room. As previously said, the view had really nothing special but the room was nicely furnished and confortable. Bathroom is also nice and convenient. The bed was really confortable. Breakfast : Huge selection to choose from. A lot of indian dishes, dim sums, fresh juices, pancakes made to order, egg station ... Everything was quite good except the bakeries : croissants and pains au chocolat were quite dry and tasteless. The best spot to seat is the small outdoor patio as it is a bit noisy and dark inside.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable service, nice location and great food”
Reviews.Author: Y0U-G0
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week in the Oriental Club room. The room is worth the extra few bucks because you're able to use the Oriental Club Lounge, which offers breakfast in the morning (avoid the crowds at the main restaurant), then tea-time with snacks and drinks during the day and a champagne cocktail hour in the evening with great appetizers and a selection of drinks and cocktails. All for free. Add free wi-fi, which actually works good all the time and you got yourself great business value. The staff is extremely friendly, they remember your name immediately and remember your "usuals" (would you like a double espresso, sir?"). They never say no, they try to facilitate even the oddest requests. Rooms are well kept, the amenities are fine, but the furniture is relatively plain. The TV has surround sound and you can plug your iPod to the TV (all cables in the room) and listen to your music while taking a shower. The bar is good and they even had live jazz music on the weekend. The Italian restaurant by a Michelin star chef is great (it's "okay" if you're used to European haute cuisine) and the hotel restaurant where they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner is better than expected. If you're a formula one fan this should be a good location for you, because the track runs right around the hotel. But the location is convenient even if you're not there for the race. The AC is quite noisy and blows right above the bed, so it's best to turn it off at night, but this way the room get pretty hot. That's probably the only negative thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the others this is the one to go for”
Reviews.Author: araf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on the way back from Aus. Notified a significant wedding anniversary in advance and got upgraded to a harbour view suite on floor 16. Greeting letter and S$125 bottle of red wine at room service prices provided. Service was as good as you could get from waiters to concierge to desk staff. Could have sat for hours drinking in the view over the harbour. Never seen such a breakfast choice with the abilty to sit outdoors if you wished. Staff very attentive. remembering drink preferences after the first day and folding napkin up whenever you left the table. Free bottled water in rooms and free fruit replenished each day. One let down was not to do with the hotel but the guests who did not adhere to the requested dress code but appeared in shorts at meal times. Just not up to scratch! Taxi prices very cheap but erratic despite meters. Taxi from airport to hotel S$25. From hotel to airport S$13.20. Taxi from Chintown to Hotel S$14.20! Don't understand it! Singapore Sling in hotel bar S$20. Raffles S$29.45. Capuccino in hotel S$10. Would go back to the hotel without any hesitation and it had given me the taste to try some other MO sites. Singapore great if you like shopping but not much else. Little India worth a visit. Went to Battle Box in Fort Canning Park could have been great but all commentary broke down and the whole thing was a shambles and not worth the money with no refund being offered. MO pool out of action for a couple of months but arrangements made with Mandarin Bay and Pan Pacific were more than adequate. The trick of remembering guest names is not as clever as it appears as whenever you are greeted at the restaurant they ask your room number and then covertly print out a slip of paper from the terminal with your name disclosed, they then refer to this on the way to the table without you knowing and address you by name. Good trick though!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Service, a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: yetis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but certainly starting to show its age, relative to the newer Mandarin's around the world. As usual, the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless luxury”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer123
Reviews.Content: What a treat to stay at the Mandarin Oriental. The surroundings are excellent, as you'd expect. The staff are incredible and really seem to go above and beyond to ensure guest satisfaction. An initial problem with my room was quickly fixed with a move to another room. All meals I had in the hotel were accompanied by a 'little extra' with the 'chef's compliments'. Top marks to housekeeping and the staff at Melt restaurant for flawless service - particularly to waiter named John who gave outstanding service. Thank you Mandarin Oriental!

Reviews.Title: “MO Singapore dreadful example of a great hotel chain.”
Reviews.Author: gumjoytravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dishonest to the Mandarin Oriental Brand name. I was a "giant fan" of the mandarin oriental hotels always basing my next holiday destination on where there hotels are located around the world HOWEVER the Mandarin in Singapore is a complete disappointment. Here is a run down of my disappointments with the hotel; 1. Its chinese new year so I requested a sea view room to enjoy the fireworks- however the hotel upgraded me to a room them deemed 'better' which is in the back of the hotel and had a terrible view of the backside of another building. When I requested the room I wanted I was told there wasn't one available and I would be stupid to want to change/ downgrade rooms. 2. When checking in I was told my room rate had increased from 325 to 619 Singapore dollars. I had to contact my travel agency twice and then forward on my reservation by email to hotel which consequently cost me the difference as I need to pay for the hotels insanely expensive internet service as well as having to make long distance phone calls. 3. The concierge at the Mandarin in Singapore is a joke. At 10am I requested that the conceirge could make me a reservation for a restaurant that evening! At 530pm I received a note from the concierge saying that the restaurant stops taking reservations after 3pm as its an automated online something or other and I would not get a reservation, however I asked for help at 10am! I therefore contacted the restaurant personally and had no issues making a reservation at 7. Cleanliness; The hotel is spot on. Its very clean. Location; The hotel is very convenient Rooms; A total disappointment. I was told the hotel has just undergone a major refurbishment however the rooms were nothing special. Value; Abysmal Sleep quality; At least the bed and the bed sheets were nice. After crying myself to sleep I slept great. The swimming pool area was also a construction site with half of pool area roped of and with construction dust blowing into your face. FANtastic I personally love the Mandarin Oriental hotel chain. I frequent many of their hotels around the world however my experience at this hotel has left me rather jaded. I will certainly never stay at this hotel again, and I will also in the future consider other hotels in other cities not just the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Final leg of long-haul holiday”
Reviews.Author: craigie2
Reviews.Content: The above hotel was the last one before flying back to the United Kingdom and it was fabulous. Our room was fantastic, just as shown on the internet. We were upgraded at no extra cost. How lucky was that! I think the only difference was in the view as the friends we were with had paid for an upgraded room whilst we had opted for a different view room which was slightly cheaper. Breakfast was included in the overall cost and was a sight to behold. I've never seen such a selection to choose from. It catered for all nationalities. The presentation was superb. The staff were excellent. We were escorted to our room on arrival by a beautiful lady in traditional dress. The toiletries etc were great too. It is five star and thoroughly deserved that rating. Wonderful all round.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the world for sure”
Reviews.Author: kalli12
Reviews.Content: Everything to remember for and talk about this hotel is more than fabulous. The one word that came to my mind when I first got there was "exquisite." We were overwhelmed by its exquisite oriental touch everywhere and pleasantly attentive service. It knows what we travellers want when we go to another region. It's not just another high-end hotel with universal modern touch that you can meet wherever in the world. It brags a consistent oriental atmosphere with glamour and richness of Indo-China region and we loved it! We stayed in one of the rooms on the club floor for the Christmas. The room was spacious, and the furniture and fabrics show extraordinary taste of the region. Shining dark wood, elegantly colorful embroidery- Just delicous. And it had a window wall facing the seaside with Fullerton and Merlion in the view. The view gets fantastic at night. You don't want to fall asleep. The welcome tea and fruit was also beautifully set. They also have hung on the door knob a cute mini bag with a paper Christmas tree decorated with tiny beads on the surface. It had some chestnuts in it, implying the season. The breakfast was superb! And if you stay on the club floor, you can be served breakfast in the club lounge, too. On the morning of departure, we asked to be served in the lounge around 5:00 a.m. I wans't expecting much. I just wanted to stuff empty stomach real quick before we leave for a long way back. But when we were served, we were so moved by the quality of food and friendly service of the staff. I just don't want to come back. I've also stayed at the popular Ritz Carlton Singapore. It's also a very good hotel, but the Mandarin Oriental appealed to us much more with its exquisiteness and pleasant characteristics. As everyone knows, Singarpore is "the city" to note when it comes to accommodation levels. The Mandarin Oriental Singapore is one of the best in the city bien sur!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, facilities and location”
Reviews.Author: Jock5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the harbour and next door to Marine Square Mall. It is a short walk to the Singapore Flyer and about 10minutes from Raffles. The room we had was located on the 20th floor with a harbour view. The outside wall of the room was an entire window with the most magnificent view. The room was comfortably furnished with a 40" flat screen TV which had all major channels. We had breakfast in the hotel and the buffet was exceptional. There is a 25 meter swimming pool although on our second day it was closed for refurbishment. We were offered and alternative pool in a neighbouring hotel. The service is first class. The staff are, without exception, friendly and helpful. This hotel is one of the more expensive hotels in Singapore but represented exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, Exceptional, Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: brickello
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental Singapore deserves all the great reviews and more. It truly is one of the best hotels in this part of the world. Beyond the amazing rooms and the topnotch facilities, what truly sets it apart is the exceptional service the attentive yet unobtrusive staff provide. My partner and I got a great deal on the hotel from gtahotels.com, which was practically almost a steal. Upon arrival, we were upgraded from a Deluxe Room to a Premier Harbor View Room which provided breathtaking views of the Singapore skyline. The bed was huge and was great to sleep on. The bathroom was immaculately clean with separate bath and shower. It would have been nice to have rain shower heads though. The breakfast buffet at Melt was overwhelming, providing a myriad of delicious choices from Continental to Chinese to Indian breakfast fare. And the swimming pool, though a little too plain, was a great place to lounge and chill under the hot Singapore sun. The complimentary water, sorbet and fruits served made the experience even more delightful. The hotel is located a bit out of the way from major places of interest in Singapore like Orchard Road, the Civic Centre, etc. It's about a ten-minute walk to the nearest subway station. But this gives it a bit of that exclusivity factor. And besides, immediate areas like The Esplanade and Marina Square provide great places to hang out at night. The rooftop bar at the Esplanade is particularly a wonderful spot to chill and spend time with friends amidst the spectacular views of the harbor. As mentioned, the best part of the hotel is the exceptional service. The staff never fails to make you feel special, whether you're having breakfast at Melt or reading your favorite book by the poolside or simply just entering the hotel. Everyone is polite, pleasant and is always willing to please. The staff at the poolside were especially commendable, offering to open the umbrella shade and giving out complimentary goodies every now and then. This brand of service has made me a fan of the hotel and I expect it to be the same in all other Mandarin Oriental hotels. I look forward to staying again at The Mandarin Oriental Singapore and would definitely recommend this to everyone who's visiting Singapore, whether for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: trueblueChester_Uk
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled up in the car we knew that we were going to enjoy this stay. We stayed for 3 nights at the end of our 3 week holiday before heading home. Easy check in process and the room was very large with a great bathroom. All the staff seemed to know your name the minute you arrived. The pool was really well located although it did get a bit windy sometimes. Water and papers/mags were available by the pool as well as fresh fruit and the odd frozen grapes on a stick! The breakfast was manic as there were a lot of chinese in the hotel for chinese new year but we found a quiet spot in the outside garden area. We had the Valentines meal in Dolce Vita which is run by a Michelin star chef. The food and wine was fantatsic and some of the best tastes we have ever had. I would recommend dining here if in singapore. Another highlight was the Axis bar which overlooked the new year celebration area. You get an happy hour and complimentary canapes to go with them. If you didnt like the canapes (as some were spicy) they would make you some, within reason, to your liking. Its in a great location by the marina and a healthy walk down to boat quay and then onto clark quay where all the nite life is.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with great service in good location”
Reviews.Author: Littlefrog13
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in Singapore at this hotel, it was in a good location near to shops, restaurants and bars, the hotel itself was modern and airy inside with nice decor. Our room and bathroom was spacious, clean and nicely designed - again with all mod cons. All of the staff that we encoutered were very attentive, helpful and polite, it was clear that they want to ensure good service is a priority at this hotel. We only ate breakfast in the hotel, the choice was vast and what we ate we enjoyed very much. We also used room service twice for snacks, this was quick and efficient and again tasty. We didn't use any of the other facilites as we were to busy exploring Singapore, however the pool area, restaurants and spa all looked very nice, and if I were staying longer I would have certainly taken advantage of these facilities. Singapore is lovely and clean and we found to be a safe place to visit with plenty to see and do. I would definetly stay at this hotel again when I am next in Singapore, and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: cruiser8211
Reviews.Content: After travelling for nearly 5 years, this is the first time I have been compelled to write a review after staying at a hotel. I was upgraded from a Club room to an Ocean Suite room which had the most stunning view over the harbour basin. The room and bathroom were well appointed and service throughout the stay was perfection

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!”
Reviews.Author: princessdrea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at MO properties in Hong Kong and Hawaii, and choosing to stay at the property in Singapore for one week was a no brainer. We were definitely not disappointed. Our trip was divided between business and family visits/leisure, and the hotel acocmmodated both aspects of our visit beautifully. The staff was friendly, polite, deferential - the Axis Lounge staff greeted us by name after our 2nd visit, and remembered our "regular" nightcap order. When they were unable to get us a table for dim sum in their chinese restaurant, they managed to get us an immediate reservation at a very well renowned restaurant that had already told us they were booked. The few times we were able to spend an hour or 2 at the pool we were delighted with the pool staff and the amenities offered - iced water, iced fruit, international newspapers and magazines. The MO in S'pore became our home away from home and I will definitely be staying there on our next trip - they made us feel like rock stars.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: pdjlk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights at the Mandarin Oriental in early January having booked with C-Trip and it was the best value short stay that we have ever had, we only paid £205 and it was worth twice that. We had a Seaview room in which was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and it had a great view of the Singapore Flyer and the new complex that is being built. I would love to know how the guys at the foyer of the hotel managed to know my name every time I met them. I think the way to judge a good hotel is that if everyone who is staying regardless of how much they pay is treated the same and this hotel does this superbly. Lastly I wish I could have the breakfast every day as it was exeptional. Thankyou to all Paul and Leita

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Service!”
Reviews.Author: Hatebeinghome
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental in mid January as a stop over on our way home. We arrived from a long flight very early in the morning and were able to check in straight away. We were also upgraded to a Mandarin room. The rooms are a good size, with plasma tvs and very comfortable beds. There is a well equipped desk with a good lighting for the business traveller. The bathroom is large and has lovely ginger and lemon toiletries. From beginning to end the service level was faultless. Every member of staff greets you and is very pleasant. English language skills were perfect and as a result our needs were effectively dealt with. This is not always the case in hotels in Singapore. We had buffet breakfast at Melt and did not experience any of the concerns noted regarding queues. However, we did eat towards the end of the breakfast session and it was very busy. Service staff were attentive and removed plates promptly. There is a very extensive range of options for buffet breakfast including egg station, asian selections such as noodles, dumplings and congee, indian food, pancakes and waffles cooked to order, a wide range of yoghurts and fruit and fresh juice bar with smoothies. Beverages on offer extended to lattes and expressos which was much better than the standard percolated coffee. Breakfast is a little expensive so a breakfast inclusive rate would be preferrable. The hotel is connected to Marina Square shopping centre which links to Suntec and Raffles City which offers plenty of shops, restaurants and other facilities. Turn right at the front entrance and a flight of stairs leads you into the shopping centre. When in Singapore we normally stay close to an MRT station. While it is about a 10 minute walk to the MRT through Marina Square and Raffles City shopping centres it is all airconditioned and we had no problems getting around. Taxis were readily available and are cheap. The pool area is nice with good views. The pool is not large but functional with 1 metre depth to one side and 2m to the other. Pool staff were prompt with seating and towels and brought chilled bottled water and face towels. There is a well equipped change room with lockers, showers, hair dryers and toiletries. If you have a late check out you can store luggage and use the pool and change room facilities to freshen up before your flight. One suggestion would be free internet or a terminal to check in for flights. A very enjoyable stay! We would definately stay at the MO again!

Reviews.Title: “about it”
Reviews.Author: pranikonda
Reviews.Content: Its very great staying in this hote.Its amazing and the services of this hotel are excellent and the food is also very delicious especially sea food

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: travel1028
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights. It's an exceptionally clean and sleek hotel with extremely polite staff and fantastic service. Check in was quick and easy, we were upgraded without even asking, the room was very clean with a large and comfy bed, the view was incredible, the bathroom was pretty plush. Location is fine and the doormen get you a taxi within seconds. All staff members go out of their way to be polite and accommodating and will always wish you a good morning/evening and rush to open doors for you and call lifts. Our early check out was made more bearable by the coffee, tea, juice and yummy biscuits they offered us whilst we waited for our taxi to the airport. The pool is small considering it's a large hotel but it rains so often in Singapore we didn't get a chance to use it anyway! I can't comment on the bars, breakfast etc as we didn't experience them but overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent user of MO hotels and I have stayed here numerous times. I was not totally satisfied this time and will probably change hotels. Our room was nice with a good view. The breakfasts are amazing and the staff at breakfast is great. However, at check-in we were not offered tea as is usual with MO hotels. Also, the hotel staff seemed over-busy with tour groups. As we paid full price, I expect the usual top-rate MO service, which we did not receive. We had dinner at the Chinese restaurant at the Fullerton and the level of service was significantly better than the MO.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel With Awesome Views of Marina Bay”
Reviews.Author: ginocosme
Reviews.Content: While the Mandarin Oriental, Singapore is certainly not cheap, our week's stay was well worth the money spent. Everything from the airport pick up, check in (which for us was done in our room instead of at reception), the glorious rooms (we stayed in a Premier Harbour View, which have the best views of Singapore and Marina Bay), the excellent breakfast buffet, one of the best cantonese restaurants, and excellent, friendly staff, this hotel has ended up as one of the best my partner and I have stayed in - and we travel a lot! Get a room on one of the top floors, splurge on a Premier Harbour View room (well worth the extra cost) and enjoy not only the hotel but Singapore - she's a fantastic city. One word of warning though - pack light, you'll be taking home lots of shopping, Lots!

Reviews.Title: “OK Oriental”
Reviews.Author: leatours
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in the Mandarin Oriental between flights. We selected the Hotel based on its high Trip Advisor ranking and wanting to experience staying in a different location having spent four nights staying in the boutique Scarlet Hotel in Chinatown earlier in our holiday. We had booked an airport / hotel car transfer through the Hotel before our holiday. In hindsight we would have been better to have organised our own transport as the charge was considerably more than we had paid for the same service to the Scarlet, however this was offset somewhat by the cheaper room rate. Taxis are so cheap and well regulated in Singapore, that private airport transfers are not really necessary anyway. The Hotel is located at the business end of town, so is probably not the best position for accessing the Orchard road shopping malls, and the nearest MRT station is a fair walk. Within 6 months however the huge new Marina Bay Casino complex will open nearby which will dramatically change the dynamic of this area, and this will also include a new MRT station within easier access to the Hotel. The property is certainly typical of the old style American Hotels popular in the 80’s, but the rooms have relatively new furnishings, and are large and comfortable. The service was very friendly and professional, check in formalities were completed in our room while our luggage was delivered. There are a number of restaurants within the Hotel which as foodies we found to be either too expensive or uninspiring, so we ended up dining in the Lighthouse Restaurant located on top of the nearby Fullerton Hotel. The nightime view was spectacular, matched by the quality of the service and the excellent food. The next morning we also discovered a number of restaurants within walking distance along a short street connecting the Millenia and Suntec shopping malls behind our Hotel. The Hotel breakfast buffet in the morning was certainly one of the most extensive we have experienced, however its popularity is its downfall, it was so busy that there were long queues waiting to be seated and also at the chefs egg cooking station. Fortunately there were so many food choices, alternatives were easy to find. One of the highlights of our trip was experiencing a fish foot massage (located on the overpass connection between Millenia tower and Marina square adjacent to the Hotel). This quite unique experience requires you to place your feet into a tank containing hundreds of small fish that nibble at your skin removing any dead skin cells. The sensation is very enjoyable and proved a wonderful conclusion to our Singapore stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but be very careful!”
Reviews.Author: SushiMo
Reviews.Content: We were tired after a long flight and just needed to get to our room, unpack, shower and relax for an hour or so. We had pre-booked and pre-paid for an Ocean View room for 11 nights B&B, but on checking in we were told of a special one off offer to join their club. The girl was softly spoken and we both took it as a $150 special one off fee - unaware that it was in fact $150 per night plus taxes - totalling over £800 more on check out - I was horrified as we never used the place that much. The 'free' papers turned up at random - 4 days, we had already pre-paid for breakfasts anyway, never went to afternoon tea, and attended the evening brunch on less than 1/2 the occasions. Admittedly the 8pm checkout for a midnight flight out was included, but paying for one extra night there would have been more logical. Very disappointed with that, it soured the trip and was a complete waste of money for us as we had gone to Singapore to sightsee day and night, not sit in an expensive club. The room was fine, though we did wake up on a couple of mornings to find the bathroom floor covered in water from an overflow, however, it never bothered us too much. Wasn't impressed with the hotel pool, just a bit too stark and small, so we regrettably never used it. Staff were brilliant, always smiling and making you feel special, they looked amazing too. The meals we had were outstanding and we were very pampered, but they were expensive. Annoyed not to be able to have free internet usage, in fact, if we had of had that I doubt we would have used the club at all - it was the only place you could get it. Enjoyed being there, but not ending in tears when faced with the departure bill - way over our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Blueram
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days as a treat for my wife, but it did not live up to the expectations set via the hotel website and the reviews on Tripadvisor. Positives * The hotels has a nice pool which provides some special views of Singapore city centre at night. Not quite as impressive as the Fullerton hotel view, but still pretty nice. * Reception provided on arrival was warm from the Head Porter, all the other porters and reception staff. Negatives * We were waken up at 8:30am on Christmas day with the noise of a jack hammer above our hotel room. On contacting reception, we were told they were unaware of any renovations above our room and would get back to us. We were granted a room change, although the whole process took 2 hours to be completed. During our swim in the evening, we could clearly see that all the rooms on the 12 floor of the building facing the harbour had been covered with a a white tarpaulin – renovations maybe?? We asked one of the pool staff and she said that the renovations were started a week ago and would continue to the new year!! How in world can reception in a 5 star hotel not know which rooms are under renovation and why would they put a couple celebrating their wedding anniversary (or any guest for that matter) underneath a room being renovated? Truly unforgivable! * Not all reception and concierge staff were fluent in English. * Breakfast was a bit of a mad house, especially if you wanted an omelet. * Location may be convenient if you are a business traveller with a convention at Suntec city, but a tourist would need to walk for about 15 minutes to the MRT at Raffles Place. Singapore Flyer is within easy reach though. * The hotel did previously have a brilliant view of Marina Bay, but with the construction of a new football stadium in the bay has significantly affected this view. Unfortunately we will never return to this hotel in Singapore. I would suggest the Grand Hyatt Singapore over this hotel in terms of service, location and comfort anytime. For a little less money, the Hilton Singapore is also very nice, although in need of some slight renovations due to the age of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it...”
Reviews.Author: Kit_rush
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was amazing.. Right from the staff to the location to the view... On check-in we were given a view upgrade.. The rooms are spacious and ours had a nice view.. The staff is extremely courteous and friendly.. We stayed for 3 nights and were returning for another night after a cruise in between.. They gladly stored our bags that we were not taking on the cruise.. We left a small pouch in our room and promptly received an email about it the next day.. The pouch was returned to us during our return stay.. On our return stay, we were to be picked up from the hotel at 5:30 as we had a late evening flight.. On requesting them, we were hoping to get a couple of hours of late check out.. Imagine our pleasant surprise when we were told that we could actually check out at 5:30. !! Overall... An EXCELLENT choice to stay in singapore...

Reviews.Title: “Great Indulgance”
Reviews.Author: AkashaStar
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel in in Singapore harbour. Beautiflu view - Incredible Spa. Fantastic Service. Not cheap by any stretch of the imagination, but after flying 15 hours from Toronto it was worth the splurge. Staff - Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Area, Excellent Service...”
Reviews.Author: maydaymusic
Reviews.Content: Quick to check in, but some problem in the room, and they sorted our right away. Next to Marina Square. But compare to another hotel which i stayed 3 months ago, this 5 star* hotel, is bit old. But it offered a good rate at the time when i did my booking, about USD128 (all in, deluxe room with breakfast). Lobby is not as grand as another hotel close to the area. but it is okay. A bit disappointed. Room is a bit small, not as the picture that i saw on their website. But i was told that our room has been upgraded to a newly renovated...but it looked old .....I wonder...

Reviews.Title: “top class service”
Reviews.Author: ekxplorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as an overnight stopover on the way back to Australia. I booked for a city view room "Club City" and got upgraded to "Club Harbour" at the time of check in. The service at this hotel starts the moment the taxi arrived at the front door. We were asked to leave the luggage there and proceed to the check-in counter, they will be taken to our room. Our check-in was pleasant and fast, we were escorted to the 19th floor where we were seated and offerred drink before completing the check-in process. And our luggage somehow arrived shortly after we got into our room. Everyone is genguinely there to make you feel comfortable and relaxed without overly intrusive. During my sort stay i didn't get a 'No' for any of my request, they strive to do everything they can to meet/exceed my expectation. Our room is on the 19th floor, that's also where the club lounge is. We checked in around 13:00 and left 18:30 the next day. The king bed is comfortable with 3 differrent pillows each has different thickness. There are master switches for the lighting on both sides of the bed, which are handy. The air cond is a bit quirky though - i think(?) it has motion detector to turn itself down if there's no one in the room - i only discovered this 'feature' when our room become stuffy overnight - a quick fix is to wave the arm for help and the cool air will come :). Considering all the benefits we received: afternoon tea, cocktail hour and champaign breakfast, it's damn good value. to other travellers, if you can stretch your budget, it definitely worth it. Definitely will use this hotel again on our next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaNigel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my husband in mid December. The check in staff were extremely effiecient and arranged for our luggage to be taken up to our room and escorted us to the room themselves to make sure everything was OK. We stayed on the 9th floor with a harbour view. And boy what a view, even with the current building work (is there there ever not building works in Singapore harbout?) the view, especially at night, was stunning. Room - was spacious with a proper desk and space to put your suitcases. Decent sized wardrobe and drawers etc to unpack your stuff. Bathroom - very nice indeed. Spotless clean with both a bath and a separate shower. The bathroom was welll stocked with extras. I got blisters on the first day and found plasters in the bathroom, the next day room service had doubled the number as they realized they were needed. Food - we never ate in the restaurants but had room service breakfasts. The breakfast selection is enormous. The menu in the room has many more options than the thing you hang on the door handle. We had the continental breakfasts which were generous and delicious. Location - its a good location for walking around the older parts of the city. Boat Quay is just across the river and is a great place to eat. The chilli or black pepper crab is a must. Car hire - we hired a car to go and visit the more out of the way parts of Singapore. The hotel gives you free parking (give the chit the porters give you when they take the car, to reception when you want to use the car again, they scribble something on it to make sure you don't pay). The car is clearly parked in a cool place, as it is nice and cold when delivered. All in all, a very pleasant and relaxed stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: aikoaikoallday
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels that I've ever stayed at. The staff was the most helpful, friendly and knowledgable that I've ever experienced. You are warmly greeted by each and every member of the hotel staff, yet they manage to be completely unobstrusive. The rooms are well above average, not spectacular, but they are impeccably maintained. Laundry service was quick, poolside service was superb, breakfast at The Melt could not have been better. I cannot say too many good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Business”
Reviews.Author: MDBGLR
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental is located at the heart of the city and is walking distance from the office centres and the malls in singapore. the stay was very comfortable and staff was cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Good to go.”
Reviews.Author: PaulS14
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and good recommendation for sure! Super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCN9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 6 nights during Christmas 2007 and will be going back again this Christmas. We throughly enjoyed our stay there and can say that its one of the Best Hotel's ever where the Service is concerned. We hope our stay this Christmas will be as good.

Reviews.Title: “THE MANDARIN ORIENTAL ACHIEVES EXCELLENCE IN ALL AREAS”
Reviews.Author: KandiManPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for six nights in November and on this occasion had an ocean view room. We have enjoyed fifteen stays at this hotel over the last eight years and all visits, apart from the first stopover stay, have been for a number of days (10 days on one occasion). When we arrived our room was ready with our bedding preferences in place. The staff, beginning with the Concierge, to everyone were courteous,helpful, friendly and were knowledgeable about our preferences. The rooms deserve 5 star rating and we really enjoyed the large flat screen television, surround sound and DVD player. The hotel is located beside the Marina Bay (Resevoir) opposite Theatres on the Bay and adjoining two major shopping malls. It is easy access to wherever you wish to visit around Singapore. We highly recommend the buffet breakfast in the Melt the World Cafe. There are chefs at stations ready to prepare your selections. The friendly staff give exceptional service and remember your preferences. One day a small girl was in the cafe and the chef in the pancake area made and decorated a pancake in the shape of Mickey Mouse and personally delivered it to her at her table. We complimented him on doing such a nice thing and a few days later, on our last day, he presented us with two he had made for us. A new innovation since our last visit is that "Real" coffee made by a barrister is served. We started the day with a wonderful blend of coffee in the form of a cappuccino or whatever. The quality of fruit and juices is consistently excellent. On some previous accasions we have stayed in the Club and you can expect exceptional personal service from the Club manager and her staff. We will be back to our favourite Mandarin Oriental next year for another holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Diarmaid
Reviews.Content: This was our first venture to a Mandarin Hotel and what a fantastic place to stay. I had made a mistake with our booking but the hotel still accommodated us and gave us a fantastic harbour view room with an early check in (we were 5 hours early). The staff were so helpful at all times. The two gents at the entrance who order cabs, etc, were just amazing and always made us feel welcome and always smiled and invariably had something funny to say. Despite the hotel being 5 star, it didn’t have that awful business/stuffy aura that some hotels seek. The room was luxurious and modern. The sound proofing wasn't great however as you can hear the lifts tinkle as they reached our floor. This was the only fault with the room. Breakfast was very impressive with huge variety and excellent service. The hotel charge for internet if you use it for more than 10 minutes, which is a bit unfortunate. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel in the evening as Singapore has so many options and the concierge desk gave us excellent recommendations. We also didn’t have time to visit the spa as we only had 2 days. I'd happily stay at the Mandarin Oriental again and really couldn’t fault the hotel in any significant way.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - 5 star, friendly & helpful staff and a buffet breakfast you have to see to believe”
Reviews.Author: mwnight
Reviews.Content: I read great reviews about the Mandarin Oriental on Trip Advisor before we booked - the reviews were right! I booked through the hotel's website. There is plenty of information no their website. The only thing I couldn't find was the price for transfers to and from the airport but I'm glad I didn't book transfers because a taxi from the airport was inexpensive. I emailed the hotel in relation to the breakfast and received a quick response. The room rate wasn't cheap but I definately got what I paid for. The hotel is centrally located, very close to shopping centres (it backs onto one), a train station and tourist destinations such as the Singapore Flyer (ie: Singapore's "London Eye"), the Merlion on the harbour and the Raffles. It is a quick taxi or train ride to Boat Harbour, Clarke Quay and Orchard Road. We arrived very early in the morning and they gave us a room straight away (7 hours before check-in time). We booked a harbour view room and the view was as good as their website showed. The room was 5 star - it had everything we needed and more (including free bottled water, fruit, newspaper and toiletries such as a toothbrush & toothpaste, shaver, loofa, etc). The staff were very professional, accommodating and helpful. The staff always smiled and said hello each time you passed. Many of the staff remembered our name from the first day on (I have no idea how they do that with so many guests coming and going!). The concierge's recommendations were perfect for us. We booked the Zoo Night Safari and High Tea at the Raffles through the concierge. We went to Singapore for 4 days for shopping and sightseeing. The hotel catered to both holiday makers and business people. I didn't feel uncomfortable not being a business person at this hotel (unlike how I felt at The Marriot in KL when wearing jeans instead of a suit). As for the buffet breakfast - unbelievable. It puts the Vegas buffets to shame! There was something for everyone including Western and Asian food and a variety of bars where you could get things made to order eg: juice, eggs, pancakes & waffles. We didn't get time to try the restaurants, room service, bars, business centre or spa at the hotel so I cannot comment on these. I look forward to staying at this hotel again one day and I would recommend it to anyone visiting Singapore, for any reason. Thank you Mandarin Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Cat_from_Melb
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 3 nights while in Singapore for a conference at Suntec convention centre. The hotel is large but still feels like a calm and cool haven after being out and about in Singapore. I had a Harbour View room which was a lovely room with a great view and good bathroom. It is just a short walk from the convention centre. Breakfast (included in my rate) was very good with a wide variety of cuisines available. In room wireless internewt was included in my rate but I think that except for that business package you have to pay and it is comparatively expensive (USD30 per day). The most impressive thing about the Mandarin, as is the case elsewhere, was the service. Staff were friendly and helpful and remembered guests names in spite of the large size of the hotel. I had a late flight home and they provided both a late checkout of 2pm and access to the fitness centre at 6pm for me to have a shower and change before going to the aiport. I was not in Singapore for long but between breaks in the conference did manage to get some shopping done (Singapore does have an amazing range of shops!). Although I'm sure there are now more edgy, glamourous hotels in Singapore, the understated elegance and high level of service both recommend the Mandarin, particularly if you want to be in walking distance of the convention centre.

Reviews.Title: “I am still a fan. Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tziambra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two days on our way to Malaysia and I wish it was actually longer. We got upgraded to suite and it was great; very large living room, a nice bathroom and an extra toilet. The amenities in the room were also very nice (flat screen TV, DVD etc) and the small details (bath salts, conditioner etc) were appreciated. The breakfast was also very good, especially the fresh fruits and the homemade yogurts. The spa was quite simple, I was expecting more but I do realize that most guests are on business, not leisure. We did not eat at any of the restaurants but had drinks at the bar. Their singapore sling is very good, the rest of the cocktails, I was not impressed with. No problems with service, they were friedly and efficient. The location of the hotel is also good in my mind because it is far from the chaos of Orchard road but close to the MRT station. I was very happy with the choice to stay at this hotel, I would go again. Overal, I am still a fan of the Mandarin Oriental brand.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite There”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: This is a well refurbished early 1980's hotel that is designed along the lines of the Hyatt in The Embarcadero Centre in San Francisco and The Royal Garden Tsim Sha Tsui. The new rooms are really quite pleasant in that sort of dark and beige way that many modern hotels go after. Decent plugs and rip off internet rates as is the norm in Singapore. Lots of small annoying personnel service lapses as is also the Singapore norm. Not cheap for what it is and maybe the Four Seasons will be used next time.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: EdmondHongKong
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Manderin Oriental just now to cerebate our 25th wedding anniversary. We found the service and breakfast excellent. We had a good time and enjoyed very much the atmosphere created by the hotel. This is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “One of our all time favorite hotels - it just gets better each time we stay”
Reviews.Author: Kathy3197
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Singapore. We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel and it's about the 6th time we have done so, though we have stayed at other hotels in Singapore. We just love the Oriental. We had 4 nights with Executive Club. In the 3 years or so since we last stayed at the Oriental, the service (which was always fantastic) has been stepped up another notch. From the time you arrive, to the time you leave, you are "special" at the Oriental. Their staff are exceptionally well trained and nothing is too much trouble. Their location is great, affording wondering views of the marina. It's just a matter of walking out the front door and up a flight of stairs and you can connect through to one huge shopping centre after another. As usual, we dined at both their Chinese restaurant and their Italian restaurant. Both are sensational, especially Cherry Garden which does the most amazing Dim Sum (Yum Cha) on the weekends (WOW - you have to try it). The service at the Executive Club was exceptional (fabulous staff) with good quality wines (and champagne!!) available during the cocktail hours plus a wide variety of spirits. We also had breakfast at the club and it was (as usual) exceptionally good, with breakfast cooked to order and served to your table. All in all - it gets ticks all round - exceptional staff, great location, beautiful decor and rooms. Rooms are average in size but quiet adequate (we've also stayed at the Shangri La and the Ritz Carlton and their rooms are a lot larger) . The bed is really comfortable and the decor is beautiful. The Executive Club is by far our favorite of all the hotels we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional end to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_0n_Tour
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mandarin Oriental with my wife as the last stop off on our honeymoon, we had booked an ocean view room however upon our arrival we were upgraded to a suite free of charge. We arrived at the hotel at 0930 and although check in was not supposed to be until 1400 we were given a complimentary breakfast by the hotel staff until our room was ready. The hotel was fantastic, food was out of this world even the breakfast choice was like taking a world culinary trip. the location of the hotel was great with some decent shopping malls directly on the doorstep and it is in easy walking distance to both little India and Chinatown. The one thing that really impressed us about the hotel was the hospitality and friendliness of the staff, they really added a personal touch and could not do enough for you. This is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed in, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Met my every expectation! Top Location.”
Reviews.Author: PhillipP
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Mandarin on our way to Indonesia. The service we received was one of the best I have ever experienced in the world. We felt like royalty but without losing our privacy. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The transfer from the airport was also great and highly recommend it. I highly recommend rooms with views of the Marina. The hotel served the best breakfast I have had in a hotel so far and the staff are out of this world. Nothing is too much work. I felt that the location cannot be beaten with access to numerous restaurants and sights. If I can be picky, my only two points are that the bathtubs were small for a hotel of this calibre and the wireless internet was far too expensive. I understand that the hotel was not initially built as a Mandarin but was taken over instead, so not an easy option to just enlarge bathtubs. As far as wireless connection is concerned, the hotel replied to my feedback advising that they check with other hotels to make sure they are competitive and they find that their prices are so. My opinion is that the price is high to take advantage of all the business travellers, and even if it is similar to all other hotels, that does not take away from the fact that it is extortionate. That aside, I would most certainly return back to the Mandarin.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Too much luxury for me.”
Reviews.Author: WanderingProfessor
Reviews.Content: I chose to book directly on the Mandarin Oriental website and asked for a car to pick us up from the airport. I think it was a smart move. A Mercedes drove us to MO and we were greeted right on arrival by several staff members. We did not have to check in, went straight to our room that was actually an upgrade to a suite and signed the administrative documents there. The suite was absolutely superb. It was my first time in Singapore so I do not have elements of comparison with other hotels but MO offers incredible luxury. The level of service is perfect (though some staff members are clearly hunting for tips). The breakfast is legendary, combining all sorts of food from sushi to Indian and of course continental. We tried the Chinese restaurant as well, and the level of service was unbelievable, the best I ever experienced anywhere in the world (though I found the food not up to the level). Swimming pool and fitness room are tiny but well equipped. It was a real treat to stay at the MO, though I am not sure I will return. Singapore is so much about money, one is desperately looking for humanity there. MO is perfect but huge and lacking simple charm. If looking for flawless stay in a luxury hotel, look no further. If interested in something quaint and romantic, keep searching. Oh and one more thing. Hotels of this level should stop charging for internet, it makes them look cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location near the bay”
Reviews.Author: GN1962
Reviews.Content: I often stay in Singapore which I used as a hub for my trips in Asia. I tried the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore in June 2009: it is a nice hotel, well located near a bay (nice to jog along). It is not as impressive as the one in Hong Kong and is not much different from other Singapore 4-5* hotels such as the neighbouring Marina Mandarin (another hotel chain). Rooms are reasonably sized and service is as expected for the price range (look for promotions and packages!) and hotel category. The restaurants are a bit disappointing and not up to such an hotel thus the just "Very Good Rating". The outside swimming pool is also a nice place to relay after a long trip from Europe. I would definitely recommend it though I will try the Pan Pacific next (by the way other hotels I visited: the Novotel is well located especially for eating out dinner but I would not recommend it; the Changi Airport Crowne Plaza also has nice big rooms but I would recommend it only for a night).

Reviews.Title: “Still number one....after service recovery...”
Reviews.Author: wockinwod
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the Mandarin Oriental and I was reluctant to return after having had some issues with my booking on my last two stays. I had completed the feedback email and was personally contacted by the Front Office Manager (Amit) who sincerely apologised for the mix up which also seemed to be an issue with American Express Paltinum Travel. I found an excellent deal on line for a Mandarin Grand room inclusive of breakfast so I decided to given them another go. I also wrote to the Front Office Manager to let him know I was returning and arriving early in the morning and asked if there was a chance that my room could be ready early. Not only did he offer this but also indicated that they would upgrade me to a suite. This is what I call service recovery. Amit even came to greet me on check in which I thought was a nice touch. Let me just say that I have always been impressed with the accomodations, staff, level of service, professionalism and quality of this hotel. Its biggest detraction is its location which is just some distance from most things. Again the room was great (see pictures) with a nice big lounge and balcony area. Quite a modern feel and the large flat panel TV and DVD player in the lounge and the bedroom was most useful. The fruit basket, chocolates and evening wine were also a wonderful touch and very much appreciated (and consumed). Also the rooms have lovely big bathrooms with great amenities and wonderful towels (not a big deal unless they are old and scratchy!!). The turndon service is also excellent. Special mention has to go to breakfast at Melt. Although it can be very busy, the food offerings are amazing and always excellent. Added to this is the grace and courteousness of the staff who never fail to disappoint. There is a reason why this hotel rates so highly on trip advisor. It is consistently good and most often excellent. I am, as they say, a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Hotel with immaculate service”
Reviews.Author: rickg6
Reviews.Content: Difficult to compare this hotel to others in Singapore as i have only experienced the Fairmount as an alternative. However as a stand alone observation, i can highly recommend the Mandarin. Will probably suit couples/solo travellers/business people more than families (although the hotel does have a lovely pool area), but if you want high style/comfort in Singapore in a good location (to be fair, i would say other hotels are perhaps slightly better located to the city centre/shopping etc) i would certainly choose to stay here again. The hotel is beautiful inside, very stylish and the staff outstanding. My name was remembered by several members of staff who possibly only met me once previously and i was made to feel extremely welcome and very well looked after. Rooms were well apportioned, modern and comfortable, food superb and all those little things handled efficiently and with no fuss. In racking my thoughts, i really couldn't find fault with anything at all. If you want a top end hotel that compares favourably to anything another top city detsination could offer, you should not be disappointed with the MO in Singapore. As a traveller to Singapore 4/5 times pa i will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but didn't like the location”
Reviews.Author: Family-C-L
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at three very nice hotels in Singapore: Mandarin Oriental, Ritz-Carlton and the Four Seasons, and though I have to say they are all fine hotels, the location plays a key role in my preference. The Mandarin (like the Ritz) is located in an area that, to get anywhere, you must take a taxi, so make sure this does not bother you. It was, however, an issue for me. Though there is a mall that is connected to the hotel, it wasn't a particularly nice mall. This is the main (and probably only) reason why I will not stay here again. So let me preface my review by saying, consider this a critique of the location and not of the hotel. In terms of the hotel itself, the Mandarin is nice. Like the property in Hong Kong, it has an understated elegance, though one area I really disliked is the structure of the walkway to the rooms--- it felt very impersonal, like a business hotel, i.e. a Hyatt. For me, the first impression wasn't very good. My feelings did get warmer as we arrived at our room. We stayed on the executive floor and the room was lovely. A large ceiling to floor window that overlooks the harbor area and a glass partition that separates bathroom from the sleeping area, very modern and designy. High quality fabric slippers and all the amenities you could think of (including a loofah sponge, nice touch). I wonder if I'm the only one but what I continuously find irritating is that Internet is not offered free of charge. It seems to be the case with most 5-star hotels these days, but hopefully that will change. Like another reviewer said, charging for Internet connection these days is like charging for oxygen.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AnitaVag
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mandarin Oriental for a week. Was celebrating our wedding anniversary. Had a harbour view room which had fabulous views over the harbour. Have been to some great hotels around the world and I have to say the MO Singapore has to be one of the best I've stayed at. The rooms are not very big however they were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was amazing. Extensive choice in the buffet area. The hotel has a nice pool and the service was very impressive. Complimentary water at the pool side. Pool staff regularly brought over sorbets, fruit etc. Was given complimentary late check out at 3.00pm as we had a late flight out of singapore. We was also given a complimentary shower room to freshen up after we has checked out. This was good as we were able to shower up before we caught our flight. Overall the MO exceeded my expectations. Was very impressed by the standards of the hotel and its staff. Would definately come back and stay in at this hotel if we ever came back to singapore. I would highly recommend this hotel as I had a really great stay. Also the hotel was in a good location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: suitdude30
Reviews.Content: The service at the Mandarin Oriental Singapore is simply breathtaking, as is to be expected of any MO establishment. I marvel at how management trains its staff, as it clearly shows in their friendliness, attention to detail and initative. The service alone makes me want to return on my next visit to Singapore. The excellent service is evident everywhere in the hotel, but especially in the restaurant, where I enjoyed several delectable buffet breakfasts. Speaking of the breakfast buffet, the MO's spread certainly ranks among the 3 best I have ever eaten, almost on par with the Shangri-la Kuala Lumpur and the JW Marriott Jakarta. Rooms are not the most spacious, and for the prices charged by the MO, I would certainly expect more. However, they are still very quiet, beautifully decorated, and with the usual extensive selection of TV channels, and expensive Internet access. In this day and age, I am disappointed that the MO still charges for Internet access, and a lot at that - S$30 per day, whereas it's free at all Shangri-la hotels and resorts. One of the loveliest aspects of staying at the MO is its architecture - guests soar up the enormous atrium in glass elevators, which makes one feel as if one is flying. Breathtaking. The rectangular swimming pool is perfect for lap swimming (as I love doing every morning), complete with a lane marker. The gym is above-average, with new equipment, but could be improved with a greater selection of weights and apparatus. MO is one of 3 hotels atop Marina Square, a retail complex with countless shopping and dining options, which is in turn linked to the nearby Raffles City complex via an airconditioned subterranean walkway. To get to Orchard Road, a taxi will cost around S$6 (taxis are cheap, clean and plentiful in Singapore), while the Mass Rapid Transit subway trains provide cheap and easy access almost anywhere. Aside from breakfast at the Melt World Cafe, I didn't try any of the MO's restaurants, which include a Morton's Steakhouse and a Chinese restaurant. Make no mistake, the MO is an expensive hotel, but if you are able and willing, it's a quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever ever again!”
Reviews.Author: bmwx6driver
Reviews.Content: we were unlucky enough to be in the hotel while liverpool fc were staying so it was amass with security men. from check in to check out the hotel was dreadful. they tried to fob me off with a lesser room, lied about not having anything better, then admitted that the hotel was over booked due to football fans paying over the odds. eventually we were upgraded. the club lounge was full of liverpool old boys swearing and wearing sports gear. the pool was full of autograph hunters and it was a struggle every time you went out the hotel entrance. the evening buffet is nothing special and its good that we were comped it or i would be complaining even more!! i waited for 30 minutes for a poolside drink, not the staffs fault as they were running around like mice, they just needed extra help. the hotel is very gloomy and really dated, give it a miss or check up on the football tours next time!!

Reviews.Title: “best service,clean but too dark the interior decoration”
Reviews.Author: belShanghai
Reviews.Content: we stay in mandarin oriental for 5 nights deluxe ocean room it was okey not really a great view because of some construction work for casino building,room are very clean and nice bathroom,food are very good but the only thing we complain aboout this hotel is long que for breakfast never seen this for 5 star hotel,doorman are well experience asking which flight,and telling you which terminal in singapore airline you need to get off.

Reviews.Title: “Service as it should be - thank you Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: threebritsabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore at the beginning of October 2009 and we have been captivated by it. It sits on our 'absolutely recommended' list. All staff are attentive, but never intrusive. Nothing is too much effort. Public areas are spotless and the rooms equally so. Treat yourself to a Harbour View Room and soak up the city skyline. We took afternoon tea at the Axis Bar and would commend this to you. In our view, the food was much nicer than at Raffles and the service unquestionably friendlier and more courteous.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night at this hotel recently. It was without doubt one of the best hotel experiences I have had! The hotel was in tip-top condition, and the service was exemplary (right from the doorman to the housekeeping staff). I was upgraded to a harbour-facing room, which had a great view at night. Food was uniformly good. Morton's Bar is worth a visit as they have a happy hour on weekdays for martinis, and free steak sandwiches are handed out! I had dinner at Morton's, where the service was (once again) phenomenal. All in all, I would definitely recommend the Mandarin Oriental to travellers - it is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Tbird60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the end of a long holiday and had a great time. Singapore city is wonderful - great for sight seeing, very clean and very friendly people. The hotel is staffed by helpful, friendly and polite staff and whilst we only had breakfast in the hotel it was a fantastic experience - high quality food and a very wide choice and range. Our deluxe room had a view out to sea and was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located for walking around the city at any time of the day or night - there were no issues about personal safety at all. The hotel has a wonderful pool outside on the 5th floor where the staff cannot do enough to look after you. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel and city and would definitely re-visit if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel simply sets the standards, others should take note”
Reviews.Author: The_Tr8vel_Bug
Reviews.Content: I have to say the service levels from this hotel just blew me away. Every member of staff I spoke to was pleasant/helpful/attentive without being either obtrusive or trying too hard. A frequent business traveller I usually only add comments on TripAdvisor for people to help with holiday plans as I use it so much for the same but if you're going to Singapore for whatever reason, simply stay here and you won't be dissapointed. Business or pleasure- the rooms are excellent, the facilities were gold standard and room service food/concierge services were almost instant wthout any mistakes. Having stayed in JW Marriots/Intercontinentals/Sheratons/Hiltons/Four Seasons all over the world, being on business at these places are very rarely memorable, the Mandarin Oriental certainly was and for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: RDDR
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a nice and comfortable hotel. The styling is a bit cold and dark, but nevertheless comfortable. The rooms are nicely decorated. Only the main hall doesn't look that fancy. We had an ocean view room, which was nice, especially in the evening. The location is OK, next to a shopping center and about 10 minutes walk from the subway. There are also some restaurants in the surroundings. The service is correct and helpfull, but defeneatly not as personal as for example The Data in Langkawi or the Peninsula in Beijing. The breakfast is really nice and comfortable. Only the number of seatingplaces is limited. We had to wait one day for almost 15 minutes before a table was available for breakfast. Although we didn't mind, it is not what you expect from an upper-class 5 star hotel. We enjoyed our stay and would reconsider the hotel again next time, although the Marriott on Orchard Road is propably better value for money (stayed there years ago for business)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.....”
Reviews.Author: kuiken
Reviews.Content: We spent 12(!) nights in Singapore, in this amazing hotel. When we checked in at the reception, they asked us: are you here for 12 nights?? We said yes, and afterwords we can say: Can we have 12 more!! Friendelyness, and promptness at the reception was good, the lady went with us to our room, and explaned everything what we needed to know for a good stay. Once they organized a trip for us to the Night Safari. Room was ok. Not special, curtains need to be renovated. Amenities you need during your stay were there. We had room 1702. Excellent view over the harbour, were they were preparing the racing-track for the formule 1 races, next week. There was no noise from outside-inside. Housekeeping did a good job everyday. Breakfast very good, lots of variety, and for most of all, a well trained and high-service trained team. thank you for that. Swimmingpoolstaff: the best in years. Everyday lots of bottles fresh and cold water, cold towels, fruits, and little snacks during the day. Very friendly staff, and also well trained in customer relation!!! Gym: excellent equipment, clean, and good staff. I can go on with all these compliments, but it was an amazing stay. In a friendly Singapore. Will we be back: when we make the choise to stay again in Singapore: a BIG YES!!! Did we mis something: yes a lobby were you can rest, sit and wait....... Now are people gattering togethering near the elevators, not a good impression when you enter the hotel

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: erinmay88
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel, it was amazing! we arrived at 6am, and although the rooms were not quite ready to check in, they stored out luggage and told us to help ourselves to the breakfast buffet. well what an amazing start to the day, when you have just stepped off the plane (from germany) the breakfast was the best buffet I have experienced anywhere in the world (I travel frequently) there are many different areas and styles of food and I couldn't have asked for a better experience. personal favourite was the made- to- order omlette! after we finished breakfast we were able to go straight up to our rooms which were impeccable. extremely clean, amazing, amazing view! great bathroom, very spacious and good work desk area. the pool area is beautiful, so amazing, great by the pool service also! even a hut with clean beach towels, sunscreen and tanning oil etc free of charge I will definitely stay and again and will recommend to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: freqflyer1832
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Wish it was for a week. The hotel is close to the Esplanade and SunTec Mall for you shopaholics. It is close to tons of food courts and Gluttons Bay for you foodies. By the way, the food courts in Singapore are nothing like what we get in the US. The choices and the taste blew me away. The hotel and the staff were great. Everything I expect from a 5 star from nice appointments, to comfortable bed, to great decor, etc. Complaints? Can't think of any.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Just2Cheshire
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental, Singapore is a family orientated hotel. We were upgraded on arrival to a junior suite - overlooking the harbour and onto the Grand Prix Circuit. The staff are very accommodating - the breakfast marvellous (as many different flavours as you can imagine). From the outside a pretty normal hotel, inside the architecture is amazing. Sun terrace and swimming pool at the back of the hotel, secluded. Very attentive staff. We enjoyed our stay but it certainly did not have the wow factor that the Mandarin has in New York. Check out at 10am for an evening flight was not a problem. The luggage was left securely and when we returned we were given a complimentary room, with toiletries, towels etc, to freshen up. The hotel is a short walk from the underground and the Marina - great for people watching and restaurants. Travelling around Singapore is very easy - use the underground (cheap, efficient, clean and safe). Make sure you buy a multi-pass, which also entitles you to use the buses. Must sees are Chinatown, The Botanic Gardens, the cable car ride to Sentosa Island. We didn't like Little India - felt dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Our No.1 choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Trevora61
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a wonderful stay at the MO. Although at the time of our visit the hotel was full and public areas very busy due to the visit of Liverpool FC, staff remembered our names each time they greeted us and it almost felt as if we were their only guests. Special thanks to Amit for his warm welcome, and arranging some special touches for us regarding our room. We stayed for a week in a spacious suite which was meticulously maintained and fine touches like fresh fruit and cookies were replenished regularly. The breakfast dishes at Melt are varied and delicious and staff go out of their way to carry out special requests (particular thanks to Andrew for locating Rose tea for my wife and having a pot ‘on stand-by’ the next day!). The Sunday champagne brunch is not to be missed! In summary, the combination of personal service and extremely high quality and attention to detail is what makes this hotel stand out. We have stayed at MO several times and it will always be our number one choice in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest RIP OFF, PRICE HAGGLERS, QUOTED one thing, GOT ANOTHER !”
Reviews.Author: Dayna8
Reviews.Content: Well, we travel quite extensive, and the reviews on here, maybe some of these people don't get out alot ! Prior to our arrival, I emailed the Reservation Supervisor Samantha about Club Harbour rooms etc. and initally we had booked an Ocean Room because we were informed there were no Club Harbour rooms avialable due to National day, but there were CLub City. Also, I informed here we were clebrating an event. None the less, we were told we could get the ClubHarbour room for S609 but I told her why should I pay a higher rate when there was an indulgence package where you could be picked up at the ariport yada,yada, yada. none the less, they were holding this Club harbour room for us. When we got to this hotel after an 18 hour flight, we were told the room was now S800. I refused to pay this because another country is celebrating, and you want me to pay RACK rate. none the less, Fauzi, Desk Mgr. came out after I told him I'm not getting into the haggling, or would go elsewhere, and told us we could us the club lounge for S120 together, and he would upgrade us. Well, we went from the 9th floor to the 20th floor. Okay, you knew we were celebrating something prior to us coming, then to top everything off, they charged us for the lounge the night we got there and it was already closed !!!!! However, they said due to our inconvenience the comped us a night, the night they comped us, was the day we ched out and didn't use the lounge.
