We never got a tour of the lounge or the facilities everyone else was speaking of, so we really don't know what was avialable to us or what wasn't. Our room had the linenes changed and trash emptied daily. Certain things we left housekeeping never wiped down at all. So, maybe it's only catered to for certain individuals. Now, our room had a great view of the singapore flier, and is easily accessible to the malls which is a tremendous plus. So all the hoopla about customer service, where is it ???? The night safari......joke. We tried to get into shows and were always told, sorry, they are sold out. Well, if they are that much in demand, distribute tickets so some of us can see it, but no need, we won't be returning. The Duck, that was nice.........friendly......... Overall, keep it. Learn how to treat people......equal..........and learn about different parts of the country, like the United States. Come back to people and show them how things are done, and don't try to get every little dime you can. If you quote a price, go back to the folio, I have all the emails, dates, times, and the contact person. The Mandarin is Overated. I will stick to W, Le Meridian, or Marriott. They know how to treat people.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at it's best.”
Reviews.Author: rsmette
Reviews.Content: It is pricey, but really worth it. We had a great time laying by the pool and seeing the sights of the city. It is a five minute walk to the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Cindi95
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the mandarin oriental with a friend for 5 nights, looking for a relaxing break away.From the moment we arrived untill the moment we checked out we were treated like royalty.The staff could not do enough for us and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable.The buffet breakfast in the hotel was amazing as were the restaraunts within the hotel.The day spa was our highlight of the trip and was sensational.I highly recommend this hotel for a luxurious break with outstanding views over the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: TamarTiger
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in on a multi destination holiday and by the end of the trip I can honestly say it stood head and shoulders above all the others we visited. The best breakfast buffet I have seen anywhere and I spend a lot of time in hotels. The most accommodating staff I have ever encountered and the most efficient too. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable hotel, a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: JillyK079
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriental for 3 nights, on check in we upgraded to a Club room (at a really good price), we were given a corner suite, with balcony, amazing. This meant we could use the Club lounge for breakfast, my husband enjoyed the eggs benedict and I ejnoyed the glass of champagne with my fresh pancakes and blueberry compote. We also enjoyed a cocktail in the evening. The room was immaculate, staff impecable, everything you would expect from a hotel of this standard. We used the pool and gym, both were a nice treat at the end of the day to relax and cool down. I would stay here again tomorrow, it made our stay in Singapore luxurious and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay once again”
Reviews.Author: choogirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of our honeymoon and two nights at the end of it. We were collected at the airport on arrival both times and were brought in a merc to the hotel-there was fresh water and towels in the back of the car which was a lovely touch. Check-in was in our room as we were staying in the club floor and it was fast and efficient. The club lounge is amazing and the food and drink is delicious. We had a huge room on both visits and the view over the harbour was beautiful. As well as getting a harbour view upgrade, there was also a beautiful bottle of red wine left in our room. Staff were all so friendly and welcoming. Even sitting by the pool, fresh water is brought over to you on arrival and is replaced frequently. Snacks like frozen fruit and sorbets were brought around at least once an hour. We ate in MELT one night and it was absolutely delicious and would definitely recommend it. We will definitely return to this hotel again as we enjoyed it so much.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious experience - WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Ms5Star
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Jan 2007 with my parents and it was a fantastic experience, one I will remember fondly for a long time. Lobby - One point that may work against the Oriental, but which did not particularly bother my family, is that the lobby is dark and not very welcoming (black tiles and walls) and there isn't the hustle and bustle that you can feel in other hotels with grand lobbys such as The Fullerton. There is no real place to people watch or just to relax and have a drink however what The Oriental may lack in this area it makes up for in friendly staff who greet you constantly as you go up to your room. I felt like a celebrity every time I walked in to the hotel so it didn't bother me. There were lovely flower decorations and I was impressed by the decor of the elevators which was very intricate and unusual. Check in - Check in was very smooth and we had no problems. Staff were very efficient and there was virtually no wait involved. Room - We REALLY loved our room! Even though we had a standard room, it was larger than an average hotel room with a little lounge and desk. Despite having three people in one room, it did not feel cramped. The bed was amazingly comfortable, possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The bedding was like velvet against the skin! Pillows were just the right softness too. The bathroom was luxurious and packed with soaps and shampoos. Our view wasn't great (we overlooked a tennis court and a view other not-so-exciting buildings) but we still did spend some time admiring the few. It was great to people watch. So all in all, our room was fantastic and we were very happy! Dining - Some of the best food I have ever tried was at The Oriental. The first night we ate at Dolce Vita where I had a tasty pasta dish. What really took the cake was the MELT ~ World Café which we ate at every morning. The wide variety of food, the high quality of ingredients, the attention to detail... everything was wonderful. Every morning we were greeted by name by the friendly hosts and led to our table. I loved the Indian section and often gorged myself on the curries. I also loved the fruit bar which had really fresh ingredients and you could make up whatever combination of drink you wanted! I am a huge chocolate fan so I made use of the chocolate fountain which of course was delicious. One fault I did find is that my freshly made pancakes were rather gluggy and stodgy but this is a minor point. Loved the food! Unfortunately we didn't get to eat at the Cherry Garden or the Steakhouse (as we are vegeterian) but I was completely satisfied with the Melt. So good! Room service - After a long day of sight seeing we decided to indulge in a three course room service meal for dinner. We were really impressed by the professionalism of the waiter who folded out a table for us which was equipped with a freezer. We had napkins, plenty of cutlery and the food was still piping hot. I throughly enjoyed my meal which was incredibly filling. Staff - The staff are so enthusiastic and helpful, we we really impressed with all the staff, from the people who open the doors, to the waiters to those on reception. We didn't encounter one member of staff who was ill-tempered. The maids always said hello to us. The staff made our stay truly terrific. Pool - Although the pool itself is nothing to write home about as it is not very big, it was big enough and generally very quiet when we were there. I didn't like how the resturant overlooked the pool as I felt I was on show but the view overlooking the city from the pool is amazing. Location - Very convenient for access to Marina Square and the MRT. We had no problems getting anywhere. We throughly enjoyed our stay and would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Glitzy Elegance”
Reviews.Author: michellevoyager
Reviews.Content: We checked in here for a night on transit. Absolutely no regrets....It has the convinience of a real bonified shopping mall just outside (Not the crappy kinds you typically find in Hotels in Asia) yet an obviously luxe calm the moment you step into the hotel. My only complaints were in-room. If you're paying more than 300 per night, you'd expect that the beds be less springy and more firm. But that could just be preference.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: wally1
Reviews.Content: had a couple of days pitstop in Singapore and chose this hotel from all of the TA reviews and it was really good. We decided upon arrival to upgrade to the club lounge as that guaranteed us an 8pm check out and it was worth it. Had lots of food and drink in the club lounge which saved us $ in the long run. Room was great and we really enjoyed the pool area....would definately recommend the Oriental

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: dinotraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be listed as one of the top hotels of the world. The service right from the limousine that picks you up from the airport to your checkout is impeccably handled by warm and genuine staff. The rooms are wonderful and its the little things that tend to matter, like the fresh fruit and bottled water in the room changed daily. When you are on holiday for leisure rather than being a business customer as most bill as are settled by companies you appreciate things more. Nothing is to much trouble for the staff who serve you with a smile always. If you get the chance take a club harbour room which has glorious views over the harbour and the city too. The club class lets you have breakfast, all day soft drinks and afternoon tea & cookies then evening tit bits and cocktails. The spread that is served and the drinks have to be seen to be believed. The pool are is one of the best in the world we have been to as in the staff are so attentive with towels, iced friut, iced drinks and iced flannels at regular intervals. From the time you arrive and they know your name till the time you leave everything about your stay is logged in there minds and computers no doubt to ensure they serve you with what you like. This was our 4th year in the Mandarin Oriental and when we holiday in Singapore we would not stay anywhere else. Even a free room at Raffles well maybe !!!! Melvis and the girls in the club class need a mention as without them the Mandarin Oriental would not be the place it is today. Alice Swe out of the club is also liike another daughter to us and we keep in touch. Dont believe the bad reviews you read on here which are few and far between as we have come up against a few rude people who stay in these places and think they are a cut above the staff that work there. Just remember to treat people how you would like to be treated and you will have a super stay in this hotel. Hope you all enjoy as much as we do.

Reviews.Title: “Superb 5 star plus hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulo1179
Reviews.Content: Don't even look anywhere else, stay at this hotel. Everything, and I mean everything is superb. From the mountains of food for breakfast, to the wonderful service, fantastic rooms and facilities this place is wonderful. Room (I had a marina view room) was great, very comfortbale and nicely decorated. Food was brilliant, every choice under the sun for breakfast and the evening buffet was absolutely stunning. The pool is superb, open air with a great view, when you get in they come over and leave a glasss of fresh orange view next to the lounger for you, 5 star service. This place is the best place I've ever stayed, any queries let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with the best service!”
Reviews.Author: jnoap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental recently and we were upgraded to a bigger room, with a balcony which was fantastic. The room was generous with a lounge and desk and extremely clean plus they even had made a little baby pack for my daughter and provided a child robe and slippers for my son which i was impressed with. I had breakfast at Melt with my 4 yo and 2 yo, while my husband went to work and the staff there were so helpful the choice of food was amazing, one of the best buffet breakfasts I have been to. The location is great as it's connected to marina square (which connects to suntec) via the carpark or stairs outside the hotel, which is really convenient. If you walk straight through the carpark there are quite a few breakfast places as well which is really handy. My husband used the Oriental Club lounge for work in the morning before his meetings and he said it was very good. The pool on level 5 is fantastic again with excellent service. there is a children's pool and another bigger pool. As soon as we sat down on the lounges we were given bottles of water straight away and the kids were given pool toys to play with. We were there for only 1 hour at the pool and were provided scented cold face towels, a small cup of ice cream and a small cup of jelly each as a little snack - all complimentary. On our 2nd night we all fell sick with the flu and the dr had to ring the authorities to ensure it was not swine flu. We were then tested and quarantined in our hotel room till the results came back. The hotel went above and beyond our expectations by upgrading us again to a junior suite whereby we had a lounge room and a separate bedroom with 2 bathrooms, so that our quarantined stay would be more comfortable. The front office manager Amit was so fantastic with the service he provided. Once we went into our new room he had arranged for snacks, boxes of soft drinks, baby/toddler food, boxes of bottled water, cereal, an xbox for my son to play with, kids dvds, kids books and toys to be placed in our suite to make it as comfortable for us as possible - all complimentary. It was just unbelievable. Obviously we ordered a lot of room service as we were not allowed out of the hotel room and the food was delicious. Once our results came back negative Amit had said we could stay in the room for as long as we needed. When we checked out at reception Amit personally farewelled us and wished us the best. I can genuinely say that this is the service provided is exceptional and the best I have ever received in any industry or situation. I cannot fault anything at this hotel. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: Portiaretriever
Reviews.Content: Good location (close to Singapore Flyer, Marina and Suntec Malls). Excellent rooms with every concievable facility (although a little smaller than some hotel rooms in its class). Service very good and would certainly recommend this hotel if you wanted more from your city break than "just somewhere to lay your head". Try and find yourself some time whilst you are there to spend around the roof top pool- the service there is fabulous- certainly on a level with hotels such as The Four Seasons. Complimentary fruit, papaers, magazines, sun tan lotion. Chilled water replaced every hour and the most wonderful complimentary sorbets delivered on a regular basis. Well done Mandarin Oriental, we shall certainly seek out other Mandarin Orientals on our future trips around the world.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: paras108
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect just opposite marina bay. we spent our new year there to see the fireworks display. of course to get a view of the marina u have to pay little more but it was worth it. the whole hotel is done in an oriental theme. the rooms are lovely. downside being the pool area and a lousy gym. however proximity to the mall is good and so do not eat at the hotel which can be expensive - just hop into the mall and there are tons of good restaurants on level 2

Reviews.Title: “Man O - a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: JClasstraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for only a couple of nights for our honeymoon on our way back from HK and Malaysia. We were tempted to go to Raffles only because it’s Raffles but the $1000/night price was enough for us to say no. Man O was recommended by a friend who has stayed there before. We had a harbour view room so we could see the Merlion from our window. The harbour is starting to be dominated by cranes and shipping so is not attractive as say HK harbour but it was nice all the same. Service was very efficient on arrival, check-in was smooth and professional. We were immediately shown to our room which was nice and features were all explained. Welcome drink took a little while but the quality made up for it. The bedding was very comfortable; TV was still CRT but that wasn’t a huge problem. The decor at the entrance was a bit ho-hum, the quality of the wood was very good but it was very plain. Some like that, others don’t. The hotel is very quiet and the service is very friendly. We tried Morton’s Steak House. To be perfectly honest, we found it overpriced. The quality was good but I have had better steaks in Australia for cheaper. Quantities were humongous, probably too much actually! For some reason though, the Man O seemed to embody Singapore a bit too much. Professional and clean, certainly, but perhaps also lacking a little character. But for no-frills, business-type travel, it’s definitely spot-on. Location is quite good though the walk to the MRT is not exactly short – having to walk through a labyrinth of shopping centres to get there.

Reviews.Title: “good location, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: marjacDenmark
Reviews.Content: i have stay there in aug 2005 and july 2007. both times were excellent. nice breakfast buffet. nice standard in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I am a Mandarin fan”
Reviews.Author: VivDelhi
Reviews.Content: It's always a pleasure to stay at the Mandarin. Theirs' may not be the most spacious hotel in Singapore but they always make up for that by their excellent service. This is one hotel where I feel pampered on each of my visits. The staff is excellent and very courteous. The rooms are very cozy and their mattresses are probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Rooms are well-equipped with the latest electronic equipment and excellent quality toiletries, though their standard TV remote still remains a mystery to me as I always end up struggling with it. But apart from this small niggle, stay at the Mandarin is always a flawless experience. Check out their pool and health center, they're undoubtedly the best in Singapore. And not to speak of Melt, the world cafe which feature exclusive cuisines from all over the world. Overall, I would definitely recommend a stay at the Mandarin, no wonder it has been rated amongst the 50 best hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: nautilus360
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, upto 5 star standards. One of the best places I have stayed at. Beautiful view from the room. Everything was perfect. Superb staff. Great place for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Devine”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea04
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in late May in a club room. We couldn't have asked for more. Service was exceptional, food excellent and the evening cocktails to die for. We enjoyeda coulpes spa treatment which was fabulous. We will certianly be returning to this hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westinhan
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin Oriental in Singapore is absolutely gorgeous! The lobby, the restaurants, the rooms, everything is just amazing. I have to say that the room I stayed in was one of the best ever! It was beautifully appointed with all modern amenities and extremely comfortable, too. The desk was lovely. The bed was lovely. The bathroom was lovely. Everything was stunning! You could do business at the professional-looking desk or you could enjoy the amazing view or you could take a nice shower in their rain showerhead shower or go for a relaxing bath in the luxurious tub. The only thing is the hotel is not located on Orchard Road, so it is a drive to many places. SUMMARY: I loved this place. The location was not so convenient for me, but the view was spectacular. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax and be Looked after”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: We agree with the wraps in the recent reviews -- we too had a Club Room (upgraded complimentary to a Harbour View I think it is called). The room was good and the bed very comfortable. Bathroom good too (although if I was picky the bath was fine but not particularly big). But the service and friendliness was what we thought set it apart. The Club is very comfortable, great food and drink, and the people there couldnt do enough for us. A limo from the airport thrown in and an 8pm checkout for a late plane were appreicated inclusions. The spa -- particularly in our case the couples suite -- was luxurious and comfortable. As another reviewer said, on the pricey side but a good treat. Same friendly and attentive service at the pool and the fitness centre and probably anywhere else! There is a bit of construction around the area at the moment but it didn't interfere at all and there was no noise that we noticed. Until it gets finished, you might say that some other hotels are a little closer to areas you might want to be -- particularly as it gets steamy if you walk -- but if you don't want to walk off the excellent food there, there are plenty of taxis to take you anywhere for only a few dollars. We couldn't fault the service from anyone and it made it a great and relaxing few days. We'd love to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Club Lounge and Pool and Spa”
Reviews.Author: muir77
Reviews.Content: The best things about this hotel are the Club Lounge, the pool and the spa. The room is ok (stayed in a Club Cityview). The view from the room is fantastic. The bed is comfy, the bathroom is fairly big although it only has one sink (much prefer double sinks). But its not the room that is the best part about this hotel. Its the service and the way you are made to feel in the Lounge, pool and spa. You just get spoilt rotten. In the lounge: Champagne for breakfast, snacks all day, gorgeous food and more champagne in the evenings. Poolside: sunglasses cleaned, loads of ice cold water and ice towels for your face, snacks all day long like frozen grapes and sorbets. Spa: great staff and great treatments. The best spa expericence ive had in a long time. Pricey - yes. But worth it. Im a big fan.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience - even if you only do it once.”
Reviews.Author: CasualTraveller_9
Reviews.Content: Wow.. First class treatment all the way. We stayed here for three nights to experience a little more of SIngapore than a stop over lounge. From the limo driver to the reception staff, our first taste of 5 star treatment was addictive! We were rushed straight up to our upgraded suite and checked in whilst sitting in the living room of our suite. Long stemmed red roses, tapas and wine also greeted us on arrival. The flowers and tapas and wine were changed every day, the room was sparkling and nothing was too much trouble. Every morning at breakfast, we were greeted by name. How they remembered this I have no idea! Each morning we were given our favourite table and unobtrusively served coffee. The evenings were spent in the Lounge with a fabulous Jazz singer, plenty of free tapas (HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE CRUNCHY ANCHOVIES AND WASABI NUTS) and lots of lovely cocktails. Would definitely go back to Singapore, even just to stay at this hotel! And the weddings were lovely to watch as well.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST of the BEST”
Reviews.Author: TrevnMarion
Reviews.Content: My beloved and I had to wait over 3 1/2 years to do the honeymoon thing (kids in uni), but THIS particular hotel chain and their staff made it very much worth the wait. Impeccable rooms, fastidious in detail, and the most wonderful of Staff who excelled in every area. Marion and I in our future travel will always seek out the OM Hotel chain, and hopefully they see fit to open in Australia sometime in the future. The Hotel is beautiful, but it's the Staff and services proffered that make it such a stand out from a lot of others. Our room on both occasions looked out to a harbor view and that in itself was simply stunning. If you're looking for an affordable Hotel, where you'll feel pampered, valued and be happily ensconced in a few days of luxury then this is for You too. Special thanks to ALL the Staff who made our stays memorable in so many ways, Sherrin at Reception, Sumit at Reception, Chris at Melt Restaurant (Good luck in Marrakesh Chis), Jack in Dolce Vita, Marco in Dolce Vita (BRILLIANT Chef) and ALL the Staff at the pool. Sumit actually went out of his way to assist us by re booking us back into the Oriental Mandarin after a bad experience at Angsana Resort in Bintan Island. Not only did Sumit find a room for us on short notice but he extended an upgrade which was VERY appreciated. We left this Hotel feeling as if we have gained new friends and feeling quite special. So is there a downside, well wine is hideously expensive, but that's Singapore NOT the Hotel, and Singapore We Loved. Marion and I are happy and proud to recommend the Oriental Mandarin Singapore and ALL of their Staff and Services

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff, great food!”
Reviews.Author: sherna123
Reviews.Content: We were honeymooners, and we were upgraded to an ocean suite, and it was so nice. We had a balcony and the room was large, with a sitting area, and nice view. We went to eat at the chinese restaurant called Cherry garden, and it was awesome, we had a great meal, and the staff were always here for anything we wanted! It is right next door to the Marina Square and The Suntec Mall, and it was great to just walk 5 mins and be in a enormous shopping mall! Its a great hotel, although they seem to be very busy, still i felt like we were well taken care and one more thing the breakfast is awesome, great array of food!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...even if only for one night”
Reviews.Author: VikFam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the OM for one night in May. From the moment we arrived, we were treated as pampered guests. The room was impeccible, the bed was soft and sumptuous. The pool was sparkling and the lifeguard even recognized from a previous location! We ate at Morton's which was great (a little pricey on the wine). But the food was overall exceptional. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a romantic getaway with all the frills !

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: petitetraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant, the service is second to none. We arrived off an early morning flight and because our room wasn't ready we were offered a complimentary breakfast and drinks. The room was nicely furnished, and we had a harbour view, which was worth the extra. Every eventuality was catered for, I had a blister on my foot, and found sticking plasters in the room, besides everything else like toothbrushes etc. The bed was a dream. I rarely sleep well in hotels but this was the exception. Also loved the large fluffy towels and everything was absolutely spotless. I'm a clean freak and notice these things. Location wise, its a bit off the beaten track, but hey taxis were so cheap it really didn't matter. Don't push yourself to walk too far in the heat! The food in the hotel is delicious. They have an evening buffet which was truly excellent, all kinds of seafood, chinese, indian, malaysian...makes my mouth water remembering... Lastly, since our flight out was early evening, the room was made available to us until 2pm....a nice touch. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. Its rare that I find nothing to gripe about, but this time I really couldn't fault them on anything.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous 12th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: sc_dog_lover
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in April and had a fantastic time. Our travel agent was quite emphatic about the MO having a strict 2pm check in policy and that the only way to guarantee an early check in was to pay for the previous night. We didn't bother doing that and arrived at 7am after a 13 hour flight expecting to dump our bags, caffeinate ourselves, and go out for a few hours. We were delighted to be able to get straight in to our room. Our anniversary had been mentioned on the booking and the reception staff were really sweet- congratulated us on our long marriage and how we didn't look old enough! And they upgraded us to a harbour view room (809) which was fantastic. The room had a full length picture window with a view across to the Merlion, an enormous comfortable bed, and a fabulous bathroom with separate shower Don't miss the lemon grass and ginger body lotion and shower gel! There were thoughtful additions like fruit and a pot of Chinese tea, and on out anniversary they left us a complimentary bottle of red wine. The service was fantastic- it seemes that every time we'd been out, someone had been back in and tidied up my shoes! Everything in the room was of a very high quality and looked brand new. An earlier reviewer was very uncomplimentary about the lobby and the atrium. I admit that on first inspection it seemed a bit odd and possibly slightly dated. But after a few hours out in the heat and humidity, the cool, shady tranquility was very welcome. The pool area is fantastic. Both days we were there we went for twilight swim and loved the views of the city. Again, fantastic service with towels and a little bottle of water brought to your lounger. The breakfast was fine, although we slept so well in the comfy bed that we nearly overslept and missed it. On the second day we had an early start so had the room service breakfast. Again, superb. Especially the freshly squeezed carrot juice and the tropical fruit plate. The cocktail bar on floor 5 was a real treat. Stylish but not pretentious, never-ending complimentary nuts and rice crackers, and a great mango marguerita. And tremendous city views. The area is great. If you cross the road at the front and head towards the water, there is a really lovely promenade area, with the Gluttons Bay hawker centre (which we didn't try) , an outdoor auditorium with free concerts at weekends (great atmosphere, lots of families out for an evening stroll), and loads of restaurants . We loved the No Signboard seafood restaurant. Other things we loved- the waterside bars in front of the Fullerton Hotel, really cool and trendy at the weekend. (It seemed that every round of two drinks cost us £20 wherever we were, but you're only young once!), the Hippo bus tour (one guide who's surname was Nicolai- exceptional), the Botanic Gardens (the restaurants there looked great). Fab! Fab! Fab!. If it wasn't 13 hours away, Singapore would be my favourite city break destination. _

Reviews.Title: “Top Class!”
Reviews.Author: JohnofTaipei
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental from 30 April to 4 May 2009.We were upgraded to the 20th floor (there are 21 floors).We initially wanted a harbor view,but unfortunately there weren't any available.We got complimentary Axis bar drinks. An excellent hotel.Superb service!The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful.A cool oasis in the heat and humidity of Singapore. We had breakfast at Melt every morning.The maître d' welcomed us back every morning.Believe me there are literally hundreds of people eating breakfast every morning and she remembered our names and room number within a day.A very big compliment for us.The food was excellent.A very very wide variety of food.One hour isn't enough for sampling all the delectables! Great location.Walking distance to all the main attractions and shopping malls. The rooms are quite big.The 42' TV with good quality sound was a big plus!The bathroom was big enough and was beautifully finished in Italian marble. What I loved the most was the bed.It's heavenly.I was looking forward to taking a well deserved rest after a long day of shopping and sightseeing.The bed did the trick.The pillows were just right.Perfect for insomniacs like me. We wanted to try the spa,but we didn't have enough time. All in all an excellent hotel.One of the best I've ever stayed in! Thanks Mandarin Oriental for making our stay such a wonderful experience.We will certainly come back next time we visit Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at Mandarin Oriental Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at MO six nights from the 21st April 2009 for an anniversary holiday with my husband. Before the trip I did lots of research and considered also the Raffles, the Ritz-Carlton and the Shangri, but decided on the MO. And that was the best decision, we were most happy with the hotel! We took a limo taxi from the airport (about 18 euros) and were checked-in in our upgraded City suite (with Club services). We had a bottle of red wine, green tea, fresh fruit and bottled water (both replenished every day) and beautiful fresh flowers in the room. The suite had a large living room, a suitably sized bedroom, a dressing area, a guest wash room, a marble bathroom with a separate shower (and lovely Elemis toiletries, a big plus!). We had two large tv's and two entrances as well. There's lovely art all over the hotel, also in the rooms. The windows are from floor to ceiling. The club services included: a champagne breakfast, an afternoon tea, evening coctails with lots of things to eat (both warm and cold, a theme every night (loved the Indian especially), well chosen French cheeses, and Moet, of course). Soft drinks all day, pressing of two items per day, late check-out until 8 PM, newspaper delivered every morning etc .etc.. The service in the hotel is exceptional all over, but especially at the Club. You can naturally use a PC, fax etc.; read magazines and books in the Club. We liked the pool area, there were always vacant sun loungers and umbrellas. The nice young men were most helpful, they bring you fresh bottled water, fruit and sherbet and even clean your sunnies, if you wish! The pool is open from early morning to late evening. There's a really nice view to the city, the Merlion etc. from the pool area. You can also see the Singapore "eye" on the other side near the Ritz-C. As the sea is next to the hotel there's sometimes a welcome light breeze from the sea. There's a kiddie pool, but unfortunately some parents bring their small kids who can't swim (and who make lots of noise) in the adult pool. Scary! Fortunately this was not daily and normally the pool area was an oasis of calm. Altough you can stuff yourself with the delicasies at the Club, the restaurants are well worth visiting as well. My favourite was the Dolce Vita (I'd come back to Singapore for the truffle risotto only) , the Cherry Garden was excellent and the more casual MELT was nice as well. All restaurants had good food and excellent service. The Cherry Garden is very nicely decorated. The housekeeping at the hotel is exceptional. The room and the public areas are spotless. Nothing was ever missing in the room like in some other top hotels we have stayed in, on the contrary the amenities were ambly replenished every day. I sent my "travel trousers" for laudry and they had also resewn a hanging button! The laundry and pressing were always returned in excellent condition and much earlier than expected. The location of the hotel is brilliant, you can walk to lots of places once you get used to the heat and the humidity which took us polar bears a day or two . The colonial area, the Esplanade, the Merlion, the Raffles etc. are only a short walk away. Singapore is much more greener than expected, my husband saw a big parrot next to the hotel! Taxis are really cheap, don't hesitate to save your feet in the heat. The lowest fare was less than two euros from the hotel to the City Hall MRT (underground) station. There's so much to see in Singapore, our only regret was that we only stayed six days. We'll certainly return to Singapore and the Mandarin Oriental!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel brand!”
Reviews.Author: nielsensmith
Reviews.Content: WOW! What an amazing hotel! We arrived at the MO around 5:30 am and they allowed us an early check in at no charge. Our luggage was left behind in Vancouver and the staff took it upon themselves to work with the airline to sort it out on our behalf. While they did this, they also loaned us clothes so that we had something clean to go shopping in. The hotel is connected to a mall (these are so plentiful in Singapore that you're never far from one!) so we quickly picked up some necessities after a quick nap. The breakfast buffet at MELT (in the MO) was incredible! They had fresh fruit, homebaked breads and pastries, homemade jams and preserves, all the western buffet classics, Indian choices, and Chinese choices including Dim Sum. It was the best breakfast I've ever eaten, but it wasn't cheap. We had booked a Harbour View Room, and the upgrade cost was well worth it. The room (#1207) was exactly as they show on their website and we were able to take postcard perfect photos right from our room. The bed was very comfy, which was important after a long trip from Canada and all the staff made us feel like we TRULY mattered. Every detail was taken care of and the hotel was immaculately clean. It was a delightful experience and we will definitely stay with MO again.

Reviews.Title: “Standing ovation”
Reviews.Author: Irishlatino
Reviews.Content: I've no idea what the correct smiley or web-speak or whatever it is for the emotion that I'm trying to put across but I believe it can be summed up with: *standing ovation* Without a doubt the best of the 5 hotels we stayed in during our little SE Asian trip (Four Season’s Jimbaran Bay, Banyan Tree Bangkok, Mandarin Oriental KL, Le residence Ankor Wat) We stayed in a Suite, 2 entrances and 2 bathrooms, not too large at 75sq/m and good views, 2 plasmas, cinema system, guest bathroom, etc. Hints for a good stay: • Club lounge is a must simply for the additional level of service. • Use the hotel limo service for transfers. We’re used to 1 or 2 people ready and waiting as we enter, but they had 10 people waiting for my wife and I. • Try the Sushi and the Italian restaurants which were highly enjoyable. • Harbour view may not be worth the extra it as the skyline is damaged by the cranes developing the casinos across the bay (take note of the when we were there though). • The cocktail bar was well stocked and presented some exception live jazz and soul. What didn’t we like: Actually could not criticize anything except maybe the Italian a la carte restaurant sitting right next to the pool where you run the risk of noisy kids disturbing your meal. The after stay follow up was good with the club lounge also re-confirming flights even when we had checked out and were at another hotel. Highly highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay - still great but a few issues?”
Reviews.Author: elodieDubai
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 6 nts at the MO, our 3rd stay at the hotel. I personally am a great fan of the Group and the Brand, and have worked them with them in the past,having been in the hotel industry. However, some disappointment that there was no real recognition of the fact we were returning leisure guests ( come on MO, if Ritz Carlton can do it!!). We were given a harbour view room, when my husband mentioned that we had been automatically upgraded to this on our last stay - but we had to ask. Remembering that a 6 nt stay is quite good for the hotel, particularly in this business environment. It was also my husband's 50th birthday and again no real recognition, evn though I mentioned this on my first reservation request e-mail. Subsequently, I asked what birthday amenites were available - and received a good response. But these things should be picked up by reservations in the initial communication with a Brand of this calibre and not prompted. We were not sure if th hotel is economising in this difficult environment, but the room AC could not be set below 18.5 and the ambient temperature was actually 20 degrees in the room - it was very warm at night and we found ourselves hot and sleeping without covers. We did request to have the AC checked - which it was. Unfortuantley, a maintenance card was left in our room, noting that the room termperature had been reduced to "VIP Level"! So, we assume that if you take a suite or the club floor, your room can be set to a cooler temperature! O.k, so internally these"standards" can be agreed, but the guest doesn't need to know!! By and large, the staff are still superb and one of the main reasons we come back to the hotel each year. But, we noticed some variation this time, depending on department. Room service were terse and abrupt when I asked if it would be possible to receive 2 glasses of wine in under 45 mins, as we were going out. We were not requesting a full meal! I understand the operational restraints of hotels - but this a 5 star establsishment. That said, most staff are excellent and a huge assett to the hotel. Our last small gripe, relates to breakfast ( not the food, which is amazing). But the hotel clears down exactly at 10.30 am, to set up for lunch ( being a business hotel). It is uncomfortable when your unfinished plates are cleared quickly and when you are aware that people are waiting to do this! Also, being told every morning, for 5 days, at 10.15 am that the breakfast will be finishing at 10.30 am, is just annoying. A discreet sign at the entrance woud be less officious and intrusive. To sum up, even though the rooms and bathrooms are smaller than the RC next door, this is still a classy hotel, with great views, in a fantastic location. There is excellent attention to detail in most areas and it is a haven in the midst of the bustle of S'pore. Being opposite the Esplanade and a pleasant walk to Clarke and Robertson Quay are also big positives. On balance, we would still choose to stay here again, but it would be good to see the service standards being more consistent - as they have been in the past. However, the hotel is almost top of the Trip Advisor list for a reason - and most people will not be disappointed at all with their experience.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: JudeH
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect from the Mandarin Oriental! But it was even better than you could expect from a big chain hotel. When we checked in they asked us when our flight out was 3 days later. It was 10 PM so without us even thinking to ask they said that we could have the room until 6 and that after that they had somewhere we could have a shower and change just before we left. We have never come across this and were delighted and very surprised! The breakfast was amazing! The first day someone takes you on a tour of the breakfast to show you the many areas from which you can select. They do a special deal which you book on line through the hotel website and it is a bed and breakfast deal. Definitely worth it!! A great stay in a very special hotel!

Reviews.Title: “World class luxury”
Reviews.Author: TomjMumbai
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, in the heart of the city, some of the best restaurants in town are in this hotel. Comfortable, spacious room, good room service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Biren27
Reviews.Content: Being my first time to Singapore I greatly the recommend the Mandarin Oriental. Newly refurbished the hotel offers spectacular views over the Singapore harbour including the famous lion fountain and the Singapore opera house. The first thing that hits you when you enter the hotel is its vast ceiling, natural light and architecture along with the extremely friendly and well trained staff you seem to get over your jet lag immediately. The rooms are an eclectic mix of colonial charm with a modern twist equipped with a plasma tv and warm interiors. The oriental spa although a bit expensive rates top notch for its ambience and treatment rooms. The pool uniquely shaped and located on the upper floors offers a great view of the singapore skyline. The fitness centre also offers yoga classes in the open foyer. The breakfast in this hotel is not to be missed as it offers a vast array of options, along with exotic fruits and juices imported from other parts of south-east asia. Overall the hotel staff get full marks for service with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: alohalucy
Reviews.Content: Outstanding experience. Hotel itself is beautiful, nicely laid out and in great location. Rooms have extensive amenities, from fresh apples and bottled water daily to loose bath salts to umbrella, and much more. It feels like every detail has been considered for comfort and convenience. The breakfast buffet is phenomenal. Service was excellent all around. Spa experience was exceptional. The business center charges 50 cents/min for computer, but a quick email check of less than 5 mins was free. Our pre-arranged late checkout was extended by 3 hours without problem. Highly recommend the Morton's Bar happy hour, with half-price martinis and delicious complimentary steak sandwiches. The Axis lounge also offered complimentary appetizers and half price drinks at happy hour. This hotel and breakfast buffet were highlights in and of themselves.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: divend
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel and experience. On check-in they upgraded me to a harbour view room, which had the stunning views of the harbour, esplanade and central business district. I could even see the Singapore Merlin. The hotel is well located and connected to the Marina Mall and Suntec City. The rooms are a good size with a comfy bed and with all the excellent amenites, including dvd player with home theatre style sound. I'm usually not much of a breakfast eater, but the breakfast served at the MELT Restaurant was simply superb, that I made sure I got up half an earlier. The breakfast spread is by far the best I've ever experienced in any hotel around the world, for both the sheer variety and mind-boggling quality. Had Dinner had Morton's one night. Superb steaks and crab cakes, but a bit pricey. I requested for a late check-out. And they agreed without hesitation. Overall, the staff was very couteous, and made my stay fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the veiw”
Reviews.Author: APTII
Reviews.Content: Great place, great location and a variety of food options make this place one of the best places to stay in Singapore. The rooms are priced very attractively and you will find Indian food available here. If you decide to have food here, the spread is lavish and offers a a lot of choice. One should go for the buffet if you are really hungry - it also offers unlimited beer. The place is very comfortable and most of the rooms are having an oriental fragrance. rooms are very nicely placed and offer all facilities one will require. Staff is very courteous. Again one of those places which is VALUE FOR MAONEY. Also it is tied up with JETAIRWAYS so you earn miles.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: fsba20
Reviews.Content: Loved it, loved it , loved it. We had previously booked to go to the Shangri La on Sentosa Island for Xmas but having read some reviews on tripadvisor we cancelled our booking and went to the Mandarin Oriental - and we are so glad! Everything was great from start to finish, honestly we could not fault it. We were there for Xmas day and they made the whole day really special - Christmas stockings on our door in the morning and mulled wine with breakfast. We had the buffet dinner there for Xmas Day and the food was excellent. We had breakfast included in our rate and the choice was a little overwhelming! would go back without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fosh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our holiday. Check in was fast and we were upgraded to a suite as this was our wedding anniversary, the suite was lovely and there was a complimentary bottle of red wine waiting for us. Our suite overlooked the swimming pool and the Singapore eye. We chose to pay approx £50 per person per day to upgrade, this entitled us to breakfast and entrance into the executive lounge in the evening. The breakfast was good with a wide choice of cuisine and champagne if you wanted it. In the evenings the executive loung was quite and very relaxed, there was a wide choice of drinks and nibbles readily available. The choice of drinks ranged from Moet to branded spirits to bottled beers. As drink is so very expensive in Singapore this proved to be a good option for us . The bars and restaurants in the hotel are very expensive, spirits are approx £10 per shot. We visited Raffles for a Singapore sling, the pianist in there is out of this world. A visit to the Swiss hotel is a must for the night time view of the sky line. We went on the city tour on a double decker bus, this was a bit of a let down as half of the trip was spent travelling to a gem factory and some botanical gardens, neither of which is our thing, if we had known this when booking we would not have gone. We spent the some time lying by the pool, cold bottled water is replenished regularly and sorbet and fruit is served throughout the day. Singapore was not quite the 'wow' place we expected it to be but there is a certain charm about it, however, the Oriental Mandarin was an excellent choice as a base for us.

Reviews.Title: “Classy!”
Reviews.Author: PageyTasmania
Reviews.Content: This was our special treat on our way home to Australia after 5 weeks in Ireland and the UK. We did the Singapore stopover - which I highly recommend - to break the long flight from London to Melbourne. The Mandarin does what Singapore does anyway - but at the top level. The service is brilliant. Our room was quite stunning - very large, beautifully appointed and very comfortable. We were jetlagged and ordered room service. Dinner was lovely and the service incredible. On our arrival I was stunned at the orchids as we walked in the door to our room. I thought they were fake they were so perfect, but soon discovered they weren't. Have since bought two phalaenopsis orchids and look forward to buying more! We needed to source some good digital bargains in our short time before our flight back to Oz and the reception staff were very helpful and spot on in sending us to the right shopping centre. If you want a little bit of luxury to finish your trip, this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: scotty0910
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel in a Harbour View Room for 3 nights in early March. The staff are very welcoming and the room wonderful with views of the harbour and wheel. The breakfast buffet is wonderful with a wide selection of food although a note of warning for people with small children as we were charged £70 for an evening buffet for our 4 year old who does not eat £70 worth of food! Our mistake as we should have checked but just to warn others beforehand. All the staff were extremely helpful and made the first part of our holiday memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DebsDebs
Reviews.Content: Top class on all fronts. I would thoroughly recommend staying here! My only negative comment (if you really pushed me to have one) might be the pool area, just felt a little bit dated.... Excellent breakfast, superb concierge service and top class business centre not to mention superbly comfortable room and fabulous view. Great gym too. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on the way back to Australia from Europe. Upon checking in we found out that it was Singapore independence day the following day and the hotel was fully booked. This meant that the room that we thought that we would get (ocean view) was not what we got as these rooms were allocated to people that wished to see the national day parade which passed the hotel. Our room therefore looked over the pool with a "glimse" of ocean. Having said that there is little to fault in this excellent hotel. The best feature for me (I like food) is the incredible breakfast buffet. I have NEVER seen a better selection of food for any other hotel - it was fantastic (pricey but worth every cent - we had it included in our room rate so I was delighted). Staff were extremely helpful and accomodating. I would recommend without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great.....apart from Moretons restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: ncyprus1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great staff, great location, upgraded to suite overlooking the harbour, on arrival, whisked straight up to the room for check-in, what a great arrival. Beautiful food and service from the Italian restaurant by the pool, and a very nice treatment in the spa. Very nice, well equipped, and spotless, gym. Great location in the city. A couple of irks however. Was very pleased to read in the blurb that no-one wearing shorts or flip-flops were allowed in the club lounge and mobile phones should be switched to silent. In reality this was not the case. They are probably too polite to say anything but plenty of people ignored the rules which was a bit off. Moretons restaurant. Meant to be steak to die for, but wasn't - my fillet mignon was chewy, and had to be replaced - and prices to give you a heart attack. $$16 for a jacket potato!! Not a well cooked one at that. $$128 almost the cheapest bottle of wine, a 2006 Margaret River shiraz, priced way over the top. Thought Dubai hotel food was expensive, not compared to this. Probably the most expensive and disappointing meal we have ever had, which was a shame as it was our last night in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: neenastar
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from a trip to the far east which included a two night stay at the mandarin. The room was a decent size, the level of service was brilliant and the hotel itself is beautiful. The location is ideal being a 15-20 minute drive form the airport and ideally located within singapore. I would definately recommend this hotel, deserves its 5 star rating !

Reviews.Title: “One of the World's best”
Reviews.Author: glewpot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in February. Confusingly there are three hotels with very similar names in the Marina area. We got very close to checking in at the Marina Mandarin which is where our taxi dropped us. I can vouch for how charming they are! Having arrived at the correct hotel the first thing that strikes you is how understated but stylish the decor etc is but this is pretty typical of the chain. What else strikes you is the level of service, consumately professional and very charming. We got a great rate for the hotel which others have mentioned. I think that this is because there are definite signs of refurbishment and updating needed particularly around the pool area and in our room. (slightly bad tiling repairs, slightly old decor) This doesnt detract from the superlative service. Everywhere you go you are met with smiles and offers of assistance. The pool staff are excellent (so is the pool). Restaurant service exceptional. Door, reception, concierge staff all brilliant. If they do refurbish the Mandarin then the price might be out of sight for the likes of me - so go for it while you can!

Reviews.Title: “Not delivering what promised”
Reviews.Author: aussietoday
Reviews.Content: Checked in and was given a bad room. I had reserved one room as a Marina view delux room that was a quiet room. They over booked and when arriving shoved me into a room with a view requiring me to stretch my neck to see on a terrible tiny corner room that was smaller than a standard room on a low floor. Requests to management were negatively recieved. I immediately checked out and went next door to the Ritz carlton that gave us a better rate, an early check in as was 550am and a beautiful high room. My hat off to the Ritz Carlton and as for the Mandarin oriential - they will never get my business again in Singapore!!

Reviews.Title: “I Loveeedddd It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rihyy9
Reviews.Content: I did not know where to start. This hotel is just so delightful! It is close to Changi International Airport, about half an hour of cab ride. There are 3 shopping malls nearby, which are Sintec City,Marina Square Shopping Mall and Raffles Place, ALL are within walking distance.Besides, Bugis Junction Shopping Mall is also near but I took a cab.The beds are really comfy and nice. The room is quite big.I booked for 2 connecting bedrooms for my family so it's very convenient for me.The lobby was very pretty decorated.I went during Christmas time and there was a huge Christmas tree where I remembered taking photos. Overall, this is a perfect place to stay and I would love to stay here again during my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: JonnyHei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MO Singapore multiple times in 2006 & 2007 while traveling on business. The hotel is well placed for walking access around town and a quick ride from the airport. I recommend booking a car from the hotel, they pick you up just outside customs. Booking the club level is a nice treat, but not as smart as ensuring you have a harbor view room. At the time, they were refurbished more recently than the city view rooms. Room service and staff treatment throughout the hotel was excellent. The spa is nice, but small and isn't separated from the flow of guests going to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “One of Worlds best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in this wonderful hotel. It has a perfect view to the Singapore Flyer and the ocean. surrounded by big shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dated?”
Reviews.Author: Pausanias
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Oriental in 1990. It was brand-new then and its atrium lobby was quite an eye-popper and that, combined with the trademark Mandarin Oriental levels of service and fine food, made it one of the greatest hotels we had ever stayed in. Today, the views from the rooms have become more spectacular with the development of the financial district and the marina, but the hotel is showing its age. That vast lobby now looks very, very dated, with acres of empty gloom, almost like a Soviet-era convention centre. Our premium harbour view room, 1402, was a bit dated and rather small by today’s standards, with a bulky TV set-minibar unit taking up a lot of space, though the newly installed bathroom was excellent and generally speaking this was a pleasant space to occupy. Downstairs, the restaurants are inward-looking, lacking any natural light, though our two meals were truly excellent - an evening buffet offered a wonderful tour of Asian cuisines and the buffet breakfast was world-class. The pool area lacks elegance or shade - something we crave - and the crazy-paving also betrays the hotel’s age. If I ran Mandarin Oriental I’d be looking to build anew here, take their brilliant staff with them, and sell off this brutalist building. On our return visit, in two months’ time, we’ve booked the next door Ritz-Carlton Millennia after inspecting their rooms and their pool area which seem to be a notch up. And we got the same room rate as the Oriental - around S$450 for B&B with a guaranteed 5pm check-out. So four stars out of five for what is, for most people, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury - 6 stars? - huge contrast to Bintan Island”
Reviews.Author: JackHughes
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hote. Everything is superb. A huge contrast to Bintan Lagoon Resort where we stayed the last 4 days and only had lots of troubles. The breakfast is very delicious. The view from the rooms stunning. Very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Service second to none”
Reviews.Author: steelmantom
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have stayed in. The service was fantastic - from the moment we arrived by taxi and I was greeted with 'good afternoon Mr *****.' That was a good trick. He didn't even see my luggage at that point. The service at the pool was amazing and I am not usually a pool person. You have to experience this. If it wasn't such a long journey from the UK I would be a regular.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning! May be my favourite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vissi87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore for 3 nights on the first stop of our overseas holiday. As we pulled up to the entrance of the hotel, a herd of bellboys hurried over, opened the doors of our taxi, greeted us, took our bags out and ushered us inside. Check in staff was very welcoming and made us feel at home. The public areas of the hotel are gorgeous and spotlessly clean and the lifts which take you to your room are glass which allows you to see the massive atrium interior of the hotel. It’s beautiful. We were escorted up to our 12th floor room by a very friendly man who demonstrated all the electronic features of the room for us. Our bags were brought up shortly after. The room itself was large and beautifully decorated in modern Asian style. The bathroom was massive and completely clad in marble with a deep bathtub and huge separate shower. The hotel provided every toiletry item you could think of such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, shavers, loofahs, combs etc as well as everything else you would expect from a 5 star hotel. They also provided two pairs of Mandarin Oriental branded slippers and bathrobes which was a nice touch. The large plasma screen built into the wall was fantastic, especially when watching it from the ultra comfortable beds. We even had our own balcony. Everything about the room was stunning. We had breakfast every morning at MELT The World Café and it was truly fantastic. The staff greeted us politely after seating us, explained all the various and different items we could choose from. The breakfast buffet was made up of at least 5 different stations all with so many different choices of food. They had the typical American breakfast, traditional Asian breakfast, Japanese breakfast, cereal and muesli station, waffle, pancake and muffin station, an area with cakes, doughnuts and Danish pastries and a fruit and juice station with every fruit you could possibly think of. It was really an outstanding experience. The concierge was always very helpful in organising tours or giving us directions. Every time we would return to the hotel after being out we would receive a lovely “welcome back” and smiles from every member of staff in the lobby. The staff members at this hotel were all so friendly and hospitable and it shows how much they are committed to providing fantastic service to every guest. Staying at Mandarin Oriental Singapore was an amazing experience. Our room was gorgeous, service was fantastic and food quality was great. I’ll have no hesitation in recommending the Mandarin Oriental to anyone who is visiting Singapore. It is a true luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: JA/IRBolton
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in a club room, booked city view and upgraded at checkin to harbour. The service in the clubroom was just outstanding and you are made to feel just at home, free drinks and snacks all day . Every member of staff went out of their way to give you great service. Great location and lovely swimming pool looking over the harbour. I would stay again if I was coming to Singapore. This hotel lived up to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Rennovated Rooms Make the MOSIN Top Hotel in Marina”
Reviews.Author: yamanote
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MOSIN in 1998 and were so turned off that we did not return until New Year's eve 2008. The Ritz Carlton, located next to MOSIN was our preferred hotel after that bad experience in 1998. What a great surprise to see the totally renovated rooms are a complete turnaround and raise the quality of the hotel to that expected in a MO. Our room included a large flat screen television with a wide selection of channels, a large desk, and very comfortable king bed. The bathroom has been totally upgraded as well. Our room had two sinks, a large bath tub and separate shower. We loved the pool. Its built on the roof of the Marina shopping center and is wide and expansive. The new pool furniture is comfortable and plentiful. Its a nice resort experience with a view of the skyscrapers of Raffles Place. The Balinese staff that run the pool are attentive and service oriented, providing oshibori wet towels, water, and occasional free snacks. We did not experience the food and beverage (except Morton's), preferring the lower prices and tasty fare available a short walk away at the Marina shopping center food centre. Also, the "gluttons bay" hawker centre is located just across the street. MOSIN has a branch of the American steakhouse Mortons located in the hotel. Its the best steak restaurant in Singapore (and southeast Asia). For steak lovers its definitely worth a visit, but its also one of the most expensive restaurants in Singapore. Just outside Morton's in a rotunda is a Morton themed martini bar that is one of my favorites. During happy hour free steak sandwiches are served, which are incredibly popular. Our interaction with the staff was no problem. The senior doormen were efficient and friendly in arranging taxi cab and transportation. I noted the room rate has started to ease off after years of inflation. The economic situation has certainly had an impact, but all the hotels in Marina had raised prices to unsustainable levels and the reckoning is now at hand. Check for promotions. The MOSIN has become my new preferred hotel in Singapore, overcoming years of loyalty to the RC.

Reviews.Title: “Variable levels of service - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: aluakea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over the Xmas break. Whilst the room was great and had the most fantastic view over the harbour and the breakfast was outstandingly good, the service was definitely not 5 star quality in all areas. The staff were also very variable. Some staff, for example the lady in the business centre and the concierge were excellent. On the other hand the hair drier in the room did not work and never got repaired by the service staff (they did bring a portable one). The annoying flashing message light on the phone was imposssible to put out as noone answered the phone at reception when I rang through to try to cancel it and so on and so on. We had booked and confirmed on a B and B basis, but the restaurant staff got confused, asked me to sign a bill anyway, thought there was only one guest (not sure who they thought my wife was!) and we had to check all this and sort it at the front desk. When our room key stopped working the front desk did not handle it well. Checked who I was by asking for my birth date, which I understand, but they could have done it politely with an apology, rather than being so peremptory. So the hotel has many good points, but in comparison with the Shangi La we had stayed in immediately before the service levels were at times very disappointing. Too many 'Pan Am' (false) smiles and no follow through !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PatWisconsin
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 2 AM, the front desk greeted us by name as we walked to reception. After hotel failed to give us a requested wake up call, we received a note of apology and a bottle of wine! The breakfast buffet was incredible with foods from Korea, China and India along with an array of "American" favorites. Don't miss the buffet! Accomodations were excellent and very clean. Location was good for shopping and walking to Raffles area. The Marina Mall is next door and connects to other shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “Fine rooms; not so fine service”
Reviews.Author: ALKDVS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice; the first time was for four days with Club Access (but not on the Club floor). The second was a quick one night stay. The first stay was excellent, though not without issues. The second stay was not excellent. The problems were always with service. The hotel imagines itself to be five stars, but it is not. The rooms are fine. We saw several. When we first arrived, at 1 am, we were taken to our harbor view room (we had reserved a City View room on recommendation of this site, and in acknowledgment of lower prices and more space). We thought the room small-ish, but settled in for the night, knowing that we would request a change the next day. We did that, showing that we had reserved a larger city room. The staff was accommodating, and moved us, though we then discovered that the air-conditioning in the new room was broken--and needed several hours of repairs. So they moved us again, this time to a nicer City View room, and sent a bottle of wine for our trouble. The Club Lounge was wonderful; the service was fine (except for the "concierge" there, who really knew nothing--and ended up referring us to the main hotel concierge). It was not exceptional in any way. In general, this hotel's service was lacking. There were no seats at the pool one day, and the attendants were unwilling to find any. We had to call the manager, who found some after 45 minutes. Service in the main restaurant, at breakfast, was worse: on the one morning we ate there, we were shown to our table. We placed drink orders, and then went to the buffet. When we got back, the table had been given away. They asked us to share it with the people who had taken it. We declined to do so. It took another five minutes to find a new table for us. Service in the Cherry Garden restaurant, and the spa, were both exceptional. So though we were generally pleased with the stay, we had some serious reservations about returning in five days. But we did so, confirming our reservation with the staff when we left, triple checking it with three different people. (And we left a bag as well.) When we came back, five days later, there was no record of the reservation. The hotel staff tried to cover this up, asking for various forms of identification to see if they could find it differing ways. When we confronted them, and produced a photocopy of the reservation, they admitted they had lost it in the five days we were away. I asked for the manager, who eventually made it right--though this took far too much time and caused us a bit of stress, further diminishing our short time in the city. It was, to put it simply, not five star service. We have stayed at the Four Seasons in Singapore, and would stay there again. The rooms at the Mandarin Oriental are the same size, or slightly bigger, but the service at the Four Seasons was, and is, head and shoulders above anything we saw at Mandarin Oriental. If service matters, there were enough irregularities and misfires at this hotel to urge travelers to approach it with caution. We like the location of Mandarin Oriental more but would not opt for it again.

Reviews.Title: “Restful and luxurious but not the best.”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: Price: SGD399 + tax. Breakfast SGD44 per adult. Room: 13th floor, king bed, great size, spotlessly clean, superb bathroom (bath, shower, and two basins). Service: friendly and helpful. Location: across from the Marina/Esplanade. Linked by flight of stairs to Marina Square shopping centre. Less than 10 minutes walk to Raffles City shopping centre. SGD20 taxi fare from airport. Breakfast: delicious! Friendly staff and every possible thing you could want to eat. Expensive if you only want a quick bite. Pool & Spa: pool was very relaxing with a great view of the city. Spa was lovely but too expensive as you can get the same - if not better/longer - treatments at other top spas. Overall: a lovely hotel that we really enjoyed but won't re-visit. We splurge on luxury hotels when we don't have much time in the city, or when we really need a break and, unfortunately, this one didn't provide us with value for money. We thought breakfast was expensive, and internet access wasn't included either. If money is no object, then we guess you'll love it. But then again, you'll probably choose a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views, Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Tsunami_5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary, so we decided to end our trip in the lap of luxury by staying at the Mandarin Oriental during our stop in Singapore. The hotel's exterior is unimpressive and not indicative of the modern interiors and stunning rooms. We were trying to decide between the Ritz Carlton and Mandarin Oriental (incidentally right next to each other with almost a shared courtyard), but chose the MO due to its floor-to-ceiling windows and high reviews. Overall, we were not as satisfied with the property as we'd like for the following reasons: - For the price charged and the kind of brand, service was extremely disappointing to say the least: 1. God help you if you try to order a DVD...according to their in-room directory, you are supposed to call guest services if you would like to order a DVD after 11pm. When I called Guest Services, the lady was first surprised by my request and then transferred me to the concierge desk. No one answered the phone at the concierge desk, so I called guest services back and explained no one was answering the phone. Her response? 'Oh! Let me transfer you again' and before I could say anything, I'd been transferred again. Finally after a good amount of waiting, the concierge deigned to answer the call. When I tried to explain the situation and that I only wanted to rent a DVD, he cut me off in the middle of the explanation and said 'I will have a colleague bring up the list of DVDs to your room'. Of course, the colleague, much less the DVD menu, never showed up. 2. I called Baggage Services to have our luggage picked up before 4pm as we were in a bit of hurry to catch our flight. The attendant asked for number of bags and confirmed someone would be at our door by 3:55. Of course, no one showed up. When I called at about 4:05pm, the attendant had no clue about the request and asked me for number of bags again and said someone would be up immediately...finally showed up at about 4:15pm. - Overpriced: the in-room dining rates are exorbitant for the kind of food. For 2 Penne Arrabiatta and 1 dessert, we were charged SGD 105. Though the pasta was nice, it was not worth the price. Dessert was great though. - Rigid: Breakfast stays open till 10:30, which is fine. If you happen to come at 10:28 like me and try to order omelette at 10:31, too bad. They will no longer serve from the buffet and you will have to order from the a la carte menu. As the staff is extremely busy cleaning up the buffet after the stroke of 10:30, service is extremely slow. At one point, it took the waiter 15 mins to get toast, by which time the rest of my husband's breakfast had gone cold. That said, the room was stunning with floor-to-ceiling window that faced the harbour and the Singapore Eye. Lit up at night, it was truly lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late one evening - around 1 a.m. Staff immediately jumped to attend to luggage and check me in. Took almost no time. Had to be at conference next morning at 8 a.m. -- luckily could walk there from hotel after receiving directions from staff. Room was excellent - as was bathroom. Separate shower & tub. Toilet in a partially walled off area, but without a door. Bath amenities were also pretty nice including more than the usual. Despite open air atmosphere of hotel, it always seemed hushed. Swimming pool was excellent for early morning workouts. Was much longer than traditional hotel pools. Upon exiting pool, found that hotel staff had left cool wet washcloth and glass of water next to my belongings. Fitness center was also excellent with same attentiveness. Had breakfast at hotel only one morning -- buffet at main restaurant. Very extensive and excellent quality. Needed to really pace myself. Assortment of newspapers offered. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Schroedinger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the best I've ever been to. The rooms are great: clean, large, beautiful. Food is fantastic, in particular the magnificent breakfast. Not to mention the service, which was simply awesome. Do opt for a room with a harbour view - it's great!

Reviews.Title: “DIsappointed! Lacked Ambience”
Reviews.Author: ExpatinCairo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 7am on Dec 6th and had booked our interconnecting rooms from 2pm on the 5th so that after our long flight we would have guaranteed access to our rooms. Despite this, the rooms were not ready and would not be until 3pm that afternoon although they offered us 2 separate rooms next to each other until they became available. Not great when you have 2 young children and you have spent a lot of time getting everything right and double confirming this with them 48 hrs before arrival. Despite this and having to talk to Front Desk manager, Direcor of rooms etc this was sorted by midday. The view of the harbour currently is very disappointing given all the building work, cranes etc so much so that we preferred the non harbour views. We have stayed in many 5 Star Hotels and whilst the service was great and the staff knew us by name it lacked something. We could not access the Club Lounge due to the ages of our children so not sure if this would have made a difference. If you are a business traveller this hotel would be great but as a tourist I think this would be a little disappointing. We had expected it to be like the one in Kuala Lumpur but it is not. It is hard to point to specifically what it is about the hotel..it is 5 Star service but lacks atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: JunianSH
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights last week. The room had a great view to the harbour. The sound system in the room was latest technology and it was easy to hookup my ipod. But what was really outstanding was the attention by the staff. They knew my name imediately and everybody was caring and trying to be of help, without giving the impression of being pushy. And every one would do the extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: EdwinT
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 night at The Oriental Club with a Harbour view room. The Club lounge is great, excellent service, food and atmosphere. Overall the staff is very helpfull and all can be arranged. Lot's of personal attention! Wasabi restaurant is less perfect but you can't have it all. Location is perfect to Orchard road. Not directly on thebusy street but close enough by MRT and Suntec mall. View to the Marina, Financial district and The Fullerton is wonderfull. They can leave the curtains out of the room :-). Compliments to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive ... but great”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
