Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in many ways Good location next door to Marina Square shopping which, itself is next door to City Hall MRT station. Great staff, always smiling & prepared to help. Good location for large business event. We held a 250 person conference there & it went very smoothly. Rooms are comfortable with all facilities you come to expect (good bed, internet, decent TV, comfortable bathroom with decent shower). Food is ok, if a little unexciting in the restaurants. Concierge is very happy to recommend places to go out to see & advise how best to get there. Staff are flexible too. I had to extend my stay due to the problems in Thailand & there were no problems accomodating me at short notice. All in all great - only niggle is the price. It seems expensive, even for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: SDHokie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for four nights over a two-week period (we stayed one night, then went up to the Datai in Langkawi for a week, then came back for three more nights afterwards). When I made our reservations online, I indicated it was our tenth anniversary. When we arrived, we were upgraded from a Club Harbor Room (which is very comfortable) to a Club Suite on the 20th floor (which is indulgent). You definitely want to get Club room - the complimentary breakfast and happy hour are a great benefit. The reception, conceirge, and wait/restaurant staff were incredibly friendly, responsive, and accomodating. From the time we were met outstide customs at Changi Airport and were wisked to the Mandarin in a Mercedes S-Class Sedan to the in-room check in, to every time we left or returned, the service was outstanding. The hotel is beautiful and the restaurants and bars we tried at the hotel were great. About the only negative thing I can say about the Mandarin is that the pool is a little on the small side. Aside from that, we would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel,modern city”
Reviews.Author: jgelsis
Reviews.Content: A hotel with perfect organization,friendly service and modern decoration!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to our high expectations and more. Check-in staff were friendly and helpful and presented us with a room upgrade and bottle of wine since it was our honeymoon. The room itself was spacious and well designed with plasma TV, DVD player etc. The buffet breakfast was exceptional - probably the best in any hotel I've had around the world - and well worth getting included in your rate if possible. The hotel location is good with some sights, shopping centres and a metro station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - Will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Julie-AnnFrost
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. The room was lovely and very comfortable with fantastic views over the Marina. We arrived at a very busy time but check in was good and the staff were very very pleasant and could not do enough for us. We had breakfast in the hotel each morning, the staff all calling us by our name was very impressive and service was faultless, the food was excellent and we were really spoilt for choice. We would definatley stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Service”
Reviews.Author: BeHappyM8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our 4 week Italian and Parisian holiday and although we received some very welcoming and warm hospitality in Europe, it was nothing compared to the 5 star service at the Mandarin Oriental. From the moment we were personally taken up to our upgraded Junior Suite (it was our 25th Wedding Anniversary and it was so sweet of Management to mark this with an upgrade) by a delightful and engaging Concierge till the moment we left 3 days later, the service and attention to detail was faultless. No-one needs to be fawned over but gee, it's nice to feel like royalty and the staff here could just not do enough for you. The hotel itself is magnificent as is the pool area which we chose to relax by after a month of walking, walking, walking. Again the service here was excellent, always bringing you complimentary water or frozen fruit or whatever. Our view of the Esplanade on the Bay and the entertainment warming up for Singapore's National Day topped off a most relaxing and welcoming stay.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As It Gets”
Reviews.Author: fly2it
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from seven days at the Mandarin Oriental and what a stay. The moment that we stepped out of the immigration hall, we where greeted by the hotel representative and taken back to the MO by a Mercedes. We were greeted by the hotel staff that where waiting for us at the front door, check-in was quick and smooth inside our room. Due to past experience we had booked a Club Harbour View room, but where upgraded to Club Harbour View suite. The view from these rooms at night is just fantastic with the Merlion standing at the entrance to the Singapore River to the back drop of the financial district. The rooms are all well appointed with impeccable décor that has a high standard of maintenance from the housekeeping team. The bags arrived within a few minutes of the check-in. The beds are very comfortable with a choice of pillows available to meet most needs. The housekeeping team serviced the room several times during the day and a turn down service was undertaken during evening cocktails. The bathroom was modern and well appointed with tub and a shower the toiletries where of a good standard. Visited Melt to experience the famous buffet breakfast and was not disappointed, the buffet was extensive, fresh and offered plentiful choice. Breakfast was also taken in the Club Lounge this was of a more formal offering where you are treated as individuals by professional dedicated staff. Used the gym on a daily basis, this had recently been refurbished with new Techno equipment, cold towels along with iced water always on hand. The pool and surrounding areas where spotless, the staff where very attentive anticipating your every need, offering iced water and cold towels upon arrival and several offerings of sorbets along with iced fruit. The club comes alive each evening and is a special place to unwind and enjoy some fabulous cocktails and canapés. One of the most over looked benefits offered to Club gests is a 20:00 check out, with most flights back into Europe departing around 23:00 it good to have a late check out. Any visit to MO must include an Oriental Club package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gomamagodover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 nights here. When we arrived at the hotel at 1:00am S'pore time, we were greated by a lady who checked us into our room right upstairs in our room. After being offered a refreshing pot of tea, she oriented us to our room. After that I took a nice hot shower and wallowed in the fabulous bed. The service was 2ed to none, they met our every need. We got the "Club Service" that included breakfast, afternoon tea and cocktails. (their slings were better than the Raffles Hotel" Long Bar slings) If we ever get back to S'Pore, we will be sure to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent MOS”
Reviews.Author: welshtrav
Reviews.Content: Not sure about the reviews below but my stay was my tenth. A fact recognised by the hotel. Having been picked up at the airport We were wisked from the car straight to the suite (we had been upgraded to recognise our 10th stay) It was fantastic. A card from the staff in the Club and the General Manager along with a bottle of wine and fruit waited for us) < The stay was perfect we were recognised by name everywhere we went. The staff were so attentive and could not have been more helpful, The pool was alway a delight with the staff greeting people as they arrived and providing water, sorbets and fruit throughout the day. Melt had the most amazing breakfast buffet and the Club also provided an excellent breakfast experience. Cocktails were always a pleasurable experiece with a wide range of food offerings available and impecable service. This hotel is in an excellent location and you are treated to memorable hospitality from the moment you approach the hotel. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: LindaEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel, puts the UK service to shame. Room we had was an Ocean suite and the views were incredible, large glass floor to ceiling windows all the way round the room. The soft furnishings, bathroom and even toiletries were all thought out so well and in keeping with the Oriental feel. Fresh fruit was delivered every morning and our bed was turned down with new slippers each night - not expected! The service was first class and the added bonus of using the club hour for drinks and nibbles each night was well worth it. I could go on and on! We wish we had had longer to enjoy the experience and if one day we ever go back to Singapore we will stay at the Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: frequentravller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. All rooms 'supposedly' renovated. Our non smoking room smelled of cigar smoke and the ancient TV did not work. To get a laundry pick up or any housekeeping/bellboy requirements took two calls.The second being the reminder. Our second room had a massive leak at 1am from the ceiling though a light fitting ruining my make up. For our troubles we just got a limo to the airport. This hotel - no comparison to its Bangkok or Hong Kong branch.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: BarneyGrimsby_UK
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Mandarin Oriental properties before, we were looking forward greatly to our stay. We arrived early in the morning after a very long flight from London expecting to check in straight away as we had paid extra for this, only to be told ourroom was not yet ready. Not a good start. They did provide us with coffee and toast from the breakfast buffet, but we had to sit in a corner almost in the corridor outside the breakfast room and were left to sit there for a couple of hours. Not good when you are exhausted and just want to get some sleep. A receptionist eventually came to find us only to tell us our room had been ready all along. No apology was given though. So we went to check in for the second time, only to find we were only booked in on a room only basis. Again we had paid for bed and breakfast. The receptionist was not pleased when I told her ths and dismissed this in an offhand way, eventually saying they would contact our tour operator. Too tired to follow this up further we went to our room. Our room was lovely. It was spacious and clean and had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable and no noise could be heard from adjoining rooms or the corridor. There were several restaurants in the hotel but we only used the breakfat buffet. The other restaurants were expensive although they didi look nice. Singapore is full of excellent places to eat, why limit yourself to a hotel? The breakfast was excellent, with a huge choice. It only ever had about 3 people in it every time we went in. I'm not sure it warranted 4 staff at the door, each saying good morning and walking us to our table. Too much fuss for our liking. The fresh juice section of the buffet was particulalry brilliant with so much choice. The pool was good. The attendants rolled out the towels and brought fresh iced water regularly. We didn't spend much time here though. We had a view of the pool from our room and it never had more than a handful of people sat out there. The concierge seemed too interested in talking to his mate the first time we wanted to talk to him. The second time we tried, we asked about getting booked on the breakfast with the animals at th zoo. We were pleased to get this sorted. When we asked him to book us a taxi, we found we had been booked on an organised coach tour. It was very good, but this was not what we asked the concierge to do for us. Our problem with our booking was still not sorted the day before we were checking out. I had to get in touch with our travel agaent back home before this was acually corrected. The staff in the hotel are overly attentive. We felt uncomfortable with the fact that when you walked in the lobby there were at least 6 staff waiting to say good evening to you. I'm sure some people expect this sort of fawning, but it does nothing for us. 1 person is surely enough. The hotel has some very good points but we were not bowled over by the service we got. When we return to Singapore we will be looking for an alternative hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Factory_Chris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay here and cannot say enough about how fantastic the whole experience was. We stayed in a Ocean Suite - decent size, well equipped room with a small balcony. Two things really stand out for me; one, the breakfast, there was an amazing selection of food on offer; noodles, sushi, Indian, Chinese, dim sum and the usual bacon, eggs, etc. There really is something for everyone all in in a nice relaxed atmosphere. And secondly; the service - little extra touches really made the difference; rose petals in the bath when we arrived, cold towels and sorbets brought to you jus when ou need then around the pool, front desk/front door/lift staff always attentive and friendly - they really make you feel special. The bar in the evening was really good aswell. A great view and good selection of drinks all in a chilled out atmosphere with live laid back jazz! I can definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay somewhere 'a bit special'.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Wallis1326
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three nights at the Mandarin Oriental - what a hotel, from entering to leaving the hotel everything is first class. We opted for a Club Room - this is highly recommended, it starts with a wonderful breakfast either continental or select from the menu, the foods on offer on the breakfast bar are incredible from the variety of fruits and nuts to the selection of breads. All day long it is tea, coffee, fruit juice, a selection of snacks plus peace and quiet. For two hours 5 - 7 it is cocktail time, any alcoholic beverage you may want plus a selection of "nibbles" more than enough for a light meal, then until 10.30ish it is coffee, tea, and a variety of soft drinks. The staff in the Club room are all very friendly and helpful. The bedrooms are just fantastic, we overlooked the harbour which at night was quite magical with all the buildings being lit up. Once we had registered at the hotel everyone was aware of our names and never failed to ask if we were ok, needed help or were just friendly. This is one of the best hotels and I only hope I will be lucky enough to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: cburrell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a three night stop over in Singapore staying at the Mandarin Oriental. We stayed in a Club Suite which allowed us access to the club lounge where we could enjoy complimentary breakfast, snacks, cocktails and champagne throughout the day. Every culinary delight you could ask for was on offer and the staff were truly attentive and polite. Singapore is a wonderful city and I would highly recommend staying at the Mandarin. However after visiting Raffles I did pine to stay there too. The two hotels couldn't be more different so both have advantages over one another. The Mandarin is ultra modern where as Raffles offers a step back to a bygone era of grace and imperial luxury. Our Suite at the Mandarin was very nice and could not be faulted. Extremely spacious offering a king bed and separate seating area. Modern bathroom and a small balcony. It also benefited from the most spectacular view of the Singapore Skyline. The hotel has many restaurants offering cuisine from all over the world. On our first night we ate at the Cherry Blossom Chinese restaurant which was very nice. We also dined at Morton's which I have to say was very expensive indeed. Two steaks with beers was in excess of $360. Nice steaks, I have to say, but $100 each...not sure. We managed to set aside some time to visit the spa where we enjoyed a couples massage for 90 mins. Absolutely incredible. This was truly the best massage I have ever had! After that we visited the pool where we spent the rest of the afternoon sunbathing. Attentive staff come around with complimentary fruit, granata and sorbet throughout the day to cool off the guests. During our short stay we managed to squeeze in a visit to the night safari, a night time spin on the Singapore Skyline and of course the obligatory Singapore slings at the Long Bar in Raffles. Oh and don't forget the shopping. Wow! My only disappointment was missing the Grand Prix by a few days. Oh well...a perfect excuse to visit again next year!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alipeper
Reviews.Content: The best services I’ve experienced during my stay in Asia. The rooms are not so big but very clean and fancy. The food was great, the thai one especially. I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: travelight33
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mandarin for 3 nights when the city was prepating form the F1. Excellent hotel, having stayed in several other Mandarin hotels, this one lived up to my expectations! Excellent Service. In room check in on the club floor was a nice touch after a long flight. Rooms are excellent with great views over the harbour (see my pic). The bars were lovely and the club lounge serves an excellent singapore sling! My only concern with the location was that it didn't feel very safe to go out exploring because there are main roads all around the hotel and it's not very pedestrian friendly, but a short trip in a taxi will take you where you want to go! Overall It was a lovely stay and Singapore as a city break is ideal. The shopping is excellent and there's a really nice mall joined onto the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Gecko10
Reviews.Content: Welcome and check-in was a little bit below expectations. Staff was very friendly but the personal touch was missing. The room was ok nothing very special. The Clubfloor lounge is very large and serves very good snacks. The Chinese Restaurant on the 5th floor has excellent food and service is above expectations. The Bar was a bit disappointing. Overall the Hotel is a little bit below what you would expect from a Mandarin Oriental in Asia. I have been staying in the Ritz-Carlton which is next door and has more spirit to it, so the next time I will prefer staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming details”
Reviews.Author: shelley_75
Reviews.Content: I have always admired the fine details of Mandarin Hotels, but, was extra pleased with the newly renovated Mandarin Oriental. Situated close to the Esplanade Park, this hotel has the charm unique to Mandarin Hotels. The standard rooms are mid-sized, yet had all the necessities needed by a business traveller. In all my trips, I always make it a point to try 2 things: (1) buffet breakfast and (2) room service. The buffet breakfast met the basic standard of serving continental + local items. Of course, the dimsum was quite good! Room service was excellent which made me decide to go for room service in my entire 5 days of stay. I also liked the good night truffles. While the lobby is quite small, checking in and out was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: RedzerH
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Mandarin Oriental and had a fantastic stay. The level of service is superior, the rooms dressed to perfection and the location amazing. The staff try to foresee every potential need you might have such as taxis etc without needing to be asked. The F1 preparation was being undertaken around the hotel and we enjoyed being able to watch this from the room and to see fantastic views generally. The japanese restaurant was amazing. I have nothing negative to say because this hotel clearly sets an example.

Reviews.Title: “Take a bow Mandarin Oriental Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: gfox7
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the late post but as they say good things to those who wait! Singapore is a vibrant electric city but if you look outside the box it is absolutely beautiful. Rich in natural beauty (the lush green surroundings on every road - corner is an absolute treat!), Singapore exceeded expectations for our annual family holiday. We booked seven nights at MO Singapore using MO central reservations. The booking Agent Chris is one of the most helpful people that anyone will ever come across so if you are thinking about going to MO anywhere in the world he should be the man you should book through. We encountered Singapore to be one of the best places that we have ever visited. It is very friendly and everyone at MO Singapore made our welcome extremely comfortable. For that I am very grateful especially to all the staff that served us breakfast. They were so polite (especially to my son - and I cannot thank them enough), that I was astounded by the level of professionalism, and this was to be found throughout the hotel. This is what booking a Five star hotel should be all about, and MO singapore is one of the best. We discovered Singapore by mostly walking it, and this is what anyone should do when they arrive here. The place is simply breathtaking. The shopping of course is an incredible experience but it can be overwhelming at times. Orchard Road is a wonderful experience if at times crazy but then Oxford Street in London is exactly the same thing so go figure. The highlight was popping into Raffles and experiencing a monumental treasure, at which you truly felt history still alive at the place. For us and especially our three year old, Singapore Zoo was the place to be. It was beyond words near enough to being THE jaw dropping experience of all time. It's about 12-15 miles away from the centre of Singapore but it is worth the effort. Consider this. It's Jurassic Park but with animals not dinosaurs and you should have an idea of the picture I'm trying to paint. We loved it and it should be the number one destination especially if you are a family reading this. The Zoo in my opinion beats Sentosa Island, simply because the Island is going through a lot of work. This isn't a bad thing because it will soon be a world class resort incorporating Universal studios. However be warned. Although you can have a two for one ticket to see the pink dolphins show and the sea life centre, the latter is a big let down for the price they charge. It's in and out at the sea life centre and it leaves you wanting more. So Singapore if you are reading this make a bigger sea life centre! Right next to Sentosa Island is Vivo shopping centre which we found to be extremely useful and the views from the top are incredible, and next door to that you have the ferry terminal just incase you fancy a hop on to somewhere else! In all if you are thinking to Singapore or not to Singapore, then do not hesitate. The other thing we realized was that Malaysia isn't so far away from Singapore, so if you want to go on a adventure there is nothing to stop you - that is if you have the time to do so. The last point I would like to make is this. When we booked our room we were told that we could have a child bed at no extra cost. However at arrival we were told that we would have to pay extra for a room to accommodate the bed. We of course declined and took it up with the management, who were very helpful and apologetic. Although at first we were disappointed at this hiccup, the management of the hotel including the manager himself wrote back to assure us that this will never happen again. I would like to add that even when something went wrong and not to our satisfaction, everyone at MO singapore were extremely helpful. We look forward to visiting MO and Singapore once again, and on a parting note I would like to thank the staff at MO and the manager for being incredibly courteous once more because they deserve it. MO Singapore anybody? Anyday...

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: This is clearly a greatly loved hotel and for many reasons - not only does it offer all the benefits of a first class city hotel - great choice of restaurants, superb spa, comfortable rooms, good business facilities etc but also a generous swimming pool area with plenty of comfortable sunbeds and resort style service. Food was among the best we have had in a hotel. Don't really like the architecture but very easy to ignore in such comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: Scoobydum77
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is very nice, but nothing special. It is very modern but lacks any real charm. We arrived late and decided to catch the buffet before it finished. The cost for two plus one glass of wine and two cokes worked out just under £100!! Food was not of a great standard. Cost of a glass of wine in the bar was around £11. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Floridot
Reviews.Content: I can't speak highly enough of our stay at the Mandarin Oriental, Singapore. From arrival to departure we receive the best service of the many hotels we stayed in on a round the world trip. We arrived very early morning after an overnight flight and were greeted with smiles and a lovely breakfast. We had a beautiful suite overlooking Marina Bay and the Singapore skyline and it was just perfect, with wonderful touches and the most comfy bed in the world. We ate in all of the restaurants and every one was a delight - particularly the Cherry Garden and Morton's. The swimming pool with regular service of iced fruits was just perfect after a hot day's shopping. We also made use of the Business Centre which had excellent facilities and the staff there were so helpful and courteous. The service as this hotel was outstanding, we felt that many hotels could benefit from the customer service training the Mandarin Oriental provides to its staff - they seemed to anticipate our needs before we even asked. The shops and attractions are really not far away and it was a delight to wander along the waterside, visit Clarke's Quay and see the Christmas lights on Orchard Road. This was a particularly special visit for my husband who lived in Singapore as a youngster so we looked forward to a very special return - we were not disappointed and we will certainly return to this hotel whenever we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but then it all came apart....”
Reviews.Author: sambakongen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 6 days in late august following a 7 day stay at The Regent. We had booked a club room using the Mandarin Oriental promotion with American Express (stay 3 days and pay only for 2). We were quite pleased with the hotel until our 3rd day. Staying in a club room we had been to the club lounge each day for breakfast and although there was a sign at the entrance mentioning the dresscode (no shorts and no open-toed sandals) this was widely ignored by the guests and on the 3rd day my wife walked in in flip-flops and was stopped at the entrance being advised she could not enter in those flip-flops. Pointing our that from the entrance she could see 2 other ladies in similar flip-flops, she was advised that the other ladies were wearing flip-flops not made from rubber.... My wife went to the room to change and the following day the club lounge manager stopped me in my tracks asking if my wife was upset over the incidence? Why the club lounge manager did not ask my wife I don't know, but I said that my wife was of course upset at having been discriminated at. Then it all fell apart for the club lounge manager... She said that they had approached the other ladies in the club lounge after turning my wife away and asked them to change shoes as my wife had pointed out they were not following the dress code. Some lame excuses followed and the manager asked me if things were now in order since they had ensured no one showed up in flip-flops. I was flabbergasted!!! I tried to explain the manager that we had nothing against the other guests wearing flip-flops but we had something against the hotel choosing to apply its policies at the entrance to some people and not to others. As we stood in the entrance to the club lounge talking about this, 2 ladies by the way walked in in flip-flops and were not stopped. The club lounge manager had no clue what I was referring to - and that is the exact reason I will never stay at a mandarin oriental hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply, stunning!”
Reviews.Author: OldVillain
Reviews.Content: The experience begins as you step from the taxi. Hotel staff open the taxi door and take your bag from the boot (trunk) of the cab. You are ushered into the cool, air-conditioned reception lobby. Lobby staff are immaculately dressed in the Mandarin Oriental’s classy uniform. Desk staff smile and greet you as if they are genuinely pleased to see you. If you are not already booked into a Club room, then upgrade – it is well worth it! http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=HZNsXnrNNWY I was given a room on the 19th floor. Definitely the floor to be on because that is where the Club Lounge is sited; just a short walk away from 1906, the room that I was given. This is a good room to go for (or 1901~1905) because you can pick-up the Club Lounge’s free Wireless Broadband, instead of using the in-room cabled service. It also saves you carrying your laptop into the Club Lounge. The rooms are beautifully appointed. All that you require is there for you in the various draws and cupboards to be discovered. Molton Brown shampoo, conditioner, body wash and body moisturiser are also available in Club rooms. It’s great to shower with these products in the morning and leaves you feeling pampered. You have a nice desk and chair (a mini office) to work from and a fabulous view over the marina and towards the Central Business District. Breakfast is served in the Club Lounge on the 19th floor from 06:30 until 10:30 (you can use the ‘Melt’ Restaurant on the 4th floor if you prefer but quite frankly I wouldn’t bother). Here on the 19th, you are treated as an individual by the immaculately dressed and professional staff. After breakfast is over you have morning coffee. Later, a light lunch-time snack is served buffet style. In the afternoon, you have Tea (scones, clotted cream and jam, amongst the other delights). Then comes the cocktail hour (two hours actually, from 17:30 until 19:30). Followed by snacks and drinks throughout the evening until the Lounge closes at 23:00. Morton’s Chicago Steakhouse is sited on the 4th floor and if you love a delicious steak, this is the place to go. There are other restaurants available, including a Japanese restaurant. Whether staying on business, like I did, or travelling as part of your vacation, this is one of ‘the’ places to stay in Singapore. I booked through Expedia.com and got an amazing packaged rate. As Mr Schwartzenegger once said, ‘I’ll be back!’

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bigkeeper
Reviews.Content: A first class hotel, with top-notch staff and personalized service. Every part of our stay was enjoyable. The moment we stepped out of immigration, we were greeted by our driver in a Mercedes. Upon departure, we were dropped off at Changi Airport in a Mercedes. The Oriental Club Level is terrific and most relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JBean73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in a club room from 22 Aug during the Singapore National day fireworks. The hotel must have been busy as the view from the harbour rooms of the fireworks is phenomenal. Despite being busy the service was excellent. The room, restuarants and services were all excellent. The staff very friendly and helpful. I liked the location, away from the hustle and bustle of Orchard road, but very close by taxi if you wanted to do some shopping. It was great to walk around the Marina area. I'd call it an understated 5 star luxury hotel that isnt pretentious, but has everything you require from a 5 star luxury hotel as a business traveller. I have stayed in many Singapore hotels and I will definately being staying at the Mandarin Oriental again on my next trip to Singapore in a few weeks times.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, great hotel, great breakfast !!”
Reviews.Author: erickred
Reviews.Content: Spent one night only at the Mandarin Oriental. We booked one Executive room with access to the executive lobby and late check out at no charge. Thus, we spent two full days in Singapore before going back home. The room is a top floored and handsome viewed room. We chose a bay view room. The executive lobby allow you to get free drinks all day long. The breakfast is trully extraordinary and delicious. We took a glass of champagne while eating our cramble eggs ! The hotel is located close to a big mall and a train station. Tips : it's cheaper and quicker to get a cab from/to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MorganJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 days as a business traveller. My room was a Junior Seaview suite. My feelings with regard to this place is mixed. The location is "alright" but not really within walking distance to the cool shopping areas, and the coastal view is a bit gloomy. Its not really something for a holiday sort of stay. For business use, it was excellent location wise - very close to the financial district, yet still luxurious. Fairly quiet "corner" of the city. Optically, the building is pretty hideous (as is much of Singapore from this time period). Inside its obvious that it has been upgraded (a lot) inside - recently. The lobby, elevators and restaurants were definatly of 5 star grade. The front desk service and lobby staff, also. (classic asian style service, tons and tons of employees). The rooms themselves were not really to my liking. I mean, lets keep it real here - the room price of a suite - is under 500 euro - so compared to europe or attractive parts of the US, it's not exactly expensive. But... The bathrooms had dated style marble - which was not very nice, the ligthing was generally poor (which is never a good sign), the windows / sliding doors were of original vintage, which detracted from the luxury feel. The AC was sort of weird, if you put it on 20c, it was meatlocker cold, anything above 20c (incl. 20.5) equaled 35c++ and very high humidity. Weird. The carpet was nice, but never "felt" clean. The amenities were plentiful. The minibar and TV was very 1990's. Generally the room just didn't feel "crisp" in any way. Scrapes and stuff all over the place. The closets stank like they had been closed for 15 years. Also, the shower had nice long black hairs in it, not so nice. ;( Cleaning (besides from the hairs) was mediocre. So... I guess... Not horrible, not great. Personally, I wouldnt go there again. Oh, the Mortons steakhouse at the hotel was as good as the ones in the states. Very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Morpheus07
Reviews.Content: We got an Executive Club room and requested a high floor. This was accommodated as we were on the 18th floor. When we got dropped off at the hotel, it was buzzing with people...at least 7 people were jostling into position to open car doors, check us in, welcome / greet us, open front hotel door, call the elevator, etc. I think over the 2.5 days there we were welcomed at least 100 times! The people are really warm and friendly and we can say was some of the best overall service that we have received. After a while it may seem a bit over the top but still nice! With the Executive Club room, you get access to the Executive Lounge on the 19th floor. Views are to the 'back' and not out the 'front' towards the marina or city skyline. That said, the food, snacks, drinks and comfort settings / furniture are very good. You can also use free wireless internet access up there...in case you don't know, the whole city of Singapore is wireless and anyone can register and access free internet, even tourists. I would also recommend paying the extra $20 or so to get a harbour / city skyline Executive Club Room looking over the 'front' rather than the 'back'. We made the mistake of not doing this. Pros - service, politeness of staff - quality of fittings and furnishings - cleanliness - food Cons - S$105 for a 1-way Merc E-Class ride to airport not worth the value (big S-Class Merc is S$155) - shopping mall attached to hotel is very average - Morton's Steak House not open for lunch On a side note, we did the Night Safari at the Singapore Zoo and would recommend this for a good time. To wrap up, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ed05
Reviews.Content: A really world class hotel. I stayed in a club harbour view room. Im my opinion it is well worth the extra to stay on the club floor. You receive champagne(moet) breakfast, afternoon tea, internet access and evening cocktails included in the price and the very nice atmosphere of the club lounge on the 19th floor. You can also benefit from in room check in and check out away from the crowd in the club. The room was very comfortable and benefited from a great view. As an aside I left a coupe of personal items in the room after we had checked out. They were delivered to me airside at Changi before departing. Impressive service.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best...”
Reviews.Author: SSS2005
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at MO, Sing in as many years. They have never let us down. We booked a City Suite through Amex and were upgraded to a Harbour View Suite. Spent 7 nights there. The staff could not be nicer... right from the Bellboys to the Room Service folks. We were travelling with my 2yr old daughter. She was virtually adopted by the folks working at Melt - the fabulous breakfast restaurant. We did a lot of room service for my daughter - dinner time - and they would make us off-the-menu items. We used their excellent baby sitting services too - hotel staff. Due to the National Day Parade it was a bit noisy with all the practicing going on but we didn't mind. At their rehersal my daughter got to enjoy the spectacle from our balcony - including some nice fireworks. This is a fabulous hotel - don't think twice about booking to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel with Unbeatable Service”
Reviews.Author: Cooki
Reviews.Content: From the outside the Mandarin Oriental looks rather unimaginative, but as soon as you step inside you are transported to hotel nirvana. The lobby is spectacular, albeit somewhat dark, with striking artwork and a large reception area that easily accommodates large numbers of guests arriving simultaneously. We were greeted by lovely reception staff, and were upgraded to a suite and provided with late checkout til 6pm. Upon booking we had mentioned that we were traveling for our anniversary, so the hotel saw fit to put us up in a fantastic room. In less than ten minutes we were riding one of the panoramic lifts in the atrium up to our room. Although we have often stayed in hotel suites, this particular one was no mere hotel room, but rather a full apartment in itself, with a separate dining area, kitchen, living room, and bedroom. The decor throughout was impeccable, and the service continued to raise the bar. Perfectly timed with our arrival, our bags came split seconds later, followed by a complimentary fruit and tea tray. The bed was one of the most comfortable ones I have ever had the pleasure to sleep in, with a choice of pillows that satisfied even a fussy sleeper like myself. I feel that one of the hallmarks of truly great hotels is invisible service, and staff that can truly anticipate your needs. Housekeeping managed to slip in and out of our suite unnoticed, and the turn down service was perfectly timed to coincide with our dinner outings. The concierge was extremely helpful, and was able to provide suggestions that covered everything from entertainment to dining and shopping. The service throughout was simply outstanding - genuinely hospitable, knowledgeable, and efficient. The hotel is located a little bit on the periphery of the more happening spots, but taxis are fairly cheap, and are a widely used means of transportation. The MRT is also extremely efficient, but you will have to walk a bit to the nearest station, and Singapore is not very pedestrian friendly in all areas. As a result, we ended up hopping in a taxi every time we stepped out of the hotel. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to people who want to experience hotels as they should be - supremely comfortable, with friendly and efficient staff, immaculate service, and beautiful interiors.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star Customer Service; Not great for tourists”
Reviews.Author: tygerlily
Reviews.Content: As a sightseer this hotel leaves a lot for desiring. We found Singapore customer service in general was greatly lacking but we expected better at the Mandarin Oriental....and were disappointed. Customer service at the concierge/front desk was very spotty. We actually had a concierge tell us to walk several blocks out of our way to do a money exchange because he was too busy chatting with his female coworkers. Lobby not that impressive but rooms decorated nice enough. You can tell the bathrooms are a bit old but still nice. It's a fine hotel for business trips but not very romantic or leisurely. Good access to the malls by the harborside and once you get a hang of the thoroughways through the malls, you can access the subway (MRT) almost without going outside - although it's still a good 10 min walk. We took advantage of the food court directly across the street from the hotel which was nice. Expect to do a lot of walking if you're sightseeing Singapore and don't expect great customer service even at the nicer malls.

Reviews.Title: “A very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: VicnHil
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at the Mandarin Oriental and I agree with the other reviews it is indeed a fabulous hotel very calm and relaxed. We stayed in a club room and it was well and truly worth the extra dollars. Our check in was friendly and efficient and we were taken to the club where we had a great pot of tea while the staff checked that our room was ready. Our room was on the 20th floor with a marina view simply wonderful. Plenty of room, a fabulous big, comfortable bed with a doona, big comfy pillows and a wardrobe with plenty of hanging space including lovely fluffy white gowns and slippers. We chose to stay in a club room to enjoy all the extras, particularly the late check out, as our flight did not leave until 9pm. The club became a special place where we could enjoy a quiet pot of tea and a bite to eat and of course some fabulous cocktails and canapés each evening. We were always made welcome by the great staff. I celebrated a birthday during our stay and the Mandarin Oriental surprised me with a birthday cake and the club staff all sang “Happy Birthday” it really made my birthday special. The front of house staff were wonderful, always ready with a smile and the concierge very helpful with directions and arranging tours. We used the services of the Oriental Spa and both agree that it was the best spa treatment we have so far experienced. We will definitely be making the Mandarin Oriental our hotel of choice the next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the MO except....”
Reviews.Author: Kichi73
Reviews.Content: As a local resident in Singapore, I decided to stay at the MO to watch the preview of the nation's National Day parade. As it was a busy weekend on Aug 2-3rd, the hotel was certainly put to the test in service standards. I was pretty perturbed when I reached the hotel for a check-in at 3pm and realised that my room was still not ready for occupation. I was told to wait for 1.5hrs. I was merely told I was to be allocated a higher floor than I had originally booked but not given any form of compensation while I waited. The front desk could have given me a welcome drink and told me to take a rest in the club lounge while I waited. Does that mean I had to wait and check time and again till I was eventually allocated a room? No answers were given. Was this the kind of service standards I had expected from a top ranking tripadvisor hotel? What's more, such service standards strayed from the usual standards I would expect from a MO hotel ! I began to wonder if It was because I was a local resident and not an international guest and therefore not given priority in room allocation. I know that front desk was under a lot of pressure but my point was that they could have been better prepared to deal with such a tight and pressing condition. I had no choice but to store my luggage with concierge and go ahead for a swim at the pool while I waited. Along the way, I was put through some inconvenience as I was still afterall a hotel guest, with no room but using hotel facilities. I waited patiently till half past five and still there was no news from front desk. I decided to go downstairs to front desk and after much difficuly, they finally found me a room. My question is - If I did not go downstairs at 6pm to enquire, would it mean that I was simply forgotten and had to wait till 7pm to get my room when I should have been given at 3pm? That would mean that I would have to miss half the show at the Marina bayfront where the preview was happning - the only reason why I chose to check in at the MO as it was directly facing the bayfront. I even had to remind the front desk there was a need for some form of compensation for the time lost. I was rather shocked such reminders had to be given after reading reviews about the excellent service standards at MO Singapore ! Are local guests not guests of the hotel at all? I was only able to speak to the Duty Manager subsequently who proceeded to apologise and compensate me for my time lost. The next day, I also received a personal apology note and a box of chocolates.Perhaps this was only an isolated event about their lack in service standards. The duty manager had superbly demonstrated the service standards of a top ranking hotel, so did the pool staff who remembered guests by name ( not all staff could do that ! ) as well as the some of frontline staff I met along the way. What I liked about the MO as compared to other hotels in Singapore is this - the huge buffet spread at MELT, the poolstaff who bend over backwards to provide excellent service and the awesome view of the harbour view rooms. Things to improve - service standards of front desk ,TV in rooms ( do consider changing to plasma or flat screen which the rest of the world is using ) and pl. treat all guests the same way, be it local or international. Although there was an unpleasant event I met during my stay, I still loved the MO Singapore, but do bear in mind that they should do better if they want to keep th top ranking on the tripadvisor website.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, over the top service, great location”
Reviews.Author: S3CR3T3X3C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2008. The hotel is an exemplary place and my kids are now forever spoiled for breakfast buffets. From the warm greetings when one arrives to the over-the-top excellent service, the MO is what other hotels aspire to be. It is a true oasis of calm and peace in otherwise hectic Singapore. What we liked/loved: - the SERVICE-- OH MY GOD they were absolutely amazing. Second only to the Shangri La Bangkok but not by much !! - the breakfast buffet is out of this world - the rooms were small but beautiful (fresh orchids in multiple locations) - the swimming pool on the 4th floor is really nice with great views - the aircon is really nice --kept the room meat-locker cool :-) - the overall look of the place -- very nice cool, Asian modern - the location is fantastic --right in Marina area close to everything and right next to the Marina Sq shopping mall (!convenient with a great food court) What we did not like/hated: - Singapore's National Day celebrations were scheduled to be held right across the street. This meant loud booming practice sessions at 9am. The din was equivalent to a rock concert. OUCH!! - For a super luxury hotel, I was surprised that the MO Singapore did not have those cool TOTO washlets, bidets etc. In fact the bathrooms were the only dated part of the hotel that I could discern. They need to update the bathrooms. - Laundry is definitely tailored for the expense account set. This means that you could be out USD 300 for doing a family's worth of clothes. The MO should come up with some reasonable family plan for this. It is painful and annoying. Overall we loved the place and will certainly stay again. We realize that Singapore is more a business hotel type spot rather than a resort type location but with a few tweaks the MO could move into the heavenly zone occupied by the Shangri La chain and some others. C'mon guys you can do it ! :-) Two qualified thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyKSN
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling around the world with my family, but I have never ever got so good service like here in Mandarin Oriental Hotel. What can I say.. Very good (=amazing) service, very good room. Thanks ! Family from Finland

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, no surprise”
Reviews.Author: lisa026
Reviews.Content: It will come as no surprise that this hotel gets raves from me. It truly is a great hotel and the service was wonderful. We had lost our luggage coming from London and they upgraded us to a suite and then gave us wonderful baskets with all the products needed, even a shirt, skirt and sleepwear, very much appriciated. They had the most wonderful breakfast buffet I have ever seen that set us up for the day and could not have been more helpful in every way. It was a very funky, modern hotel and we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Staying in the Hotel than outside!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissJewel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Club rooms which gives us access to the club lounge. We were picked up by their limosine service which is included in rates.....so i wont say it is free! (one way only). We were checked in privately so no queuing which I totally love. They catered to our needs 100%! Great customer services, sexy staff and very attentive. I will always stay at the Mandarin Oriental but its not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class - as good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: wasamaid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in July 2008, for only one night. En route from Darwin to Penang we decided to break our journey in Singapore. Upon our arrival at the hotel, we were overwhelmed by the efficiency and courtesy of the concierge and reception staff. We were then escorted to our room by a very pleasant reception clerk. We had booked a harbour view room (room 1403), and were very pleased with its appointments and features, and with its position. As a small feature, the hotel directory in our room was new and clean and not browsed by a hundred previous guests, as is often the case in other hotels. We had an uninterrupted view of the marina. However, as other trip advisors have noted, there is much construction work on two sides of the marina in this area of Singapore, and a floating stage is now positioned on the water, directly opposite the hotel. This detracts from the view, but there was no external noise. We arrived late, so chose to eat in our room. The room service menu was extensive, although expensive, but the food was very good. Breakfast at the Mandarin Oriental is as good as it gets, and is an experience in itself. Don't even think of having breakfast in your room. Staff remember the names of all guests, and the array of food is simply staggering, extending through several rooms. I seldom remember staff names, but one of our breakfast waiters (Ramees) provided us with exemplary service. Marina Square shopping centre adjoins the hotel. This hotel is quality through and through, and is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra at Raffles”
Reviews.Author: dodger15
Reviews.Content: Have you ever had that sinking moment in your stomach when you realized the ridiculous money you spent money on, you could have spent on something else much better? That sums up my experience at the Oriental. ***Before the Trip*** Prior to the trip, my fiance and I discussed booking with Raffles, but decided to save the extra bucks and stay with Oriental instead (at the end of the day, the money saved was only minuscule!). Not to say that the Oriental is anything to sneeze at - there were definitely some amazing features this Oriental had, but after staying the one in Bangkok and seeing what we could have had at Raffles, this was just another great experience at a luxury hotel but nothing spectacular. Right before we left for Singapore, we ordered a limo to pick us up at the airport. During the call, they offered us an upgrade to a club level room for not much so we said "Why not? Let's do it!" ***Arrival*** The chauffeur was already there when we arrived, helped us with our luggage and was VERY patient with us as my fiance rushed off to exchange currency. He was pleasant and we drove away in style in a gorgeous black Mercedes. Inside, he already had cold waters waiting for us - very thoughtful! The check-in process was a breeze and he took us up to our room. ***The Room*** The room was nice (#2136). It was chic and mostly modern with an Asian flair and lit beautifully with recessed lighting. Since it was a club room, we were on the 21st floor, but the view was industrial!! Muddy waters, a highway, industrial boats and construction below of some mall they were building - yuk. Disappointed. (Sidenote: I took this trip in Dec 2006 but I see from a recent review that they were still building the darn thing?) The bathroom was mediocre. The marble shower was nice, although I've seen better. The bathroom had that window blind thing again where you can actually look into the bathroom - annoying. And if you look through that window, the end of the bathroom from that angle is the toilet with no door. If you were laying on the bed facing the bathroom, you can actually see whomever stand up in front of the toilet doing their business - get my gist? It was a little too "close" for our comfort. Other than the view and the bathroom thing, the room was decent and furnished nicely, down to the fruit basket and bottle of wine. Woohoo! ***Club Benefits*** The club room was located on the 19th floor. They had some tasty yummies there and it was just so relaxing to sip some champagne with your honey by the window. It was quiet too - very nice. ***Limo Service*** This was the best part of the trip! We paid a bargain of about $50/hour to have a chauffeur drive us around Singapore. Great deal, considering the size of the island. I think we got away with paying about $300 total. :) Our chauffeur was AWESOME. He took us around all the sites and even helped us take pictures! When it rained and we were out of the car, he made sure he had an umbrella over us. He made sure we weren't hungry and when we were he took us to the most AMAZING noodleshop with delicious local flavors. The owner is supposed to be famous for how he makes the noodles - he even did a show for us! We felt very special in the restaurant. When we asked for a custom suit, the chauffeur took us to a fabulous shop and even had it shipped to us in the States for a discount off the price. Sweet! Our chauffeur also took us to Raffles to look around - that's when our hearts sank. Raffles was MUCH more gorgeous than the Oriental. The extra money we spent on the club room could have gotten a regular room at Raffles but - sigh - next time, right? There were so much more good stuff with the chauffeur but I won't tell it all here - this should give you the gist of how awesome their limo service is. ***Overall*** This is where I learned my lesson on how it usually pays off to pay just a little more for the hotel you really want. It was a good trip and the hotel was still nice (less the construction and window into the toilet thing), but our good time was mainly thanks to the limo driver. I probably wouldn't stay here again. P.S. The Oriental is adjacent to a mall - nice if you're bored but it wasn't anything to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Real Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggontour
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at most of the big hotels in Singapore, and the reality is that there's a lot of positives about all of them. I had not, for one reason and another, stayed at the Oriental. As I continued to read reviews, and with the benefit of an Amex FHR made a reservation. My trip includes some other fine stops; the Ritz-Carlton in Singapore and then the Park Hyatt in Saigon. However, my expectation was that my stay at the Oriental was going to be the best of them all (and the other two were very good indeed). The stay was good, but it didn't reach the level that I was anticipating. Generally the hotel is superb, but there were some items and some issues that grated. One was relating to an airport pick up car that Amex had cancelled well in advance, that had turned up and been charged to my room and stayed there even at check-out. (I promise you Changi airport is the one airport in the world that doesn't need an airport limo pick up. The worst experience on your way into town will be the ever increasing Singapore traffic.) I got an online survey from the hotel after I had left and I took care to provide some feedback that I was less than overwhelmed with my stay. As I've said not a disaster, just some issues. I might even have said that I preferred the Ritz Carlton. I then got a message from the hotel asking if I'd be willing to discuss my feedback. So, in what would have been late at night in Singapore (I'm in New York) the most charming lady (Michelle) called me from the hotel and listened to my feedback, and issues and the charge that I'd never managed to remove. She even listened to my gripes about the cost of room service, and that the door man didn't know where the Ford Factory Museum was (not many people do, it's about the Japanese occupation of Singapore and well worth a visit for history buffs) And she said the right things, and had the charge fixed the very next day. Finally I got a pleasant follow up note from the Duty Manager (Mandy). So, I have to admit that the service in the end did win me over and I'll be happy to stay there again. My only word of warning about the hotel - and others nearby - is that there is a lot of construction in the area. A situation I suspect that is not going to improve between now and the F-1 race.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: PPlog
Reviews.Content: My husband had collasped so you can imagine I was in quite a state. The staff were wonderful and supportive. They had arranged to pick us up from the hospital (Senior Guest Services Manager came along to) and had refreshments arranged for us in the room on our return back from the hospital. Mandy Lee was the Senior Guest Services Manager who had constansly kept in touch with me to make sure we were ok. We also had to cancel out flights which she had handled and also extended our stay at the MO. When we left Mandy was also there to say good bye. Service was brilliant. Thank you Mandy for all our support and effort. I was also extremely impressed with the service of all the other staff. Well done and I will definitely be staying there again when I visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and service , but Raffles is still number one”
Reviews.Author: mr_drabu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our recent anniversary. We arrived at a little past midnight and checked out the (technically) next day at 1300. Our last two trips we stayed at the Raffles, but given the short time period this time, we chose the Mandarin Oriental. We had booked last minute (around 4 days before). Their website had the best offers, but these had all been taken up so we booked with expedia and flew tiger airlines (even last minute half the price of Singapore Airlines). Our check in was absolutely flawless and service exquisite. Our rooms were (in typical Mandarin Oriental style) well designed and spacious. We booked the spa during our stay which was exquisite. The gym was nice too, although lacked the heavy weights which I was too busy to use anyway. All in all excellent hotel, excellent value for money and a top rate choice, although I prefer the Raffles (but not for the cost!). p.s. I had a harbour facing room and there were some rehearsals going on for Singapore Day. However these were mainly from the late afternoon till maybe 2100 hrs and did not disturb our stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lulu031
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and it is mainly due to the excellent service. Everyone smiled and greeted us, often having a friendly chat. Our harbour view room was great - very comfortable bed, great bathroom, huge window overlooking pool and sea. The incredible buffet breakfast was included and it was truly magnificent. The hostess who greeted us gave us a guided tour of the vast array of food that was available and by the time she showed us to our table our waiter knew our name - they have little rock and roll style ear pieces and the word must have been passed along! The service at the pool area likewise excellent - bottled iced water, little nibbles of frozen fruit, a tiny glass of gelato, iced towelettes - all complimentary. The hotel is very close to Marina Square shopping mall (great shoe shops) as well as others. You are never far from a mall in Singapore. Just across the road from the hotel we stumbled on a night food market on the harbourfront which was very buzzy and had delicious inexpensive food. As we were on our way home from Europe, this was the perfect stopover hotel - luxurious, comfortable, everything we needed within walking distance so that we could just relax (and shop).

Reviews.Title: “My kind of hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjmumto2
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and I cannot fault it one bit. The food was delicious and the rooms clean, comfortable and spacious. We were upgraded to the executive suite which I have to say is the best hotel room I have ever stayed in. I did find the reception area not as welcoming by design as the bars and restaurants are on the upper floors, but the teams of welcoming staff I could not fault. The pool was clean, the staff attentive and the nice touch of free cooled water and sorbet was a plus. Our card was rejected at check in and they still allowed us to go to the room and contact out bank to sort it out. Will definitely go there again

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Benchimus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right within walking distance of the Arts complex ('The Durian'), and near a number of other high end hotels. It's not far to walk to the nearest underground station (through the shopping complex next door), we became fairly expert at this route! As you would expect from the Mandarin Oriental chain, the service is excellent, and the rooms are well specified (very clean and tidy, excellent room service). The bathroom had a separate bath and shower, and the toiletries were replenished twice daily (also complimentary bottled water was provided twice daily - in fact they tidied the room twice daily). Our room had a view over the pool area, and we could see the bay in the distance. We took advantage of the cocktail happy hour at the bar (?Jack's?), and fell in love with Lychitinis (or however you spell it). We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, although I'm sure it would have been excellent; Singapore has some excellent food, and you won't be short on choice (assuming you like South and East Asian fare of course!)

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: lil-miss-sunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for one night on the way back from our honeymoon in Bali. The hotel is very impressive, we stayed in a club room on the top floor, the room was excellent, huge bed, luxury bathroom, imaculately clean. As we were on the club floor we had the use of the club lounge on the floor below, this was where our breakfast was served - you could have champagne with breakfast, they were bottles on ice alongside the juices. it had an amazing view of the city & you could go in there any time & help yourself to sanwiches, soft drinks, tea / cofee & cakes etc (we were only upgraded to club facilities as we were on honeymoon - we're not usually that extravagant !). The service in the hotel is second to none, you could call down to housekeeping for clean towels etc at any time & we were automatically offered check out at 8pm as our flight was not until midnight, you get the feeling that whatever you wanted if it was possible to get it or do it for you they would ! However we have to say that we felt although the service was superb & the staff ultra polite there is something a little impersonal about this hotel - its as if they expect a certain type of guest, not ordinary people like us. We commented that although the hotel was fantastic you could use the phrase "style over substance", think hotel babylon, lol ! However for one night it was a great experience & one which I would be more than happy to repeat, lol. We even got a glass of champagne while we were sat checking out......back to reality now !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: ab1e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the M O for 4 nights at the start of our honeymoon. On arrival we were upgraded to a harbour view room with a huge picture window, with views over the business district, the harbour and the Merlion statue. Staff were helpful throughout, and couldn't do enough to make our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic , highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmybyron
Reviews.Content: agreat hotel , excellent service , neaver have seen so many staff. great rooms , quiet , yet you can open a window. we were upgraded with out asking. the checkin occurs in the room which is always nice. nice clean pool for laps. the food was excellent , one of the waiters took a surprise pic of us and presented it to us at the end of the meal , free. late check out not an issue. great shopping center behind the hotel. one of the best we have stayed in , we will go back

Reviews.Title: “Poor service! Give it a miss!!”
Reviews.Author: Shiv'sTrip
Reviews.Content: I am writing about this hotel which suppose to be a 5 star?? No way its not a 5 star. We stayed here 16/05-20/05 Room 1237. Check in was Ok the receptionist was bit rude though just wanted my credit card details. We were on honey moon and first stop was bangkok which was Fantastic! and then oriental Singapore- The worst thing is that upon telling them that we were on honey moon we were given a smelly smoking room. my partner is asthmatic i told reception but they reacted like they don't care.. no upgrade no flowers no complimentary stuff from Oriental -we got chocolates and fruits from the Pullman King power Bangkok which is 10 times better than Mandarin oriental i think!!! we were forced to stay in this smelly smoky room which we paid $AUD300 per night. complained few times and given up we were told there is some expo going on there are no rooms available. Pathetic! The water force in taps in bathroom is so slow that you have to take about 20 mins to shower properly. staff here behave like they are very polite but they are not. i will never stay at this hotel again. there are other options available like holiday inn or swissotel merchant in Singapore written a complaint to hotel manager no answer. Simply Pathetic Poor Service!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: pmetka
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights for a stopover in singapore, and we had booked 1 room on their executive floor, Hotel design is stunning but some service are not what you expect from a 5 stars hotel. Check in should have been done thru the special floor for executive customer, but for some reason they didn't let us go upstair and check in was very slow, after showing us the room which was not what I booked (harbour view!) I had to insist that I wanted what I had booked and they finally gave me the room! And it was worth it as view was amazing! The BB and cocktail were very good and tasty

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a place - service with a capital S”
Reviews.Author: TravellersHobart
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night here before our return to Australia. We moved from the InterContinental because of the guaranteed 8pm check out in the Club rooms. We were offer an upgrade to a larger Club room - the only problem was it was a smoking room and we had requested a non-smoking room. The room had been "de-smoked so there was no lingering smoke smell. The view over the harbour was spectacular. The room was spacious and the bathroom was beautifully designed. The decor of the Club lounge was inviting and the outlook was so good you could sit there with a very good cup of coffee or a very cold glass of champagne for a very long time. Staff in the lounge knew what service was and did it well. Nothing ever appeared to be a problem. They asked for the correct pronunciation of my surname so they could correctly address us. I travel under my maiden name (passport hassles) therefore my husband and I have different surnames on our hotel bookings but not once was I called Mrs husband name or my husband called Mr my name - they got it right everytime. The Club lounge had the most extensive breakfast menu of any of the Club lounges in the 3 hotels we stayed in Singapore this trip. With free flowing Moet champagne and the choice of items cooked to order for breakfast it was sensational. Evening cocktails were wonderful - basically anything you want and very good quality spirits used. Food at the evening cocktails was a hugh selection of tasty morsels. I just loved the place and would have liked to stay there for a lot longer - we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: gavinessex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my one & only night in Singapore. The hotel is now looking dated and in need of upgrading though the rooms are very pleasant & comfortable. However, in my opinion one of the key benefits to staying at a top class hotel is for the concierge service. However, not only could the concierge not get me into my preferred choice of restaurant he seemed unable to come up with any suggestions that he could get me into. In desperation I decided to call my chosen restaurant and managed to get a table when the concierge had failed. This whole process wasted an hour of my time. On the upside, the restaurants & bars in the hotel are outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Benalmadena01
Reviews.Content: Using the hotel internet site I booked a four night stay in a Deluxe King Room and a round trip from the airport in a Mercedes S-Class. A very friendly driver was waiting for us at arrivals and we had a beautiful trip to the hotel. A whole line of employees greeted us by name when we arrived. We were whisked immediately to the room where we were given jasmine tea as we checked-in. We were on the eleventh floor and on the other side of the hotel from the harbour. I asked about an upgrade. I was told that the room we were in had recently been refurbished and that it was a lovely room (which indeed it was). We also had the advantage of having a terrace and not being on the noisy side of the hotel so we stuck with that room. I enquired about access to the Club but for the price we decided we would rather go 'a la carte'. On the first morning we got a taxi to Raffles and had lunch at the Long Bar in Raffles with a Singapore Sling and in the evening we had a beautiful meal at the restaurant at the top of the Swissôtel - what a lovely view. We went to Mortons Steakhouse one night and had an excellent service, in fact we weren't even shown a menu to order from but rather the waiter came over with a trolley and we were shown various cuts of meat on a plate and various vegetables to choose from. I forgot to enquire about the prices (since we were shown no written menu apart from the wine menu) and when the bill came at the end it was more than the price of a night's stay in the hotel! The last night we went to the Dolce Vita restaurant and ate at the side of the pool. What a restaurant! Amongst the best I've ever been to. I guess we liked the tranquility and the spaciousness of it besides the excellent food. It only lacked live piano music! We both miss that restaurant. What I don't miss in this hotel though was walking along the corridor on the 11th floor to get to our room. I'm 1.94 metres tall and when I looked over the railing as I walked I found it a little disorientating - I would have felt more comfortable if the railing had been about 30 cm higher off the ground. One night the toilet wouldn't flush. After ringing reception the maintenance man was at the door about a minute later which was impressive. He left our room and accessed the toilet from an area on the other side of the wall. It was fixed and I was told to wait at least a minute inbetween flushes. However an overflow tap next to the toilet dripped every few seconds so we had to put towels down on the bathroom floor so we wouldn't slip at night. Check out was extended to 2pm for us.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: AreAnyNamesNotTaken
Reviews.Content: I actually preferred this hotel to the vastly more expensive Ritz-Carlton next door, where I stayed on my last visit to Singapore. Of course, it can't match the RC for sheer sumptuousness, but it is cosier and feels as though a lot more effort went into the decoration and furnishings. Despite the Oriental's huge size, the tasteful rooms and well-equipped rooms manage to have a boutique feel that is unusual for this kind of business hotel. The public areas of the hotel are an extraordinary mish-mash of wacky architecture and clashing styles, from trendy modern Japanese to tacky 1970s European; whether or not this is to your taste is a matter of opinion, but it certainly makes a change from the usual faceless, identikit hotels that I spend so much of my time in. Unlike most business hotels, this is one that I would also be more than happy to book for a holiday (assuming I wanted to go to Sing on holiday!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: maugrim
Reviews.Content: I read previous reviews and was looking for a nice break at the end of a work related trip. To unwind a bit, I booked a Club room and found that it was worth the extra money. Room wise, the Fullerton has a better feel, though I could hardly argue with the view I was given, looking straight at the Merlion and surrounding area. For me at least, one of the best features in the room was the speaker system which could be connected to a variety of devices including ipods. Whilst the rooms may be less so, the level of service is way better than that of the Fullerton. It is worth staying here for the staff alone, who are genuine in anticipating needs and of being genuinely helpful. From the sorbets, water and ice cold fruit, poolside every half hour or so, to having drinks re-filled in the club floor area, the level of service and manners is akin to travelling first class on an Asian airline. I can't give a better accolade than that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellers2Perth
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 4 days on the return journey from the UK. We arrived early (9 am) and our room was not ready but the hotel staff were excellent. As it was going to be 4 hours before we could get into our room we were upgraded to a suite with views overlooking the Marina. The spa and pool facilities were excellent as was the morning breakfast buffet . The hotel was spotless and the service exceptional, everyone made you feel very special. It is also within walking distance to the restaurants and night life of Boat and Clarke Quays and Orchard Road for shopping. Having travelled all over the world and stayed in some pretty top notch hotels (including Singapore previously on many occasions) this is certainly one of the best for its general all round appeal. We will definitely stay on our return again in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “DonandHelen”
Reviews.Author: DonandHelen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights en route to Shanghai and 5 nights on the way home to Sydney. We have been to Singapore many times and have stayed at most major hotels represented. We always book for the Club floor (this is important) as it is a home away from home. The Club Lounge has champagne breakfast, unlimited soft drinks and tea and coffee during the day in addition to cocktails and canapes at night. It is also a quiet haven after shopping/sightseeing in the city. The accommodation (approx. 41 sq. metres) is first rate and the attention to detail is outstanding. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff who are very attentive when required. The hotel is within walking distance from the subway which is most convenient if not using taxis. We have stayed at this hotel many times and rate it 1st or 2nd in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: bjpdds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 days and we absolutely loved it. The entire hotel staff was very polite, friendly, and catered to our every need. The restaurants were great, especially breakfast at Melt the world cafe. The location was perfect as you can walk to the major attractions or take the MRT to anywhere in Singapore. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotell”
Reviews.Author: finakyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental at the beginning of our recent 3 week trip to Singapore and Thailand. We arrived at the hotel at 7am in the morning after a long and tiring flight. Despite check in not being until 2pm, and the hotel being fairly full, we were able to get access to our room by 8.30am after having had breakfast in the hotel's restuarant. Public areas in the hotel were very nice, with a number of bars and restuarants, shops, a fitness centre and a ovel yutdoor pool and sun terrace. Our room was located on the 8th floor and was very well appointed, with a large bathroom containing both a bath and a double shower cubicle. Both furniture and decor was very nice and the bed was enormous and very comfortable with a selection of pillows available. The view of the harbour from the massive floor to ceiling window was spectacular. All of the staff members we came into contact with during our stay were friendly, polite and efficient. All in all we found this to be an excellent hotel, in a great location and perfect for a short stay in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: DerbyshireEdyth
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this hotel for 2 nights stay. Previously we had stayed 4 nights Valley Wing Shangri La Hotel Singapore and also 7 Nights Club Intercontinental Bali. Both of which gave us superb service.
