So we were looking forward to finishing our trip with the Manadarin Oriental. I am afraid we were rather disappointed. Check in was luckwarm to say the least. On arrival to our room check in was very matter of fact. No mention of the Jasmin Tea left in the room. We found that later. Service in the Club Lounge much the same. Apart from Jana he was very attentive and remembered how we liked our drinks. The ladies frequently passed us by and often did not listen intently enough to our requests and got it wrong. The room was well presented and modern and comfortable. We had a City View and it was quiet! However, the bathroom was very small no bath just large walk in shower. The only other problem encountered was with the actual structure of the Hotel. With a central atrium from floor to ceiling and being on the top floors my husband suffered from vertigo. All the six glass open lifts went directly from the centre of the atrium. Quite spectacular if you can stand heights and a number of people found this a problem. Don't come out of your room and look straight over the bannister! it's a sheer drop to the floor! It was nevertheless an interesting experience, but we did expect something more. We shan't be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Personal hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyQ
Reviews.Content: This is simple one of the best hotels I ever stayed at, and I usually stay at 5 star hotel. I also think you got a lot for your money. From the moment you arrived until you left you were given all assistance and possible care. I recommend the club floor, where there is a superb breakfast included.m The evenings aperifs are almost a dinner and i saw several comples that in the afternoon used the bar for bottles of free champagne of good quality. The hotel is very good for business travels with comfort for business work and fast internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbaLondon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Huge room, huge bed, huge TV.... excellent service (which is, of course characteristic of such places in Singapore). Cannot fault anything. Breakfast is delicious but expensive so it would be a bonus to have it included in the room rate. It is really nice to have a balcony, especially if one smokes. All in all an excellent hotel. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mandarin Oriental”
Reviews.Author: noonie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and got upgraded to a seaview deluxe room. Overall a quality hotel with great staff and service, comfortable rooms and all the amenities you would expect for such a reputable name. Breakfast quality and choice was overwhelming, with great staff also. Only a couple of minor niggles - not enough poolside loungers at peak times, plus single glazing in the rooms not enough to block out the construction noise from across the harbour. Would still book here again without hesitation all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Coltbridge
Reviews.Content: A one night stay in March. They slightly messed up my arrival (at 0800 off an overnight flight) saying "you cant check in til 2", but the supervisor sorted it pretty quickly, and gave me a complimentary breakfast while I waited an hour for my room. The room was good - about 200 square feet plus bathroom (separate shower, immaculate bathroom), and a balcony. The decor was fresh and modern while still high quality, the bed just right (not too soft or hard). At first I was a bit annoyed by the lift chimes, which were clearly audible in the rooms, but these are turned off at night so they didnt disturb my sleep. The lobby is quite "dark wood, water and glass", distinctive in design but maybe a little heavy. The rooms sit on a series of inverted pyramid balconies, so each balcony looks dramatically down into a gulf - very striking. The staff are amazing - desparately keen to help. So keen, in fact, that they sometimes dont actually listen to what you want but just assume and rush off at high speed to deliver their best guess! I would happily stay here again. A really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations...”
Reviews.Author: icycle_jen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriental after the Chinese New Year for four nights in the City View room from the 11th till 15th of February. We arrived earlier than the 12pm check-in time but they still managed to check us in efficiently and without hassle. Staff were extremely nice and welcoming in that they opened the lobby doors once you went in and out of the hotel and into the lift. Upon walking towards our room, the atrium amazed us. A staff member from the front desk escorted us to our room and made sure everything was in working order. Luckily we got a room that was just newly renovated with a new tv and other amenities. The room had a balcony which was an added bonus. The room was serviced twice daily and it was extremely well maintained. Everything was provided in the bathroom from spabath powder, toothbrushes, shavers and even hair ties. Fresh fruit including apples and mandarins were provided together with bottled water daily. Newspaper was left outside the door every morning even without our request. Being situated directly opposite Marina Bay meant that the walking distance to major attractions such Gluttons Bay (hawkers heaven) was less than one minute and major shopping centres like Marina Sqaure and Suntec Centre was easily accessible. Marina Square could be reached from exiting the lobby and turning right towards the staircase which we found to be of convenience. We were lucky enough to be able to catch the Chingay Parade of Dreams Demonstration right in front of the hotel that lasted for approximately 4 hours. The Singapore Eye could also be seen from the hotel and looked spectacular in nature. We checked out at approximately 3:30 since out flight was around 4pm in which check out for us was extended free of charge. Taxi's are freely available within the hotel premise and buses stop right in front of the hotel if one wants to try out their public transport. One of the best hotels I have every stayed at and service was beyond expectations. Will definitely go again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: bighonez
Reviews.Content: Wow. This was a very nice hotel. Very impressive central atrium that goes all the way to the top of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Breakfast is not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: fcetonia
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the hotel and staff. The service was superb.Nothing was too much trouble and always with a smile and friendly manner. the Breakfast may appear to be pricey but belive me it is not to be missed !!! Worth every penny, I only wish I had an enormous appitite to do it the justice it deserved. I would certainly return to the OM when next in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, efficent but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Trippinbrit
Reviews.Content: The staff here is pleasant and efficient and the hotel is very attractive. We arrived to be immediately escorted to our club room on the 20th floor overlooking the marina for check in. The room is a good size with a large bed and a very good desk set up. There is plenty of storage space and everything is immaculately clean. The bathroom was a bit of a disappointment; only one sink and a very short bathtub. I suspect that this a popular business hotel where the rooms frequently have single occupants with the majority being male. The club lounge for breakfast would be very nice except for all the cell phones being yelled into. Is it my imagination or does the volume decrease as they get older - the young ones seem to be trying so hard to impress. You can immediately recognize the ones who are already successful, they don't yell, if they use their phones at all. Later in the day the lounge is pleasant for a cold drink and a snack. We dined at the the Italian restaurant by the very attractive pool area and the food was quite good with attentive service. All in all this a well-run hotel with much to recommend it. Now the negative. The marina area is undergoing a lot of construction including a monumental casino across the channel from the Oriental. The construction and traffic noise is just plain loud. There was a pile driver going while we were there that didn't stop until 10pm. I can't imagine what it is like when the floating stage directly in front of the hotel is in use.The windows at the Oriental simply aren't up to blocking out the noise. A retrofit with airport-style quad glazing is definitely in order. While we liked the hotel we would probably choose something a bit quieter next time.

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd Visit and still amazing but must upgrade to club floor”
Reviews.Author: jorichards
Reviews.Content: My 3rd visit ! and still love this hotel . On my first two visits I stayed in the club rooms so I think I have been spolit as this time we were only in Singapore for under 1 day so I decided to stay in a Standard rooms ( not worth the upgrade for this amount of time) . The rooms are equally as good but I missed the personal service and the attention to detail given when you stay in the club floor rooms. Also missed the free buffet breakfast & drinks and canapes in the evening. The location of the hotel in my mind is one of the best , easy access to boat quay , suntec city shopping mall,raffles and city centre sightseeing, it's also on most of the sightseeing bus route if want to go further afield. If you are thinking of staying in singapore I would not hesitate to book this hotel and would not consider staying anywhere else .

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: MrPJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for ten nights over Christmas whilst visiting family. Had a Club City Room, slightly larger than the Sea and Marina view rooms as I recall but not by much - a very good size. On every level I found it impossible to fault the hotel - staff were incredibly attentive and polite but never overbearing or appearing to be 'sucking up' or giving the impression you are a king. They just come across as genuinely happy to be at work and pleased to see you, like friends. We just felt totally at home throughout. I would almost everyone take a Club floor room. The Club offers excellent value for money and you can, if you wish, eat three meals a day up there (inclusive) incl. champagne breakfast and cocktails at tea. The Club staff are amazing and the whole Club experience made our stay extra special, providing the perfect place to relax and meet friends and family before venturing out. Choice of restaurants on site is exceptional and Melt totally changed out attitude to buffet. The quality of food was incredible so much so that after our first lunch visit we decided to have Christmas Dinner there too. Every festive food imaginable available including Lobster, monkish, sushi, roast turkey, brussel sprouts(!) indian, thai, chinese and, especially for the Antipodeans, an a open charcoal barbecue outside with a huge selection of meat and fish cooked on demand plus a whole lamb. it's not just quality though - nothing is on massive platters, just smaller plates, expertly prepared and replenished as required. Which made it easier to take small bites and enjoy a little of everything rather than stuff yourself on the first course. My mouth waters just thinking about it........ oh to be back there! Mortons Steakhouse on site is like being in the US - I've spent plenty of time in the US and it was like being teleported back there. Food, portions, service, style..... an incredible feat of theming and a fantastic meal. Then to working off the marvellous food......the gym is newly equipped and the well trained staff were, again, well beyond expectaions. The outside pool area was relaxing with great service from the staff. Concierge was spot on too - a little something I noticed was that the hotel staff gave all the taxi drivers a gift. Might have been Christmas or to highlight that it is now branded Mandarin Oriental and not just The Oriental. Which incidentally was the only problem, if any, during our stay. Despite the age of the hotel and its appearance in so many photos I could not believe the lengths we had to go to in explaining what hotel we were going to and where it was. Grasping Singlish helps but even then we needed to list every other hotel in the vicinity before drivers worked out where to go. But I think the gifts were a means to deal with this - a great idea. Totally recommended and I do not want to stay anywhere else next time. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Lakshmi
Reviews.Content: I know my review is late (10 months late), but I simply miss it that much – that I thought I would reminisce back and write a review for the travellers which are looking to stay here. Starting from the top, my and my husband arrived at Singapore Airport where we had a Mercedes waiting for us. The driver kindly helped us with our luggage and gave us cold hand towels and bottled mineral water. We arrived to the hotel and we where greeting with such respect. The door was opened and they congratulated us using our name that was really personal and again great service. As we where staying at the Executive Club Lounge, we where escorted up to our bedroom, where the lady did the check in registration. After we where shown around the hotel and again great service. The must do’s in the hotel are: 1. Spa (Amazing experience especially the couples packages) 2. Eating in the world café (food is amazing and get all world selections) 3. Upgrading so you have access to the club lounge (unlimited non alcoholic and alcoholic drinks served with canapés) This is a fantastic service and I am itching to go back very soon, after I am back from Hong Kong Oriental Mandarin. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Oriental”
Reviews.Author: 73Duck
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the MO on the return leg from Vietnam; can't add too much more than the other glowing reviews below. The MO may not be everyone's cup of tea; it is a stark, minimalist design, but very tasteful nevertheless. The interior atrium is simply awesome in its scale; the elevator shafts are arranged in a circle that look like a Buck Rogers space ship getting ready to launch. We were on the 11th floor with a great view of the harbor; every detail has been thought of. Our rate didn't include breakfast, and at 50 Singapore dollars each we decided to pass it up. As has been previously pointed out, the location and service are superb; this is a very desirable address in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: melandra
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 2 nights here on our way to Australia. The hotel and service are fabulous.We were on our honeymoon and they gave us a free bottle of champagne. We were already in a wonderful room. The buffet breakfasts were the best I've ever had and well worth the money. We had room service food one night and it was good and not over expensive we thought. Loads of it also. We ate at the restaraunt I think it was the Cherry Blossom or something which was a bit pricey but excellent and very authentic. On our last day we booked the 3 hour romance spa ritual/massage and it was to die for. Worth every penny!! My husband even tipped the masseurs £25 we loved it so much. The hotel itself is a wonderful building with a sort of huge twisted atrium in the middle. And it was immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: It is so hard to choose between the first class hotels in Asia & we have stayed at some of the best - Four Seasons, Peninsula, Shangri-La etc but this was our first time an a Mandarin Oriental property & it is by far the best in Singapore. At first we found the decor underwhelmimg in comparison to some of the more ostentatious hotels but what the MO has in bucketloads is superb style & service. Rich, dark, sensuous interiors & fantastic staff. Forget the superior rooms, as for just a little more you can get a Club Room & the difference is out of this world. You have access to the private Club Lounge with the most amazing benefits - from champagne breakfasts, morning & afternoon cream teas to evening cocktails & canapes - all free & served in the lovely 19th floor lounge with plush sofas & great views (no children under 16 allowed) even the internet connection is free so it represents fantastic value for money. Wonderful rooms with great bathroom & Molten & Brown toiletries replenished twice daily. The service is impecable - it was my birthday whilst I was there & the staff produced 2 huge birthday cakes as well as putting out fresh fruit & flowers every day. Rooms with a harbour or ocean view are only slightly more expensive than city view rooms so well worth the extra. By far the best hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best...”
Reviews.Author: mlb11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MOH 2 years ago in a harbor view room right after they renovated. The room and facilities were first class. In early February, I stayed in a harbor view room again, now 2 years after the renovation and it is still first class. The rooms are very chic, comfortable, and the sound system very nice. The view is awesome! Read the other reviews concerning food and service - they are exactly right. If you do want to venture out and eat some good, cheap local food then go to the "food republic" located in the Suntec Convention center, about a 10 minute walk from the hotel (mostly indoors). I ate toast, eggs and kopi (coffee) there for breakfast on several mornings for under $3SGD. My only slight complaints with the MOH are the internet charge which is 50 cents a minute and soap/shampoo. Given the quality of services this hotel offers and the Mandarin Oriental Hotel group as a whole, they should not charge for the internet (especially in-room wireless). The soap/shampoo are okay, but seem a bit economical for the hotel. They should offer a higher quality brand of product such as my experience at other hotels that use Aveda, Thann, Juku, etc....

Reviews.Title: “absolutely the best”
Reviews.Author: merionvw
Reviews.Content: Having travelled extensively on both business and pleasure i can honestly say this is one of the best if not the best hotel i have ever stayed in. The location is great - walking distance from the city centre, raffles and all the major attractions. the rooms are big and beautiful, spotlessly clean and so are the pool and reception areas. The bars serve great cocktails and snacks. The breakfast buffet is without doubt the best i have encountered. yes it has all the usuals western style but all with a quality i have never come across before - fresh, plentiful and varied. But you can also choose from the japanese, chinese or indian buffets - mix and match. and it is all being cooked fresh in the open to view kitchen so its always piping hot. but such interesting and varied dishes. the bread staion has just everything and the fresh fruit covers a whole counter with tropical fruits i have never come across as well as all ones i am used to. they will even freshly squeeze a fruit smoothie for you from any combination. If possible the dinner buffet is even better - do NOT bother eating outside - we tried it one night and regretted it. The starters include huge prawns, oysters, crab and every kiond of meat and sushi as well as super fresh salad. Main courses are again set out on counters by nationality - the indian dishes are to die for or you can have your personally chosen ingredients stir fried with the most wonderful stock, or chinese or japanese as well as good all western joints, chicken etc. But the thing that puts this hotel above all others is the service. from the minute you walk through the door a myriad os staff are ALWAYS on hand to answer your every need - in fact they often ask to help even when you dont need anything. changing the duvet from my bed (too hot) into a sheet and blanket setup was done rapidly and without any reluctance. i was always greeted at the restaurant by name (how do they do that?) and escorted politely to a table. the bellboy even raced me to the lift to press the button. even the reception staff approached you with a smile as you neared rather than the usual frosty attitude as you try to get their attention. the pool attendant stopped what he was doing immediately to ask if i needed any help as i appeared in the pool area. i felt cosseted, cared for and cared about. i cannot praise this hotel enough. in singapore do not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars and Better”
Reviews.Author: ShaunScotland
Reviews.Content: Still one of the best hotels in the world. From getting out of the taxi to getting to your room everybody was friendly and efficient. Been over a year since my last stay but they still had my preference for papers and airmiles on line and managed to get an up grade to a sea view which is always welcome. The room was fantastic and nice to have one control to work all tv and radio. Plenty of nice goodies in the bathroom to take home with me soap etc. Bed is very comfortable and huge plus the curtains did a good job of blocking out the daylight if you wanted to sleep late. Breakfast is always an experience from the happy girls at the front who remember your name to one of the best spreads of food I have ever seen. Liked the free flow of freshly squeezed fruit juices. The pool area is well equiped with a good size pool for swimming a few laps and the free bottles of water and small snacks that they take out to you all the time is a nice touch. Its joined to the Marina shopping centre so the shops are a short walk away and under cover so no need to get wet if it rains. Some hotels claim 5 stars but the Oriental is 5 stars and 5 star staff. Well worth the price for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: SydneyDan
Reviews.Content: The Oriental Singapore was definitely the best hotel I've ever stayed in. I'm sure there are more luxurious ones somewhere in the world, but I've never stayed in them -- and I've stayed in quite a few five star hotels. Firstly, the interior of the hotel is just stunning. The entire centre of it is hollow, so you can look from the ground floor up to the very top. It's quite an amazing sight. Secondly, the buffet meals at the restaurant were just breathtaking. The spread goes on for rooms, with what must be easily over 100 dishes available at any one time. Every cuisine is catered for at all times of the day. The breakfast was particularly excellent -- the quality of every dish was a cut above what you typically get in a five star hotel. The staff were impeccably attentive and polite. From the moment we were picked up at the airport by limo and then greeted at the hotel with extremely fast checkin (everything done in advance for us) to the many, many staff available all around the hotel to help you. The hotel gym and spa was very nice, with attentive gym instructors and free bottled water, towels and headphones. The selection of restaurants in the hotel was amazing -- apart from the main buffet restaurant, there were many other bars and restaurants, and even one standing alone from the hotel near the spa. All in all, the Oriental experience made my business trip vastly more enjoyable and I have been hankering to go back for a holiday ever since!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: RICHARDLONDON41
Reviews.Content: As we were cruising from Singapore in early January we decided to spend new year at the Mandarin Oriental, mainly because of its location near the Marina. We were not disappointed. We chose a club room and the extras made it very worthwhile. The hotel is very well located as part of a large shoping centre and is near all major amenities. What stod out for us was the sheer quality of the hotel, lovely bedroom, impeccably served food and friendly and helpful staff. There is a lot of competition in Singapore and this hotel works as hard as any to keep itself at number 1, a pretty much faultless experience

Reviews.Title: “Loved it loved it loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LondonPatel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin for 2 nights and it was amazing - staff were great, food was great, rooms were fantastic and huge (and I am a VERY fussy person!). You cant fault it - got great deal on asiarooms.com. if i went back to singapore i would definately stay there - loved it!

Reviews.Title: “First class, FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Victoria36
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. From the minute the hotels limo picked us up from the airport we were treat like royalty. We were welcomed by lots of staff on arriving at the doors of the hotel, all staff were very friendly and really looked after us. We had booked a club room so immediately they took us upto to the club lounge to check us in, we had only been in the hotel a matter of minutes and we where drinking champagne. We were overwhelmed with the service we where being given. The room was very clean, spacious, modern and had a lovely harbour view. I would highly recommend this hotel. A stay at the Mandarin Oriental is a must for anyone visiting Singapore. We shall definately be staying here again, very very soon hopefully!!!!

Reviews.Title: “must stay in a club room”
Reviews.Author: livvylou
Reviews.Content: All of the the other reviews are absolutley spot-on. I live in singapore and decided to have a night here as a Xmas treat. Our stay in the Club room was worth every extra penny and i cannot recommend it highly enough. If you have the time to spare to use the club afternoon tea and evening cocktails, then do book the club rooms, have the tea, woof the food that goes with the cocktails, and gulp the champers that is offered. Oh yeah... then you can indulge in more champers the next morning at breakfast, have another afternoon tea and more nibbles and cocktails because you don't have to check out till 8pm . BLISS !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always made to feel most welcome”
Reviews.Author: joyouslife
Reviews.Content: Singapore Hotelerie at its best! And this for many years. Our recent stay Jan 10-12, 2008 has, as all the others in the past, been adding to a great time in Singapore. The service is impecable and attentive and we like the Club Level (18 and 19th floor) with added service and separate breakfast lounge and pre-dinner cocktails and nibbles. Separate check-out service with extra service is worth a few extra Dollars. The rooms all are refurbished and have everything a business/leisure person would expect, though the rooms are on the small side. The pool area is worth mentioning as it boasts a full size pool and staff which attends to you even at 630 in the morning! Friendliness all over and special mentioning of the warm welcome you receive by staff, every time you enter or exit the hotel. They do go the extra mile! The only Hotel for us in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: Davidob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin for three nights in a Club Harbour View Room as part of a month’s trip around Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand. Check in at the hotel was very quick, efficient and friendly and we were soon escorted to our room on the 19th Floor. The view of Singapore was marvellous and the room was very well equipped, with very comfortable bed, flat screen TV and cabling to enable MP3s etc to be connected to the sound system. The room was not particularly large but was beautifully furnished with an equally well furnished bathroom complete with separate bath and shower and plenty of nice Molton Brown products. Staff and service at the hotel couldn’t be faulted with the perfect mix of very friendly but unobtrusive service with staff anticipating your every needs. The Club Lounge was a great bonus with excellent breakfast and snacks and cocktails, loved the seared tuna and the excellent lamb chops! Also had breakfast in Melt but much preferred to have it in the Club Lounge with the freshly cooked options. One little niggle was the limit of 15 minutes free internet access in the club lounge even when the lounge was empty, free wifi was also available if you had your own laptop. All in all a very enjoyable and faultless stay and I would definitely recommend upgrading to club lounge access.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Serge29
Reviews.Content: Last June [2007] my wife & I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore - it was a wonderful & faultless experience, from the moment we were picked up by their limo till the moment it dropped us off for our return home. Our room on the executive floor was great as also were the champagne breakfasts we enjoyed daily. Their various restaurants & bars were also outstanding. Their location adjacent to a large shopping mall made shopping convenient, with the mall being unobtrusive. We have also stayed at Raffles and the Fullerton and have had a thorough look at Goodwood Park - and the Mandarin Oriental beats the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: ozintokyo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Singapore. The staff are excellent and the breakfast is the biggest buffet I have ever seen in a hotel. Overall it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: munthe
Reviews.Content: We recently spent christmas at the mandarin oriental, we stayed for 1 week in total and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was a huge spread and everything was fresh and delicious. The overall service given by all staff in the hotel was excellent. However what I would say is that if you are used to staying in 5 star hotels in asia then the service is exactly what you would expect in hotels of that standard. Some of the previous reviewers seem to go over the top about the service and so can appear misleading. I suppose it's what your used to and admittedly the service in hotels in europe nowhere near compares. The location is great if you want to be near the quay area and also convenient for shopping. The marina square mall adjoins the hotel and you can cross through there to the suntec city mall so everything is close by. Its only a short, reasonably priced taxi ride to orchard road and there is also the mrt close by. One thing I must point out if anyone is wanting a good family dinner on christmas eve then this is the place to be. We were 4 adults and 3 children and we spent a very pleasant evening in the melt world cafe. The children were well catered for with their own room with toys, cartoons and 4 members of staff watching them. They had there own candy floss machine and as much to eat as they wanted, this gave us adults a nice relaxing evening too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zabo
Reviews.Content: I had a 4 night stay at Oriental Singapore whilst attending a large medical conference. at the end of July 2007.The hotel is located in the heart of business district of Singapore on the marina and close to many 5 star hotelssuch as the Pan Pacific, Meritus Mandarin, Ritz Carlton, shopping malls and directly connected to the large Suntec Convention centre where the conference took place. A good thing about this part of town is that most malls are linked and there is a large underground mall pass connecting you to the famous Raffles area and the metro..I travelled alone and had a deluxe sea view room overlooking the harbour and part of the marina. The room was clean , comfortable and spacious enough for a couple. A plus in the room was a DVD player and Ipod port .Furnishing was modern with an oriental touch.The bathroom was luxurious with a separate shower and generous bathtub and ample amenities..Breakfast was included in my rate and very good with quite a selection including indian. south asian and american treats. The surrounding skyline at night was amazing to behold and I particularly enjoyed strolling along the waterfront at night which was very safe.Although this hotel is about 15 mins from the famous shopping Orchard Road, the surrounding malls do have lots to offer and as this was a business trip I found the location very convenient. I would recommend this hotel for business travel or short stopover in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Melt”
Reviews.Author: JAMPerth
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit to Singapore for us and our 13 year old daughter and we had decided on a change of hotel. The Oriental did not disappoint. The Melt breakfast buffet was magnificent, friendly attentive staff and a huge range of cuisines to choose from. A leisurely breakfast set us up for the day's sight seeing, with little need or desire to eat again until evening. We didn't envisage the pool would be a hilight however the level of service and attention from the pool attendants made this experience a memorable part of our stay, particularly for our daughter. The location away from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Road was a bonus and provided easy access to pleasant exploring on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - couldn't fault this hotel in any way”
Reviews.Author: PuffinMarine
Reviews.Content: Absolutely top notch in every way

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: SirGoofy
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stay in this hotel three times a year. The hotel generally is great and neat. The rooms are very comfortable and the food in the Oriental Club is great. However there is not free internet access in the room, only at the club. The hotel is definitely costly and the location at the Marina Square so the view and shops are great. If I were to travel on my own, I will probably stay somewhere here or Orchard Road. Overall this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good position otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: hagsdownunder
Reviews.Content: Yet again our booking was mixed up but unlike the Shangri-la the front desk manager (!) made us wait- (there was nowhere to sit- as the few chairs available were occupied) while she attempted to rectify their mistake. We then (after a long flight) had to wait around until 3.00 pm. before our room was available. This is a hotel for business people; its position overlooking the marina is great but there is none of thepersonability of the staff or of the hotel. The decor is ... minimalist or just not fitted out. There are three large reception rooms in the entrance which could have some chairs for guests waiting when not used for conferences! The Melt restaurant offeres a very comprehensive buffet which could feed half of Biafra but is pricey in their a la carte. (I am also so tired of waiters whipping plates away before you have finished chewing!) The rooms are very pleasant- decor good, beds comfy and good pillows. The entertainment system offers many music channels which we love and seem to be offered less and less in Asian hotels. The pool is hopelessly lacking in loungers- we watched many guests being turned away because they had no-where to lie. However the attendants were great- giving us regular bottles of water and little sweet treats from the kitchen. There are many shopping opportunities close by and the MRT is a 5 min walk away. Internet access is as usual expensive at S$30 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CumbrianGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: We were really looking forward to our 3 night stay here after reading all the great reviews on Tripadvisor but we were disappointed. We arrived early in the morning (7am) after an overnight flight from the UK and had requested an early check in. The check in process was smooth but we were then informed that our room wasn’t ready but would be ready at about 9am. They had just checked in a couple with a young child and given them a room. Another couple arrived about 30 minutes after us and they too were told a room wasn’t available. At around 8.30am they were given a room. I then went to the reception to find out when our room would be ready and was told by a receptionist that we shouldn’t have been told that a room would be ready for us at 9am. I queried why the other couple had been given a room and he said that the couple had paid extra (I checked this out with then later and this was not true). We were then grudgingly given a key to our room. We showered and I searched the room for a hairdryer but couldn’t find one. I rang housekeeping and someone came to the room immediately and looked in all the drawers but couldn’t find one either. He returned 5 mins later with a hairdryer. This one overheated after 3-4 mins and you had to wait for it to cool down before you could finish drying your hair. The safety deposit box also wouldn’t work so we called reception and they had to come to the room and reset it. Although these are only small faults in themselves I just didn’t expect this from this hotel. On the good side the hotel is in a great location. Not as busy as Orchard Road. Great location for eating, shopping and transport (Hop-on hop-off tourist bus is just opposite and MRT station close by) The breakfast was great with a huge range of asian and western food and freshly squeezed juices. The room was large and excellent, serviced twice a day Earlier in the year we stayed at the Marina Mandarin and when we return to Singapore again we will stay there rather than the Mandarin Oriental..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Patoman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel to celebrate my birthday. We booked our stay over the internet using the hotel's own website. This was smooth and without any hitches. We also booked a limo from the hotel to pick us up from the airport. Our pick up was there to meet us on time and was friendly, efficient and courteous. The check in process was also very smooth. We booked a club suite with a harbor view. It was excellent and the view was suberb. Since we arrived very early, our first meal was breakfast. The range of food and fruits available in the restaurant is one of the best I have ever seen. On subsequent days we had breakfast in the club lounge which was also very very good. The hotel is connected to a great shopping mall and my wife spent many happy hours there. The complimentary afternoon tea in the club lounge of the hotel is a great way to relax after a morning of shopping. There are a number of good restaurants around the hotel and we tended to have breakfast and afternoon tea in the hotel and all other meals outside the hotel. The staff of this hotel are excellent and the level of service of a very high standard. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly charming”
Reviews.Author: Rigiblick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my personal favourite in Singapore where the helpful and friendly staff always make me feel at home. For travellers flying late in the evening, I can only recommend to book the Executive Club lounge. At a moderate extra cost you can use the room until late with all the extras that go with it. Being used to hotels where they charge another full day when checking out late, I am extremely happy with this service. Not only can you check out later, breakfast in the lounge as well as afternoon tee are complimentary. In addition, you automatically end up on a higher floor with marvellous views over the harbour if you book that category.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Dinosaw
Reviews.Content: The MO Singapore is everything a hotel should be, we stayed as part of an extensive two week holiday during which we enjoyed some very good hotels but the MO stood out a mile. Fantastic staff, great facilities, stylish well equipped rooms and the best hotel breakfast going.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doc_Jon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oriental on the last leg of our honeymoon in Indonesia. The hotel was superb and was a great way to finish our holiday before flying back to reality. We booked a Club Indulgence package in a Harbour Room. This was on the 18th floor and had spectacular views of the Singapore harbourscape. The room was very modern and had all the mod cons, we particularly liked the bathroom decor. Although the room was not the biggest, it was more than adequate for two nights and the view was really worthwhile. I cannot recomment the Harbour room enough. The Club Indulgence package included access to the Club lounge, a free limosine transfer from the airport (one way) and late checkout - ideal if you have a late flight. The club lounge was also superb. With champagne breakfast, afternoon tea with cakes and aperitif in the evening with an open bar, the facilities could not have been better. One evening we ate at the inhouse chinese resaurant and was not disappointed. It has a great reputation and this is definitely warranted with high quality food and exceptional staff service. There were a number of other restaurants in the hotel but please make sure you do get out of the hotel and check out Singapore. We also used the Spa for a massage before we flew back (the indulgence package gives you a discount) which was a great way to relax before the long flight. Again, highly recommended, top class facility. To sum up, great hotel, excellent staff, in a good location to see all of Singapore. Very easy to recommend, you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel, should be rated number 1 in Asia”
Reviews.Author: WoodyNumba1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our honeymoon with 4 nights at The Oriental in Singapore. We could not fault this hotel at all. The service was excellent, the rooms were fantastic, food was plentiful and of high quality and the location was ideal for shopping and eating (with hawkers near by). When we checked in at this wonderful hotel we were greeted with smiles from people who enjoyed their jobs (didn't smile because it was there job). We were given a complimentary breakfast as we arrived earlier than check in time which was buffet and it was delicious. We were questioned about our departure flight and automatically was given late check out until 4.00pm without any additional costs. It was a very pleasurable stay and this hotel makes the best Singapore Sling. We also stayed at The Mandarin Oriental in Kuala Lumpur which is currently rated the number 1 hotel in Asia (please see review). We thought that hotel was not worthy of being rated the best hotel in Asia when compared to this one (even from the same chain). We believe this hotel should be rated number 1 in Asia hands down!! * We had one nights dinner at a restaurant within the hotel called The Cherry Garden. This food was a little expensive however a memorable meal for positive reasons and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mandarin Oriental, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Aussieholiday
Reviews.Content: I am writing to inform you all of the wonders of the Mandarin Oriental hotel in Singapore. We found the experience to be one of sheer luxury. I would urge anyone contemplating a stay in Singapore to seriously consider this option out of the many, many available to choose from. In terms of value for money ...it was a hit. We booked early and directly with the hotel and secured a great rate of around $300 AUD per night for 2 adults and 1 child with breakfast included. Fantastic, given the excellent standard and quality of the hotel. As a bonus, the roll out bed was free of extra charge; a rarity for the other Singapore hotels that I had checked out. My husband has worked in a global role out of London but based in Sydney for the last 10 years. As a consequence of this, he has spent much of that time travelling the world. I have been very fortunate to be able to join him on many trips and have experienced many 5 ~ 6 star hotels. I would have to say that the Mandarin Oriental ranks most highly. We found the attention to detail across all aspects of service provision to be excellent. The most notable point was the friendly and courteous attitude of all staff; from the staff who handled my initial e-mail enquiries to the Concierge and dining staff and right down to the pool and gym staff. They all expressed good cheer and humour and genuinely appeared to love their work and to be committed to making the hotel function at optimum performance. We were also greatly impressed by the size of our room (we were upgraded to a Junior Suite), the quality of inclusions and the care taken to clean the room, attend to 'turn down' of an evening and to replenish bathroom items. The latter point may seem a minor one but, can lead to irritation if unattended! Similarly we were very impressed with fit out of the gym, the hotel landscaping, the pool and its surroundings. I walked over to check out the Fullerton which, in my opinion, pales in comparison to this hotel. In terms of children, this would definitely be your choice of hotel in Singapore as: the pool was huge and surrounding area was great, you are away from the intense hustle of Orchard Rd, there are great cheap-eating Hawker food markets across the road and beautiful, riverside plu other walks in all directions from the hotel. There is a greater sense of space in and around this hotel compared the Fullerton and Orchard Rd hotels that would appeal to anyone with kids. Anyway, taxis are so cheap that all venues are easily and cheaply accessible. I have already recommended your hotel to my friends who travel and our friends based in Singapore who we were visiting. The Mandarin Oriental would be a definite choice for our preferred accommodation if we ever to choose to stay in Singapore again!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking views over the city”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic views over the harbour and the city. I was there on business, and although the company was paying, I would definitely stay there if I was returning for a personal holiday. Walking distance to the river and metro, plus a large shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “Wow amazing !!!”
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mandarin for 3 nights and it is one of the best Hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff are amazing and very friendly at all times. Great location and views. The decor is plush and well managed. The porters are extremely knowledgable and know absolutely anything about Singarpore. The breakfast buffet is is to die for, it gotg me out of bed every day! The in room entertaintment is hi tech all cables are supplied for connecting laptops, camera, DVD etc so it can be projected to the TV and the accompanying Bose speakers, well what can I say? I would recomend for any one!

Reviews.Title: “Oriental Delight...”
Reviews.Author: patisserie
Reviews.Content: [-------] Absolutely Wonderful, the location, chic decor, impeccable service and the breath taking view of the Singapore skyline all make up for the premium price. The Oriental houses 2 of my favourite restaurants. MELT, a mid-range buffet house that serves anything from indian to chinese to home made vanilla ice cream and MORTON'S, arguable one of Singapore best steak houses... pricey but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: Have not been here for two years, and i was very pleased with the renovated rooms and public areas. The service was always good, but it was exceptional on this visit. Even at 1am check in, the individual from the front desk took us up to the room to make sure all was well. The rooms were spacious, and very comfortable, and the only improvement needed was the low light over the sink in the bath room. The cafe where breakfast was served was well set out, with different stations, although it was a little pricey at close to $45 sing. per head. If breakfast was not included, I perhaps would go out for a tenth of the cost and have some of the local breakfast. The staff in the hotel were excellent, and very polite, greeting guest where ever they met you. My only complain was the cost of wifi at $30sing. was a little steep as was the price of snacks around the pool. $14 for a smoothe, and $14 to launder a sports shirt were a little on the high side, even by international standards. A wonderful hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: APinkLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a club room on the 20th Floor for 5 nights. The room was big with a fantastic bathroom where you can look straight out to sea from! Along with Molton Brown toiletries and surround sound system that you can connect your ipod to. We feel the extra paid for the club room was worth it for the size of the room, the veiws and the club lounge! The club lounge provides Champagne breakfast, high tea, evening cocktails and canapes and internet all included in the club room price. We had breakfast in both the Club lounge and Melt, both were really good but the selection of food in Melt was outstanding. During our stay we ate dinner in Melt and Cherry Garden, both were very good with good service. The pool area is a good size, very clean and great service from the pool staff, who provided bottles of water, sorbet and fresh fruit. The location of the hotel isn't central but opposite the Esplanade and right next to Marina Square shopping centre so plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. However it only cost around £1 for a taxi to Clarke Quay and about £2 to Orchard Rd. We did walk to Clarke Quay which only took around 15 minutes! I do agree this hotel is more of a business hotel but it's still worth staying there for a little bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but location not so great”
Reviews.Author: NicC
Reviews.Content: The Mandarin is a great hotel but the location does let it down. Whilst for business guests I guess this is not so much of a problem, but for tourists who have a few days, I would not recommend this place so much unless they got to grips pretty quickly with the transport options. Hotel itself, cannot fault. We didn't get any Molton Brown toiletries that I read of in one review - maybe this is just for Club guests? Incidentally the hotel tried very hard to flog this option to us - it just didn't seem to make economic sense. The breakfast was wonderful but we found the restaurant prices obscenely expensive. Made the mistake of eating at Mortons one night (we'd left it very late to eat, our feet hurt too much to go out and it was the only place that would take us at 1030pm at night in the hotel) and I was shocked by the rip-off prices. S$ 20 for a Martini, when you can get a fabulous one with views to boot at New Asia Bar at the Swisshotel for S$12? S$35 for one tiny crab cake? I refused on principle to order a main course as I felt that to charge those sort of prices for something that would cost a quarter of the price outside was taking the michael. Service was annoyingly American, with waiters wanting to 'present' the menu to us instead of just letting us read the menu! Next thing they will be giving a slideshow. Plus they never let us alone for a minute. Not the place for a romantic dinner. The concierge was not well informed on bus routes - I guess he is more used to helping business guests and hailing cabs. We wanted a bus to the Orchid Gardens and was told that there was only 1 bus that didn't quite go as far - not true. Luckily the bus driver helped out and put us right. There's a bus that takes you right there BTW. This leads me to the location. Not great for tourists. Whilst you can walk, in the sapping heat that's not always an option. City Hall MTR is about 10 mins away and not much use if you want to go to Chinatown or the Quays as this involves a nightmare change at Doby Ghaut. My recommendation is to go across the road and get a bus from Esplanade Mall. The bus maps are easy to work out, they are cheap, and air conditioned! First 2 days we used taxi, then graduated to MTR, but finally worked out the buses were the best way to go. There are loads of buses that go direct to Orchard Road. Next time we visit Singapore, we'd choose the Fullerton. Great hotel in a very central location. Don't bother going to Raffles for the Singapore Sling - what a disappointment and waste of money! DO visit the Swisshotel on Stamford Road and head to New Asia Bar for great cocktails at sunset. We enjoyed Clarke Quay area very much at night, and had the most wonderful brunch at Marmalade Pantry in the Palace Renaissance mall on Orchard Road. Shops don't open until around 1030/11am, so it's great to go there for a late breakfast before the shops open.

Reviews.Title: “nice but too formal”
Reviews.Author: rachaelmakeup
Reviews.Content: I honeymooned here andloved the Spa. The massage I had at 9pm at night was very memorable. The room service was fab. A lot of American business people here during our stay with local girls. At one point one drunken girl was climbing the pillar in the bar and being geered on by the guys which upset my evening a little. I just felt as a honeymooner, there wasn't a lot of romance in the hotel, mainly business guests so we really took advantage of room service!! The Dolce Vita restaurant wasn't at all prepared for a vegetarian. After liasing with the chef I managed to get a rissoto whipped up at tremendous cost. £50 for 2 mains and 2 drinks. My favourite part was swimmming in the rooftop swimming pool in the morning. The design of the hotel was breath taking though! And I loved the staff's uniforms. Would return but wouldn't reccommend for loved up couples.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lieblingsg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many top end hotels in Singapore but I think I have just discovered one of the best that Singapore has to offer. I am referring to the new revamped The Mandarin Oriental Singapore, formerly known as The Oriental. I used to be a member of the gym at the hotel many years ago and I had stayed in their rooms during those period. I would not wax lyrical about my experiences then.The hotel was part of the Marina Square development near the city centre and was part of a trio of hotels, namely, Marina Mandarin, Pan Pacific and The Oriental. The Oriental as it then was had always been the best of the three though. Its neighbour, The Ritz Carlton Millenia, came into the scene as the first 6star hotel In Singapore and had always somewhat overshadowed The Oriental. However, since this hotel became part of the Mandarin Oriental fold, it has metamorphosed into the most luxurious hotel in town. I have stayed in the hotel twice, once over the August 2007 National Day holiday and the other last weekend. My first stay was in a huge corner suite with a south view and that of its neighbour, The Ritz Carlton. The second stay was in a normal deluxe room with a West facing view of the city skyline. On both occasions, I had access to the Club Lounge, which is the reason why a stay in this hotel is very highly recommended. The Club Lounge is the most luxurious facility of its kind in any hotel in Singapore. I have been to a few of these in other hotels but the one in Mandarin Oriental is by far the most luxurious, beautiful and inviting. The décor is something out of Elle Décor Magazine with 2 types of seating, plush sofas or small dining tables. The walls are clad in pleasing exotic dark wood veneer and tribal artifacts tastefully adorn the lounge area. The Club Lounge is bathed in natural light which comes in from a high floor to ceiling window panels. There is a library near the reception area but coffee table books are placed everywhere for your reading pleasure. If you have access to the lounge during your stay, this is where you can have breakfast away from the madding crowd, indulge in high tea or enjoy evening cocktails. Between 5.30pm to 7.30pm, that is the best time to hang out at the Club Lounge. That is when they serve gourmet food! Last weekend, they had North Indian food on one evening and French on the other (foie gras maison and slices of magret de canard a l’orange anyone?). During my previous stay, the food was Thai. The food is simply delicious and enough for you to skip dinner altogether. But that means forgoing a delightful selection of superb restaurants in the hotel, including Mortons for exceptional steak. If you don’t have access to the Club Lounge, there is a coffee lounge on the 4th floor with a harbour view and plush setting. And if you don’t eat out, order room service. Even its room service food is top notched and the food comes with such beautiful presentation. My order of seafood chowder was absolutely delicious and came chock a block with a treasure trove of shrimps, mussels and scallop. My order of Tom Yam Goong was served in a petite young coconut. In other words, this hotel has the Mandarin Oriental quality stamp all over. This also applies to the service for which Mandarin Oriental is famous for. From the bellboys, to the reception and down to the chambermaids, everyone greets you with a smile. As you check in, a personel will escort you to your room or to the Club Lounge. The service is both assured and confident. You cannot say the same about this in many other establishments on the island. The rooms are very tastefully done with a lot of wood and marble in the décor. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom adequately spacious with a separate bathtub and shower areas. The toiletries from Molton Brown are quite exotic and very refreshing. Whilst the rooms are not equipped with a plasma TV, the touch screen universal remote for the TV makes navigation for in-room entertainment a breeze. I recommend a room with the harbour/city skyline view. It will take your breath away despite the sight of towering cranes all over the construction site for the integrated resort. The sunset and water view is worth the extra penny. They also pamper you with a generous fruit bowl, a delicious cheese platter plus a bottle of wine. I did not try the spa, so I cannot comment on that. The fitness centre has been upgraded and is now 10 times better than what it used to be. The fitness centre is no longer open to public membership which explains its quality. The hotel pool is definitely one of the best here as it offers you a good depth and length enough for you to do short laps. If you are an Amex Centurion Card holder like me, you have extended check out until 6pm, which gives you all the extra time to indulge in the luxury that this superb property has to offer. I would recommend this hotel highly for a superb weekend getaway even to Singaporeans. My experience here is 10 times better than that in Mandarin Oriental Kuala Lumpur (see separate review).

Reviews.Title: “Made our honeymoon even MORE memorable!”
Reviews.Author: Liriel
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough complimentary things about this hotel! The room (or should I say suite) we stayed in was like nothing I've ever seen before, the opulence and attention to detail was second to none. The staff were better than 5 star - 7 star in our opinion, nothing was too much trouble and they seemed to anticipate our every need and desire. The food in the Club lounge was sensational and different every day. Our stay wasn't long enough but the perfect way to end our idyllic honeymoon - even the bathrobes were "to die for" - so soft and comfy!!! Just fabulous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Chiangmai61
Reviews.Content: From the welcome at the airport till the check out of our stay everything was more than perfect. We enjoyed our stay a lot, nothing was too much. In the room all details were there and well maintained. Sure that we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: wtetek
Reviews.Content: I have stayed five nights in the city view room from Oct 23 to Oct 28. The staffs are very courteous and meet my requirements. They changed my room from 9th floor to 13th non-smoking floor. The deco in the 13th floor's room is more contemporary than the 9th floor's room. The staff told me that higher floor rooms have better deco. The room also implements surrounding sound system and the DVD player. The remote control of radio, tv, and movie are combined together. I suggest the relax radio channel which provide much melodious oriental music. The staff also provided me an office chair because I must sit a long time in order to work and they help me solve some trouble, such as the internet problem. The wireless internet 24hours charged me about 30 singapore dollars. The pool is also beautiful and you can enjoy the fantastic habour view there. The breakfast in Melt Coffee is luxuriant and I especially love the many different kinds of fresh juice. You can go to the Marina Square through the stair next to the hotel and go to the MRT through the subway between Marina Square and MRT station so that you do not need to worry about the high temperature or rain outside. Although it may spend you some time, it is worth because the environment of Oriental is much quieter than the Stamford, a hotel adjacent to the MRT station. I would recommend this hotel to everyone sincerely.

Reviews.Title: “3rd year back at the Oriental”
Reviews.Author: buyply
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year back at the Oriental, all stays have been for 14 nights, this year we did not book the Club on the 19th floor and this suited us as we did not have to rush to get back for the club lounge between 5.30-7.30pm, and the plus side was that having breakfast in Melt each morning was fantastic, just so much choice. The service around the pool was already good but we felt had improved even more this year, with bottled water, sorbets and fresh fruit being given out throughout the day. We did not use the hotel to eat in the evenings as we could eat acroos the road at a hawker centre for under £10.00. Would not hesitate reccommending this hotel, everything about it is 1st class.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable service”
Reviews.Author: markandwendy
Reviews.Content: it was the last leg of our honeymoon,and after stopping at some amazing hotels this topped it. the service and staff were unbelievable. felt like the king and queen. got an upgrade to a suite as it was our honeymoon but the staff couldnt do enough for us. the hotel is fantastic,modern and tranquil and very very flash. the restaraunts were magnificent. would recommend this to everyone.absolute luxury

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: bluechick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in August 2007 after a trip through Malaysia. Having stayed in cheap hotels through Malaysia I wanted to book luxury for the last stop. And I'm glad I did! I got a stay 4 nights pay 3 deal which made it much cheaper. The room was lovely and the bathroom was beautiful. The breakfast was also amazing. Great location as well, and ocean views. I also enjoyed the pool with its city views. Being unused to staying in these kinds of hotels however I did feel there were a couple of downsides. Another reviewer mentioned the overservice and I felt the same. It felt like I couldn't turn a corner without someone there to open a door for me and it made me feel more like I was constantly being watched. But the shop assistants do that as well in Malaysia/Singapore so I think it is just their way. Other complaints were the price of everything - use of internet in the business centre was hideously expensive (there is a very cheap internet cafe up the road) - and also having only duvets on the beds in a city that is constantly hot and humid meant for a couple of very warm nights. To be fair though, I never asked for the bed to be changed so that might have been available if requested. Overall, thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend it. Singapore is also a lovely city and so safe for a solo female traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly indulgent!”
Reviews.Author: MsGandT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental for 2 nights in October 2007, during a short transit in Singapore. Am I ever glad I did! The hotel itself is stunning. My room was on the 8th floor with a harbour view and overlooking the pool. It was immaculate. But what really made the stay for me was the staff. They could not have been more helpful and friendly. I feel I should also put in a good word for the breakfast at Melt's Cafe. It was a buffet to end all buffets. I think I sampled Chinese, Indian and continental breakfasts one morning....shame I didn't follow up with a trip to the onsite fitness studio!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: gvabibi
Reviews.Content: Very calm and relaxing place. I had a lovely and spacious room on the 8th floor with a great view on the marina. The lobby and the interior decoration are really magnificent, this hotel is one of the most beautiful places I have ever stayed. What is not that great about this hotel: 1) the location, a little far from the MRT station, and sometimes you have to wait 10-15 minutes or more to get a taxi at the hotel. 2) the service is a bit slow (especially the room service and the pool bar).

Reviews.Title: “Three cheers for the Mandarin Oriental Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Geribean
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived from the second we left we were treated like visiting royalty - they literally killed the fatted calf for us. We were upgraded to the Club Suite (obviously this means paying extra but my word, it was blinking worth it). The use of the club means gorgeaus bedrooms, use of the club lounge for afternoon tea and evening cocktails and canapies where we literally drank our own body weight in champagne. Loved the facilities and lots of restaurants to pick from. Would we stay here again? We would move in if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Renamed and revamped. A lot of improvement. I'm a fan.”
Reviews.Author: hanyu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the renamed Mandarin Oriental Singapore over a weekend when in town to see some relatives as a stopover on the way back home. I've stayed here before some 6 years back and been to the Shangri-La, Fullerton, Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton. I was curious about the heavy advertising on the "renamed, rejuvenated" spiel for this branch of the Mandarin Oriental chain and opted to stay here. I got a harbourview room. Incentives: 1) There has indeed been a marked improvement in the hotel since several years ago. I was honestly impressed with the change. The hotel looks refreshed and even though the building itself isn't that new, the hotel and its facilities/furnishings have all been upgraded and/or well-maintained. 2) With the new casino coming up and move of the business/downtown area to the bay area, The MOSG is in an excellent location for business in the future along with already lovely views pegged to improve as 2010 looms. 3) It is next to a major mall with food and shops readily available though it is not directly connected to it like the Pan Pacific. This means having to walk outdoors and risking some rain frequently but I personally didn't find the 2 minute journey that much of a hassle. The local theatre and concert hall is right across the street for those with artistic intents. 4) The service is truly top-notch and in this reviewer's opinion, now the best in town. The staff were all sincerely friendly and smiling with greetings that didn't sound too artificial or over the top like in some places. They opened lift doors and the doormen were always ready to assist. Memorably, housekeeping polished 2 pairs of shoes for me and even declined a tip saying it was a pleasure to be of service and he enjoyed polishing really good quality shoes! In all my years of travel, I've never encountered such a thing and am truly impressed. This attention to personal detail and individual touches by the staff helps make one feel special and at home and differentiates the truly international world-class from mere 5 stars. They have clearly exceeded anything Fullerton, Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons have provided in the service department. Only the Shangri-La compares but the Shang's location isn't as convenient for future business come 2010 and truth be told, it is also getting a little long in the tooth. 5) They have a great collection of restaurants and breakfast was excellent. Morton's, the chinese restaurant and the cafe were all consistently good places. This is useful for business trips since meal meetings can be right at the hotel without sacrificing food quality. Discentives: 1) The only blimp on service was that I checked in with a request for a non-smoking harbourview room , which was accepted when I made a booking, only to be sent to a smoking one. When I called front desk, the person on actually told me they didn't have anymore non-smoking rooms. This is clearly wrong and my booking shouldn't have been accepted to begin with or I should have been told at the front desk rather than after I came up to the room. To the hotel's credit, the front desk manager immediately took charge when I expressed unhappiness and moved me into a better non-smoking room with a better view and sent up bellhops to move my luggage. These personnel also declined any further tip as part of the apology for the error. She also called to personally apologise for the mistake. 2) The rooms are functional at best with little character or space. However, closet and storage space is quite excellent. One can argue that prices for rooms in Singapore are very reasonable next to Hongkong or even Bangkok for the upper end but a little more space would be nice. The next door Ritz-Carlton fairs better in this department. The lack of character and amenities seems to be a Singapore hotel thing in general. Even the lauded Fullerton's Philippe Starck room furnishings were somewhat perfunctory overall in design when put together though each individual piece was often quite avant garde. The special extras found in MO NYC and HK were all missing like decked out multi-fax phones and flat screen TVs in the bathrooms. 3) The hotel rooms still use cathode-ray tube TVs. This is already quite unacceptable for 5 star world city standards. However, the facility to iPod link to the the room sound system is pretty good. 4) The need to exit the hotel in the open to get to the nearby mall has already been mentioned. 5) No underground mass transit service is nearby and public transport ex-taxis are not a feature of this hotel or the nearby Ritz-Carlton. 6) For a revamp, it is disconcerting to see they still use the old name "The Oriental" on the clothes hangers, writing instruments and toiletries while the mineral water and paper etc. trumpet "Mandarin Oriental". This is somewhat inconsistent, though to be fair a more minor point. Taken in total, the MOSG has indeed impressed me and seems to be a true member of the aggressively expanding MO chain. While minor points remain that peg it lower than its compatriots in Tokyo, Hong Kong and Bangkok, this is true of all Singapore hotels in general. When in Singapore, weighing all the hotel options, I would definitely opt to stay at the MOSG again. It is my pick for a Singapore hotel. I'm a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Majic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller4957
Reviews.Content: My partner and 6 year old son stayed at the hotel for 3 nights on our way back to New Zealand and it was just what we needed to relax and be pampered after a busy time in Europe for 3 weeks. From the moment you arrive every staff member makes you feel very special.We were upgraded to a larger city room which was lovely and of the hotels we had stayed in the bathroom had a seperate shower not the shower -bath set up. Service in the dining room for breakfast and choice was great and even at the swimming pool there was always someone to give you a towel or lemon sorbet. Good location close to Sun Tec City and harbour cruises boat quay and clarke quay. We can recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 20lindy
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the friendliest welcome ever. Due to us being newlyweds we were immediately upgraded to a suite, This was 2 rooms that were the biggest i have ever stayed in complete with a luxurious bathroom that you could have held a party in, settees, coffee table large wall to wall executive desk i could go on and on. To say the least it was absolute luxury. Singapore was fantastic we just love all the people they were so freindly .......................... Thank you Oriental for making it a great start too our honeymoon we will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneNelly
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore at 6am and had a one night stopover booked on the way home to Australia from Russia. The room was going to be available from 2pm but we upgraded to a suite to get a room straight away. The room included the "Club Room" facilities (breakfast that morning and use of the 19th floor Club Room which gave you free afternoon tea & evening open bar with delicious hot/cold snacks). The breakfast room on the 4th floor has an extremely extensive food selection and very ambient surroundings. The hotel itself is first-class in all respects, with very happy, helpful staff, and one we would recommend without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive hotel.”
Reviews.Author: spartac
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel in December 06 and absolutely loved it! I actually wasn't crazy about Singapore but our cruise to sydner was on Dec 23rd and the only flight available from Tokyo was on the 19th. The Hotel is Fantastic. I won't comment more as you see most of it on the pics: the modrn/traditional decorum, the AMAZING rooms, the nice pool scene. I didn't try their breakfast or any of the restaurants or bars but it looked fabulous. Very convenient location next to some of the interesting areas, malls (which are everywhere in Singapore) and not far from the metro. Of all of my Asian and Australian trip, this one was arguably the bext por second best hotel. With the other contender being Tokyo Park Hotel. The only negative I can think of was the price of the drinks around the pool. Singapore itself ended up being a very nice place. a Great introduction to Asia as it is very Western yet present a mix of 3 ethnicities. We had thing to do all 3 (full) days we were there. I was a bit disapointed by the night Safari in the Zoo and all the way to get tickets there. Didn't think it was really worth it. We liked the doble decker bus as a way to get a good orientation tour of the city on the first day. I would definitly spend again a night (or more) in singapore as a hub, on my way to another destination. Yes, a bit "Big Brotherish" but still worth the detour.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Peelay
Reviews.Content: We had just stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Hong Kong a month before, and given it's cut from the same cloth and had allegedly just been renovated too, staying at the Oriental in Singapore you would not have known they were related. Pet hate - in room check in which they are quite insistent on and had to be firmly dissuaded from trying again, after our first experience of it. Took forever, no need. Why do they insist on coming into your room with their shoes on? The room finishings were cheap and the touch screen remote control for the tv, just annoying, as were the ceiling speakers. Big hole in the ceiling above the shower that was just not filled in. Cheap slatted blind to hide the glass wall separating the bedroom area and bathroom - why bother with a glass wall at all if you're not going to put the bath there as a feature. Bad, bad design. Cheap products in the bathrooms. Huge and impressive atrium space but most of the rooms are linked to outside corridors around it and therefore noisy. Request a room at the end of these corridors. Communal corridors featured ripped and dirty wall papers. Has it been totally or partially renovated? A ridiculous number of staff to meet and greet all of whom want to take your bag and ask you the same question. Very tiresome indeed. Good choice of restaurants, from Mortons to the Melt the World Cafe (Melt - The World Cafe actually, but we preferred the former way of reference). MtWC seems to do the buffet thing at all times. Disappointing; wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: tunesm
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this hotel. The room was clean and nicely designed and we were even given an upgrade on arrival which was delightful. The staff were helpful and friendly - the doormen were great. The buffet breakfast was one of the best we've had in the world - pretty much anything you wanted you could get. Make sure you cross the road and try the Hawkers Market there. It's filled with locals and the food is excellent - Especially the Roti which we had more than once. I would honestly fly back just for that! Only difficulty was trying to get a cab at times but it's not like we had anywhere else to be as we were on holiday! It's about a ten minute drive to Orchard Rd and very close to the Raffles Hotel (for high tea). I would absolutely stay here again and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: chipsox
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the first time on 9/20....just for one night...on my way home from Penang. I just have to say that I was thoroughly impressed with this property. The staff was incredible...my room was clean, large...and the view was breathtaking overlooking the water. Had a great meal at Morton's Steakhouse....my only complaint is the bar at Morton's closed too early..... Minor complaint. Love this place....and am looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stays”
Reviews.Author: safircraze
Reviews.Content: At least twice a year i stay at this hotel. Overall, it's good for food and shopping cos it's adjacent to marina shopping mall complex, and across the street from the esplanade concert hall. The bad: far from MRT (about 20 mins walk), but you can catch cab very easily, or from the esplanade bus stop, hop on one of many buses that will pass one of the MRT stations. Room-wise, the harborview is the best because it has newest facilities, with dvd player etc, and, ofcourse, stunning view. The bathroom has a wall glass so you can take a shower and watch tv at the same time. the other room is facing city and another one i can't remember the name of the view. These rooms are old-ish style, but HUGE, much bigger than the one facing harborfront ( i can't remember whether this room has dvd player). But anyway rooms are very clean, with complete amenities (i love the body lotion). Try booking with breakfast included, cos the food range is to die for. I used to stay at the fullerton, though it's closer to boat quay, room-wise, oriental is much larger

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Macau038
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Oriental, Singapore a number of times in the last 18 months and everytime I have found the hotel staff, service and quality to meet and exceed my expectations. Although considered to be essentially a business hotel I would have no hesitation in taking the family there to stay also. The F&B are brilliant and the Morton's Steakhouse is a favorite with a lot of the local Singaporeans also. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: battersaweib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriental hotel for 5 days on our way to Bali. We thought the hotel didn’t look that great from outside but they were renovating while we where there. The entrance and lobby of the hotel was absolutely beautiful. The staff where very friendly and helpful. The only thing which I didn’t like about the hotel where the rooms: The rooms are a good size but the décor was a bit outdated compared to the lobby area which is very modern.
