We also couldn’t open the balcony which I thought was a shame and the cleaning staff didn’t do a great job. I also think that the noise the lifts make when they get to a floor is very annoying. I really have to recommend you to have breakfast at the hotel which is absolutely amazing. They have the best breakfast buffet I have ever seen with anything you may want for breakfast. I am not sure I would stay there again until they update their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Indulgent and Relaxing stay at the Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: laleitz
Reviews.Content: I met my husband for a stay in a City View, Club Level Room at the Oriental, and it was absolutely the right place for us to stay. The whole hotel environment is one that feels utterly serene and indulgent. The room was well appointed and I appreciated the little touches the housekeeping services added each day. The hotel is located an easy 10 minute walk to the City Hall subway station, and it is possible to do almost the whole walk indoors through various malls if Singapore is having one of its torrential downpours.. Getting cabs was super convenient, and the workers hailing the cabs were so nice and actually funny! The Club perks were worth every penny- free internet in the lounge, extra help with concierge services, champagne breakfast, non-alc drinks all day, and evening cocktail and hors d'oeuvre hour. The breakfast was a nice blend of waitress service and buffet. I loved having a mimosa in the morning! The best thing was that the cocktail hour food was amazing and changed significantly each day. At both main services they had a wonderful selection of very fine cheeses. The afternoon tea had a nice array of nibbles, too. They seemed to be a bit slow in the service in the lounge, but most of the time i think it was cultural and not wanting to intrude or to seem pushy... I loved the amenities in the room especially the nice sound system and the soothing Chinese Tea when we arrived. The bathroom was beautiful, though I do wish the tub and the shower had been a bit bigger. Each were fine only for one person really. As far as some of the otehr aspects of the hotel: We had a couple's massage in the spa's couple's suite and the service there was impeccable. The massage was one of the best each of us has had. The food from room service was surprisingly good, as was the food at Melt. We didn't try the other restaurants though we heard good things about the Japanese restaurant and the Mediterranean restaurant from friends staying at the same time as us. I sat out by the pool, but I didn't get in because the one day i had time I felt it was too cool to get wet and there is no hot tub. Overall, we really loved our stay at the Oriental, and we would go back in a heartbeat, particularly for the reasonable prices we had for the club (about $300 US after taxes/service fee).

Reviews.Title: “A holiday of a lifetime !”
Reviews.Author: Bluenose57
Reviews.Content: What a place, stayed there in June 2007 with my twin brother and our wives and my father. celebrated our joint 50th birthday and my fathers return to Singapore since 1962. Decided to upgrade to the Club Floor before we arrived, what a choice ! the staff in the hotel are excellent, picked for thier customer service and charm. Full marks to Melvis and her team at the Club level who pampered us (especially my father, 73), the cost of the upgrade to the Club level was well worth it, excellent breakfast and full day service, cocktails in the evening were just the thing to round off the day. We are planning to go back to Singers in 2010 for my wifes 50th and our 30th Wed Ann. Will stay in another hotel purely to get a different view of the city. If you are first time in Singapore the Oriental would not be far of a very good hotel at a very good price.. thanks to all at the hotel for making our stay a lifetime memory of good times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SYCAMORES
Reviews.Content: We have just returned to the UK after a 4 night stay at The Oriental, Singapore.We arrived on 30th August 207.The rooms were clean, large and had everything that was needed. The staff were always smiling and very helpful.The buffet breakfast in the 'Melt Restaurant' was out of this world, with every type of food available.We also dined in the Morton steak house and the Italian restaurant 'Dolce Vita', both sited within the hotel.Both were excellent..The pool was brilliant along with the very helpful and attentive staff at poolside.It was a very pleasant stay after having travelled around Australia for 3 week.Well Recommended and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but avoid special occasions”
Reviews.Author: Brian37
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Oriental, Singapore from August 8 to 12. The room was large and luxurious, and the staff were efficient and friendly. The only problem was the Independence Day celebrations which took place outside. Road traffic to the hotel was totally blocked for many hours. I had to walk half a mile or so through extreme pedestrian congestion. Fortunately I could manage OK, but a handicapped person, or someone carrying luggage, would have found it impossible. I suggest you check what events may be on in Marina Bay before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be Pampered”
Reviews.Author: NYC-Canuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for business in Aug 2007 in Club Harbour Room #1806. Club rooms are floors 18 to 21 with the Club Lounge on floor 19. The Lounge serves complimentary breakfast. It's a nice spread with a bit for everyone. Cold cuts, cheeses etc for Europeans, Japanese and Chinese breakfasts, breads, fruits and a selection of hot food off a menu. The Lounge also does complimentary appetizers and drinks from 5:30 to 7:30 pm If you stay in the Club room two nights or more you get a complimentary transfer one way to or from the airport - your choice. Airport: 20 min away by taxi. Taxis are very inexpensive here in Singapore compared to other main centers. Taxi fare was $16 from the airport. Customs was a breeze - Heathrow take note! Luggage was very prompt. 40 min from time of landing to hotel. There are also airport shuttle buses to the various hotels for about $7. Not quite as fancy as the Manderin in HK but the room rate was less too so it balances out Check In: - if staying in a club room they take you up to the room and check you in there. Very efficient. Staff: Excellent all around. Service is wonderful. Any queries were done quickly and efficiently. Everyone is personable. Hard to get through the lobby without a couple of offers to carry my briefcase for me. Room Service: Prompt - before promised time. Food was good. Selection of vegetarian items too. Fitness: They have a fitness room with several treadmills, bicycles, elipticals. Also some free weghts, a few machines: legs, chest and shoulders. Pool: Outdoors and big enough for laps. Spa: I didn't use but they have a nice selection of services at reasonable rates. Menu in the room. Internet: Cost approx $20 USD per day for wireless in room. Free wireless in club lounge. Good connection. Have a business package - stapler, tape, etc in each room. Room: Lots of closet, storage space, iron and ironing board in room (hooray - rare in Asia). DVD / CD Player. Bedside clock with alarm. Fresh fruit every day. No noise issues. Bathroom: Nice - separate shower and tub, marble. Good vanity lighting. Spacious. Only minor complaint is that the tub is not long enough for me to extend my legs in (I'm 5'10"). 2 terry cloth robes. Security: Have to put your room card in the elevator before you can push the floor #. In room safe where you program your own code. Great area. Attractions: right across the street from the Esplanade Mall. Close to the Boat Quay for al fresco dining. Distances may be farther than you think. From Raffles 5 to Raffles 1 is a 15 min walk. Bring an umbrella - Singapore is known for its rain. Highly recommend the hotel - wish everyone I stayed was like this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slick999
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Hotel. The views from the habour rooms were excellent. We stayed for 2 nights on our Honeymoon before travelling on to Bali. It does have a slight clinical feel but the staff are faultless and the choice for breakfast is amazing. Its true luxury even down to having a member of staff in the lift to press the button for the floor you need (just in case you can't press it yourself!!) Because we were on our honyemoon we got a free room upgrade to the Harbour view which is well worth paying for the upgrade and we also got a free bottle of wine. There is alot of building work in the area and can be slightly noisy but I think that is just common of Singapore as its such a busling and developing place. The hotel is in such a good position I would recommend this hotel to try.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location. Take the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: deevienne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Singapore for four nights before going on to the Rasa Sayang in Penang. We chose The Oriental because of its location - right next to the main shopping malls, and an easy walk to Raffles. We even walked back to the hotel from Chinatown after being dropped off there at the end of the city tour. It took about half an hour and was not unpleasant, as Singapore has lots of trees lining the streets to keep the sun off you. The best rooms are on floors 18-21. We had a harbour view and were lucky enough to see the rehearsals for the National Day Parade which was, for the first time, to take place on a specially built floating platform in the harbour. From our high vantage point we had a spectacular view of formations, fireworks, Chinook helicopters flying low to simulate an air-sea rescue, and a fly-past. If this was a rehearsal I envy anyone who gets to see the real thing! We found very few eateries open before 11am, especially ones that served what most would consider a breakfast, so you should seriously consider taking breakfast at the hotel. For other meals you'll have no problem finding plenty of variety at very reasonable cost. Taxis are cheap, too, and tipping is not expected, or indeed encouraged. It's said that you absolutely must have a Singapore Sling in the Long Bar at Raffles, and throw peanut shells on the floor. Well, if you must you must, and you really must. But be warned, that SS will set you back eight quid, so make sure you get your money's worth in photos of yourselves imbibing it. No doubt we'll pass through Singapore again some time. When we do we'll certainly stay at The Oriental. And yes, we'll probably do the Singapore Sling thing again, too. What price nostalgia!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive but cold and noisy”
Reviews.Author: henrieta
Reviews.Content: The staff in all areas was very polite and always helpful. The breakfast buffet was impressive. We stayed in the Harbor room on the 8th floor – the room was extraordinary. The hotel is very well decorated, but it felt very cold because the main colors are black and red. The only issue was the noise. From the inside it is the Morton’s bar, which gets very busy in the evenings and you can hear the noise in the bathroom and the room entrance. From the outside, there was a building work going on opposite of the hotel, which started early in the morning till 8pm. It was very disturbing and it didn’t stop during the weekend at all. Please note that I was there in Oct. 2006, so I am not sure if this is still going on – check with your tour operator or directly with the hotel. Also near Esplanade is a place which holds some live music concerts, which are also very disturbing. On Friday night it went on until 1 am. The swimming pool and the area around are very nice with a great view at day and night. But again it was very noisy because of the building work on the harbor side. I can accept the typical city noise, but this was a bit too much. The windows in the hotel room cannot be opened and yet I could hear all that noise inside. The fitness room was quite small for hotel with such a capacity.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: NieceEngland
Reviews.Content: The Oriental is truly a breathtaking hotel. The staff are ultra efficient. Our room overlooked the city and marina and was so breathtaking that we slept with the curtains open just so we missed nothing. Our only slight critisism would be that it has a very 'clinical' feel, and unlike Bangkok or Indonesia we did not get the feeling that the staff were genuinely welcoming. That aside, our room was really comfortable, and cleaned twice a day. The staff were not intrusive and we were not pestered by reps or hotel management wanting us to book trips. It obviously caters for both business and tourist guests and manages to make both feel comfortable. A quick mention for the head doorman. A truly wonderful character, full of advice and information

Reviews.Title: “Amazing New Year Celebration at The Oriental”
Reviews.Author: q9rve
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here for 3 nights during New Year's Eve...thought that it would be a great way to ring in 2007 and indeed it did! I loved every aspect of The Oriental Singapore, although this is one of those "less luxurious" properties in the Mandarin Oriental Chain, but it is the service here that shines out and is one of the most important factor in making me want to go back here. On arrival, there are plenty of doormen and bellboys at the door so you don't have to worry about doing anything yourself at all. Check in was very quick and soon we were whisked to our room. We booked a Superior Ocean View...but they upgraded us to Premiere Ocean View Room (the only difference is that it's located on higher floors) The room, although I would say small in size (as much space has been devoted to the bathroom), is cosy and spacious. Nevertheless, if there are 3 to a room, you may feel a little bit tight. The room boasts many good technologies such as the BOSE surround sound and the large bathroom was a plus. Having been recently renovated in I think 2002? The rooms were free of stains, scratches, furniture wears etc. Now, I noticed that many of our fellow trip advisor members commented that the service here is a little bit "cold" and sometimes it's hard to get somebody's attention. This is infact, true, as this is quite a large hotel. Therefore, it does take a while for you to get the housekeeping or the bell boys to come up etc. However, in my opinion, it's not that long- so I didn't really mind. You must try the breakfast buffet at MELT- The World Cafe...I couldn't agree more with the other reviewers..it has a really large and extensive selection of all the food that you can ever imagine. I personally loved it. The other factor that I considered in choosing to stay here is because of its location. It's only a 5 minute walk to Esplanade- Theaters on the Bay, and Marina Square area. Also, the swimming pool area overlooks Marina Bay so we were front row for the fireworks on New Year's eve. I highly recommend this hotel for families as the atmosphere is very warm and friendly..and the pool area is quite large. There are no major negatives about The Oriental Singpoare..but some of the minor ones are the services in Melt Cafe, being a large restaurant, it could take a while to get somebody's attention. Other than that, I don't see any areas that would need improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: Sunsetter2010
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an amazing start to a holiday My partner and I booked a trip to Austalia and as the journey is a long one we decided to stop over in Singapore for a few nights. Not knowing what Singapore was like let alone the hotels we took a gamble and chose The Oriental Hotel - the pictures looked amazing on the website so we thought why not! We arrived and I must say the pictures were great but nothing compared to the real thing! On arrival our bags were taken to our room which was the Premier city suite, and we got shown round the hotel by the staff. The hotel is faultless, the decor is amazing and completley compliments what the hotel is offering. The swimming pool is amazing which also has a childs pool too. Our hotel room was amazing totally out of this world, the bathroom was huge, plenty of strorage and a lovely comfy bed. What was a nice surprise was that as we was on one of the suite floors we had complimentary breakfast and evening canapes, all of which was fantastic and on our very own floor!!! What I loved about the hotel was how friendly people were, very helpfull and always smiling - just what you want when you are on holiday. The hotel was very very clean and we felt like royalty! The choice of restaurants was brilliant to, there were plenty to choose from continental, japanese, tai, american etc. The hotel is very very close to the harbour and shopping malls and is a 5 minute taxi journy to the local markets and orchard road. I felt that Singapore was very cheap but if you want to spend big bucks then head to Orchard Rd where all the boutique shops are - if your looking for something traditional, a bargain or electrical items at a great price then head to the markets at china town! In my opinion the price of the Hotel was very cheap considering what you pay for a basic hotel in England what you get at the oriental is loads for your money. If your thinking about going here then I would definatley recommend booking one of the delux, or premier suites as breakfast is thrown in (but double check before booking) ! Overall the hotel and the area was spot on - we will be definatley be returning to this hotel - 10 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Oriental”
Reviews.Author: DKBS
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Oriental Hotel Singapore. We loved staying here, the hotel was fabulous and the service outstanding. We had a standard room which was very spacious (bigger than we had expected) and ample space for 2 adults and our 2 year old (who slept in a cot provided by the hotel). The staff couldn't have been more friendly and did everything to assist us - nothing was ever too hard. They even remembered my husband's birthday and a birthday cake was even left in our room. Breakfast was amazing with every cusine and food type covered - even little desserts/lollies etc. The pool was a typical city hotel pool (rectangle shape) but very nice and there is also a children's pool. What makes this pool area even better is the staff, the greet you as you walk out to the pool, have your towels ready on your cabana chair (with a headrest!), then they bring you a bottle of cold water and a small plate of fresh fruit. They have kids pool toys as well so our little one was entertained. Very relaxing. My husband had a massage in the day spa which was fantatsic. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants apart from breakfast but they did seem lovely. Overall we loved this hotel for the staff, the tranquil surrounds and being on the marina (with a shopping centre right next door). It was excellent (and just far away from the bustle of Orchard road but close enough to everything). It was fabulous with a toddler too who loved going up and down in their glass lifts. We would definately recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great views, service just ok”
Reviews.Author: Moonray1
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is beautiful. Our room was large and well appointed with modern furniture and a very large bathroom. We also had a great view to the sea. The restaurants are great - very nicely decorated and expansive, tasty offerings. The pool area is great - good size pool and lots of lawn chairs. The only negative point I can say is that the staff's service-level is slow. We seemed to have to wait all the time - for our food, for the bill, for the concierge, for check-in, for check-out. Perhaps we just hit a peak time? Otherwise, it's recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Dr Drew2's post”
Reviews.Author: asf
Reviews.Content: I couldn't agree more with Dr Drew2's post. Oriental Singapore is a very high class hotel. Location, rooms, amenities and breakfast selection are really good, but the service is the downside and doesn't follow the Mandarin standard elsewhere. Staff are cold. To get the attention of the staff to simply serve coffee/tea at Melt Cafe is a challenge! I usually have 3 cups of tea, but there, I had to be glad to have just the first one flled...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a little cold”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Drew2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice and all of the Asian décor in the lobby makes it slightly cold. The staff are nice, but do not seem to be very warm. The hotel and the experience are great though. We booked our room through the Amex Business Platinum Fine Hotels rate which was only $9USD more than the lowest rate on the hotel’s website. For this rate we were given an ocean view room with a bottle of red wine and a cheese platter delivered once we got to the room. It was a very nice and classy touch. We were also given free breakfast at Melt-The World Café. The rooms that are ocean and harbor view rooms are actually smaller than city view rooms. We were on the 10th floor with a great view of the pool and the Ritz Carleton. The rooms have a nice entertainment system that is quite complex with a remote control that has more in common with a palm pilot than a remote control. There are mounted speakers in the room too. The bathroom is not that large and the shower is quite small. The toiletries are huge. You cannot possibly take them with you unless you have a large toiletry bag. The room came with lots of extra toiletry amenities such as razors, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc. One wall of the bathroom is glass that looks into the room which is a nice touch. The air conditioning in the room, though, does not make it that cool and the bathroom can get quite warm. Melt-The World Café has a great breakfast spread. There are several stations with everything you could possibly want. This is the only hotel buffet I have ever seen that serves pure maple syrup from upstate New York. They have it sitting along the waffle and pancake bar. I was very impressed. I never thought I would see pure maple syrup 9,000 miles away from the States. The downside to this place was the service. There was a long line to get a seat and the place was empty. They seemed to be understaffed. I could not get anyone’s attention to bring me coffee even though they had looked at our table. We even returned to our table and everything was gone including silverware and cups. We had to wait to get new sets of everything, and getting them to clear the used plates was impossible even with staff looking at our table. I could not believe how bad the service was. It was completely different from any kind of Mandarin Oriental experience we have ever had. I hope it was just a coincidence and is not usually that bad. The pool area is great and it overlooks the road and has very cool night views of the harbor. Even though the pool closes around 9pm, they leave towels out and people swim after hours. As far as the location, the hotel is connected to the Marina Square mall, but you have to go out of the hotel a few feet and go up a very odd stairwell to get to the mall. The other option is walking toward the street and walking to the front of the mall. The hotel is very close to the Esplanade and all the food places there. The Esplanade seems to be a very popular area with lots of people hanging out there. The hotel is nearest to City Hall MRT but it is a little bit of a walk. But Singapore is such a walking-friendly city. We walked from the hotel to the Merlion, to Clarke Quay, and it is not that bad. We took a taxi back to the hotel though. We definitely would return to this hotel if the price was right, but we preferred the Conrad more because it felt warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Asian delight..Deserves all the accolades!”
Reviews.Author: FrankDrebin
Reviews.Content: I have just finished spending a week at The Oriental, Singapore and still feel the luxury that was lavished on me during my stay! On the advice of a work colleague I splurged for the Club Level room and I have to say it was money VERY well spent (or expensed as in my case.heheh) Anyway, regardless if I was paying personally I would have been happy to upgrade myself to the Club Level as it comes with a wealth of freebies including one-way Limo transfer to/from the Airport (an air conditioned Oasis once you hit the Singapore heat!), free breakfast which is abundant (including many hot items), cocktails between 5:30 - 7:30 and more. All of the food and drinks privileges are served on the 19th floor in the Club Lounge, which is beautifully decorated and enjoys fantastic views across Singapore (although it would have been better to have it on the City/Bay facing side.) My room was very nicely decorated with a beautifully large shower and separate bath. All amenities were top notch, however the 'standard' 27" TV was a bit out of place considering the modern level of all the other bits and pieces. LCD's would be much more suitable. Apart from that everything was great and the wired Internet connection worked perfectly (if not very expensive. typical in Singapore however.) Complimentary wireless is available in the Club Lounge, another perk! The location of the hotel is perfect, being minutes away to the downtown financial district (perfect for work) as well as the shopping areas around town. The new waterfront/outdoor theatre is also right in front of the hotel and would be quite fascinating to see a performance from the Water-facing rooms! The service was immaculate in every level with personalised greetings most days from the entrance of the hotel, to the Club Lounge and everywhere in between. I have no idea how they knew who I was nor how they keep track but it's impressive nonetheless. The Gym/Pool area is great with the gym receiving a recent facelift. It is very well fitted out with an onsite trainer available. I also took advantage of the Oriental Spa (two nights in a row!) and I highly recommend the signature massage! So relaxing and tranquil (and I'm not a person who typically relaxes easily in those environments.) Overall you can definitely get the feeling that this hotel is very highly recommended. Great service, location, fit-out and so much more. Again, highly recommend the Club Level rooms, but I'm sure that any room in the hotel will be more then satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely oasis on a business trip”
Reviews.Author: NWSongbird
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in Singapore as a break during a business trip. The Oriental was by far the most pleasant hotel we stayed in during that trip! The decor was lovely, the staff friendly, and the rooms had excellent views of the harbor and the city skyline through floor-to-ceiling windows. I also loved that they were filled with small details (wood carvings, flowers, drawer pulls) that pulled them apart from an ordinary hotel. The location is not very central, but Singapore is such a convenient city to navigate that I didn't find it to be a problem. My only complaints are that the staff was not especially prompt - I had to ask twice to get a lightbulb replaced in my room, for example. Onsite services are exceedingly expensive, as mentioned in another review - I spent over $30 for a small salad and a glass of wine for lunch one day, and found the spa to be prohibitively expensive. We also had a terrible experience at the bar there - extremely slow and disjointed service for very poor quality drinks. By contrast the breakfast buffet, which was included in our rate, was without question the best I've ever had - we're talking three rooms full of every kind of food imaginable! Long story short, if you go for the bed and the breakfast, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Get the Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: gt4877c
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2-night stay at this hotel as part of the Singapore Stopover. The location is excellent (Close to the shopping centers, and Little India etc.). The room was really nice. Service was great. But the highlight of our stay was definitely the breakfast buffet. That was the most amazing buffet I have ever seen in my life. It was HUGE, and had the most unique items on it. Indian curry for Breakfast? If you stay here, you have to get the buffet. It's expensive if you don't have it included in your room rate, but it's worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room to sleep, but doing anything else expensive”
Reviews.Author: EfJay
Reviews.Content: I say up front we are not usually 5 star people - but we booked the Oriental as a special treat for the first 2 nights of a 2 week holiday after we flew into Singapore. It also coincided with our wedding anniversary. We booked an ocean view double on line directly with the hotel - but upon arrival found we were 'upgraded' to a Harbour View twin (2 beds pushed together) due to the hotel being at 'full occupancy'. A bit disappointing, given the fact that we booked the room & had it confirmed by the hotel months before. The room itself was lovely, the pillows and bed the most comfortable I have ever slept on and the view from L12 superb - but I would rather have had the double room we had on our confirmation email. Still it was nicely appointed with good quality fittings, robes, towels, toiletries etc. We found everything outside the room was beyond our budget. Even the online rate (quoted on line in $USD different for each night) was converted to a common $SGP rate per night on arrival - presumably averaged out over the 2 nights. We had to sign our agreement to check in, leaving me wondering if we were being ripped off as I was not familiar with the $USD/$SGD/$AUD exchange - have to wait for the credit card bill to check! The shops & restaurants in the surrounding area were also expensive and quiet, and lacking in the genuine street life which for me is part and parcel of Asia. I found the location out of the way - the hotel we stayed at on previous visit (Meritus Mandarin) and later on our holiday (Oxford) were much better locations. We tried to get a drink at the round bar on level 4 but it was crowded and the door people asked us to wait (!!)so we headed out of the hotel for all of our food and drink after that. The foyer was beautiful but I found it rather dark and gloomy - no natural light at all. The final bill was $600 SGD including tax but no breakfast - we didnt do anything in the hotel at all other than sleep. I agree with others that the reception area was always busy and you felt like you being railroaded when you went there for anything. In short, if you actually go to see the city - and not hang about the hotel room - there are far better value options!

Reviews.Title: “Good but overrated”
Reviews.Author: point579
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental is undoubtedly a very good hotel at a good location. They have comfortable rooms and reasonably good food. However the service is far below what one would expect from a hotel that is rated so highly on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Not a patch on the Oriental Bangkok”
Reviews.Author: Gifford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights in April and I have to say that compared to the standards of service set by the Oriental Bangkok we were disappointed. At check in they seemed only interested in upgrading us to a Club room at an extra cost of about £70/night. This seemed over the top and we felt that a 5* hotel should have been more interested in welcoming us than trying to make a quick buck. On top of this we felt food and drink in the hotel was overpriced (drinks were actually cheaper in Raffles Hotel). We went to Morton's bar one night only to be told we could only have one drink as they were closing. My cocktail was the worst and most expensive Cosmopolitan I have ever had. This is clearly a business-orientated hotel and there were a few conventions on when we visited which made the dining room busy at breakfast time. Despite these criticisms the hotel is very well situated for seeing the sights of the city and the room was very nice, though again not quite up to its Bangkok counterpart, though that hotel is in a class of its own. For anyone already booked to stay here do not worry, the hotel is still very good, but I do not think it is up to the many rave reviews previously given, as there are many excellent hotels in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at about the Oriental BUT ...”
Reviews.Author: randcbathgate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in April. Having stayed a week previously at the Mandarin in KL (see our review) where the service was really fantastic, the Oriental was a little disappointing by comparison. The public areas and hotel rooms are exactly what you would expect from a hotel of this class. Rooms were spotlessly clean and well serviced. Toiletries and tea/coffee were replenished twice daily, and fresh fruit was put into the room each morning. There was a good roof top pool area with sun loungers, (but not enough umbrellas), and a spa which was very nice. The hotel also benefits from being located next to the Marina Mall - which can be accessed from the hotel forecourt. Location wise the Oriental is great. You are walking distance from the old Colonial areas of the city (Raffles landing point etc) and taxis are plentiful around the hotel. The downside to this hotel was the service. Whilst everyone was very polite, it was obvious that this is a hotel with a high turnover of guests. During our stay there were a number of conferences underway at the hotel, and also endless tour buses delivering, or collecting guests. This meant that reception was always busy, and you generally had to wait to speak to reception staff/concierge. When we were intially show to our room the receptionist left very quickly, and did not explain any of the room features. The tv/audio system was quite complicated to work and we would have appreciated them spending a little time to explain this. We had drinks in two of the hotels bars. On both occasions the sevice was very slow, despite neither bar being particularly busy. These are really minor points, and the hotel overall was a great base for our stay. We would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Oriental is an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sino888phile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many hotels in SIngapore, as we use Singapore or Brunei as a stopover in each direction on the way to Hong Kong or China from Perth. I read the reviews on this website, and the Oriental seemed the one which stood out to me. We paid A$214 per night from the hoteltravel.com company for a cityview room. We were never once disappointed with our decision. From being addressed by name when we first arrived, to being upgraded to an oceanview room, to the attentativeness of the staff, we were won over in the first few minutes. Breakfast was unbelievable. Even better than the Empire Hotel in Brunei. There was the widest selection of food we had ever seen and the hot food was actually hot. Whilst waiting to be picked up to go to dinner one night, we counted 14 staff outside the hotel, welcoming and farewelling groups. The room was not enormous like some Chinese hotels, but it was very well laid out and would be very suitable for business people and holidaymakers alike. The Oriental thoroughly deserves its high rating on ths website.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and cracking view”
Reviews.Author: Dawn on holiday
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Oriental for two nights 12 / 13 April 2007. We had decided to take the train and walk but found ourselves in the massive shopping centre adjacent to the hotel quite exhausted dragging our luggage around and couldn't find the way into the hotel. There is no interconnecting door. I think the best way to arrive is probably by taxi. However once inside the atmosphere is very calming. The check-in staff were very courteous and even showed us right to our room. Check out those lifts - wow. We had chosen a Harbour View room with a fabulous view towards the Merlion and the city. Soft music was playing and the bathroom was mable wall to wall. From the toilet you can see through a glass wall into the bedroom and out into the city. There is a blind too of course! The bath is indeed small but there is a separate power shower. Bathrobes and slipper. The fresh fruit was replaced daily and they had even given us a bottle of wine as we were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. A lovely hotel which we enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Siboyblue
Reviews.Content: Just back from 7 nights in the Oriental and I cannot recommend it enough! This 5 Star Hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in. The service, quality and quantity of staff are out of this world. Every little detail taken care of in a Hotel that looks as though it opened yesterday. My partner and I took a Premier Room with Harbour View. Well worth the money, we were greeted with relaxing music upon entering our room from the surround sound system and a great view of the marina and Merlion. Nice sized room with great bathroom. The power shower was fab! Had room service a couple of times and the prices were very fair. The food came 30 mins later and was served by a waiter as if an ala cart meal. Which it was! Coming from the UK the price to the pound made it a pretty reasonable cost. Great facilities although they are refitting the Gym at the moment so you either have to use a much smaller temporary Gym or they can give you a pass to Fitness First about a 15 min walk away. Also good to note that they are constructing some sort of stadium in front of the Hotel. Whilst it is not going to block anyone’s views it is a little noisy at times during the day, but not a major problem unless you’re a very light sleeper. You can see the construction in one of the pictures I have taken.They tend to start work at 8am and finish 6pm. Over all would not stay anywhere else in Singapore, indeed we did fly off to KL on this trip and should have stayed 5 days in Malaysia but came back within 24 hours cos we just could not do without our Singapore and the Oriental Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewY0rk
Reviews.Content: Second time spending one night layover at Oriental. Rooms are crisp, clean and modern. Service is exceptional and friendly. Club Room had great breakfast in a great room with good view of the city. Hope to spend more time at this hotel next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A good place”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: It was a good experience. It was the first time in my life that I stayed in a luxurious pplace because I have not enough money to do in Europe or the USA but in Asia. Well ,the hotel, the staff, the room, the swimming pool, the breakfast was fantastic but I expected something else. Perhaps is just my problem because is my first time in this kind of hotel but it was not something to remember as I expected but, again, perhaps is my problem. As soon as we arrived they tried o give us another room , more expensive, which I did not like. They said that our room was not ready and some stories and I felt as if they wanted to get more money... Next time I will stay in the fullerton, better location Just one advice: In the Arab quarter there was an arabian restaurant. I do not remember the name but it was in the corner ob Bagdag and Kandahar streets. Really, rellay, really nice. A good hotel anyway

Reviews.Title: “Great place - good veg breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Diptesh
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay - newly good sized refurbished rooms, large bathrooms, good toiletries, sensible things like alarm clock, large safe, iron & ironing board, free tea/coffee, separate luggage & cupboard area. In all, a good room for the price they charge. As a vegetarian (and being an Indian), was extremely pleased with the wide selection of Indian vegetarian food in the sensibly priced breakfast buffet. The choices are extremely wide. Liked the attention to service - be it the smiling doorman, to the conceirge to the attentive staff during check in /out. At present, a little distant from an MRT station, but understand a new line will soon be next to the hotel. The rooms have a good sized balcony - but Singapore weather is many times humid & one prefers the air conditioned comfort of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DutchTravel_lovers
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 3 nights at the Mandarin Oriental in Singapore and loved it. We arrived at 8 pm and got an upgrade for an executive club room on the 19th floor for which we decided to pay a little bit extra as the executive club gives several privileges like a late free check out until 8 pm, daily champagne breakfast on the 19th executive club lounge floor, free internet access for your laptop, daily free cocktails from 17.30 - 19.30 and free tea in the afternoons. The staff in the lounge is really friendly and can arrange your business calls as well. The ladies had nice Chinese dresses on and were all very knowledgeable. The interior design in the executive club lounge is very upgrade and well done! We did not have our breakfast in the normal breakfast restaurant, but it looked good too. We can recommend this hotel for Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Bigblueboy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after a thirteen hour flight to find we had been upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. This is what i call a first class hotel. Staff very friendly, helpful, efficient with attention to detail. The concierge staff are tripping over each other to help you, and always service with a smile, the warm welcome on arrival made the long flight worth it. Excellent facilities and all rooms very clean and in good decorative order. Room service quick, even at 4.30 in the morning. I could go on all day about how much i love this hotel, i only wish that i could visit Singapore more often and stay here, this must be one of the best hotels i have stayed in. You will not regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: mosquita
Reviews.Content: The Oriental is what you expect. Slick, well run, nice rooms, excellent service. Pool area is a bit bland and windy and the location isn't great, but thankfully taxis in Singapore are cheap and plentiful. If you are used to the Oriental group hotels you won't be disappointed. This lives up to it's reputation, without the wow factor. Spa is bland but therapists are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel All Round”
Reviews.Author: Nubbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Oriental for 2 nights and loved it! The rooms are large and well appointed, comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. The food is incredible. The Melt Restaurant has a superb selection, very fresh - breakfast, lunch and dinner. I would also reccommend the signature 1.5hr massage - it was possibly the best I have had. I highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Service at the Oriental”
Reviews.Author: DewsburyEmily
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a holiday to the Far East where for the first three days we stayed at the Oriental Hotel in Singapore. This is an excellant hotel and the staff are all very friendly and really seem like they want you to enjoy your stay. We were upgraded to a Harbour View room which which was such a treat. The room was spacious, clean, tidy and had a fabulous bathroom and the pillows were enough to make you want to stay in bed for the three days. The cleaning service was excellant and attention was paid to every little detail. I even saw people cleaning the walls! The pool area was also very nice with staff delivering clean towels to your lounger with chilled water and Evian mist face spray. The location of the hotel is also good, it is near the new theatre. It was always easy to get a taxi to and from the hotel. The only down point was that it was quite a walk to the MRT but taxis are so cheap it hardly matters.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JWEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a deluxe Harbour view room - straight from check-in (which took seconds) you can feel the quality of this hotel. After a 14 hour flight our room was perfect - wonderful, comfy bed and a very well stocked bathroom. Nice touches, like free water and apples add to the experience and our view of the Singapore skyline was perfect. Asked for a high floor and only got the 6th (which is the first floor of rooms) - but only a minor niggle. Also had our check-out extended by a couple of hours free of charge. Staff are very friendly and can't do enough for you (the same as much of Singapore!). Pool area was beautiful as were all the public areas of the hotel. Also great soundproofing in the room, never heard another voice during our whole stay. Orchard Road only a 10 minute taxi ride away but lots of shopping malls on the door step. Can't wait to go back to this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Singapore!! : )”
Reviews.Author: firebucket
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this wonderful hotel in early March '07 for 4 nights, after booking through asia best hotels for $210 SIN per night including full buffet breakfast. At this price it presented as excellent value for money - (included +++). About S$15 for a taxi from Changi Airport direct to the hotel (cheap), where check-in was very friendly and a complete breeze. However, when we went to the deluxe city view room on the 7th floor, we discovered the configuration was 2 x twin double beds. Not much good for our 1st year wedding anniversary! After checking our paperwork from the internet booking company, I found the mistake had been mine, erroniously ticking "twin" instead of "double"!! Oooops. (Had done the same for our next hotel in Phuket also! Double ooops) Back we went to the reception desk, cap in hand, to try and get a king bed room. Well, I think the poor girl may have thought the mistake was their's as we were upgraded to the "Grand City View" room which is about 49 sqm and USD $320 pn on their website. Beautiful. She personally escorted us up to the 9th floor to ensure we were happy with the room (which we were!) and left us to settle in. The room was massive with a seperate sitting/lounge area, huge balcony, seperate dressing area and massive dark marble bathroom. It had all the usual trappings of a 5 star hotel with Wireless high speed internet access, Cable television, work desk, Dual-line telephones with IDD and voicemail, Bathtub and a separate glass enclosed shower, Plush terry-towelling bathrobes and slippers,Tea and coffee making facilities, Hair dryer and mini bar & Daily selection of local and international newspapers. The only thing that could possibly be improved on would be the brightness of the lighting in the bathroom area (mirror), which I found a little dim. This hotel is really quite beautiful inside with a stunning internal atrium area and glass elevators. The decor is unmistakeably asian with dark hues and huge chandelliers. The pool area is what you would expect with a 25 metre lap pool and adequate gym area. Only missing a hot spa! The pool attendants quickly & happily set you up with a lounger, plush pool towels & free bottled water. (The hotel provided several free bottles of mineral water in your room also). Breakfast was the most comprehensive that I have ever seen - anywhere. On the first day we wondered in all of it was really included in the price we had payed. Definately try to get it included because it costs about S$45 per person if you pay on the day. They had there own little bakery cooking anything you wanted, eggs done anyway you liked, fresh squeezed juices in front of you etc etc etc... It really has too many food choices to list here, but you could never get bored with it and the service was just great and so quick. The location of the hotel is perfect. The Marina shopping centre it is attached to is one of the best we found in Singapore really. (MRT Station, great Restaurants, a bowling alley, cinemas and all the shops you could want.) The Merlion was an easy walk, river boat tours, fountain of wealth and Raffles Hotel. Watch those Singapore Slings though at S$44 for two at Raffles! But you gotta do it! We tried the MRT a couple of times but honestly the cabs are so very reasonable in price we just caught them in the end or walked. The night safari is a must-do and we enjoyed that immensely. We just caught a cab there and back from the Oriental which was under S$20. We really loved Singapore in general, the Oriental Hotel and would love to go back sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideLive
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Oriental set this hotel apart from all the others in Singapore. I have stayed at many hotels in Singapore but this is my favourite and I would recomend this above all else. I have stayed here on seven occasion since it reopened after its refit and found the service to be consistant every time. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexGirlx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our Singapore stopover (organised by Singapore Air and would recommended this as a way of breaking up your journey) and thought it was lovely. We arrived about 9am and although we didn't expect to be able to check in this early they were very apologetic that the room wasn't ready and upgraded us, by way of apology, to a top floor harbour view room! Beautiful hotel, clean, perfect decor and the staff were really friendly. We didn't eat in the hotel but would recommend the bar with fabulous city views at night. Good location, about ten mins walk to Raffles, 15 mins to Boat Key and close to the Chinese quarter. Would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: duesseldorf67
Reviews.Content: First, the highlights of the hotel: Fantastic efficiency which includes speedy 'in-room' check-in; prompt room service and overly friendly staff from front door host to cleaning lady. The Hotel's staff training program is spot on. The Spa, which is a part of the hotel is 5Star and overall, the hotel and the room is one of the cleanest I have ever stayed at. We had a Harbour View Room with ceiling to floor windows. The bathroom was small, the bath was small, but very modern with lots of amenities. Best and most comprehensive Buffet Breakfast in MELT, World Cafe on Level 4, I have ever seen. Where I feel improvements are needed: there are not enough 'movie' channels on tv, the room-service meal variety is not diverse and comprehensive enough and is too much asian specialities (food was excellent though, had the salmon and the chicken), all restaurants in the hotel are expensive, even compared to say Sydney or Bangkok Hotels. There is a business center if you want to use a hotel computer for internet, which comes with a charge by the minute, the fitness center is tiny, the outdoor pool is very basic and not landscaped. Nothing majorly wrong with this hotel at all, decor is very asian and a bit dark (i.e. foyer / restaurants ) for my liking. Would stay there again, but would also like to try out a different hotel on my next stay to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly mediocre”
Reviews.Author: itinerant_ceo
Reviews.Content: After all the rave reviews, the Oriental was a real disappointment. The suite, quite an expensive one, was small and poorly designed. The bathroom was poor by Far Eastern standards: tiny bath, bad design, aging fittings. The room service and hotel restaurant food were disappointing. Even the service, while very good, was not as impressive as other hotels in Singapore. Don't get me wrong: it's a good hotel, but there are much better around. I travel to Singapore a lot and I would recommend all the other hotels I have visited over the Oriental, especially Raffles The Plaza and the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hash Brown
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Wife stayed in this Hotel from 22/01/07 - 25/01/07 on our way back to the UK from Australia. This Hotel is Fantastic and is a must for everybody who stays in Singapore!! We stayed in the Pan Pacific on a previous visit to Singapore and we thought that was great but this tops everything. The whole Hotel is beautiful and the service is without fault. One tip though would be too ensure you get breakfast in your room rate. You will not be disappointed. There is food there from every part of the world and it is faultless!! Even if it's not part of your room rate make sure you eat there!! We found we were having breakfast and then not eating again until Dinner. There was just so much choice!! Singapore is a fabulous place and all the Hotels look great but when we do return we would have no hesitation in stopping at the Oriental again!!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered at the Oriental”
Reviews.Author: sagu
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was just fantastic. The hotel staff were friendly and they gave us a complimentary room upgrade. The hotel is centrally located and is close to MRT and shopping malls like Paragon and Takshinaya (im sure i got the spelling wrong). The only thing which kinda put me off was the long waiting time at the coffee shop. Had to wait for nearly 5 minutes before we could place our orders. Oh and the bar was simply superb. Had the best cosmopolitan in Singapore! I would definitely stay at the Oriental again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tv1
Reviews.Content: This really is a nice hotel, with great views. The rooms are well appointed. Restaurants are good. Morton's steakhouse is a must, though a tad expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie2801
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days on the way to Australia and I have to say I think it is the best hotel I have ever stayed in!!!!!!!!!! The service and comfort are second to none from the moment you get out of the Cab to the moment you leave nothing is too much trouble. The staff are amazing and there are so many of them you feel like a VIP. We had a Ocean view room with a huge bed and stunning views, room service was amazing and we also had a massage in the Spa which was brilliant. Breakfast was included and was a feast of every countries cuisine truely an experience and all this for £80 per night!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Singapore is brilliant a real eye opener as to what a zero tolerance approch to anti social behaviour can do. No one drunk, no one swearing, no problem walking around late at night just polite and respectful people everywhere brilliant!!! Went to Raffles to do Afternoon tea well you have to dont you thought it was a bit over rated and in fact the Afternoon tea at the Oriental was better. Chinatown and Little India are great and worth a visit. Cabs are so cheap its probably the best way to get around but the MRT trains are also really convenient and cost pennies. Sentosa island is worth a visit will be back someday

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: adamico3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Booked as part of a package from Asian Affair Holidays. The staff could not do enough for the guests at this hotel. The Oriental Spa was a wonderful treat to end of the day. Our room came with the full american breakfast buffett in the Melt Restuarent. The breakfast was two meals in one there was something for everyone on the buffett. Concierge Suhartono Alamsyah was wonderful with booking tours and arranging transportation. The best sleep I had in a long time very quiet hotel and clean. Great housekeeping staff. Our room attendant was David. Oreintal keep up the great service and too bad you are not in more cities around the world as other hotels can learn from yours. Andrea D'Amico Jan 7-11,2007

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and very good value”
Reviews.Author: shelley66
Reviews.Content: after reading many reviews of Hotels in Singapore on this website I decided on the oriental it was great value for only $175 aus per night this included a massive buffet breakfast which had food from all different nationalities The service in this hotel was fantastic, the staff were very freindly and the room was quite large. it even had a balcony The bathroom had both a bath and shower and mirrors on the wall everything had been renovated so very comfortable it had in house safe robes and a bar fridge. the staff cleaned the room each day replaced any towels and sheets and even turned down the bed each night. the bed was king size and very comfortable. it definalty made for a great expience in Singapore. the hotel was even right next to a shopping and movie complex so very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: menome
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems small at first, the reception area is not all too big, you could call it cosy. Check in was prompt and we did get a free upgrade to a junior suite for no apparent reason. The service is excellent, they are quite patient at the front desk and you never have to wait long before someone attends to you. The bell boys are excellent as well, they did the small things that really add up and make it from a good to an excellent experience. You have people with specialise jobs, ie. the "hail taxi" man, the "luggage" boys, the laundry lady, so there was always people to attend to you very promptly for your every need. The rooms were very nice, I think the hotel must of recently got refurbished. Seperate shower and bathtub, large bathroom; room overall was a good size. Breakfast, room service or any type of food or service (especially food) was very expensive at this place. The supermarket is literally 2 minute walk from hotel in Marina square shopping centre so no need to use the hotel snacks. The Tiger beer in fridge was out of date, but that is the only flaw I could find in this hotel for my 5 nights stay. Overall, this was an excellent hotel and out of the 5 star hotels my travel agent showed me, this was in fact the cheapest option but turns out to be one of the best hotels I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Oriental is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeMario
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel and staff! I cannot praise the Oriental hotel enough.I arrived here on 14th January for 2 nights but have ended up staying for at least another week as my son is unwell and unable to fly. Check in was very quick.All staff are extremely pleasant and efficient.A room was made available for us as soon as we knew we had to prolong our stay. We initially had 2 interconnecting harbour view rooms that were amazing with lots of nice touches and well equipped desks for working. Now my son and I are in a large pleasant room with living area and balcony and a nice view of the singapore skyline.Rooms are very clean and beds very comfortable. Room service is excellent, efficient and reasonably priced-just as well as we have been confined to the room for a few days! IT facilities are excellent and internet access good value. You are spoilt for choice at breakfast in the Melt cafe and service is perfect-no need to ask for coffee refills here!Haven't tried any other restaurant yet but good selection. Location is good and I would prefer to stay in this Marina area than Orchard road area.Shopping mall attached to hotel that connects to several other malls and city MRT station. Looking forward to travelling on and joining my husband and daughter but will be sad to leave the Oriental. Will definitely stay here when return to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Tany_Jo
Reviews.Content: Slightly disappointed! I travel a lot, both business/leisure and have stayed in other 5-star hotels Mandarin Oriental, Shangri-La, Ritz hotels and I did expect a similar experience. Stayed in a club room, the view was great (top floor, sea/city view), room was clean, great sound system, good bed. However, the bathtub was SMALL, the fruit that comes with the club room, were not so fresh apples and oranges. No fruit basket or anything else. The Club Lounge is great, wonderful service, nice deco, but breakfast choices a bit limited, but I overall I think the breakfast "experience" in the lounge was good. Some staff members were really nice and friendly, in the lounge, at the front door, by the elevators, but then some disappointments, especially the pool staff. In a five star hotel, especially in Asia, I expect to get top service everywhere. The SPA was good, but then again in Asia you do expect to get a bit more for your money. Nothing special. Pool are area was good, but something was missing there as well, it was not a five star hotel standard, it was moreless 4-star hotel pool. I liked the deco of the hotel, but on some rainy days, I felt that it's a bit dark and gloomy, maybe the wall-to-wall carpets or something should be changed to make it a bit brighter. Coming down from the 21st floor and looking out of the elevator I didn't feel it looks like a 5-star hotel. The (small) reception area is stylish though. All in all, a good experience, but I don't think I'll stay another time.

Reviews.Title: “A deluxe business hotel. Not a luxury one. A disappointement”
Reviews.Author: CD_in_geneva
Reviews.Content: I cannot agree more with PeteLondon. This Oriental is just ok. An upscale business hotel but defenitly not a 5 stars Mandarin Oriental hotel. I spent 4 nights there in a harbour view Club room after staying at the Landmark MO in Hong Kong and i noticed the difference right when check in. Lots of problems in the room. The wardrobe doors would not close and never been repaired. Only one plug was working. The same 2 apples and 2 oranges in a plate during the whole stay were never changed. No personal touches or special attentions. The SPA is rather small, though they have very good traitments. No steam room or sauna. Rather basic, small and old fitness center. Very good club lounge with high quality drinks and food. Very helping club level staff. I didn't try the restaurants and bars of the hotel. The club level is an excellent value, with free breakfast, tea, soft drinks and evening champagne with canapés. But beware, the beautiful lounges is becoming crowdy and noisy when at the free alcohol time. I shall go back to the Oriental bearing in mind i won't have to ask for exceptional service and true luxury. I liked the connexion to the Marina Bay mall which is connecting to Raffles city and the subway. After expressing many times my disappointements regarding the room and the service i was offered a bottle of wine and a limo transfer to the airport. Fair enough!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and excellence!”
Reviews.Author: Nuleewed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Oriental for the first part of our honeymoon. We were asolutely delighted with the hotel. It totally exceeded our exepectations. We were upgraded to a harbour view room, which has seperate lounge and 2 bathrooms. The room was spotless and the bath was full of rose petals - bliss! As well as the room being fantastic, we loved the rest of the hotel facilities. The roof-top pool at sunset is not to be missed. Fabulous views. We were spoilt for choice in terms of restaurants - our favourites were the Cherry Garden chinese restaurant and the World Cafe where we had a fabulous all-you-can eat buffet! Other hotels in the past had put us off buffets but this is like no other - expensive but worth every penny! The staff were also excellent - always polite and attentive. We accidentally left our balcony door open one evening and a huge bug came into the room - a member of staff immediately got rid of it and we received a bottle of champagne for the inconvenience! If you want luxury, location, top quality service in Singapore stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: AsianTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Was expecting a great stay since it was in the highest category in the Singapore Airlines Stopover package. The other choices were the Ritz Carlton and Raffles and one other. The Oriental did not live up to that category. The room was only above average, it has aged, the room had problems (toilet flushing, TV sound problem, phone cord disconnected). The service of the front desk was superb though. They went out of their way to help us resolve problems. The staff was great, the property was less than desireable.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, not best for value for money”
Reviews.Author: PeteLondon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but no room ready when arrived at 6PM and had to change original room half way through stay because room flooded due to heavy rain, staff very indifferent to this. Stayed in club room and was pleasent, ask for marina view as originally were put in one with 'city' view but certainly wasn't view of city sky line. Overall is a good hotel but having paid for 5 star club room I felt it was pretty average for the catagory and I have stayed in better hotels for a lower cost. The 'fruit' in room consisted of two apples and an orange each day, hardly an exotic array! Complimentary alcohol is served in club lounge between 5:30 - 7:30PM each day which leads to a stampede at these times which can be a bit tedious, we opted to go out and explore singapore after making use of this for a few days. Nice swimmig pool but no jaccuzzi next to it and gym was basic. If this sounds negative, it isn't meant to be, it is a very pleasent hotel but I felt I paid more than it was worth, if you get a good deal go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Pete82
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel!! We stayed in a harbour view suite which was lovely with huge bathroom and lounge area. It has a good location near the marina and walking distance from Orchard Road - 15mins. Breakfast in the Melt was good and great spa. Staff always friendly and helpful. I would recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “True Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: Shermanator
Reviews.Content: "Wow" sums up this hotel nicely. We booked one of the Club Experience rooms, which included access to the Oriental Lounge on the 19th floor and lots of other extras. Free airport pick up in a Mercedes set the tone for the next two nights stay perfectly. From the minute we stepped out of the car at the hotel, we were treated like true VIPs. We were whisked up for a quick tour of the club loubge, then taken directly to our room to check in with Alice, one of the impeccable front desk staff. The room was gorgeously decorated, the bed super comfortable, and the entertainment system very good. A sumptuous breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails with nibbles were served in the lounge, which boast a very nice view- and all complimentary. Be warned, however, that the hotel enforces a smart casual dress code in most of its public places. This meant that no flip flops or shorts, for example, were allowed in the lounge or even in Morton's bar for a quick drink. This was a bit of a nuiscance, being that the outside temperature was about 30c, so we had to change a couple of times. The pool does not have very many sun loungers, so get there early. We would highly recommend this hotel- the staff bend over backwards to be helpful, and are always very friendly and curteous.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: NotInTheOC
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early at 8AM and the front desk got us in a harbour view room by 9AM with no fuss or issues. Pool was nice and quiet and we loved the free juice and water. Melt Cafe was perfect, service good and the breakfast buffet excellent value for money. View from the room was amazing, bathroom was perfect and we especially liked how our Ipod could be plugged into the room stereo system. Overall a solid 5 star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Service needs a makeover at this over-hyped hotel”
Reviews.Author: ApplesInMyBra
Reviews.Content: My hustband and I are currently living in Singapore, and we wanted to treat ourselves to a little "getaway" for Christmas this year. We picked the Oriental based upon the many great reviews on this site. We booked the "Christmas Spendour" package directly on the Oriental's website, promising a spacious City Suite with "oversized tub" and seperate shower. We checked in on Dec. 24th for one night, including breakfast at Melt - the World Cafe. First of all, when we checked in, there was no City Suite available and the receptionist told us that she was "upgrading" us to a harbour view room. This was not true, because the harbour/ocean view room was much smaller than the City Suite would have been. Unfortunately, I only found this out after our stay when I went back to the website to compare the rooms. Duped from the start! The room was ok - nice size, quite clean, and the surround sound on the stereo was very nice - we could hook up our iPod and listen to Christmas carols, and watch movies in surround sound. The tub was definitely NOT oversized. In fact, it was tiny - asian sized. The breakfast buffet at Melt was a nice spread with a bit of asian flavours along with western favourites. The service was not that great, we waited 25 minutes after being seated for someone to come by to offer us coffee. Throughout breakfast I had to get up to go and summon someone to please fill our coffee cups - definitely not 5 star service. At the end of our meal, we also got the bill and we had to remind them at checkout that breakfast was included in our package and had them remove the charges. Check your bill!! The pool area is in desperate need of a makeover - the yellow lounger covers are dirty and grimy, and the towels provided are frayed and faded. Also, no drinks are served around the pool so if you want that tropical cocktail, forget it. Also, very crowded with loads of screaming children in a quite small area. There is also contruction going on next door on the Marina so be prepared to listen to a lot of noise. We went for spa treatments on xmas day and it was really nice. Except there are no spa facilities such as jacuzzi, whirlpool, sauna or steambath. Basically, you go in get your massage and get out again. Nothing special and not really worth the SGD$165 I paid for a 85 minute massage. My husband got the "Shiatsu" massage but was dissapointed because they didn't even use the bars from the ceiling to walk on his back. He said it was a plain old dry Thai massage - not Shiatsu at all! I would not go to this hotel again - a bit overpriced and over-rated in my opinion. Next time, we'd rather go to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb!”
Reviews.Author: Invisible_Shadow
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel twice in December and it was an absolute pleasure. A fairly large hotel, but with a personalized touch to it. The service throughout the hotel in all the different areas was excellent. All the staff are very accommodating as you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. The rooms are attended to twice a day with fresh fruits being brought in each time. We were upgraded to a Premier Harbour room. The views from the room...Wow! The view at night is especially spectacular. The room size is very good, with a small office area provided. Room facilities also excellent as expected, with all the usual suspects being in the room. The room lighting controls are a neat touch, as well as a privacy button which is respected by the hotel staff. There was also a DVD player in the room, which was useful. The bathroom is also superb, with a very modern shower system. It is separated from the room with a glass panel, so one can see straight out of the bathroom onto the amazing views from the room. Of course if privacy is required, then there are blinds on the bathroom side of the glass panel. This glass panel enlarges the size of the room and gives the room a nice feel. The business centre is very well equipped and once again, excellent service is provided. The Internet access at the business centre is very expensive compared to any local Internet cafe. However when I used it for less than 10 minutes to check my email, they didn't charge the costs to my room. To sum up, an amazing hotel from the moment you walk in to the reception area. Highly recommended and one of the best 5* hotels I've stayed in to date!

Reviews.Title: “value for money (steven boersma the netherlands)”
Reviews.Author: travelloverHouten
Reviews.Content: It's a fantastic hotel,it's a business hotel with also very good leisure facilities. restaurants are great. Try Mortons Steakhouse, probably best steakhouse in Singapore. We had an executive suite which was great and very spacy. Seperate living area and a seperate bedroom. Breakfast is average to 5star standards in Asia. Conviently located next door to shopping mall Marina square which flows over into Suntec City. Hotel is very close to Orchard Rd. I can recommend this hotel to everyone who comes to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: amandakr
Reviews.Content: Mandarin Oriental Service from start to finish. Booked the club floor - great room, great amenities. Loved the club - great place for a cocktail. Had a lovely dinner in the Japanese restaurant and also at Morton's. Spa experience was wonderful as well. Absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toppsmark
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Singapore and 2 nights at the Oriental. This is a wonderful hotel. The room was beautiful, large, and luxurious. The view was incredible (harbour view, club room). I ate at the Chinese restaurant twice and loved it both times. The staff was friendly, polite and professional. The club has a very nice breakfast and excellent cocktail food. I would recommend this hotel to any one and would stay here again if I am lucky enough to get back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: popeye3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped here for five nights (end of November/early December) and the experience was wonderful. We took the Club Room option which was well worth the money. We were checked in in the room and were greeted with fresh flowers, fruit and a bottle of wine - fantastic. We have never stayed at a hotel with so many curteous staff available to do your bidding, nothing was too much trouble We tried the Club Room for breakfast on the first morning and it was very nice but the choice was limited. We then switched to the "Melt" Cafe (at no extra cost) which was little less than astounding, such an amazing choice of food and all well cooked and presented. Again the staff were efficient and attentive. We only managed Afternoon Tea in the Club Room once and it was very nice but limited to small cakes and tea/soft drinks etc. Unfortunately we never made it for coctails and canapes in the evening. We would advise paying the extra for the Club perks which in our case was good because it meant we didn't have to check out until 8pm which was useful since our flight was at midnight. This may or not be of interest but when we arrived at Changi Airport from the UK we looked at using the Shuttle Taxi to the hotel. The normal price is S$7 per person but we were told that we would have to wait up to an hour for a shuttle. They then tried to persuade us to take a shuttle for just the two of us at a cost of S$35 which they could provide immediately - what a con! We eventually got a taxi which cost S$15. The moral of the story is don't even think about getting the Shuttle just get a taxi - it's cheaper and quicker. In summary, if we go to Singapore again we will most definitely stay at the Oriental and wil be advising family and friends to do so as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shine13
Reviews.Content: Stayed over thanksgiving for 3 nights in the club harbor room. It's a great deal! The club room is worth the extra price. YOu get a wonderful breakfast and apps/cocktails at night and drinks all day long. Altho if you have a laptop you should bring it .. free to use there, but if you use the business room its 50 cents a min!!! My only complaint. was really the business room. Besides the internet fee it wreaks of smoke. The staff is so helpful with everything and anything you need. Really Great Service. NYC, USA

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect, but...”
Reviews.Author: Chalky9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Oriental for one night following a cruise on the Star Flyer. Our room overlooked the pool and the harbour, with an extensive view slightly spoiled by construction work on the opposite side of the road. The room was a good size, very comfortable and offered everything you could want, including space to lay both our suitcases open. The marble bathroom had a large separate shower and was beautifully appointed, but the sliding door was very difficult to close. Soundproofing in the room was not as good as might have been expected, either from internal plumbing noises or external traffic and construction. The staff were excellent. We ate dinner in "The Melt" World Cafe which offered an extremely extensive self service buffet encompassing dishes from India, China, Thailand, Japan and the West, or a la carte. (This is also where the extensive breakfast buffet is laid out.) The food was good but the wine prices were frightening - the cheapest bottle on the list was 60 Singapore dollars, with most nearer 90! We had planned to eat in Mortons Steakhouse, but found on arrival that the dress code is "semi-formal", which we weren't! In any case, a small steak was $S 73, which was more than the entire meal in "The Melt". The location is fine if you want to be near Suntec, but not really in the centre of things. Overall we preferred the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Coinean
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three night in Club suite.This is the best hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. The staff are extremely friendly & helpful at all times. Check-in was not at the desk,but in the comfort of our room. Food excellent beautifully presented and as much as you could eat. Suite very comfortable tastefully decorated and very spacious. Sorry we had not decided to stay longer in Singapore,because this hotel makes the holiday. Will only ever stay in Mandarin Oriental Singapore any time we are on the island!! Highly recommended with absolutely no room for complaint. Charles & Yvonne McQuigg Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Diro
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for the first three nights of our two week holiday and were pleasantly suprised by the Oriental. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff we encountered. We decided not to book inclusive of breakfast and when we asked for a recommendation at reception of where to go, they actually escorted us to the mall next door. We booked the standard room which overlooked the pool and it was comfortable and roomy by European standards. Overall we enjoyed our stay at The Oriental and will definately stay there again the next time we go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, service, Spa, Club facilities all superb”
Reviews.Author: hicate
Reviews.Content: More used to the elegance of the Oriental in Bangkok I was at first a little taken back by the almost space age interior design of the hotel. There is a huge inner space with a 6 glass lift tower at its center . Restaurants, Bars and rooms are arranged around it, looking over the space.
