We had a club room on the 19th floor, for an extra £30 a day per room you get a superb breakfast (part buffet, part a la carte) all day soft drinks, tea and coffee and snacks, afternoon tea, and 2 hours of cocktails, champagne (or any alcoholic drink you wanted) and savory / canape snacks from 5.30 to 7. 30. The hotel is opposite the new theatre complex overlooking the marina. It is close enough to walk to The Fullerton Hotel and Boat Quays behind it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: badger36
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was amazing - the setting, the views, the service, the staff, the food....the list goes on! I have travelled all over the world and i can say quite comfortably this is probably the best hotel i have stayed in. The rooms was amazing - i did up-grade though. Amazing views, huge bed, very very comfortable. And like many places in Singapore, the service was 1st class. Its worth paying extra for a room with a view. We also had a small balcony. I recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: S&GSmith
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Singapore & Malaysia. We stayed at The Oriental for 7 nights and absolutely loved it. Our trip was booked thru Asian Affair Holidays. They got us a harbour view room which included breakfast buffet at The Melt cafe (it would have been over S$80 for 2 ppl). I was impressed with the service of the hotel staff. They were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service For Families Too”
Reviews.Author: R8SKM
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 nights here in October in a City view suite. The hotel made our family very welcome and both children (3 & 9) were left a small gift in the room on arrival. Our suite was immaculate and huge at 75 sq meters. A harbour view would have been even better - maybe next time! Paying extra for the club facilities is worthwhile and the hotel organised a baby sitter for us (at a very reasonable S$20/hour) so we could take advantage of the cocktails and canapes in the early evening. Complaints? Well, maybe I'm being a little picky but breakfast at The Melt restaurant - whilst excellent - could feel a little rushed given the number of people. On two occasions, I was presented with the bill to sign just as I sat down to eat - not what you need first thing! We had room service a couple of times and the food and service were excellent. You can walk to Marina Square in 3 minutes where there is a supermarket for those essentials (cheap wine!). In addition to a huge range of shops there too, check out the food court on the top floor. We sat outside with superb curries for us, pizza and ice cream for the children, two tiger beers and a superb view of Boat Quay and the city skyline. Singapore is a viable destination for young families. We did Sentosa, East Coast Park, the Night Safari and Chinatown. Both children really enjoyed the holiday and the staff at the pool where excellent too. Would we return? Absolutely, especially if we are upgraded to a harbour view suite next time!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: TREASURER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oriental on a 4 day stopover on the way back from Australia to UK. Could not believe the service at this hotel !! My wife and I have travelled all round the world and can honestly say It is the best hotel we have stayed in for service. The standard set by all of the staff was exceptional and greatly contributed to our enjoyment of our trip to Singapore. The concierge,Edmund, was absolutely brilliant and provided first class information and recommendations - nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Service In Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrickPro
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Singapore on September 21, 2006 and stayed in Singapore for 14 nights. After reading all of the reviews, I had a very hard time choosing a hotel. When I approached my husband, he came up with the idea of staying at a couple of hotels, each for three or four nights. We ended up staying at The Oriental, The Ritz Carlton, The Shangri-la, and The Sentosa Resort and Spa. The Oriental was by far the unanimous favorite. Our stay at the Oriental was phenomenal. The accommodations were exquisite, but more importantly the service was unmatched by any other hotel in Singapore. We stayed in a city suite with club access. We booked the Suite Success package, which included a luxury airport transfer. We were actually arriving by ferry, and the hotel was very nice and willing to pick us up at the ferry terminal. When we exited the ferry terminal (along with 150 other passengers) we greeted by name by the driver (don't ask me how he knew who we were, we are still puzzled over that one) and transferred by Mercedes to the hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted at the steps of the hotel (once again by name) by a very kind lady. She immediately showed us right up to our room where she checked us in. She also provided to us a letter that detailed all of our included amenities during our stay. (This was a very nice touch, since often times you miss out on things that were actually included, because you didn't ask.) Staying in the City Suite was a little more expensive, but well worth the extra money. The extra benefits we received practically paid for themselves. Access to the club lounge, complimentary laundry pressing service, late checkout in the club lounge, fresh fruit, complimentary internet access, and a gigantic room made us feel like we were royalty. There was even an extra 1/2 bath that was convenient when you have a spouse that hogs the bathroom. Every single employee of the hotel went out of their way to accommodate all of our needs. After a long day at the Singapore Zoo we arrived about 10 minutes late for hors d’oeuvres in the club lounge. We decided to go up to the lounge anyway to get a drink. Upon arrival to the lounge, we were seated and told that they had just put away the food, but she would fill us up a plate in the kitchen (with a little of everything) and bring it to us. She went out of her way, and it made all the difference. When it was time to checkout and move on to the next hotel, we didn’t want to leave. For the next 8 days, while staying at the Ritz Carlton and Shangri-la, everything was just okay. Yes, these other hotels are very nice, but compared to the service we received at the Oriental, they were disappointing. My advice to you is, stay at the Oriental. If you are determined to compare the other hotels, just make sure to make the Oriental the last hotel you stay in, because everything else dulls in comparison to the service you receive at the Oriental. Don’t do what we did, and spend the rest of your trip saying, “Well, at the Oriental ……” When we return to Singapore, we will definitely return and stay the entire trip at The Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Business Hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: Sydney-AP
Reviews.Content: Having read all the reviews on Tripadvisor I tried the Oriental in both Club and standard rooms. Its a really pleasant business hotel, the club facilities are excellent with the most delightful staff and fit out. The breakfast is superb. The rooms are fine even if its a little obvious that they are older style hotel rooms that have been renovated tastefully eg old joinery with new soft furnishings. The pool area is nice but again its obviously an old hotel that has been renovated. The service is delightful, genuine and warm but its an old hotel dressed up to be something it no longer is - that doesn't make it an adequate member of the Oriental group. Don't let me make it out to be terrible which it isn't - what it isn't is a cohesive first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again in a heart beat”
Reviews.Author: graceC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Oriental during our recent trip to Singapore in Sept/Oct 2006. We first stayed there for 3 nights, then flew to Jakarta for a few days, and came back to The Oriental Singapore for 8 more nights. We booked everything through AMEX that gave us a good deal. Before arrival, we have exchanged emails with the hotel to confirm and reconfirm our booking. Our reserved room was for Deluxe Oceanview room. We also inquired about their airport transfer services and was told it would cost Sing$60 one way with a Mercedez Benz 200 series. We decided to take a cab instead since they're plenty available in Singapore and cheaper too. We arrived with bleary eyes @ 1am at the hotel after a 20-hour flight from Chicago. At first glance, the lobby was quite modern looking with marble surface all around and some water fountains that created that soothing feeling as we entered. I think they just renovated the hotel recently because everything still looked new. The check-in staff was courteous, friendly, and very helpful. To our delightful surprise, they told us that our room has been upgraded to a Club Level Harbour View room. However, my husband wanted to try out their suite since we knew both of us would be suffering from jetlag for the next few days so it would help to have a separate living room so that when one of us couldn't sleep, one could watch TV in another room without bothering the other. We got our suite on the 18th floor with Sing$190 extra per night which included all the Club Floor amenities (upgraded champagne breakfast for 2, fresh flowers and fruits daily, free internet access at the lounge, late afternoon cocktail with snacks, and guaranteed late checkout until 8pm). The suite was spacious and whistle clean with marble surface all around and modern contemporary design, a living room with step-out balcony and a decent size restroom with double sinks as well as study desk with leather desk amenities + high-speed internet access hookup, the bedroom has an armoire with TV, DVD player, video player, and one touch control from the night stand and big window for the water view, it also has big bathroom (all marble) with separate bathtub / shower / commode / double vanity area. The next day, we went to check their Champagne breakfast at the executive lounge and didn't like the selections (it mostly offers western types of breakfast) so we went down to 'The Melt Cafe' that has better choices with local taste. We asked that our breakfast be switched to 'The Melt' instead of the Champagne Breakfast (I dislike alcohol so I can't imagine drinking Champagne first thing in the morning with your breakfast!), and our request was granted without problem. The Melt buffet breakfast offers several dining stands: fresh fruit stand with a guy ready to help cut up your tropical fresh fruit selections or juice them for you, dessert stand, bakery stand, eggs/noodles stand with chinese dim-sum and sliced meat, american breakfast stand that has the usual bacon / omelet / scrambled eggs stuff, Indian cuisine stand, Malay cuisine stand that has Malay's Nasi Lemak and Chinese style porridges, and continental breakfast stand. Each stand offers roughly 10-15 choices of food so you'll definitely find one that you like. It has friendly and great customer service, fast, clean, and everything was run efficiently. During our stay for the second time, out jetlag was over so we decided to stick with our original reservation (Deluxe Oceanview Room) and again we got upgraded to the Club Level Harborview room on the 16th floor. We still received our fresh flowers and fresh fruits daily although we no longer received the club level amenities. That's fine since we were out most of the time anyway. The room was almost identical in layout minus the separate living room and the second restroom. All the amenities were the same as the ones we got at the suite (terry bathrobes, slippers, nice size shampoos / conditioners / bathgels, toothbrushes, sewing kit, cotton balls and sticks, soaps, etc). Everytime we went down to the lobby, there were always a few staff available to either help with the elevators or any other help you needed (even when the check-in desk was crowded there were always staff available to help you immediately). The room-service was always fast with the food delivered still hot and delicious. The staff was knowledgeable about their country and its places of interest. The hotel is situated next to Marina Square, a dept store with great food court on the 3rd floor. You can also go across the street to the Esplanade and do a bit of walking along the panoramic Singapore river bank. When we checked out this time, our flight back home wouldn't leave until 10.00pm so we requested a late checkout @ 7.30pm and it was granted free of charge without problem. All in all a 5-star experience all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Oriental - 5 star but not right for me”
Reviews.Author: travelandeat
Reviews.Content: This may sound harsh but... Rooms are very small. Hotel is totally renovated but lacks natural light and warmth. The Line buffet breakfast has a huge array of food but the service is very poor, particularly for a hotel of this standard. Even a coffee is difficult to get. It reminded me of a cafeteria. Found the hotel impersonal. Pool area ok. Location very good. Bell hops and door staff etc were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Conferencer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a triple room with our teenage daughter: we were very impressed. Staff were unfailingly polite and helpful, including allowing us early access to our room after arriving directly from a 12-hour flight from Europe. The room was stylish and very quiet, reasonably spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom (marble, separate shower and bath) was stocked with quality accessories. The hotel is adjacent to a large shopping mall which itself adjoins the large Suntec mall (great dining and shopping) via walkways: note that Singapore mall shops don't open until 11 AM. We absolutely enjoyed the hotel's evening "international buffet": well worth the expense for high-quality selection of all the ethnic tastes of Singapore. The only hitch was our fault for not reading the hotel guide in sufficient detail: we thought that breakfast closed at 11 AM but in fact the buffet closed at 1030h. Options after that were limited. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Glen&Isobel
Reviews.Content: Reception area is a little dark but the greeting was friendly and check-in very efficient. The room was fine though could do with more drawer space if you are staying for more than a few days. Being able to plug in the mp3 player into the sound system was very useful. There was plenty of free water available which was replaced throughout the day if used. Very good choice at breakfast and quality was excellent. Fresh juices made to order if there wasn't what you wanted available. Overall the service and staff were excellent. It was possible to walk through the malls to the City Mall MRT station. There was a large choice of restaurants in the nearby malls. The hawkers situated just across the road from the hotels main entrance had a good choice and were excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendybatch
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this really is an amazing hotel. From the moment we arrived we were subjected to perfect, old fashioned service in a fantastic hotel. We upgraded to the club rooms which turned out to be a good choice. We didnt need it, but it includes a late check out till 8pm! This represents great value for money. The room includes all the usual drinks and food daily , including a really good champagne between 5 and 7pm, and wireless internet access on your laptop. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. We went to visit Raffles hotel for afternoon tea but couldnt get in and it didnt look that great anyway. Was most disappointed in the hotel which is an institution in Singapore. We came back and had afternoon tea in the Oriental which was great value at 8 UK pounds and included a chocolate fountain with fruit and marshmallows my husband had great fun with!! Breakfast at Melt, as everyone else has already said is quite simply the best. The fruit station was my favourite with every fruit you could think of and some, which they would juice just for you. Fantastic! Taxis are cheap and plentiful and you can walk along the riverfront into town quite easily, we did it at night and it was really lovely. All in all an amazing hotel which I cannot really fault. Stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the world's great hotels”
Reviews.Author: craig_ng
Reviews.Content: Simply love it! Great hotel, even better service, nothing is too much trouble! Love the new rooms with the wall socket for your iPod - to connect to the room's entertainment system. People everywhere to greet you when you arrive at the lobby, and when you return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Maillot-Jaune
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oriental twice in August at either end of a trip to Thailand. We booked the hotel following the consistenty positive reviews read on Tripadvisor and we would have to say that we were very impressed. We booked a city view room, but on the first stay were upgraded to a Harbour View room and on the second stay an Ocean View room. There is some construction work going on next door but we did not notice any major noise or disruptions. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants to be honest so can't comment on those. The adjoining shopping centre is really good, with quite a few eating options, and there is also an outdoor hawker market across from the hotel on the Esplanade. The breakfast though is simply awesome, (we had it included in our room rate - very much recommended) we have been lucky enough to have done a fair bit of travelling in the last 10 years or so and we have stayed in other 5 star hotels in a number of countries, including a previous stay in Singapore and the breakfast at the Oriental is by far the best experienced. The choice of food, from Indian (may sound strange but boy it was good) to freshly made pancakes (my wifes favourite) is fantastic. The service was also faultless, and genuine too from our experience. For example on one occasion I went to reception to arrange a late checkout and taxi to the airport. The reception area was really busy and I realised that it was 11am when quite a few people were checking out, so I thought I'd leave it till later. On the way back to the lifts, a member of staff approached me who had noticed that I had wanted something but had left. She rode up in the lift with me, made a note of what I required and called our room 30 mins later to confirm late checkout, taxi booking and alarm call. I was very impressed by that. The gym is also pretty good and the pool is nice although I must say the pool area is fairly bland and could maybe do with more gardening perhaps. There is a good view from the pool area though. The hotel seemed very interested in customer comments and feedback and I would assume based on our experience that they are acting on this response. In summary we would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Mandarin”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mandarin Oriental after reading the reviews on TA and securing a great rate of $189SGD through my travel agent. This hotel is ideally situated on the harbor across from the skyscrapers and you would be a fool not to spring the extra $50SGD to get a harbor view room. I spent much time observing the daily changes to the rhythm of the city during my seven night stay. I spend about two months out of the year on the road and make it a habit to try to stay in good places. Let me tell you, this place knocked my socks off it was so good. Perfection? No, but pretty close. The only hotel I would rate higher is in Montreal (Gault) and is totally different in approach. The hotel is an atrium style, but not at all that 'mid western' cow-town atrium feel. It's elegant and golden. There is more marble and granite in this hotel than I have seen in any other. It's all done tastefully though and not garish. The pool is wonderful and warm and looks directly out over downtown. Make sure you take time to swim here; it's deep too and there is a separate pool for the piddling types (crumbcrunchers). The room (see the pictures) is the nicest I have ever stayed in; incredibly well designed and it has the only bathroom in a hotel I have ever felt compelled take a photograph of. Service in the room was superior, but not intrusive. Previous posts have referred to the breakfast in the hotel. Well, let me tell you, there is nothing like it anywhere I have travelled. It had by my count, Japanese, Malaysian, American, Chinese and European style breakfast foods. You could also get anything you wanted made to order. The downside is that this cost $41.95 SGD. Good advice, and it's a piece I will take next time I stay here: get a breakfast inclusive rate. The one word for this morning repast: Incredible! (really, they have 9, count 'em, 9 types of freshly squeezed juices!) Room service was incredibly prompt, if a bit pricey. Make sure you eat in the Chinese restaurant in the hotel. It can be described as a 'jewel box' and is one of the prettiest dining rooms I have ever sat in. The food is excellent as well. Also a great deal is the happy hour in the Morton's bar. This is from 5-7pm and includes reasonably mixed cocktails, but the best part are the free filet mignon sandwiches they bring around (from Morton's). The place packs full at 5pm, so get there early for a preprandial libation and snack. Now for the nits: 1. They tried to adjust my rate up from $239SGD by saying that was only a weekend rate. I was having none of this and after dealing with three people I finally talked to the duty manager. She assured me my rate would remain fixed throughout my stay (and it did...I made sure to check the bill the night before leaving). 2. Avoid the restaurant called Dolce Vita. It sits right poolside, which might provide you with a water show if there are any hot Aussies around, but the restaurant is dreary and and we walked out after seeing the 'moonshot' prices for the prix fixe only menu (and no, it's not Italian, rather a bizarro fusion menu.) That's when we went to the Chinese place. That's it for the nits and I am very picky. My business here was work, so the sybaritic pleasures of the hotel took a while to get into my skin (the massage and facial helped on the last day $190SGD). If you like the finer things in life, this place will make you happy. Note to self: remember to go next door to the Ritz-Carlton bar next time. Last words? The Oriental treats you like royalty, so live the life of a Mandarin!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Oriental!”
Reviews.Author: merry_party
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriental 2 nights in July and 3 nights in August. Both stays were enjoyed by all. July was with our two children, and we paid for a City View rooms. We asked for connecting rooms and got that plus an upgrade to Water Views room for both. The decor was subdued Oriental: ivory, black, beige, brown. The beds were perfect, as were the pillows, not too soft and not too firm. The sound system in the room was excellent (there was a subwoofer). The toilet and bath were marble, and there was a shower with an all glass door. A clear effort was made to make toilet plumbing as unnoticeable as possible, ie, the water closet was hidden behind a marble wall with a heavy marble lid (I know coz I tried to lift it). Our August trip was also for a City View room but we got upgraded to a Water View room (again!) as it was our second time. And we were lucky enough to catch the fireworks shows for the National Day in the comfort of our bedroom - what good timing! Both stays we opted for the buffet breakfast, and it was a fantastic way to start your day. The variety and quantity of food, as well as the service were excellent. I did notice though that the female wait staff were more prompt, and courteous than the male wait staff. The breakfast choices were: fruit juices and I was able to request for watermelon juice which they prepared for me; eggs any way you want it; pancakes and waffles with various toppings; Indian curries and breads; Chinese congee and dimsum; bacon, sausages, hash browns; croissants and pastries; yoghurt; cereal; plus many types of cut fruit. We also had room service for mains, and they added complimentary entrees, not a huge serving but a nice touch as it was individually presented as you would in fine dining. The outdoor pool was a great way to relax, the prices for alcoholic drinks were a bit steep though. About S$18 net. The Oriental is beside a shopping mall, and about S$5 to Orchard road by cab. So, if shopping is your main purpose for visiting Singapore, then the Oriental is convenient. We did our shopping in July for the sales. In August we decided to go for more sightseeing than shopping, and the Oriental's proximity to Suntec was a bonus. There were tour buses that started and ended at Suntec and it was easy for us to board whenever we wanted to. If we needed to go back to the hotel, we were in and out of Suntec in 30 minutes, which is when the buses come and go. The staff were very helpful, and courteous. Always with a greeting and a smile. We plan to stay with the Oriental whenever we go to Singapore and will not think twice about recommending it. What a wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Room with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WestCanTraveler
Reviews.Content: The highlight of the Oriental is its breakfast buffet--be sure to book a room that includes this breakfast in the price! (our special rate from the Mandarin Oriental hotel website included breakfast and late checkout) The rooms we had were in need of some modernisation, although the bathrooms seemed to have been upgraded more recently than the main area. Marble everywhere and a great power rain shower--and above average toiletries. The beds were not of the standard the Marriott and Westin now have made commonplace, although the linens were definitely luxe. TV had a wide range of channels. Service to the rooms was exceptional: fresh fruit left every day and at evening turndown, new towels and free bottled water. The breakfast buffet is huge and the quality like nothing else I've encountered (and I travel a lot). Wait staff have many, many tables to take care of, but do it all with ease and friendliness. I was much more impressed by them than by the reception staff who were very formal and frankly rather slow.... Location is very good--a big mall adjoining, the Esplanade theatres and waterfront across the street, and less than 10 minutes walk to a wide range of restaurants including the lovely CHIJMES complex. Taxis were readily available outside the hotel and it's very cheap indeed to go anywhere in the city. I would definitely stay here again and for my children it was a memorable experience of a top-end hotel. This is a business hotel that makes families welcome too and it would likely suit all types of visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Brent67
Reviews.Content: I must admit to being just a bit disappointed on my return to Australia from a 7 night stay in the Oriental Hotel. Having read all the reviews prior to my departure I was excited at the prospect of staying in the 'second most popular' hotel in the city (according the trip advisor at the time). In retrospect perhaps my expectations were a little too high. We were in the city for a mixture of business and pleasure. It was my fifth trip to Singapore but the first at the Oriental. Having arrived in early evening we were welcomed with a smile and a what seemed to be a hundred 'welcomes'. It was all very civilised and after a relatively long flight, very welcome. Check -in was smooth and in no time were we admiring the view accross the Harbour, over the 'durians' to the CBD. I would recommend a harbour view room every time. Having said this our euphoria at our 'Singapore adventure' was to show signs of cracking early the next day. There is construction happening on the Esplanade across from the hotel which meant machinery of varying volumes operating at all times of the day (and for a large part of the night as well). On one particularly bad day a barge mounted drill hammered holes in the ground from 9am in the morning until 8pm that night. What seemed to sound like minor explosions occuring every 3 seconds (I timed them). It was hellish. Unfortunately the pool area offered no respite as it works are virtually next to the pool. As others have noted, the food prices are out of this world. While you have to assume they will not be 'normal' rates, what bugged us most was the fact that you could never get the accurate prices before ordering. For example a poolside 'special of the day' appeared to list a variety of drinks at the (comparatively reasonable) price of S$10. It was only when we were asked to sign were we made aware that it was actually S$22. When we questioned it we were told that a coconut drink was the only drink available at the special rate and that everything else on the 'specials board' was the normal price. This may only be a minor inconvenience for expense account clients, but for people paying out of their own pockets it comes as a shock (especially for an Australian trade practices lawyer like myself). In the end it was sorted out after my wife complained. The next day the board listed all prices appropriately. We wonder how many others were caught by the 'oversight' however. The next drama was when I checked internet banking and discovered the hotel had 'blocked' an additional $1,000 from my credit card. I can understand a slight increase to cover incidentals, but the extra $1k represented an almost 35% increase over what was payable for the entire week stay. We were shocked. The (always polite) reception staff informed us it was to cover any additional costs of the stay, (and made a point of saying the mini bar was the major culprit). I wonder how many guests had helped themselves to $150 worth of mars bars and coke PER DAY. Eventually, when pressed further they admitted that the amount blocked was discretionary, but in our case they decided to block the maximum!!! Not good for the ego.........Perhaps my position as a Partner at an International Law Firm (under which the booking was made) brands me a notorious mini-bar raider. Given the size of some of my colleagues maybe such a reputation is justified - I'll never know! Another issue arose when my wife inadvertently took the key card to the room while I went to the lobby. You need the key to get to your floor in the lift. 'Security' required me to present my passport (a drivers licence with my name would just not do) in order to prove that I was the person staying in the room. The fact that my passport was in my room, and they would not accept anything else for ID created an unnecessary drama which could have been avoided with some common sense. It was, after all, my fifth day in the hotel and the person now demanding my passport had was the same person who checked me in. Notwithstanding this, I was told in no uncertain terms that I was not to leave the lobby area until such time as I could produce my passport. I should have shaved that morning! To sum up. The rooms were ok (but as expected for a 5 star) and the view was spectacular. However, the 'service' which I had heard so much about left a lot to be desired. Perhaps I'm jaded by our personal experiences with the staff and the 'system', but in the end the service all felt a bit fake to me. On to some positives! The hotel is linked directly to Marina Square shopping centre which has perhaps the best food court in Singapore (and trust me , I've been to a few). On that culinary note, across the road is Glutton Bay with a number of fantastic (but touristy) hawker stalls. It gets busy, so go early. It is a pleasent walk to Boat Quay past the Merlion and the Fullarton Hotel (our next hotel if we return). The MRT (City Hall) is quite a walk through a number of different shopping centres, but there is always something to look at. Alternatively, cabs are a cheap and easy option to pretty much anywhere in the city. For the same price there are a number of better alternatives in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - above average room”
Reviews.Author: Milkee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oriental in early July 06 for 4 nights as part of a 21 night Singapore - Thailand holiday. We arrived at the hotel at 11.00pm after a enjoyable flight from Australia. We were greeted by pretty much everyone in the foyer at the time of arrival. The lobby looks great at night. The service is brilliant. We were promptly escorted to our rooms and our bags arrived minutes later. We had asked about the Melt breakfast as our rate did not include it. We were told that it would be AUD $55 for both of us to have breakfast each day. We politely declined. If you can organise with your agent for a cheaper rate get it, otherwise, we found that there are plenty of places in Singapore that serve Kaya Toast (so good we brought two jars home with us) and coffee for two people for less than AUD $8. You just have to walk a little (less than 1 km). I reckon there was about 7 within the malls directly near the hotel. The best was at the Raffles Hotel cafe about just over 1 km walk (the one recommended in the lonely planet guide) through the numerous air-conditioned malls near the hotel. The rooms .... we stayed in a city view room. The view wasn't really of the city but of the back of Suntec Mall and another hotel. A little disapointing but i wasn't in the room to look at the view, you can do that on your adventures around the city. The bathroom is brilliant. The products in the room smell fantastic. The bath is massive and the shower was a rain shower and entirely marble. The rest of the room was a little dated for a 5 star hotel. I expected much better from the reviews on this website. The room was spotless, had a large floorspace and a good choice of TV channels (it had ABC Asia which showed an AFL game late one night!!!). It was nonetheless pleasant without being modern or over the top. The minibar prices were ridiculous but you expect that. The best part of the room is definitely the bathroom. Speaking of ridiculous, the prices of food within the hotel are outrageous compared to Australian prices and prices for other Asian hotel i have stayed in. For instance a steak will cost AUD $75+, 2 noodle/rice dishes and a chocolate desert cost us well over AUD$65 (room service), and alcoholic drinks of any description start around AUD$8-9. Needless to say, we only ate at the hotel for that one room service. Otherwise, go to Boat/Clarke quay, get a chilli crab (Brilliant!!!!!), pineapple rice, spring rolls and a few tiger beers/cocktails (with a perfect view) for around AUD$60-70 for 2. If you're fit you can walk it, if you can't be bothered a taxi will only cost about AUD$5-7. Lunch around the city is also very good and cheap. The pool is good. It has a beautiful view of the harbour but has the ambience of an empty olympic sized swimming pool. If you want it for the sole purpose of swimming after a long day at the shops or zoo it is perfect, but compared to other pools in Asia, it it would be very average but for the view. On the whole, it is a great hotel but food and drink is pricey by Australian and local Singapore standards. I probably wouldn't stay there again but only beacuse i would want to compare another hotel to this one. Having said that, i would definitely recommend it to anyone thinking of staying there. From reading the comments on this website, i would probably recommend you get the club room. From memory, it wasn't that much more per night and the breakfast/drinks/ canapes you consume would offset the initial payment. Btw, Singapore on the whole is brilliant (4 days and you can see it all). The zoo is a must, chilli crab is soooo good, shopping in the malls, whilst extensive, is as expensive as Australia so you will find that you only buy what you really want. Jewellery at the chinatown markets was cheap. Get on the MRT Trains, they are very clean and super quick and cheap. The lonely planet city guide was great for sightseeing, maps and tips.

Reviews.Title: “The Oriental - True meaning of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: blessu2
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just got back from Singapore, where we stayed 2 nights at The Oriental. Having read reviews from other tripadvisor members, I am very happy to report, that the hotel is up to all the expectations. We stayed at their standard room, with 2 single bed and extrabed (for free), the room is spacious. It has separate shower & bath. From the time we arrived to depart, all their staffs are very courteous, even to my 2 young childrens. It was always: " Good morning/afternoon/evening", "Have a pleasant stay", "Have a nice day","Enjoy your meals" from the hotel's staffs. I met several hotel guests at the elevator, and all have very positive comments. Their service is outstanding, they show the true meaning of hospitality. I will definetely recommend everyone visiting Singapore to experience this hotel. And I thank tripadvisor members for their excellent reviews, enable me to make the right decision. 2 Thumbs up for The Oriental !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: bbeinstein
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a City Suite on June 16-19, 2005. We just loved everything about it! The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We were greeted by every single staff with a smile. The City Suite is just amazing! It has a living room with an L-shaped sectional sofa and a huge work table where you can catch up on any work you may have brought. The bedroom has the most heavenly bed which guaranteed that we overslept each and every morning we were there. The bathroom had a separate bath and shower facilities. There were complimentary chocolates and petit fours everyday and housekeeping comes to the room in the afternoom just to ready your bed for sleeping. All in all, it was an amazing stay in The Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: IreneY105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Oriental two weeks ago for 3 days. It was my first time visit in Singapore, i chose this hotel because it's in the centre of the city but also have a beautiful surrounding. It's just 5 to 10 minutes taxe drive from orchard road, and there is a big shopping centre just 2 minutes from the hotel . As soon as we arrived, there were plenty of staff to greet you, which is warm and friendly. We've booked on a cityview room, since it's our honeymoon trip (don't use this excuse if you're not), we've got an upgrade to the premier ocean room which has a magnificent view. We were absolutely happy about this , and there was a bottle of red wine in the room prepared when we were there. This is what a five classes hotel would always be that considerate. The room itself is very cozy, with a modern design. And the washroom which is in a quite a moderate size and have separate bath and shower The Melt cafe offer the best breakfast we have ever, and which we've stayed in many five stars hotel , but this one is exceptional enjoyable. Since the nice and hip decor in the cafe, and plenty choices of food, even there is a juice bar, for any kind of juice, just you name it, they have it all. And besides the many choices of restaurant in the hotel , and there is a hawker food stall just 5 minutes from the hotel and after the cheap and delicious meal, you can have a pleasant walk at the esplanade. Overall we had a wonderful stay, the services are excellent and we'd love to return again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Oriental”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Oriental for 3 nights in May. I was very impressed with the hotel and service, but really began to appreciate it when I switched hotels to begin the "business" part of my trip (where I had no control over picking the hotel!). I opted for the airport pickup service from the Changi. When I arrived at the hotel, a check in person met me at the car and led me to my room. It was all very Bill Murray in Lost in Translation. Let me say one thing here-- I booked the absolute cheapest room rate via the Oriental website (113USD) so it's not like I was some VIP. We did the check in procedures in the room. The room itself was nice without being overly flashy. Even though I booked a normal room, they gave me a harbor view room, which was nice. It was the not very apparent features which I really liked. For instance, the bathtub had a can of sea salts, which I admit is something stupid to like as much as I did. I did, however, really like the fact that the hotel provided toothbrushes and razor kits. And an ironing board/iron. And an umbrella (which I didn't realize was there until I called the front desk to request the use of one for the day). The service was quite good. Taxis came immediately (which I didn't pay attention to until I kept having to wait 5 minutes for a taxi when I switched to The Regent). And the staff was helpful without being overbearing. I always got the "good morning" and "good evenings", but they were never overly intrusive, which I have often found at other hotels. The spa was also very nice. I especially liked the small, semi-private relaxation beds they have for you after the treatments. I took a bit of a nap there after my massage/facial. I didn't eat much in the hotel, only the breakfast buffet at Melt. The food choice and quality was good. For me, the highlights were the selection of fresh juices and yogurt smoothies. While I was at the hotel, I thought it was great, but it was when I moved to The Regent that I realized just HOW great The Oriental is. The Regent, by any sane standards, is a good, if not great, hotel. But when directly compared to The Oriental, it falls short in every category. Just my opinion, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Harbour View Room”
Reviews.Author: ocpi
Reviews.Content: Had a weekend getaway from The Oriental Singapore. Thumbs up for the excellent service from the staffs. We stayed at the deluxe room facing the harbour. Nice interior and view. They have a touch screen TV remote where some of the 5 stars hotels are not equipped with. We requested for a King size bed but turn out to be 2 single bed combine into 1. We wanted to change room but found out only in the night so save the hussle and slept. Was uncomfortable throughout the night when i toss and turn. So always rem need to check the bed first upon arrival. The TV was a bit too small and cant really turn the tv set to watch when i was sitting at the sofa. Nevertheless i like the sound system and the dvd player set which allows you to play movies IF you bring or purchase your own dvd. While taking a shower in the bathroom, i noticed there was water seeping out from the glass door which resulted slippery floor near the entrance of the toilet. Well I guess the hotel should rectify it to prevent guest from slipping. On a good note, we love the variety food for the buffet breakfast. May or may not come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: FMUBSU
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in early May. It is a very nice hotel. The rooms are nicely remodeled and have a great view of the city and harbor. The club level has a wonderful breafast buffet with terrific service. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The location is very convenient to the airport and shopping. It is a very elegant and modern hotel whch is in great shape and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: EMSTEW
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel after reading other Trip Advisor members reviews, it really was as people described. The interior of this hotel is superb and having played with the idea of going to the Shangri - La, I am glad I chose the Oriental. Our room was beautiful with great views of the harbour - ask for a high level room. The staff were extremely attentive and the breakfast was amazing. I only wish we could have stayed longer unfortunately we were on a stopover - I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireblond
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. Much enjoyed by myself and my husband. The trip was a combination of business (for him) and pleasure (for her) and once the business side of things was done we decided to book a different hotel from the company booked one for the rest of our stay. So glad we made the decision to change. Although the first hotel was good (Meritus Negara) and we have no complaints at all (we were upgraded to a suite), the extra effort from the staff at the Oriental made all the diference. The service from the staff was impeccable. All the way from check-in to settling into the room, to the staff in the club lounge to the doorman and concerge. Nothing was too much trouble. The domestic staff were polite and respectful of the privacy setting in the room. The front of house staff in the club lounge friendly with a sense of homour. On one occasion we were joking in the lift when one of the staff told him he should be proud to have such a problem i.e. me, (must remember to remind my husband of that on a regular basis!) We upgraded to a club room on arrival which was well worth the extra, champagne breakfast everyday, afternoon tea, and 2 hours of cocktails from 5.30 to 7.30pm all included. The club lounge was huge with stunning views over the city. The room itself was of a good size with all of the facilities you expect from a first class hotel. Even a point to plug to your ipod/mp3 player into the surround sound system in the room (cable supplied). I can recommend the spa there where I had 2 hours of bliss and was able to move my shoulders and neck in ways I hadn't done for years. The only slight downside is the distance from the nearest MRT station, but it is a pleasant walk , all of which can be done under cover via the shopping malls. We'll certainly be staying there again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sums
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed one night here. It is probably the best hotel I have been to. The service was absolutely brilliant. Nothing is too much trouble. The rooms were fantastic and Molton Brown is used in the bathrooms. It is worth upgrading to a club room where you get a superb view and use of the club lounge with free breakfast, afternoon tea and evening cocktails and a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: lchandler4285
Reviews.Content: I have traveled for business around the world, and have never had a better experience at any hotel. I stayed in the Club Level, and enjoyed first class breakfasts and outstanding horsdeuvers during the cocktail hour each evening. After the first day, the staff addressed me by name. It had a small hotel feel, with all the amenities of a first class business hotel. Remarkably, the two restraurnts in the hotel were among the best in the city. I especially recomend the "Melt" for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Gordy2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Oriental and had a wonderful time. Reception staff excellent - shown to our room (Harbour View) and had the local attractions pointed out to us. We were offered a deal to take breakfast in the Hotel every day which saved a few pounds. Food was excellent with plenty of choice. The room itself was superb and very well appointed. All the staff very polite and obviously happy at their work which made our stay most enjoyable. Would definitely stay here again. Booked this Hotel through Asia Rooms - I can highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: rdmsmith
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Stamford on previous trips to Singapore we thought we would try a different hotel this time. We weren't disappointed. The Oriental provided outstanding service and made us feel very welcome. The harbour view deluxe rooms were comfortable and had appreciated extras like audio and video inputs ports at the work desk which fed into the tv/sound system. Anyone with an i-pod would appreciate this kind of thing! Breakfast in the "Melt" cafe was also excellent. I don't think I've ever seen such a wide selection or array of food. I've stayed at a few five star hotels in my time including other Mandarin Orientals, and for me this place hit the spot. The only downside is that there aren't many public areas you can lounge in, although the Swimming pool offers a welcome refuge from the city. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: McCoist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Oriental as part of our anniversary trip to Singapore & Malaysia. It was absolutely fantastic. The staff were excellent, the room we had was large (by city-centre standards) and there were great personal touches that you just don't expect from a "chain" hotel. The Oriental Club gave great views and superb champagne breakfasts. I would not only stay here again, but Mandarin Hotels would be an immediate choice throughout asia

Reviews.Title: “MO S'pore: Beautiful Hotel with Bad Feng Shui?”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the newly (and majorly) renovated Oriental in Singapore three times in 2005. The first time, in February, was very shortly after the hotel’s “soft” reopening. Aesthetically, the redo is a huge success. While the hotel retains its rather nondescript exterior shape and square windows in a big white block of a building, the interior of the Oriental is now arguably the most striking of all hotels in Singapore. While most hotels built around an atrium recall the 80s even more pointedly than, say, Duran Duran cassette tapes and hair bands, the Oriental’s atrium is now dazzling, with mica-flecked black marble, pin-lighted water feature, and gorgeous dark woods everywhere. The staff are immaculate, the ladies in particular: their uniforms are very Singapore Airlines-meets-Asian Bond girls. As one often does in Singapore, I arrived very late in the evening and was tired. The Oriental’s sleek new interior and flawless staff immediately soothed. The front-desk clerk talked me into an S$90/night upgrade to a Club room, which turned out to be the same as a regular room but on a higher floor than my original room. Staff scurried in to replace stock MO amenities with Hermes, and someone else brought hot tea and a scented face towel. Aah. (Actually, the last two services come with all MO rooms.) The room, while smallish (34 m2), was beautiful: more dark woods and black marble, and an up-to-the minute bathroom with separate, walk-in rain shower; and glass wall with wooden blinds separating bed from bath rooms. My room had a dead-on view of Singapore’s harbor and attractive CBD skyline. Room service food was delicious and not overly expensive. Problems began the next morning (Saturday), when hammering and other construction noises began fairly early (shortly before 9 a.m.). I called the front desk to ask what was going on and was told that renovation work was still occurring on the uppermost floors – what would become the real Club rooms – and outside. I headed to the Club Lounge for breakfast, hoping that I might be able to sleep a bit more afterward. The lounge is brand new and spectacular: two-storey windows overlooking the city from the 21st floor, and rich yet muted Asian-modern décor. The breakfast buffet was fresh, luxurious, and plentiful, including fairly good champagne (Piper-Heidsieck). Sated, I returned to my room and was able to sleep some more, as the construction crews had mercifully scaled down the pace and decibel level of their work Later in the day, I stopped by the front desk to discuss my concerns about the noises and what I thought had been a bit of a hard sell for a Club room that was only partly so. As is usually the case with MO staff I’ve experienced in Asia, the duty manager was thoughtful and responsive. He took the supplemental club charge off of my room rate (for 2 nights), apologized for the noise, and assured me that I could move to another room if the work – scheduled for a shorter period – continued on Sunday. I went for a swim, and some laps the new pool put my cares behind me. The temperature-controlled infinity pool overlooks the city skyline, and the spa facilities and wet area are every bit as lovely as the rest of the hotel. When I returned to my room from my swim, I found a bottle of Shiraz and a very nice note from the duty manager, again apologizing for earlier problems. Sunday was just fine, with no construction noise and a good morning’s sleep. Upon returning home, I had a very nice e-mail from Ms Cindy Kong, the Oriental’s guest-relations manager. She again apologized for the problems I’d encountered and asked me to contact her directly concerning future stays to ensure proper care. I did contact Ms Kong again, as I was planning another visit to Singapore at the end of April and first week of May, bookends to a week in Bali. She assured me that construction work would be finished and that I would have an excellent, quiet room. That proved to be the case; this time I stayed in a Club room on the Club floor, and everything was great. I was looking forward to my return a week later. Ms Kong e-mailed me while I was in Bali to let me know that a new construction project (this time, a municipal endeavor at adjacent Marine Square) would be taking place during my anticipated stay, and she offered not only to help with a booking at another hotel but also to have me picked up upon arrival at Changi Airport and taken in an MO car to the alternate hotel. Again, MO’s outstanding customer service impressed. My third stay with the Oriental was in September, and this time the hotel offered me an ocean-view room at a very good rate. Unfortunately, I timed my stay to coincide exactly with a weekend of daylong F1 speedboat races – on the water, well within earshot of the hotel. I contacted the Front Desk, and staff offered to give me free use of a City Room, away from the water-facing sides of the hotel, for sleeping during the day. (I note here that the standard City rooms, while pleasant and comfortable, have noticeably blander décor and furnishings than the Ocean and Harbor View rooms. Staff advised that City rooms are usually assigned to package-tour customers. In any event, my City day room was a blessed respite from the constant whining of racing speedboats.) I joked with the duty manager that perhaps I have bad feng shui at the Oriental, given my star-crossed stays to date. Unfortunately, the joke or bad FS continued a bit further: later on, while I was relaxing after the boat races in my Ocean room, a harsh chemical smell seeped into the room. I opened the door and the reek of kerosene in the hallway or similar brought tears to my eyes. I flagged down a maid, who reported that a maintenance worker had spilled paint in the storage room at the end of the hall and had dumped a large quantity of turpentine on the paint still to try to clean up. A few other guests had also been flushed out of their rooms, seeking the source of the fumes. I informed the front desk of the problem and then went for a long swim. When I returned to my floor, the paint-thinner odor had subsided a bit but was still fairly harsh. I had a message on my room voicemail from guest relations. When I called back, the duty manager apologized again and asked me whether the hotel could move me and my things to a City View suite. I readily agreed. The suite was wonderful – and huge (about 70 m2). Rather than replicating the drabness of the regular City rooms, the suite was very sleekly furnished and decorated, with a separate bedroom, two bathrooms, and expansive city views. Well done, Oriental! Oh, I had breakfast (included in my room rate) in the just-opened Melt restaurant, which has several huge food stations featuring dishes -- all fresh and very delicious -- from all over the world. The Indian station was my favorite for savories, and the Western breakfast-y baked goods were to die for. Although I’ve not yet stayed again at the Oriental – I stayed at Raffles on my most recent trip to Singapore – I probably would stay there again. It really is a beautiful hotel, and the staff are perhaps the best I’ve encountered (with the possible exception of those of Peninsula Hotels). I still attribute the problems I had at the Oriental to bad luck, or possibly bad feng shui, which perhaps one shouldn’t take lightly in a predominantly Chinese culture. Nonetheless, the Oriental richly deserves the very positive rankings and reviews it’s received since its very successful makeover. If one can get a good corporate or promotional rate (my cheapest stay was S$188/night), the Oriental may be the best hotel stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “My Taste Buds Melted....”
Reviews.Author: TheTravellingGourmet
Reviews.Content: Dr. Michael Lim The Travelling Gourmet is a renowned Travel, Food & Wine Writer in Asia MELT the World Cafe at The Oriental Singapore melted my tastebuds....There are many mega-buffets now not only in sunny Singapore, but also in places like Hong Kong. Here, the design is open, spacious and bright. Food is cooked a la minute with freshly sliced proscuitto from Italy and many types of mustards just to give two examples. The Indian section is marvellous, and as for my favourite...dessert, literally mind blowing! Ice creams, fresh fruit from the usual to the exotic like Starfruit, please even the most jaded of palates. I like to dine here slowly and sample just a tiny portion of each culinary creation like a never ending Menu Degustation. Try Thai too...where some tasty treats from Thailand like Pad Thai or fried noodles tantalise. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Very hot Oriental”
Reviews.Author: Brunos
Reviews.Content: We did a brief night-stopover in Singapore on January 7th.We checked in around 7:40 pm (after a long trip from Europe)and left at 4am the next day. We were first given a room on the 16th floor. The room was hot when we got in and turned the air conditioner. By 9pm it had not cooled off, and we repeatedly called for engineering. They finally came and after an hour of work decided that it was not working. We were finally moved to another room on the 17th floor. The temperature was 27° when we came in and the manager turned the AC on. We directely went to bed but the AC did not work in this room either. Unfortunately we could not even open the window which was locked. It was midnight and did not have the courage to change room as we were to get up in less than four hours. Of course we got no sleep and the bell boy who picked up our luggage could attest that the temperature was over 27°. The hotel looked almost empty and my guess is that the AC was closed on a few floors to save costs, but that the reception was not advised of it and gave us rooms on these floors. Whatever the reason, this is totally unacceptable from a five star hotel. I left a note of complaint to the hotel GM at checkout, but never got even a word of apologies. This tells a lot about the poor quality of management/service at this hotel. In Singapore there are many more reliable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SmyeeQq
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Oriental for the first time after years travelling to Singapore for work. I choose this due to it being cheaper than Conrad but definately worth the money. Rooms are excellent after renovation! Staff are friendly. Although I was told Conrad is 6-star, Oriental appears to be much grander and posher than Conrad. No problem with shopping as Marina Square is just next door. Although walking to the MTR is not something i look forward to.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints at All”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Singapore on numerous occasions - never in the same hotel twice though, as the choice of great hotels in the city seems limitless. However, I would most certainly return to the Orientel given a chance, not only because of the excellent standard of accommodation, but also because of the area surrounding it; convenient yet much quieter than Orchard Road. The rooms are faultless and of a good size, the staff accommodating and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, almost Great....”
Reviews.Author: sankar
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a very nice hotel, though not perfect. But perhaps I had been expecting too much, considering the Mandarin Oriental Brand and what I had seen on their website. We took the standard rooms, which were pretty good in all respects but nothing very special. Big, bright, comfortable, a balcony would have been nice. And our room was a corner room which was weirdly shaped. The service was excellent, very friendly and helpful, they really go out of their way to help you. The Atrium lobby is nice but there are miles of boring white corridors on each floor which could've been spruced up with a little more color/decoration. The location is not the best, with few entertainment and late night dining options nearby, and the subway a long walk away. But it is right across the bay if you want a nice evening walk, and the bustling Boat Quay isn't too far away, and once you reach there the financial district is next door. Overall a great place to stay if you don't mind a slightly out of the way location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: AJBJDS
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with this hotel - renovated, modern, classy, incredibly clean and comfortable, friendly staff, gorgeous pool. The proximity to mall next door mall and the hawker stations across the street (on weekends) meant that I didn't need to eat in the hotel itself. (The in-house restaurants were too expensive for my liking). However, the luxurious hotel rooms make up for the lack of affordable eating options in the hotel. Just run next door and you'll have everything you need for food (and shopping if that is your thing). Great location too: quieter than being in the midst of Suntec etc. I loved my stay here and recommend it highly! I loved Little India - so much to see and great veggie Indian food. Also, the Zoo and Night Safari were fascinating and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oriental Hotel for 4 nights at the end of Oct 05. Had Sea view room, on the 15th floor, it was spectacular! I had phoned hotel 2 days before departure that we will be arriving around 9 o’clock in the morning and our room was ready by then. The hotel is about 5 min walk from an underground station, the river, etc, next to a shopping mall. Great swimming pull. Prices in hotel restaurants are on the steep side compare with the restaurants in town and they have been empty for most of the time. We didn’t have breakfast as you can get a cheap one in any of the shopping malls. We would recommend this hotel with no hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkPaula
Reviews.Content: No real complaints about this hotel. On the outside, it looks a little old, but it's been renovated inside with an interesting architectural design. The room was a bit small but nicely appointed; the Asian breakfast buffet excellent. Location-wise, it was a bit tricky figuring out how to walk to/from the hotel to Suntec City. Apparently it involves going up and down some dodgy -- or at least, as dodgy as anything can be in aseptic Singapore! -- stairs in a parking building and through a mall or two. Crossing over to Marina Bay is easy though. The accompanying photo is a panorama. Click on it to see the whole image of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days in October as a stopover en route to Australia. Had an ocean view room which was modern, extremely comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast was the best breakfast we have ever experienced - a huge choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent . . .”
Reviews.Author: trave
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Oct 21 - 23 and must say that it exceeded my expectations. Staff were friendly, facilities were excellent, and as in everything with Singapore, hotel was connected to a mall ( Marina Square) which is connected to another mall and another mall. This is important more so if you are travelling with family. Seriously speaking, just pay up and you won't go wrong with this property. Unlike some photos you see on other hotel websites, what you see if what you get at the Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place - especially Harbour View rooms”
Reviews.Author: Love_the_life
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at The Oriental in early October - first for three days before our cruise, then three days after. For the first stay we were upgraded to a Junior suite (city view) which was quite spacious; next time we had a Harbour View room on the 8th floor and this was even better equipped than the first room. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. One of the highlights was the breakfast which was included in our rate but even to pay for the buffet is good value. It was the best buffet I have seen! The location of the hotel is excellent - lovely walks around the river and so convenient to a number of shopping malls. You can walk to Raffles Mall in about 10 minutes and the Marina Square is right next door. When the upgrade to the Mall is finished (they are still working on it) it will be great. I am returning to Singapore early next year and will definitely stay at The Oriental.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: wlec
Reviews.Content: My son and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Oriental and we cannot praise this establishment highly enough. All the staff were extremely polite and helpful. In particular James on reception desk went out of his way to help us with the only problem we had which was the room. We had booked a deluxe city view room and upon check-in the room asigned to us had a double bed instead of twin beds as requested. James gladly moved us for 1 night to a harbour view room until the following morning when a twin city view became available. The city view room was lovely, very spacious and kept very clean with fresh amenities twice daily. As this was a business trip we had no trouble with the doorman getting us taxi's to various meetings etc. and each time we entered or exited the hotel we were greeted with smiles and friendliness. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “REAL NICE”
Reviews.Author: frenchandparisian
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights there, the last leg of a 3 week tour in Asia, and prior to flying back to France. The lobby was really busy, and we had to wait before checking-in. We had booked a Club City View. They messed up our reservation, it took some time to get things in order. We were finally upgraded to a City View Suite, but the whole check-in process took place downstairs, instead of in the room as they claim everywhere. Also the Suite was not ready for us, that is without water and flowers. It was however brand new and refurbished. Still I was surprised at the lack of flat screen TV. Suite was really big, with the main bathroom being on the smaller side. Also the separate shower stall would flood the bathroom. Club Lounge is beautiful. Beautiful style, and the staff there is extremely helpful and stylish. Despite the hotel being very busy, there was ample seating capacity. We had stayed at the MO Kuala Lumpur 2 weeks before, and would rate this property much much higher. There are many dinig options. We only tried Morton's, a branch of the famous US based steakhouse. Seemed weird to sit in the exact same decor as Chicago's restaurant. Service was top notch, and the food perfect (for what it should be : meat). Steep prices, I would say an additionnal 50% to the Chicago bill, which is already expensive (100USD per person). The situation is OK. From the marina, you can wal to downtown Singapore (the raffles), and anyway taxis are cheap. We took advantage of our stay at the Club Level of the garanteed late-check-out (7.00pm) free of charged, which they gracefully extended until 9.00pm : this is a most convenient feature, before boarding a long-haul flight to Europe. Todate the best Mandarin Oriental property I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. I had a few problems with the service but overall it was a nice, clean hotel and good value for money. The rooms were on the small size and the views were not great and even after complaining that we did not like the view, we were not moved to another room (even though there was plenty available) so not great customer service. My advice to travellers would be to eat and drink outside the hotel as it is very pricey especially the main bar. It is a nice area and there are shops everywhere in Singapore so you do not have to worry about the location. Take a boat ride (about 5GBP per person). I stayed at the same chain of hotel in Kuala lumpur which I would recommend much more than this one, as the people were friendlier, the service better and the rooms much larger and the food was better value for money. Also sinagpore is very expensive compared to Malaysia (I would go as far to say it is more expensive then europe if not the same).

Reviews.Title: “Very highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ian⦤la
Reviews.Content: Expected a good hotel, but were delighted that everything exceed our expectations. Rooms, views, and above all friendliness and service were exceptional. It is the staff that make this good hotel GREAT! Would not dream of staying anywhere else in Singapore.
